became the first country to officially recognize femicide , the murder of a female because of her gender , a a crime . guatemala ha the third-highest femicide rate in the world , after el salvador and jamaica , with around <number> murder for every <number> woman from <year> to <year> . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> guatemala is the largest economy in central america , with a gdp ( ppp ) per caput of u $ <number> . however , guatemala face many social problem and is one of the poorest country in latin america . the income distribution is highly unequal with more than half of the population below the national poverty line and just over <number> ( <number> ) unemployed . the cia world fact book considers <number> of the population of guatemala to be living in poverty in <year> . </s> in <year> , the guatemalan economy grew by <number> , recovering gradually from the <year> crisis , a a result of the falling demand from the united state and other central american market and the slowdown in foreign investment in the middle of the global recession of <year> . </s> remittance from guatemalan living in united state now constitute the largest single source of foreign income ( two-thirds of export and one tenth of gdp ) . </s> some of guatemala 's main export are fruit , vegetable , flower , handicraft , cloth and others . in the face of a rising demand for biofuels , the country is growing and exporting an increasing amount of raw material for biofuel production , especially sugar cane and palm oil . critic say that this development lead to higher price for staple food like corn , a major ingredient in the guatemalan diet . a a consequence of the subsidization of u american corn , guatemala import nearly half of it corn from the united state that is using <number> percent of it crop harvest for biofuel production . in <year> , the government wa considering way to legalize poppy and marijuana production , hoping to tax production and use tax revenue to fund drug prevention program and other social project . </s> gross domestic product ( gdp ) in purchasing power parity ( ppp ) in <year> wa estimated at u $ <number> billion . the service sector is the largest component of gdp at <number> , followed by the industry sector at <number> and the agriculture sector at <number> ( <year> est . ) . mine produce gold , silver , zinc , cobalt and nickel . the agricultural sector account for about two-fifths of export , and half of the labor force . organic coffee , sugar , textile , fresh vegetable , and banana are the country 's main export . inflation wa <number> in <year> . </s> the <year> peace accord that ended the decades-long civil war removed a major obstacle to foreign investment . tourism ha become an increasing source of revenue for guatemala thanks to the new foreign investment . </s> in march <year> , guatemala 's congress ratified the dominican republic-central america free trade agreement dominican republic ; central american free trade agreement ( dr-cafta ) between several central american nation and the united state . guatemala also ha free trade agreement with taiwan and colombia . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> tourism ha become one of the main driver of the economy , with tourism estimated at $ <number> billion to the economy in <year> . guatemala receives around two million tourist annually . in recent year , there ha been an increase in the number of cruise ship visiting guatemalan seaport , leading to higher tourist number . tourist destination include mayan archaeological site ( e.g . , tikal in the peten , quirigu in izabal , iximche in tecpan chimaltenango and guatemala city ) , natural attraction ( e.g . , lake atitln and semuc champey ) and historical site such a the colonial city of antigua guatemala , which is recognized a a unesco cultural heritage site . </s> <section_title_start> society <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> guatemala ha a population of ( est ) . with only <number> in <year> , this constitutes the fastest population growth in the western hemisphere during the <number> century . the republic of guatemala 's first census wa taken in <year> , and despite the fact that these census have been fairly accurate , they have not been taken at regular interval . the <year> census wa burned . data from the remaining census is in the historical population table below . </s> guatemala is heavily centralized : transportation , communication , business , politics , and the most relevant urban activity take place in the capital of guatemala city , whose urban area ha a population of almost <number> million . </s> the estimated median age in guatemala is <number> year old , <number> for male and <number> year for female . guatemala is demographically one of the youth in guatemala country in the western hemisphere , comparable to most of central africa and iraq . the proportion of the population below the age of <number> in <year> wa <number> , <number> were aged between <number> and <number> year of age , and <number> were aged <number> year or older . </s> <section_title_start> diaspora <section_title_end> </s> a significant number of guatemalan live outside of their country . the majority of the guatemalan diaspora is located in the united state of america , with estimate ranging from <number> to <number> . the difficulty in getting accurate count for guatemalan abroad is because many of them are refugee claimant awaiting determination of their status . emigration to the united state of america ha led to the growth of guatemalan community in california , delaware , florida , illinois , new york , new jersey , texas , rhode island and elsewhere since the <year> . however , a of july <year> , the united state and guatemala signed a deal to restrict migration and asylum seeker from guatemala . </s> below are estimate of the number of guatemalan living abroad for certain country : </s> <section_title_start> ethnic group <section_title_end> </s> guatemala is populated by a variety of ethnic , cultural , racial , and linguistic group . according to the <year> census conducted by the national institute of statistic ( guatemala ) national institute of statistic ( ine ) , <number> of the population is ladino people reflecting mixed indigenous and european heritage . indigenous guatemalan are <number> of the national population , which is one of the largest percentage in latin america , behind only peru and bolivia . most indigenous guatemalan ( <number> of the national population ) are of the maya people , namely k'iche ' people k'iche ' ( <number> of the total population ) , q'eqchi ' people q'eqchi ( <number> ) , kaqchikel people ( <number> ) , mam people ( <number> ) , and `` other maya people `` ( <number> ) . <number> of the national population is indigenous non-maya . <number> of the population is xinca ( mesoamerican ) , and <number> of the population is garifuna ( african/carib mix ) . </s> white people guatemalan of european descent , also called criollo people , are not differentiated from ladino ( mixed-race ) individual in the guatemalan census . most are descendant of german and spanish settler , and others derive from italian , british , french , swiss , belgian , dutch , russian and danish . german settler are credited with bringing the tradition of christmas tree to guatemala . </s> the population includes about <number> salvadoran . the garfuna , descended primarily from black african who lived and intermarried with indigenous people from st. vincent , live mainly in livingston ( guatemala ) and puerto barrio . afro-guatemalans and mulatto descended primarily from banana plantation worker . there are also asian people , mostly of han chinese descent but also arab people of lebanese people and syrian people descent . a growing korean community in guatemala city and in nearby mixco , number about <number> </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> guatemala 's sole official language is spanish , spoken by <number> percent of the population a either the first or second language . </s> twenty-one mayan language are spoken , especially in rural area , a well a two non-mayan amerindian language : xinca language , which is indigenous to the country , and garifuna language , an arawakan language spoken on the caribbean coast . according to the language law of <year> , these language are recognized a national language . </s> there are also significant number of german language , chinese language , french language and english language speaker . </s> <section_title_start> indigenous integration and bilingual education <section_title_end> </s> throughout the <number> century there have been many development in the integration of mayan language into the guatemalan society and educational system . originating from political reason , these process have aided the revival of some mayan language and advanced bilingual education in the country . </s> in <year> , in order to overcome `` the indian problem `` , the guatemalan government founded the institute indigents ta national ( nh ) , the purpose of which wa to teach literacy to mayan child in their mother tongue instead of spanish , to prepare the ground for later assimilation of the latter . the teaching of literacy in the first language , which received support from the un , significantly advanced in <year> , when the sil ( summer institute of linguistics ) , located in dallas , texas , partnered with the guatemalan ministry of education ; within <number> year , numerous written work in mayan language had been printed and published , and vast advancement wa done in the translation of the new testament . further effort to integrate the indigenous into the ladino society were made in the following year , including the invention of a special alphabet to assist mayan student transition to spanish , and bilingual education in the q'eqchi ' area . when spanish became the official language of guatemala in <year> , the government started several program , such a the bilingual castellanizacin program and the radiophonic school , to accelerate the move of mayan student to spanish . unintentionally , the effort to integrate the indigenous using language , especially the new alphabet , gave institution tool to use mayan tongue in school , and while improving mayan child 's learning , they left them unequipped to learn in a solely spanish environment . so , an additional expansion of bilingual education took place in <year> , when an experimental program in which child were to be instructed in their mother tongue until they are fluent enough in spanish wa created . the program proved successful when the student of the pilot showed higher academic achievement than the one in the spanish-only control school . in <year> , when the pilot wa to finish , bilingual education wa made official in guatemala . </s> <section_title_start> largest city <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> christianity continues to remain strong and vital for the life of demographic of guatemala , but it composition ha changed over generation of social and political unrest . roman catholicism , introduced by the spanish during the colonial era , remains the largest denomination or church , accounting for <number> of the population . protestant , most of them evangelicalism ( most protestant are called evangelicos in latin america ) in a wide number of different denomination , made up <number> of the population at that time , followed by <number> in other religion ( such a jew in guatemala , islam in guatemala , and buddhism ) , and <number> claiming no religious affiliation . a more recent <year> survey reveals catholic at <number> , protestant at <number> , other religion at <number> , and the non-religious at <number> . </s> since the <year> , and particularly since the <year> , guatemala ha experienced the rapid growth of evangelical protestantism , whose adherent currently form more than <number> of the population , and still growing , in different denomination . </s> over the past two decade , particularly since the end of the civil war , guatemala ha seen heightened missionary activity . protestant denomination have grown markedly in recent decade , chiefly evangelicalism and pentecostal variety ; growth is particularly strong among the ethnic maya population , with the national evangelical presbyterian church of guatemala maintaining <number> indigenous-language presbytery . the church of jesus christ of latter-day saint ha grown from <number> member in <year> to <number> in <year> , and continues to expand . </s> the growth of eastern orthodoxy in guatemala ha been especially strong , with hundred of thousand of convert in the last five year , giving the country the highest proportion of orthodox adherent in the western hemisphere . </s> traditional maya religion persists through the process of inculturation , in which certain practice are incorporated into catholic ceremony and worship when they are sympathetic to the meaning of catholic belief . indigenous religious practice are increasing a a result of the cultural protection established under the peace accord . the government ha instituted a policy of providing altar at every maya ruin to facilitate traditional ceremony . </s> between <year> and <year> , the prolades corporation made a study of public opinion poll in guatemala . it data reveal a relative decline in catholicism and significant growth of denomination within evangelical protestantism , people adhering to no religion , and minority faith ( including indigenous tradition ) . in <year> , catholic and evangelical protestant found common cause against abortion , in a rare public demonstration of unity . </s> * including judaism , islam , mayan religion , etc . </s> * * including other religion and none/na . </s> <section_title_start> immigration <section_title_end> </s> during the colonial era guatemala received immigrant ( settler ) only from spain . subsequently , guatemala received wave of immigration from europe in the mid <number> century and early <number> century . primarily from germany , these immigrant installed coffee and cardamom fincas in alta verapaz , zacapa , quetzaltenango , baja verapaz and izabal department . to a lesser extent people also arrived from spain , france , belgium , england , italy , sweden , etc . </s> many european immigrant to guatemala were politician , refugee , and entrepreneur a well a family looking to settle . up to <year> guatemala wa the central american country that received the most immigrant , behind costa rica , and large number of immigrant are still received today . </s> since the <year> there have been small community of asian ( in particular from korea , china , japan , singapore , and the philippine ) but in recent decade this ha been growing . also , beginning with the first world war , the immigrant population is being strengthened by jewish immigration . </s> during the second half of the twentieth century , latin american immigration grew in guatemala , particularly from other central american country , mexico , cuba , and argentina , although most of these immigrant stayed only temporarily before going to their final destination in the united state . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> guatemala ha among the worst health outcome in latin america with some of the highest infant mortality rate , and one of the lowest life expectancy at birth in the region . with about <number> doctor for it <number> million people , guatemala ha about half the doctor-citizen ratio recommended by the world health organization who ] . since the end of the [ [ guatemalan civil war in <year> , the ministry of health ha extended healthcare access to <number> of the rural population . </s> healthcare ha received different level of support from different political administration who disagree on how best to manage distribution of service via a private or a public entity and the scale of financing that should be made available . , the ministry of health lacked the financial mean to monitor or evaluate it program . </s> total healthcare spending , both public and private , ha remained constant at between <number> and <number> of the gdp . per-capita average annual healthcare spending wa only $ <number> in <year> . guatemalan patient choose between indigenous treatment or western medicine when they engage with the health system . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> <number> of the population aged <number> and over is literate , the lowest literacy rate in central america . guatemala ha a plan to increase literacy over the next <number> year . </s> the government run a number of public elementary and secondary-level school , a youth in guatemala do not fully participate in education . these school are free , though the cost of uniform , book , supply , and transportation make them le accessible to the poorer segment of society and significant number of poor child do not attend school . many middle and upper-class child go to private school . guatemala ha one public university ( usac or universidad de san carlos de guatemala ) , and fourteen private one ( see list of university in guatemala ) . usac wa the first university in guatemala and one of the first university of america . </s> organization such a child aid , pueblo a pueblo , and common hope , which train teacher in village throughout the central highland region , are working to improve educational outcome for child . lack of training for rural teacher is one of the key contributor to guatemala 's low literacy rate . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> guatemala city is home to many of the nation 's library and museum , including the national archive , the national library , and the museum of archeology and ethnology , which ha an extensive collection of maya artifact . it also boast private museum such a the ixchel museum of indigenous textile and clothing and the museo popol vuh , which focus on maya archaeology . both these museum are housed on the universidad francisco marroqun campus . most of the <number> municipality in the country have at least a small museum . </s> <section_title_start> art <section_title_end> </s> guatemala ha produced many indigenous artist who follow centuries-old pre-columbian tradition . reflecting guatemala 's colonial and post-colonial history , encounter with multiple global art movement also have produced a wealth of artist who have combined the traditional primitivism or nave art with european , north american , and other tradition . </s> the escuela nacional de artes plsticas `` rafael rodrguez padilla `` is guatemala 's leading art school , and several leading indigenous artist , also graduate of that school , have work in the permanent collection of the museo nacional de arte moderno `` carlos mrida `` in the capital city . contemporary guatemalan artist who have gained reputation outside of guatemala include dagoberto vsquez , luis rolando ixquiac xicara , carlos mrida , anbal lpez , roberto gonzlez goyri , and elmar rojas . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> * the guatemala national prize in literature is a one-time-only award that recognizes an individual writer 's body of work . it ha been given annually since <year> by the ministry of culture and sport . </s> * miguel ngel asturias won the nobel prize in literature in <year> . among his famous book is el seor presidente , a novel based on the government of manuel estrada cabrera . </s> * rigoberta mench , winner of the nobel peace prize for fighting oppression of indigenous people in guatemala , is famous for her book i , rigoberta mench and crossing border . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> the guatemalan director jayro bustamante ha gained an international audience with his film focused on guatemalan contemporary society and politics : ixcanul in <year> , and temblores and la llorona ( the weeping woman ) in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> medium and news <section_title_end> </s> major national newspaper in guatemala include prensa libre ( guatemala ) , el peridico ( guatemala ) and siglo veintiuno . the guatemala time is a digital english news magazine . guatemala also ha a few major local channel and radio station , such a one of guatemala 's major radio station , emisoras unidas . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> guatemalan music comprises a number of style and expression . guatemalan social change ha been empowered by music such a nueva cancion , which blend together history , present-day issue , and the political value and struggle of common people . the maya civilization had an intense musical practice , a documented by their iconography . guatemala wa also one of the first region in the new world to be introduced to european music , from <year> on . many composer from the renaissance , baroque , classical , romantic , and contemporary music style have contributed work of all genre . the marimba , which is like a wooden xylophone , is the national instrument and it music is widely found in guatemala . it ha developed a large repertoire of very attractive piece that have been popular for more than a century . </s> the historia general de guatemala ha published a series of cd compiling the historical music of guatemala , in which every style is represented , from the maya , colonial , independent and republican era to the present . many contemporary music group in guatemala play caribbean music , salsa music , garifuna music-influenced punta , latin pop , music of mexico , and mariachi . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> many traditional food in guatemalan cuisine are based on mayan cuisine and prominently feature maize , chili pepper and black turtle bean a key ingredient . traditional dish also include a variety of stew including kak'ik ( kak-ik ) , which is a tomato-based stew with turkey ( bird ) , pepian , and cocido . guatemala is also known for it mexican street food , which include small tamale called chuchitos , fried cooking banana , and tostada ( tortilla ) with tomato sauce , guacamole or black bean . certain food are also commonly eaten on certain day of the week ; for example , a popular custom is to eat paches ( a kind of tamale made from potato ) on thursday . certain dish are also associated with special occasion , such a fiambre for all saint ' day on <number> november , or tamale and ponche ( punch ( drink ) ) , which are both very common around christmas . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> football <section_title_end> </s> association football is the most popular sport in guatemala and it guatemala national football team ha appeared in <number> edition of the concacaf championship , winning it once , in <year> concacaf championship . however , the team ha failed to qualify to a fifa world cup so far . established in <year> , the national football federation of guatemala organizes the country 's liga nacional de ftbol de guatemala and it lower-level competition . </s> <section_title_start> futsal <section_title_end> </s> futsal is probably the most successful team sport in guatemala . it guatemala national futsal team won the <year> concacaf futsal championship a host . it wa also the runner-up in <year> concacaf futsal championship a host and won the bronze medal in <year> concacaf futsal championship . </s> guatemala participated for the first time in the fifa futsal world cup in <year> fifa futsal world cup , a host , and ha played in every competition from <year> fifa futsal world cup onwards . it ha never passed the first round . it ha also participated in every grand prix de futsal since <year> grand prix de futsal , reaching the semifinal in <year> grand prix de futsal . </s> <section_title_start> olympics <section_title_end> </s> the guatemalan olympic committee wa founded in <year> and recognized by the international olympic committee that same year . guatemala participated in the guatemala at the <year> summer olympics , and in every edition since the guatemala at the <year> summer olympics . it ha also appeared in a single winter olympics edition , in guatemala at the <year> winter olympics . </s> erick barrondo won the only olympic medal for guatemala so far , silver in athletics at the <year> summer olympics men 's <number> kilometre walk at the guatemala at the <year> summer olympics . </s> <section_title_start>
