</s> category : northern triangle of central america <article_end> <article_start> </s> norway ( ; ; norga ; vuodna ; vuodna ; nrje ) , officially the kingdom of norway , is a nordic country in northern europe whose mainland territory comprises the western and northernmost portion of the scandinavian peninsula . the remote arctic island of jan mayen and the archipelago of svalbard also form part of norway . bouvet island , located in the subantarctic , is a dependency of norway ; it also territorial claim in antarctica to the antarctic territory of peter i island and queen maud land . </s> norway ha a total area of and a population of <number> a of november <year> . the country share a long eastern border with sweden ( list of country and territory by land border <number> km or <number> ; mi long ) . norway is bordered by finland and russia to the north-east , and the skagerrak strait to the south , with denmark on the other side . norway ha an extensive coastline , facing the north atlantic ocean and the barents sea . the maritime influence also dominates norway 's climate with mild lowland temperature on the sea coast , whereas the interior , while colder , is also a lot milder than area elsewhere in the world on such northerly latitude . even during polar night in the north , temperature above freezing are commonplace on the coastline . the maritime influence brings high rainfall and snowfall to some area of the country . </s> harald v of norway of the house of glcksburg is the current king of norway . erna solberg ha been prime minister since <year> when she replaced jens stoltenberg . a a unitary state sovereign state with a constitutional monarchy , norway separation of power between the storting , the cabinet of norway and the supreme court of norway , a determined by the constitution of norway . the kingdom wa established in <number> a a merger of many petty kingdom of norway and ha existed continuously for <number> , year . from <year> to <year> , norway wa a part of the kingdom of denmarknorway , and from <year> to <year> , it wa in a union between sweden and norway with the kingdom of sweden . norway wa neutral during the world war i and remained so until april <year> when the country wa operation weserbung and german occupation of norway by germany until the end of world war ii . </s> norway ha both administrative and political subdivision on two level : county of norway and list of municipality of norway . the smi people have a certain amount of self-determination and influence over traditional territory through the smi parliament of norway and the finnmark act . norway norwayeuropean union relation with both the european union and the united states-norway relation . norway is also a founding member of the united nation , nato , the european free trade association , the council of europe , the antarctic treaty system , and the nordic council ; a member of the european economic area , the world trade organization , and the oecd ; and a part of the schengen area . in addition , the norwegian language share mutual intelligibility with danish language and swedish language . </s> norway maintains the nordic model with universal health care and a comprehensive social security system , and it value are rooted in egalitarian ideal . the norwegian state ha large ownership position in key industrial sector , having extensive reserve of petroleum , natural gas , mineral , lumber , seafood , and fresh water . the petroleum industry account for around a quarter of the country 's gross domestic product ( gdp ) . on a per caput per-capita basis , norway is the world 's largest producer of oil and natural gas outside of the middle east . </s> the country ha the list of country by gdp ( ppp ) per caput fourth-highest per-capita income in the world on the world bank and international monetary fund list . on the central intelligence agency 's gdp ( ppp ) per caput list ( <year> estimate ) which includes autonomous territory and region , norway rank a number eleven . it ha the world 's largest sovereign wealth fund , with a value of u $ <number> ; trillion . norway ha had the highest human development index ranking in the world since <year> , a position also held previously between <year> and <year> ; it also ha the highest list of country by inequality-adjusted hdi inequality-adjusted ranking per <year> . norway ranked first on the world happiness report for <year> and currently rank first on the oecd better life index , the global integrity , and the democracy index . norway also ha one of the lowest crime rate in the world . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> norway ha two official name : norge in bokml and noreg in nynorsk . the english name norway come from the old english word norweg mentioned in <number> , meaning `` northern way `` or `` way leading to the north `` , which is how the anglo-saxon referred to the coastline of atlantic norway similar to leading theory about the origin of the norwegian language name . the anglo-saxon of britain also referred to the kingdom of norway in <number> a normanna land . </s> there is some disagreement about whether the native name of norway originally had the same etymology a the english form . according to the traditional dominant view , the first component wa originally : wikt : norr , a cognate of english north , so the full name wa norr wikt : vegr , `` the way northward `` , referring to the sailing route along the norwegian coast , and contrasting with survegar `` southern way `` ( from old norse : wikt : sur ) for ( germany ) , and austrvegr `` eastern way `` ( from : wikt : austr ) for the baltic sea . in the translation of orosius for alfred , the name is norweg , while in younger old english source the is gone . in the <number> century many norseman settled in northern france , according to the saga , in the area that wa later called normandy from normann ( norseman or scandinavian ) , although not a norwegian possession . in france normanni or northmanni referred to people of norway , sweden or denmark . until around <year> , inhabitant of western norway were referred to a nordmenn ( northman ) while inhabitant of eastern norway were referred to a austmenn ( eastman ) . </s> according to another theory , the first component wa a word nr , meaning `` narrow `` ( old english nearu ) , referring to the inner-archipelago sailing route through the land ( `` narrow way `` ) . the interpretation a `` northern `` , a reflected in the english and latin form of the name , would then have been due to later folk etymology . this latter view originated with philologist niels halvorsen trnnes in <year> ; since <year> it a also advocated by language student and activist klaus johan myrvoll and wa adopted by philology professor michael schulte ( professor ) . the form nore is still used in placenames such a the village of nore , norway and lake norefjorden in buskerud county , and still ha the same meaning . among other argument in favour of the theory , it is pointed out that the word ha a long vowel in skaldic poetry and is not attested with in any native norse text or inscription ( the earliest runic attestation have the spelling nuruiak and nuriki ) . this resurrected theory ha received some pushback by other scholar on various ground , e. ; g. the uncontroversial presence of the element norr in the ethnonym norrmar `` norseman , norwegian person `` ( modern norwegian nordmann ) , and the adjective norrnn `` northern , norse , norwegian `` , a well a the very early attestation of the latin and anglo-saxon form with </s> ! . </s> in a latin manuscript of <number> , the name northuagia is mentioned , while a french chronicle of c. <number> us the name northwegia and norwegia . when ohthere of hlogaland visited king alfred the great in england in the end of the ninth century , the land wa called norwegr ( lit . `` northway `` ) and normanna land ( lit . `` northman 's land `` ) . according to ohthere , normanna lived along the atlantic coast , the dane around skagerrak og kattegat , while the smi people ( the `` fin `` ) had a nomadic lifestyle in the wide interior . ohthere told alfred that he wa `` the most northern of all norwegian `` , presumably at senja island or closer to troms . he also said that beyond the wide wilderness in norway 's southern part wa the land of the swede , `` svealand `` . </s> the adjective norwegian , recorded from c. <year> , is derived from the middle latin of the name a norwegia ; in the adjective norwegian , the old english spelling '-weg ' ha survived . </s> after norway had become christian , noregr and noregi had become the most common form , but during the <number> century , the newer form noreg ( h ) and norg ( h ) e , found in medieval icelandic manuscript , took over and have survived until the modern day . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> prehistory <section_title_end> </s> the first inhabitant were the ahrensburg culture ( <number> to <number> millennium bc ) , which wa a late upper paleolithic culture during the younger dryas , the last period of cold at the end of the weichselian glaciation . the culture is named after the village of ahrensburg , north-east of hamburg in the schleswig-holstein german state of schleswig-holstein , where wooden arrow shaft and club have been excavated . the earliest trace of human occupation in norway are found along the coast , where the huge ice shelf of the last glacial period first melted between <number> and <number> bc . the oldest find are stone tool dating from <number> to <number> bc , discovered in finnmark ( komsa culture ) in the north and rogaland ( fosna-hensbacka culture ) in the south-west . however , theory about two altogether different culture ( the komsa culture north of the arctic circle being one and the fosna culture from trndelag to oslofjord being the other ) were rendered obsolete in the <year> . </s> more recent find along the entire coast revealed to archaeologist that the difference between the two can simply be ascribed to different type of tool and not to different culture . coastal fauna provided a mean of livelihood for fisherman and hunter , who may have made their way along the southern coast about <number> bc when the interior wa still covered with ice . it is now thought that these so-called `` arctic `` people came from the south and followed the coast northward considerably later . </s> in the southern part of the country are dwelling site dating from about <number> bc . find from these site give a clearer idea of the life of the hunting and fishing people . the implement vary in shape and mostly are made of different kind of stone ; those of later period are more skilfully made . rock carving ( i.e . petroglyph ) have been found , usually near hunting and fishing ground . they represent game such a deer , reindeer , moose , bear , bird , earless seal , whale , and fish ( especially salmon and [ all of which were vital to the way of life of the coastal people . the rock carving at alta ] in finnmark , the largest in scandinavia , were made at sea level from <number> to <number> bc and mark the progression of the land a the sea rose after the last ice age ended . </s> <section_title_start> bronze age <section_title_end> </s> between <year> and <year> bc , new settler ( [ [ corded ware culture ) arrived in eastern norway . they were proto-indo-europeans indo-european farmer who grew grain and kept cow and sheep . the hunting-fishing population of the west coast wa also gradually replaced by farmer , though hunting and fishing remained useful secondary mean of livelihood . </s> from about <year> bc , bronze wa gradually introduced , but the use of stone implement continued ; norway had few rich to barter for bronze good , and the few find consist mostly of elaborate weapon and brooch that only chieftain could afford . huge burial cairn built close to the sea a far north a harstad and also inland in the south are characteristic of this period . the motif of the rock carving differ slightly from those typical of the stone age . representation of the sun , animal , tree , weapon , ship , and people are all strongly stylised . </s> thousand of rock carving from this period depict ship , and the large stone burial monument known a stone ship , suggest that ship and seafaring played an important role in the culture at large . the depicted ship most likely represent sewn plank built canoe used for warfare , fishing and trade . these ship type may have their origin a far back a the neolithic period and they continue into the pre-roman iron age , a exemplified by the hjortspring boat . </s> <section_title_start> iron age <section_title_end> </s> little ha been found dating from the early iron age ( the last <number> year bc ) . the dead were cremated , and their graf contain few burial good . during the first four century ad , the people of norway were in contact with roman-occupied gaul . about <number> roman bronze cauldron , often used a burial urn , have been found . contact with the civilised country farther south brought a knowledge of rune ; the oldest known norwegian runic inscription date from the <number> century . at this time , the amount of settled area in the country increased , a development that can be traced by coordinated study of topography , archaeology , and place-names . the oldest root name , such a ne , vik , and b ( `` cape , `` `` bay , `` and `` farm `` ) , are of great antiquity , dating perhaps from the bronze age , whereas the earliest of the group of compound name with the suffix vin ( `` meadow `` ) or heim ( `` settlement `` ) , a in bjrgvin ( bergen ) or sheim ( seim ) , usually date from the <number> century ad . </s> archaeologist first made the decision to divide the iron age of northern europe into distinct pre-roman and roman iron age after emil vedel unearthed a number of iron age artefact in <year> on the island of bornholm . they did not exhibit the same permeating roman influence seen in most other artefact from the early century ad , indicating that part of northern europe had not yet come into contact with the roman at the beginning of the iron age . </s> <section_title_start> migration period <section_title_end> </s> the destruction of the western roman empire by the germanic people in the <number> century is characterised by rich find , including tribal chief ' graf containing magnificent weapon and gold object . hill fort were built on precipitous rock for defence . excavation ha revealed stone foundation of farmhouse longone even longthe roof of which were supported on wooden post . these house were family homestead where several generation lived together , with people and cattle under one roof . </s> these state were based on either clan or tribe ( e.g . , the horder of hordaland in western norway ) . by the <number> century , each of these small state had thing ( assembly ) ( local or regional assembly ) for negotiating and settling dispute . the thing meeting place , each eventually with a [ ( open-air sanctuary ) or a heathen hof ] ( temple ; literally `` hill `` ) , were usually situated on the oldest and best farm , which belonged to the chieftain and wealthiest farmer . the regional thing united to form even larger unit : assembly of deputy yeoman from several region . in this way , the lagting ( assembly for negotiation and lawmaking ) developed . the gulating had it meeting place by [ [ sognefjord and may have been the centre of an aristocratic confederation along the western fjord and island called the gulatingslag . the frostating wa the assembly for the leader in the trondheimsfjord area ; the earl of lade , near trondheim , seem to have enlarged the frostatingslag by adding the coastland from romsdalsfjord to lofoten . </s> <section_title_start> viking age <section_title_end> </s> from the <number> to the <number> century , the wider scandinavian region wa the source of viking . the looting of the monastery at lindisfarne in northeast england in <number> by north germanic people ha long been regarded a the event which marked the beginning of the viking age . this age wa characterised by expansion and emigration by viking seafarer . they colonised , raided , and traded in all part of europe . norwegian viking explorer discovered iceland by accident in the <number> century when heading for the faroe island , and eventually came across vinland , known today a newfoundland ( island ) , in canada . the viking from norway were most active in the northern and western british isle and eastern north america isle . </s> according to tradition , harald fairhair unified them into one in <number> after the battle of hafrsfjord in stavanger , thus becoming the first king of a united norway . harald 's realm wa mainly a south norwegian coastal state . fairhair ruled with a strong hand and according to the saga , many norwegian left the country to live in iceland , the faroe island , greenland , and part of great britain and ireland . the modern-day irish city of dublin , limerick and waterford were founded by norwegian settler . </s> norse mythology were replaced slowly by christian mythology in the late <number> and early <number> century . one of the most important source for the history of the <number> century viking is the treaty between the icelander and olaf haraldsson , king of norway circa <year> to <year> . this is largely attributed to the missionary king olaf i of norway and olaf ii of norway st. olav . haakon i of norway wa norway 's first christian king , in the mid-10th century , though his attempt to introduce the religion wa rejected . born sometime in between <number> and <number> , olav tryggvasson set off raiding in england with <number> ship . he attacked london during this raiding . arriving back in norway in <number> , olav landed in moster ( island ) . there he built a church which became the first old moster church ever built in norway . from moster , olav sailed north to trondheim where he wa proclaimed king of norway by the eyrathing in <number> </s> feudalism never really developed in norway or sweden , a it did in the rest of europe . however , the administration of government took on a very conservative feudal character . the hanseatic league forced the royalty to cede to them greater and greater concession over foreign trade and the economy . the league had this hold over the royalty because of the loan the hansa had made to the royalty and the large debt the king were carrying . the league 's monopolistic control over the economy of norway put pressure on all class , especially the peasantry , to the degree that no real burgher ( title ) class existed in norway . </s> <section_title_start> civil war and peak of power <section_title_end> </s> from the <year> to <year> , the country wa at peace . in <year> , the civil war era in norway broke out on the basis of line of succession to the norwegian throne , which allowed all the king 's son to rule jointly . for period there could be peace , before a lesser son allied himself with a chieftain and started a new conflict . the archdiocese of nidaros wa created in <year> and attempted to control the appointment of king . the church inevitably had to take side in the conflict , with the civil war also becoming an issue regarding the church 's influence of the king . the war ended in <year> with the appointment of hkon hkonsson , who introduced clear law of succession . </s> from <year> to <year> , the population increased from <number> to <number> , resulting both in more land being cleared and the subdivision of farm . while in the viking age all farmer owned their own land , by <year> , seventy percent of the land wa owned by the king , the church , or the aristocracy . this wa a gradual process which took place because of farmer borrowing money in poor time and not being able to repay . however , tenant always remained free men and the large distance and often scattered ownership meant that they enjoyed much more freedom than continental serf . in the <number> century , about twenty percent of a farmer 's yield went to the king , church and landowner . </s> the <number> century is described a norway 's golden age , with peace and increase in trade , especially with the british island , although germany became increasingly important towards the end of the century . throughout the high middle age , the king established norway a a sovereign state with a central administration and local representative . </s> in <year> , the black death spread to norway and had within a year killed a third of the population . later plague reduced the population to half the starting point by <year> . many community were entirely wiped out , resulting in an abundance of land , allowing farmer to switch to more animal husbandry . the reduction in tax weakened the king 's position , and many aristocrat lost the basis for their surplus , reducing some to mere farmer . high tithe to church made it increasingly powerful and the archbishop became a member of the norwegian council of state . </s> the hanseatic league took control over norwegian trade during the <number> century and established a trading center in bergen . in <year> , olaf ii of denmark inherited both the norwegian and danish throne , creating a union between the two country . in <year> , under margaret i of denmark , the kalmar union wa created between the three scandinavian country . she waged war against the german , resulting in a trade blockade and higher taxation on norwegian good , which resulted in engelbrekt rebellion . however , the norwegian council of state wa too weak to pull out of the union . </s> margaret pursued a centralising policy which inevitably favoured denmark , because it had a greater population than norway and sweden combined . margaret also granted trade privilege to the hanseatic merchant of lbeck in bergen in return for recognition of her right to rule , and these hurt the norwegian economy . the hanseatic merchant formed a state within a state in bergen for generation . even worse were the pirate , the `` victual brother `` , who launched three devastating raid on the port ( the last in <year> ) . </s> norway slipped ever more to the background under the house of oldenburg ( established <year> ) . there wa one revolt under knut alvsson in <year> . norwegian had some affection for christian ii of denmark , who resided in the country for several year . norway took no part in the event which led to swedish independence from denmark in the <year> . </s> <section_title_start> kalmar union <section_title_end> </s> upon the death of haakon v of norway ( king of norway ) in <year> , magnus iv of sweden , at just three year old , inherited the throne a king magnus vii of norway . at the same time , a movement to make magnus king of sweden proved successful , and both the king of sweden and of denmark were elected to the throne by their respective noble , thus , with his election to the throne of sweden , both sweden and norway were united under king magnus vii . </s> in <year> , the black death radically altered norway , killing between <number> and <number> of it population and leaving it in a period of social and economic decline . the plague left norway very poor . although the death rate wa comparable with the rest of europe , economic recovery took much longer because of the small , scattered population . even before the plague , the population wa only about <number> . after the plague , many farm lay idle while the population slowly increased . however , the few surviving farm ' tenant found their bargaining position with their landlord greatly strengthened . </s> king magnus vii ruled norway until <year> , when his son , haakon , wa placed on the throne a haakon vi of norway . in <year> , haakon vi married margaret i of denmark , the daughter of king valdemar iv of denmark . upon the death of haakon vi , in <year> , his son , olaf ii of denmark , wa only <number> year old . olaf had already been elected to the throne of denmark on <number> may <year> . thus , upon olaf 's accession to the throne of norway , denmark and norway entered personal union . olaf 's mother and haakon 's widow , queen margaret , managed the foreign affair of denmark and norway during the minority of olaf iv . </s> margaret wa working toward a union of sweden with denmark and norway by having olaf elected to the swedish throne . she wa on the verge of achieving this goal when olaf iv suddenly died . however , denmark made margaret temporary ruler upon the death of olaf . on <number> february <year> , norway followed suit and crowned margaret . queen margaret knew that her power would be more secure if she were able to find a king to rule in her place . she settled on eric of pomerania , grandson of her sister . thus at an all-scandinavian meeting held at kalmar , erik of pomerania wa crowned king of all three scandinavian country . thus , royal politics resulted in personal union between the nordic country , eventually bringing the throne of norway , denmark , and sweden under the control of queen margaret when the country entered into the kalmar union . </s> <section_title_start> union with denmark <section_title_end> </s> after sweden broke out of the kalmar union in <year> , norway tried to follow suit , but the subsequent rebellion wa defeated , and norway remained in a union with denmark until <year> , a total of <number> year . during the romantic nationalism of the <number> century , this period wa nicolai wergeland referred to a the `` <number>-year night `` , since all of the kingdom 's royal , intellectual , and administrative power wa centred in copenhagen in denmark . in fact , it wa a period of great prosperity and progress for norway , especially in term of shipping and foreign trade , and it also secured the country 's revival from the demographic catastrophe it suffered in the black death . based on the respective natural resource , denmarknorway wa in fact a very good match since denmark supported norway 's need for grain and food supply , and norway supplied denmark with timber , metal , and fish . </s> with the reformation in denmarknorway and holstein in <year> , the archbishopric in trondheim wa dissolved , and norway lost it independence , and effectually became a colony of denmark . the church 's income and possession were instead redirected to the court in copenhagen . norway lost the steady stream of pilgrim to the relic of olaf ii of norway st. olav at the nidaros shrine , and with them , much of the contact with cultural and economic life in the rest of europe . </s> eventually restored a a kingdom ( albeit in legislative union with denmark ) in <year> , norway saw it land area decrease in the <number> century with the loss of the province bohusln , jmtland , and hrjedalen to sweden , a the result of a number of disastrous war with sweden . in the north , however , it territory wa increased by the acquisition of the northern province of troms and finnmark , at the expense of sweden and russia . </s> the great famine of <year> <number> famine of <year> <number> killed roughly <number> of norway 's population . the harvest failed in scandinavia at least nine time between <year> and <year> , with great loss of life . </s> <section_title_start> union with sweden <section_title_end> </s> after denmarknorway wa attacked by the united kingdom at the <year> battle of copenhagen ( <year> ) , it entered into an alliance with napoleon , with the war leading to dire condition and mass starvation in <year> . a the danish kingdom found itself on the losing side in <year> , it wa forced , under term of the treaty of kiel , to cede norway to the king of sweden , while the old norwegian province of iceland , greenland , and the faroe island remained with the danish crown . norway took this opportunity to declare independence , adopted a constitution based on united state constitution and constitution of france model , and elected the crown prince of denmark and norway , christian viii of denmark , a king on <number> may <year> . this is the famous norwegian constitution day ( seventeenth of may ) holiday celebrated by norwegian and norwegian-americans alike . syttende mai is also called norwegian constitution day . </s> norwegian opposition to the great power ' decision to link norway with sweden caused the swedishnorwegian war ( <year> ) norwegianswedish war to break out a sweden tried to subdue norway by military mean . a sweden 's military wa not strong enough to defeat the norwegian force outright , and norway 's treasury wa not large enough to support a protracted war , and a british and russian navy blockaded the norwegian coast , the belligerent were forced to negotiate the convention of moss . according to the term of the convention , christian frederik abdicated the norwegian throne and authorised the parliament of norway to make the necessary constitutional amendment to allow for the personal union that norway wa forced to accept . on <number> november <year> , the parliament ( storting ) elected charles xiii of sweden a king of norway , thereby establishing the union between sweden and norway . under this arrangement , norway kept it liberal constitution and it own independent institution , though it shared a common monarch and common foreign policy with sweden . following the recession caused by the napoleonic war , economic development of norway remained slow until economic growth began around <year> . </s> this period also saw the rise of the norwegian romantic nationalism , a norwegian sought to define and express a distinct national character . the movement covered all branch of culture , including literature ( henrik wergeland [ <year> <number> ] , bjrnstjerne bjrnson [ <year> <number> ] , peter christen asbjrnsen [ <year> <number> ] , jrgen moe [ <year> <number> ] ) , painting ( han gude [ <year> <number> ] , adolph tidemand [ <year> <number> ] ) , music ( edvard grieg [ <year> <number> ] ) , and even language policy , where attempt to define a native written language for norway led to today 's two official written form for norwegian : bokml and nynorsk . </s> charles xiv john of sweden , who came to the throne of norway and sweden in <year> , wa the second king following norway 's break from denmark and the union with sweden . charles john wa a complex man whose long reign extended to <year> . he protected the constitution and liberty of norway and sweden during the age of klemens wenzel , prince von metternich . a such , he wa regarded a a liberal monarch for that age . however , he wa ruthless in his use of paid informer , the secret police and restriction on the freedom of the press to put down public movement for reformespecially the norwegian national independence movement . </s> the romanticism that followed the reign of king charles iii john brought some significant social and political reform . in <year> , woman won the right to inherit property in their own right , just like men . in <year> , the last trace of keeping unmarried woman in the status of minor wa removed . furthermore , woman were then eligible for different occupation , particularly the common school teacher . by mid-century , norway 's democracy wa limited by modern standard : voting wa limited to official , property owner , leaseholder and burgher of incorporated town . </s> still , norway remained a conservative society . life in norway ( especially economic life ) wa `` dominated by the aristocracy of professional men who filled most of the important post in the central government `` . there wa no strong bourgeosie class in norway to demand a breakdown of this aristocratic control of the economy . thus , even while revolution swept over most of the country of europe in <year> , norway wa largely unaffected by revolt that year . </s> marcus thrane wa a utopian socialist . he made his appeal to the labouring class urging a change of social structure `` from below upwards . `` in <year> , he organised a labour society in drammen . in just a few month , this society had a membership of <number> and wa publishing it own newspaper . within two year , <number> society had been organised all over norway , with a total membership of <number> person . the membership wa drawn from the lower class of both urban and rural area ; for the first time these two group felt they had a common cause . in the end , the revolt wa easily crushed ; thrane wa captured and in <year> , after four year in jail , wa sentenced to three additional year for crime against the safety of the state . upon his release , marcus thrane attempted unsuccessfully to revitalise his movement , but after the death of his wife , he migrated to the united state . </s> in <year> , all men were granted universal suffrage , followed by all woman 's suffrage in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> dissolution of the union <section_title_end> </s> christian michelsen , a shipping magnate and statesman , and prime minister of norway from <year> to <year> , played a central role in the peaceful separation of norway from sweden on <number> june <year> . a national referendum confirmed the people 's preference for a monarchy over a republic . however , no norwegian could legitimately claim the throne , since none of norway 's noble family could claim descent from medieval royalty . in european tradition , royal descent or `` blue `` blood is a precondition for laying claim to the throne . </s> the government then offered the throne of norway to prince carl of denmark , a prince of the dano-german royal [ of schleswig-holstein-sonderburg-glcksburg ] and a distant relative of several of norway 's medieval king . after century of close tie between norway and denmark , a prince from the latter wa the obvious choice for a european prince who could best relate to the norwegian people . following the plebiscite , he wa unanimously elected king by the norwegian parliament of norway , the first king of a fully independent norway in <number> year ( <year> : kalmar union ) ; he took the name haakon vii of norway . in <year> , the country welcomed the prince from neighbouring denmark , his wife maud of wale and their young son to re-establish norway 's royal house . </s> <section_title_start> first and second world war <section_title_end> </s> throughout the first world war , norway wa in principle a neutral country . in reality , however , norway had been pressured by the british to hand over increasingly large part of it large merchant fleet to the british at low rate , a well a to join the trade blockade against germany . norwegian merchant marine ship , often with norwegian sailor still on board , were then sailing under the british flag and at risk of being sunk by german submarine . thus , many norwegian sailor and ship were lost . thereafter , the world ranking of the norwegian merchant navy fell from fourth place to sixth in the world . </s> norway also proclaimed it neutrality during the second world war , but despite this , it wa operation weserbung on <number> april <year> . although norway wa unprepared for the german surprise attack ( see : battle of drbak sound , norwegian campaign , and invasion of norway ) , military and naval resistance lasted for two month . norwegian armed force in the north launched an offensive against the german force in the battle of narvik , until they were forced to surrender on <number> june after losing british support which had been diverted to france during the battle of france . </s> haakon vii of norway and the norwegian government escaped to rotherhithe in london . throughout the war they sent inspirational radio speech and supported clandestine military action in norway against the german . on the day of the invasion , the leader of the small national-socialist party nasjonal samling , vidkun quisling , tried to seize power , but wa forced by the german occupier to step aside . real power wa wielded by the leader of the german occupation authority , reichskommissar josef terboven . quisling , a minister president , later formed a quisling regime . up to <number> norwegian volunteered to fight in german unit , including the waffen-ss . </s> the fraction of the norwegian population that supported germany wa traditionally smaller than in sweden , but greater than is generally appreciated today . it included a number of prominent personality such a the nobel-prize winning novelist knut hamsun . the concept of a `` germanic union `` of member state fit well into their thoroughly nationalist-patriotic ideology . </s> many norwegian and person of norwegian descent joined the allied force a well a the free norwegian force . in june <year> , a small group had left norway following their king to britain . this group included <number> ship , five aircraft , and <number> men from the royal norwegian navy . by the end of the war , the force had grown to <number> ship and <number> men in service in the royal norwegian navy , <number> squadron of aircraft ( including spitfire , sunderland flying boat and mosquito ) in the newly formed norwegian air force , and land force including the norwegian independent company <number> and <number> troop a well a no . <number> british commando . </s> during the five year of german occupation of norway , norwegian built a norwegian resistance movement which fought the german occupation force with both civil disobedience and armed resistance including the destruction of norsk hydro 's [ water ] plant and stockpile of heavy water at vemork , which crippled the german nuclear programme ( see : norwegian heavy water sabotage ) . more important to the ally of world war ii war effort , however , wa the role of the norwegian merchant navy . at the time of the invasion , norway had the fourth-largest merchant marine fleet in the world . it wa led by the norwegian shipping company nortraship under the ally throughout the war and took part in every war operation from the dunkirk evacuation to the normandy landing . every december norway give a christmas tree to the united kingdom a thanks for the british assistance during the second world war . a ceremony take place to erect the tree in london 's trafalgar square . svalbard wa not occupied by german troop . germany secretly operation haudegen in <year> . the crew wa stuck after the general capitulation in may <year> and were rescued by a norwegian seal hunter on <number> september . they surrendered to the seal hunter a the last german soldier to surrender in ww2 . </s> <section_title_start> post-world war ii history <section_title_end> </s> from <year> to <year> , the norwegian labour party held an absolute majority in the parliament . the government , led by prime minister einar gerhardsen , embarked on a program inspired by keynesian economics , emphasising state financed industrialisation and co-operation between trade union and employer ' organisation . many measure of state control of the economy imposed during the war were continued , although the rationing of dairy product wa lifted in <year> , while price control and rationing of housing and car continued until <year> . </s> the wartime alliance with the united kingdom and the united state wa continued in the post-war year . although pursuing the goal of a socialist economy , the labour party distanced itself from the communist ( especially after the communist ' seizure of power in czechoslovakia in <year> ) , and strengthened it foreign policy and defence policy tie with the u . norway received marshall plan aid from the united state starting in <year> , joined the organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) one year later , and became a founding member of the nato ( nato ) in <year> . </s> the first oil wa discovered at the small balder field in <year> , production only began in <year> . in <year> , the phillips petroleum company discovered petroleum resource at the ekofisk oil field field west of norway . in <year> , the norwegian government founded the state oil company , statoil . oil production did not provide net income until the early <year> because of the large capital investment that wa required to establish the country 's petroleum industry . around <year> , both the proportion and absolute number of worker in industry peaked . since then labour-intensive industry and service like factory mass production and shipping have largely been outsourced . </s> norway wa a founding member of the european free trade association ( efta ) . norway wa twice invited to join the european union , but ultimately declined to join after referendum that failed by narrow margin in <year> norwegian european community membership referendum and <year> norwegian european union membership referendum . </s> in <year> , a conservative government led by kre willoch replaced the labour party with a policy of stimulating the stagflation with tax cut , economic liberalisation , deregulation of market , and measure to curb record-high inflation ( <number> in <year> ) . </s> norway 's first female prime minister , gro harlem brundtland of the labour party , continued many of the reform of her conservative predecessor , while backing traditional labour concern such a social security , high tax , the industrialisation of nature , and feminism . by the late <year> , norway had paid off it foreign debt and had started accumulating a sovereign wealth fund . since the <year> , a divisive question in politics ha been how much of the income from petroleum production the government should spend , and how much it should save . </s> in <year> , norway suffered <year> norway attack on the same day conducted by anders behring breivik which struck the regjeringskvartalet in oslo and a summer camp of the labour party 's worker ' youth league ( norway ) at utya island , resulting in <number> death and <number> wounded . </s> the <year> norwegian parliamentary election brought a more conservative government to power , with the conservative party ( norway ) and the progress party ( norway ) winning <number> of the electorate 's vote . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> norway 's core territory comprises the western and northernmost portion of the scandinavian peninsula ; the remote island of jan mayen and the archipelago of svalbard are also part of the kingdom of norway . the antarctic peter i island and the sub-antarctic bouvet island are dependency of norway and thus not considered part of the kingdom . norway also lay claim to a section of antarctica known a queen maud land . from the middle age to <year> norway wa part of the denmarknorway . norwegian possession in the north atlantic , faroe island , greenland , and iceland , remained danish when norway wa passed to sweden at the treaty of kiel . norway also comprised bohusln until <year> , jmtland and hrjedalen until <year> , shetland and orkney until <year> , and the hebrides and isle of man until the treaty of perth in <year> . </s> norway comprises the western and northernmost part of scandinavia in northern europe . norway lie between latitude <number> parallel north <number> and <number> parallel north <number> n , and longitude <number> meridian east <number> and <number> meridian east <number> e. norway is the northernmost of the nordic country and if svalbard is included also the easternmost . vard at <number> <number> ' <number> `` east of greenwich lie further east than st. petersburg and istanbul . norway includes the northernmost point on the european mainland . the rugged coastline is broken by huge fjord and thousand of island . the coastal baseline ( sea ) is . the coastline of the mainland including fjord stretch , when island are included the coastline ha been estimated to . norway share a land border with sweden , with finland , and with russia to the east . to the north , west and south , norway is bordered by the barents sea , the norwegian sea , the north sea , and skagerrak . the scandinavian mountain form much of the border with sweden . </s> at ( including svalbard and jan mayen ) ( and without ) , much of the country is dominated by mountainous or high terrain , with a great variety of natural feature caused by prehistoric glacier and varied topography . the most noticeable of these are the fjord : deep groove cut into the land flooded by the sea following the end of the ice age . sognefjorden is the world 's second deepest fjord , and the world 's longest at . hornindalsvatnet is the deepest lake in all europe . norway ha about <number> lake . there are <number> registered island . permafrost can be found all year in the higher mountain area and in the interior of finnmark county . list of glacier in norway are found in norway . </s> the land is mostly made of hard granite and gneiss rock , but slate , sandstone , and limestone are also common , and the lowest elevation contain marine deposit . because of the gulf stream and prevailing westerly , norway experience higher temperature and more precipitation than expected at such northern latitude , especially along the coast . the mainland experience four distinct season , with colder winter and le precipitation inland . the northernmost part ha a mostly maritime subarctic climate , while svalbard ha an arctic tundra climate . </s> because of the large latitudinal range of the country and the varied topography and climate , norway ha a larger number of different [ than almost any other european country . there are approximately <number> specie in norway and adjacent water ( excluding bacteria and virus ) . the norwegian shelf large marine ecosystem is considered highly productive . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the southern and western part of norway , fully exposed to atlantic storm front , experience more precipitation and have milder winter than the eastern and far northern part . area to the east of the coastal mountain are in a rain shadow ] , and have lower rain and snow total than the west . the lowland around oslo have the warmest and sunniest summer , but also cold weather and snow in wintertime.because of norway 's high [ [ latitude , there are large seasonal variation in daylight . from late may to late july , the sun never completely descends beneath the horizon in area north of the arctic circle ( hence norway 's description a the `` land of the midnight sun `` ) , and the rest of the country experience up to <number> hour of daylight per day . conversely , from late november to late january , the sun never rise above the horizon in the north , and daylight hour are very short in the rest of the country . </s> the coastal climate of norway is exceptionally mild compared with area on similar latitude elsewhere in the world , with the gulf stream passing directly offshore the northern area of the atlantic coast , continuously warming the region in the winter . temperature anomaly found in coastal location are exceptional , with rst and vry lacking a meteorological winter in spite of being north of the arctic circle . the gulf stream ha this effect only on the northern part of norway , not in the south , despite what is commonly believed . the northern coast of norway would thus be ice-covered if not for the gulf stream . a a side-effect , the scandinavian mountain prevent continental wind from reaching the coastline , causing very cool summer throughout atlantic norway . oslo ha more of a continental climate , similar to sweden 's . the mountain range have subarctic and tundra climate . there is also very high rainfall in area exposed to the atlantic , such a bergen . oslo , in comparison , is dry , being in a rain shadow . skjk in oppland county is also in the rain shadow and is one of the driest place with precipitation annually . finnmarksvidda and the interior valley of troms and nordland also receive le than annually . longyearbyen is the driest place in norway with . </s> part of southeastern norway including part of mjsa have warm-summer [ continental climate ] s ( kppen climate classification dfb ) , while the more southern and western coast are mostly of the oceanic climate ( cfb ) . further inland in southeastern and northern norway , the subarctic climate ( dfc ) dominates ; this is especially true for area in the rain shadow of the scandinavian mountain . some of the inner valley of oppland get so little precipitation annually , thanks to the rain shadow effect , that they meet the requirement for dry-summer subarctic climate ( dsc ) . in higher altitude , close to the coast of southern and western norway , one can find the rare subpolar oceanic climate ( cfc ) . this climate is also common in northern norway , usually in lower altitude , all the way down to sea level . a small part of the northernmost coast of norway ha the polar climate tundra/alpine/polar climate ( et ) . large part of norway are covered by mountain and high altitude plateau , many of which also exhibit the tundra climate tundra/alpine/polar climate ( et ) . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> the total number of specie include <number> specie of insect ( probably <number> more specie yet to be described ) , <number> specie of algae , <number> specie of lichen , <number> specie of moss , <number> specie of vascular plant , up to <number> specie of fungus , <number> specie of bird ( <number> specie nesting in norway ) , <number> specie of mammal , <number> fresh-water specie of fish , <number> salt-water specie of fish , <number> specie of fresh-water invertebrate , and <number> specie of salt-water invertebrate . about <number> of these specie have been described by science . the iucn red list of <year> encompasses <number> specie . norway contains five terrestrial ecoregions : sarmatic mixed forest , scandinavian coastal conifer forest , scandinavian and russian taiga , kola peninsula tundra , and scandinavian montane birch forest and grassland . </s> seventeen specie are listed mainly because they are endangered on a global scale , such a the eurasian beaver , even if the population in norway is not seen a endangered . the number of threatened and near-threatened specie equal to <number> ; it includes <number> fungi specie , many of which are closely associated with the small remaining area of old-growth forest , <number> bird specie , and <number> specie of mammal . in <year> , <number> specie were listed a endangered or vulnerable ; of these were <year> listed a vulnerable ( vu ) , <number> a endangered ( en ) , and <number> specie a critically endangered ( cr ) , among which were the grey wolf , the arctic fox ( healthy population on svalbard ) and the pool frog . </s> the largest predator in norwegian water is the sperm whale , and the largest fish is the basking shark . the largest predator on land is the polar bear , while the brown bear is the largest predator on the norwegian mainland . the largest land animal on the mainland is the elk ( american english : moose ) . the elk in norway is known for it size and strength and is often called skogens konge , `` king of the forest `` . </s> <section_title_start> environment <section_title_end> </s> attractive and dramatic scenery and landscape are found throughout norway . the west coast of southern norway and the coast of northern norway present some of the most visually impressive coastal scenery in the world . national geographic society ha listed the norwegian fjord a the world 's top tourist attraction . the country is also home to the natural phenomenon of the midnight sun ( during summer ) , a well a the aurora known also a the northern light . </s> the <year> environmental performance index from yale university , columbia university and the world economic forum put norway in seventeenth place , immediately below croatia and switzerland . the index is based on environmental risk to human health , habitat loss , and change in co2 emission . the index note over-exploitation of fishery , but not whaling in norway norway 's whaling or energy in norway . norway had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> <section_title_start> politics and government <section_title_end> </s> norway is considered to be one of the most developed democracy and rechtsstaat in the world . from <year> , c. <number> of men ( <number> year and older ) had the right to vote , whereas the united kingdom had c. <number> ( <year> ) , sweden c. <number> ( <year> ) , and belgium c. <number> ( <year> ) . since <year> , norway ha been classified a the world 's most democratic country by the democracy index . </s> according to the constitution of norway , which wa adopted on <number> may <year> and inspired by the united state declaration of independence and french revolution of <year> and <year> , respectively , norway is a unitary state constitutional monarchy with a parliamentary system of government , wherein the monarchy of norway is the [ of state ] and the prime minister of norway is the [ of government ] . power is separated among the legislative , executive and judicial branch of government , a defined by the constitution , which serf a the country 's supreme legal document . </s> the norwegian royal family officially retains executive power . but following the introduction of a parliamentary system of government , the duty of the monarch have since become strictly representative and ceremonial , such a the formal appointment and dismissal of the prime minister and other minister in the executive government . accordingly , the monarch is commander-in-chief of the norwegian armed force , and serf a chief diplomatic official abroad and a a symbol of unity . harald v of norway of the house of glcksburg house of schleswig-holstein-sonderburg-glcksburg wa crowned king of norway in <year> , the first since the <number> century who ha been born in the country . haakon , crown prince of norway , is the legal and rightful heir to the throne and the kingdom . </s> in practice , the prime minister exercise the executive power . constitutionally , legislative power is vested with both the government and the parliament of norway , but the latter is the supreme legislature and a unicameralism body . norway is fundamentally structured a a representative democracy . the parliament can pas a law by simple majority of the <number> representative , who are elected on the basis of proportional representation from <number> constituency for four-year term . </s> <number> are elected directly from the <number> constituency , and an additional <number> seat ( `` levelling seat `` ) are allocated on a nationwide basis to make the representation in parliament correspond better with the popular vote for the political party . a <number> election threshold is required for a party to gain levelling seat in parliament . there are a total of <number> member of parliament . </s> the parliament of norway , called the parliament of norway ( meaning grand assembly ) , ratifies national treaty developed by the executive branch . it can impeachment member of the government if their act are declared unconstitutional . if an indicted suspect is impeached , parliament ha the power to remove the person from office . </s> the position of prime minister of norway , norway 's head of government , is allocated to the member of parliament who can obtain the confidence of a majority in parliament , usually the current leader of the largest political party or , more effectively , through a coalition of party . a single party generally doe not have sufficient political power in term of the number of seat to form a government on it own . norway ha often been ruled by minority government . </s> the prime minister nominates the cabinet , traditionally drawn from member of the same political party or party in the storting , making up the government . the pm organises the executive government and exercise it power a vested by the constitution . norway ha a state church , the lutheran church of norway , which ha in recent year gradually been granted more internal autonomy in day-to-day affair , but which still ha a special constitutional status . formerly , the pm had to have more than half the member of cabinet be member of the church of norway , meaning at least ten out of the <number> ministry . this rule wa however removed in <year> . the issue of separation of church and state in norway ha been increasingly controversial , a many people believe it is time to change this , to reflect the growing diversity in the population . a part of this is the evolution of the public school subject christianity , a required subject since <year> . even the state 's loss in a battle at the european court of human right at strasbourg in <year> did not settle the matter . a of <number> january <year> , the church of norway is a separate legal entity , and no longer a branch of the civil service . </s> through the norwegian council of state , a privy council presided over by the monarch , the prime minister and the cabinet meet at the royal palace , oslo and formally consult the monarch . all government bill need the formal approval by the monarch before and after introduction to parliament . the council review and approves all of the monarch 's action a head of state . although all government and parliamentary act are decided beforehand , the privy council is an example of symbolic gesture the king retains . </s> member of the storting are directly elected from party-list proportional representation party-lists proportional representation in nineteen plurality voting system plural-member constituency in a national multi-party system . historically , both the norwegian labour party and conservative party ( norway ) have played leading political role . in the early <number> century , the labour party ha been in power since the <year> norwegian parliamentary election , in a redgreen coalition with the socialist left party ( norway ) and the centre party ( norway ) . </s> since <year> , both the conservative party and the progress party ( norway ) have won numerous seat in the parliament , but not sufficient in the <year> norwegian parliamentary election to overthrow the coalition . commentator have pointed to the poor co-operation between the opposition party , including the liberal party ( norway ) and the christian democratic party ( norway ) . jens stoltenberg , the leader of the labour party , continued to have the necessary majority through his multi-party alliance to continue a pm until <year> . </s> in national election in september <year> , voter ended eight year of labor rule . two political party , hyre and progress party ( norway ) , elected on promise of tax cut , more spending on infrastructure and education , better service and stricter rule on immigration , formed a government . coming at a time when norway 's economy is in good condition with low unemployment , the rise of the right appeared to be based on other issue . erna solberg became prime minister , the second female prime minister after gro harlem brundtland and the first conservative prime minister since jan p. syse . solberg said her win wa `` a historic election victory for the right-wing party `` . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> norway , a unitary state , is divided into eleven first-level administrative county ( fylke ) . the county are administered through directly elected county assembly who elect the county governor . additionally , the norwegian royal family and government are represented in every county by a county governor ( norway ) , who effectively act a a governor . a such , the government is directly represented at a local level through the county governor ' office . the county are then sub-divided into <number> second-level municipality ( kommuner ) , which in turn are administered by directly elected municipal council , headed by a mayor and a small executive cabinet . the capital of oslo is considered both a county and a municipality . </s> norway ha two integral overseas territory : jan mayen and svalbard , the only developed island in the archipelago of the same name , located mile away to the north . there are three antarctica and subantarctic dependent territory : bouvet island , peter i island , and queen maud land . on most map , there had been an unclaimed area between queen maud land and the south pole until <number> june <year> when norway formally annexed that area . </s> <number> settlement have list of town and city in norway status in norway . in most case , the city border are coterminous with the border of their respective municipality . often , norwegian city municipality include large area that are not developed ; for example , oslo municipality contains large forest , located north and south-east of the city , and over half of bergen municipality consists of mountainous area . </s> the county of norway are : </s> { class= `` wikitable sortable `` </s> - </s> ! largest populated area <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> judicial system and law enforcement <section_title_end> </s> norway us a civil law ( legal system ) where law are created and amended in parliament and the system regulated through the court of justice of norway . it consists of the supreme court of norway of <number> permanent judge and a chief justice of the supreme court of norway , appellate court , city and court of justice of norway # district court , and conciliation council . the judiciary is independent of executive and legislative branch . while the prime minister nominates supreme court justice for office , their nomination must be approved by parliament and formally confirmed by the monarch in the council of state . usually , judge attached to regular court are formally appointed by the monarch on the advice of the prime minister . </s> the court ' strict and formal mission is to regulate the norwegian judicial system , interpret the constitution , and a such implement the legislation adopted by parliament . in it judicial review , it monitor the legislative and executive branch to ensure that they comply with provision of enacted legislation . </s> the law enforcement in norway by the norwegian police service . it is a unified national police service made up of <number> police district and several specialist agency , such a norwegian national authority for the investigation and prosecution of economic and environmental crime , known a kokrim ; and the national criminal investigation service ( norway ) , known a kripos , each headed by a chief of police . the police service is headed by the national police directorate , which report to the ministry of justice and the police . the police directorate is headed by a national police commissioner . the only exception is the norwegian police security service , whose head answer directly to the ministry of justice and the police . </s> norway abolished the death penalty for regular criminal act in <year> . the legislature abolished the death penalty for high treason in war and war-crimes in <year> . reporter without border , in it <year> worldwide press freedom index , ranked norway at a shared first place ( along with iceland ) out of <number> country . </s> in general , the legal and institutional framework in norway is characterised by a high degree of transparency , accountability and integrity , and the perception and the occurrence of corruption are very low . norway ha ratified all relevant international anti-corruption convention , and it standard of implementation and enforcement of anti-corruption legislation are considered very high by many international anti-corruption working group such a the oecd anti-bribery working group . however , there are some isolated case showing that some municipality have abused their position in public procurement process . </s> norwegian prison are humane , rather than tough , with emphasis on rehabilitation . at <number> , norway 's re-conviction rate is among the lowest in the world . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> norway maintains embassy in <number> country . <number> country maintain an embassy in norway , all of them in the capital , oslo . </s> norway is a founding member of the united nation ( un ) , the nato ( nato ) , the council of europe and the european free trade association ( efta ) . norway issued application for accession to the european union ( eu ) and it predecessor in <year> , <year> and <year> , respectively . while denmark , sweden and finland obtained membership , the norwegian electorate rejected the treaty of accession in referendum in <year> norwegian european community membership referendum and <year> norwegian european union membership referendum . </s> after the <year> referendum , norway maintained it membership in the european economic area ( eea ) , an arrangement granting the country access to the single market of the european union of the union , on the condition that norway implement the union 's piece of legislation which are deemed relevant ( of which there were approximately seven thousand by <year> ) successive norwegian government have , since <year> , requested participation in part of the eu 's co-operation that go beyond the provision of the eea agreement . non-voting participation by norway ha been granted in , for instance , the union 's common security and defence policy , the schengen agreement , and the european defence agency , a well a <number> separate programme . </s> norway participated in the <year> brokering of the oslo accord , an unsuccessful attempt to resolve the israelipalestinian conflict . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the norwegian armed force number about <number> personnel , including civilian employee . according to <year> mobilisation plan , full mobilisation produce approximately <number> combatant personnel . norway ha conscription ( including <number> month of training ) ; in <year> , the country became the first in europe and nato to draft woman a well a men . however , due to le need for conscript after the cold war ended with the break-up of the soviet union , few people have to serve if they are not motivated . the armed force are subordinate to the norwegian ministry of defence . the commander-in-chief is harald v of norway . the military of norway is divided into the following branch : the norwegian army , the royal norwegian navy , the royal norwegian air force , the norwegian cyber defence force and the home guard ( norway ) . </s> in response to it being overrun by germany in <year> , the country wa one of the founding nation of the nato ( nato ) on <number> april <year> . at present , norway contributes in the international security assistance force ( isaf ) in war in afghanistan ( <year> present ) . additionally , norway ha contributed in several mission in context of the united nation , nato , and the common security and defence policy of the european union . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> norwegian enjoy the second-highest list of country by gdp ( nominal ) per caput gdp per-capita among european country ( after luxembourg ) , and the sixth-highest list of country by gdp ( ppp ) per caput gdp ( ppp ) per-capita in the world . today , norway rank a the second-wealthiest country in the world in monetary value , with the largest capital reserve per caput of any nation . according to the cia world factbook , norway is a net external creditor of debt . norway maintained first place in the world in the united nation development programme human development index ( hdi ) for six consecutive year ( <year> <number> ) , and then reclaimed this position in <year> . the standard of living in norway is among the highest in the world . foreign policy magazine rank norway last in it list of country by failed state index for <year> , judging norway to be the world 's most well-functioning and stable country . the oecd rank norway fourth in the <year> equalised oecd better life index and third in intergenerational earnings elasticity . </s> the norwegian economy is an example of a mixed economy ; a prosperous capitalist welfare state it feature a combination of free market activity and large state ownership in certain key sector , influenced by both liberal party ( norway ) government from the late <number> century and later by labour party ( norway ) government in the postwar era . healthcare in norway is free ( after an annual charge of around <year> norwegian krone for those over <number> ) , and parent have <number> week paid parental leave . the state income derived from natural resource includes a significant contribution from petroleum production . norway ha an unemployment rate of <number> , with <number> of the population aged <year> employed . people in the labour force are either employed or looking for work . <number> of the population aged <year> receive a disability pension and <number> of the labour force are employed by the government , the highest in the oecd . the hourly productivity level , a well a average hourly wage in norway , are among the highest in the world . </s> the egalitarianism value of norwegian society have kept the wage difference between the lowest paid worker and the ceo of most company a much le than in comparable western economy . this is also evident in list of country by income equality norway 's low gini coefficient . </s> the state ha large ownership position in key industrial sector , such a the strategic petroleum sector ( statoil ) , hydroelectric energy production ( statkraft ) , aluminium production ( norsk hydro ) , the largest norwegian bank ( dnb asa ) , and telecommunication provider ( telenor ) . through these big company , the government control approximately <number> of the stock value at the oslo stock exchange . when non-listed company are included , the state ha even higher share in ownership ( mainly from direct oil licence ownership ) . norway is a major shipping nation and ha the world 's <number> largest ship transport , with <number> norwegian-owned merchant vessel . </s> by referendum in <year> norwegian european community membership referendum and <year> norwegian european union membership referendum , norwegian rejected proposal to join the european union ( eu ) . however , norway , together with iceland and liechtenstein , participates in the european union 's single market through the european economic area ( eea ) agreement . the eea treaty between the european union country and the efta countriestransposed into norwegian law via `` es-loven `` describes the procedure for implementing european union rule in norway and the other efta country . norway is a highly integrated member of most sector of the eu internal market . some sector , such a agriculture , oil and fish , are not wholly covered by the eea treaty . norway ha also acceded to the schengen agreement and several other intergovernmental agreement among the eu member state . </s> the country is richly endowed with natural resource including petroleum , [ fish , forestry forest ] , and mineral . large reserve of petroleum and natural gas were discovered in the <year> , which led to a boom in the economy . norway ha obtained one of the highest standard of living in the world in part by having a large amount of natural resource compared to the size of the population . in <year> , <number> of state revenue were generated from the petroleum industry . </s> norway is the first country which banned cutting of tree ( deforestation ) , in order to prevent rain forest from vanishing . the country declared it intention at the un climate summit in <year> , alongside great britain and germany . crop , that are typically linked to forest ' destruction are timber , soy , palm oil and beef . now norway ha to find a new way to provide these essential product without exerting negative influence on it environment . </s> <section_title_start> resource <section_title_end> </s> ; oil industry </s> export revenue from oil and gas have risen to over <number> of total export and constitute almost <number> of the gdp . norway is the fifth-largest oil exporter and third-largest gas exporter in the world , but it is not a member of [ [ opec . in <year> , the norwegian government established the sovereign wealth fund ( the government pension fund of norway `` government pension fund global `` ) , which would be funded with oil revenue , including tax , dividend , sale revenue and licensing fee . this wa intended to reduce overheating in the economy from oil revenue , minimise uncertainty from volatility in oil price , and provide a cushion to compensate for expense associated with the ageing of the population . </s> the government control it petroleum resource through a combination of state ownership in major operator in the oil field ( with approximately <number> ownership in statoil in <year> ) and the fully state-owned petoro , which ha a market value of about twice statoil , and state 's direct financial interest . finally , the government control licensing of exploration and production of field . the fund invests in developed financial market outside norway . spending from the fund is constrained by the budgetary rule ( handlingsregelen ) , which limit spending over time to no more than the real value yield of the fund , originally assumed to be <number> a year , but lowered in <year> to <number> of the fund 's total value . </s> ; oil field </s> between <year> and <year> , norwegian company drilled <year> </s> until <year> parliamentary official were required to be member of the evangelical-lutheran church of norway , and at least half of all government minister had to be a member of the state church . indigenous religion <section_title_end> </s> a in other scandinavian country , the ancient norse followed a form of native germanic paganism known a norse paganism . by the end of the <number> century , when norway had been christianization of scandinavia , the indigenous norse religion and practice were prohibited . remnant of the native religion and belief of norway survive today in the form of name , referential name of city and location , the day of the week , and other part of everyday language . modern interest in the old way ha led to a revival of pagan religious practice in the form of germanic neopaganism . the norwegian satrufellesskapet bifrost formed in <year> ; in <year> , the fellowship had about <number> member . foreningen forn sed wa formed in <year> and ha been recognised by the norwegian government . </s> the smi minority retained their smi shamanism well into the <number> century , when most converted to christianity under the influence of dano-norwegian lutheran missionary . although some insist that `` indigenous smi religion had effectively been eradicated , ' athropologist gutorm gjessing 's changing lapp ( <year> ) argues that the smi 's `` were outwardly and to all practical purpose converted to christianity , but at the subconscious and unconscious level , the shamistic frenzy survived , more or le latent , only awaiting the necessary stimulus to break out into the open . `` today there is a renewed appreciation for the smi traditional way of life , which ha led to a revival of noaidevuohta . some norwegian and smi celebrity are reported to visit shaman for guidance . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> norway wa awarded first place according to the un 's human development index ( hdi ) for <year> . in the <year> , by contrast , poverty and communicable disease dominated in norway together with famine and epidemic . from the <year> , improvement in public health occurred a a result of development in several area such a social and living condition , change in disease and medical outbreak , establishment of the health care system , and emphasis on public health matter . vaccination and increased treatment opportunity with antibiotic resulted in great improvement within the norwegian population . improved hygiene and better nutrition were factor that contributed to improved health . </s> the disease pattern in norway changed from communicable disease to non-communicable disease and chronic disease a cardiovascular disease . inequality and social difference are still present in public health in norway today . </s> in <year> the infant mortality rate wa <number> per <number> live birth among child under the age of one . for girl it wa <number> and for boy <number> , which is the lowest infant
