research . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> norwegian in it two form , bokml and nynorsk , is the main national official language of all of norway . smi , a group which includes three separate language , is an official language alongside norwegian in the smi administrative linguistic area ( forvaltningsomrdet for samisk sprk ) in northern norway while kven language is an official language in one municipality , also in northern norway . </s> the north germanic language norwegian language ha two official written form , bokml and nynorsk . both are used in public administration , school , church , and medium . bokml is the written language used by a large majority of about <year> % . around <number> of the population speak norwegian a their first or native language , although many speak dialect that may differ significantly from the written language . all norwegian dialect are mutually intelligible , although listener with limited exposure to dialect other than their own may struggle to understand certain phrase and pronunciation in some other dialect . </s> several uralic language smi language are spoken and written throughout the country , traditionally in the north and to a lesser degree in some part of central norway , by some member of the smi people . ( estimate suggest that about one third of the norwegian smi speak a smi language . ) speaker have a right to be educated and to receive communication from the government in their own language in a special forvaltningsomrde ( administrative area ) for smi language . the kven people minority historically spoke the uralic kven language ( considered a separate language in norway , but generally perceived a a finnish dialect in finland ) . today the majority of ethnic kven have little or no knowledge of the language . according to the kainun institutti , `` the typical modern kven is a norwegian-speaking norwegian who know his genealogy . `` a norway ha ratified the european charter for regional or minority language ( ecrml ) the kven language together with romani language and scandoromani language ha become officially recognised minority language . </s> some supporter have also advocated making norwegian sign language an official language of the country . </s> in the <number> and <number> century , the norwegian language wa subject to norwegian language conflict . this led to the development of nynorsk in the <number> century and to the formation of alternative spelling standard in the <number> century . </s> norwegian is similar to it neighbour north germanic language ; swedish language and danish language . all three language are to a degree mutually intelligible and can be , and commonly are , employed in communication among inhabitant of the scandinavian country . a a result of the co-operation within the nordic council , inhabitant of all nordic country , including iceland and finland , have the right to communicate with norwegian authority in their own language . </s> student who are child of immigrant parent are encouraged to learn the norwegian language . the norwegian government offer language instructional course for immigrant wishing to obtain norwegian citizenship . with increasing concern about assimilating immigrant , since <number> september <year> , the government ha required that an applicant for norwegian citizenship give evidence of proficiency in either norwegian or in one of the smi language , or give proof of having attended class in norwegian for <number> hour , or meet the language requirement for university study in norway ( that is , by being proficient in one of the scandinavian language ) . </s> the primary foreign language taught in norwegian school is english , considered an international language since the post-wwii era . the majority of the population is fairly fluent in english , especially those born after world war ii . german , french and spanish are also commonly taught a second or , more often , third language . russian , japanese , italian , latin , and rarely standard mandarin chinese ( mandarin ) are offered in some school , mostly in the city . traditionally , english , german and french were considered the main foreign language in norway . these language , for instance , were used on norwegian passport until the <year> , and university student have a general right to use these language when submitting their thesis . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> the norwegian farm culture continues to play a role in contemporary norwegian culture . in the <number> century , it inspired a strong norwegian romantic nationalism movement , which is still visible in the norwegian language and : category : mass medium in norway . norwegian culture blossomed with nationalist effort to achieve an independent identity in the area of literature , art and music . this continues today in the performing art and a a result of government support for exhibition , cultural project and artwork . </s> <section_title_start> human right <section_title_end> </s> norway ha been considered a progressive country , which ha adopted legislation and policy to support woman 's right , minority right , and lgbt right in norway . a early a <year> , <number> of the leading figure , among them five prime minister for the liberal party and the conservative party , co-founded the norwegian association for woman 's right . they successfully campaigned for woman 's right to education , woman 's suffrage , the right to work , and other gender equality policy . from the <year> , gender equality also came high on the state agenda , with the establishment of a public body to promote gender equality , which evolved into the gender equality and anti-discrimination ombud . civil society organisation also continue to play an important role , and the woman 's right organisation are today organised in the norwegian woman 's lobby umbrella organisation . </s> in <year> , the norwegian constitution wa amended to grant absolute primogeniture to the norwegian throne , meaning that the eldest child , regardless of gender , take precedence in the line of succession . a it wa not retroactive , the current successor to the throne is the eldest son of the king , rather than his eldest child . the norwegian constitution article <number> state that `` for those born before the year <year> it shall ... be the case that a male shall take precedence over a female . `` </s> the smi people have for century been the subject of discrimination and abuse by the dominant culture in scandinavia and russia , those country claiming possession of smi land . the smi people have never been a single community in a single region of spmi . norway ha been greatly criticised by the international community for the politics of norwegianization of and discrimination against the indigenous population of the country . nevertheless , norway wa , in <year> , the first country to recognise indigenous and tribal people convention , <year> ilo-convention <number> on indigenous people recommended by the un . </s> in regard to lgbt right , norway wa the first country in the world to enact an anti-discrimination law protecting the right of gay and lesbian . in <year> , norway became the second country to legalise civil union partnership for same-sex couple , and on <number> january <year> same-sex marriage in norway to legalize same-sex marriage . a a promoter of human right , norway ha held the annual oslo freedom forum conference , a gathering described by the economist a `` on it way to becoming a human-rights equivalent of the davos economic forum . `` </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> the norwegian cinema ha received international recognition . the documentary film kon-tiki ( <year> film ) kon-tiki norwegian black metal scene , a form of rock music in norway , ha been an influence in world music since the late <number> century . since the <year> , norway 's export of black metal , a lo-fi , dark and raw form of [ metal music heavy metal ] , ha been developed by such band a emperor ( band ) , darkthrone , gorgoroth , mayhem ( band ) , burzum and immortal ( band ) . more recently , band such a metal movement in the early <year> included several church arson and two prominent black metal # aarseth 's murder . </s> the jazz scene in norway is thriving . jan garbarek , terje rypdal , mari </s> norway ha a strong folk music tradition which remains popular to this day . among the most prominent folk musician are hardanger fiddler andrea een , olav jrgen hegge and annbjrg lien , and the vocalist agnes buen garns , kirsten brten berg and odd nordstoga . </s> other internationally recognised band are a-ha , ryksopp and ylvis . a-ha initially rose to global fame during the mid-1980s . most memorable female solo artist from norway are susanne sundfr , sigrid ( singer ) , astrid s , adeln , julie bergan , maria mena , tone damli , margaret berger , lene marlin , christel alsos , maria arredondo , marion raven and marit larsen ( both former member of the defunct pop-rock group m2m ( band ) ) , lene nystrm ( vocalist of the danish eurodance group aqua ( band ) ) and anni-frid lyngstad ( vocalist of the swedish pop group abba ) . </s> in recent year , various norwegian songwriter and production team have contributed to the music of other international artist . the norwegian production team stargate ( production team ) ha produced song for rihanna , beyonc , shakira , jennifer lopez and lionel richie , among others . espen lind ha written and produced song for beyonc , lionel richie and leona lewis , among others . lene marlin ha written song for rihanna and lovebugs ( band ) . ina wroldsen ha written song for artist such a demi lovato , shakira , inna , sophie ellis-bextor , one direction and the saturday , among others . </s> norway enjoys many music festival throughout the year , all over the country . norway is the host of one of the world 's biggest extreme sport festival with music , ekstremsportvekoa festival held annually in voss . oslo is the host of many festival , such a yafestivalen and by : larm . oslo used to have a summer parade similar to the german love parade . in <year> , the city of oslo wanted to adopt the french music festival fte de la musique . fredrik carl strmer established the festival . even in it first year , `` musikkens dag `` gathered thousand of people and artist in the street of oslo . `` musikkens dag `` is now renamed musikkfest oslo . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> the history of norwegian literature start with the norse paganism poetic edda and skaldic verse of the <number> and <number> century , with poet such a bragi boddason and eyvindr skldaspillir . the arrival of christianity around the year <year> brought norway into contact with european medieval learning , [ and history writing . merged with native oral tradition and icelandic influence , this influenced the literature written in the late <number> and early <number> century . major work of that period include historia norwegi ] , [ [ irekssaga and konungs skuggsj . </s> little norwegian literature came out of the period of the scandinavian union and the subsequent dano-norwegian union ( <year> <number> ) , with some notable exception such a petter das and ludvig holberg . in his play peer gynt , ibsen characterised this period a `` twice two hundred year of darkness/brooded o'er the race of monkey . `` the first line of this couplet is frequently quoted . during the union with denmark , the government imposed using only written danish , which decreased the writing of norwegian literature . </s> two major event precipitated a major resurgence in norwegian literature : in <year> a norwegian university wa established in oslo . secondly , seized by the spirit of revolution following the american revolution and french revolution revolution , the norwegian created their first constitution of norway in <year> . strong author were inspired who became recognised first in scandinavia , and then worldwide ; among them were henrik wergeland , peter christen asbjrnsen , jrgen moe and camilla collett . </s> by the late <number> century , in the golden age of norwegian literature , the so-called `` great four `` emerged : henrik ibsen , bjrnstjerne bjrnson , alexander kielland , and jonas lie ( writer ) . bjrnson 's `` peasant novel `` , such a ein glad gut ( a happy boy ) and synnve solbakken , are typical of the norwegian romantic nationalism of their day . kielland 's novel and short story are mostly naturalistic . although an important contributor to early romantic nationalism , ( especially peer gynt ) , henrik ibsen is better known for his pioneering realistic drama such a the wild duck and a doll 's house . they caused an uproar because of his candid portrayal of the middle class , complete with infidelity , unhappy marriage , and corrupt businessmen . </s> in the <number> century , three norwegian novelist were awarded the nobel prize in literature : bjrnstjerne bjrnson in <year> , knut hamsun for the book growth of the soil ( `` growth of the soil `` ) in <year> , and sigrid undset ( known for kristin lavransdatter ) in <year> . writer such a the following also made important contribution : dag solstad , jon fosse , cora sandel , olav duun , olav h. hauge , gunvor hofmo , stein mehren , kjell askildsen , han herbjrnsrud , aksel sandemose , bergljot hobk haff , jostein gaarder , erik fosnes hansen , jens bjrneboe , kjartan flgstad , lars saabye christensen , johan borgen , herbjrg wassmo , jan erik vold , rolf jacobsen ( poet ) , olaf bull , jan kjrstad , georg johannesen , tarjei vesaas , sigurd hoel , arnulf verland , karl ove knausgrd and johan falkberget . </s> <section_title_start> research <section_title_end> </s> internationally recognised norwegian scientist include the mathematician niels henrik abel , sophus lie and atle selberg , physical chemist lars onsager , physicist ivar giaever , chemist odd hassel , peter waage , and cato maximilian guldberg . </s> in the <number> century , norwegian academic have been pioneering in many social science , including criminology , sociology and peace and conflict study . prominent academic include arne n , a philosopher and founder of deep ecology ; johan galtung , the founder of peace study ; nil christie and thomas mathiesen , criminologist ; fredrik barth , a social anthropologist ; vilhelm aubert , harriet holter and erik grnseth , sociologist ; tove stang dahl , a pioneer of woman 's law ; stein rokkan , a political scientist ; and economist ragnar frisch , trygve haavelmo , and finn e. kydland . </s> in <year> , the two norwegian scientist may-britt moser and edvard moser won the nobel prize in physiology or medicine along with john o'keefe ( neuroscientist ) john o'keefe . they won the prize for their groundbreaking work identifying the cell that make up a positioning system in the human brain , our `` in-built gps `` . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> with expansive forest , norway ha long had a tradition of building in wood . many of today 's most interesting new building are made of wood , reflecting the strong appeal that this material continues to hold for norwegian designer and builder . </s> with norway 's conversion to christianity some <number> year ago , church were built . stonework architecture wa introduced from europe for the most important structure , beginning with the construction of nidaros cathedral in trondheim . in the early middle age , wooden stave church were constructed throughout norway . some of them have survived ; they represent norway 's most unusual contribution to architectural history . a fine example , urnes stave church in inner sognefjord , is on unesco 's world heritage list . another notable example of wooden architecture is the building at bryggen wharf in bergen , also on the list for world cultural heritage site , consisting of a row of tall , narrow wooden structure along the quayside . </s> in the <number> century , under the danish monarchy , city and village such a kongsberg and rros were established . the city kongsberg had a church built in the baroque style . traditional wooden building that were constructed in rros have survived . </s> after norway 's union with denmark wa dissolved in <year> , oslo became the capital . the architect christian heinrich grosch christian h. grosch designed the earliest part of the university of oslo , the oslo stock exchange , and many other building and church constructed in that early national period . </s> at the beginning of the <number> century , the city of lesund wa rebuilt in the art nouveau style , influenced by style of france . the <year> , when functionalism dominated , became a strong period for norwegian architecture . it is only since the late <number> century that norwegian architect have achieved international renown . one of the most striking modern building in norway is the smi parliament of norway in karasjok , designed by stein halvorson and christian sundby . it debating chamber , in timber , is an abstract version of a lavvo , the traditional tent used by the nomadic smi people . </s> <section_title_start> art <section_title_end> </s> for an extended period , the norwegian art scene wa dominated by artwork from germany and holland a well a by the influence of copenhagen . it wa in the <number> century that a truly norwegian era began , first with portrait , later with impressive landscape . johan christian dahl ( <year> <number> ) , originally from the dresden school , eventually returned to paint the landscape of western norway , defining norwegian painting for the first time . `` </s> norway 's newly found independence from denmark encouraged painter to develop their norwegian identity , especially with landscape painting by artist such a kitty lange kielland , a female painter who studied under han gude , and harriet backer , another pioneer among female artist , influenced by impressionism . frits thaulow , an impressionist , wa influenced by the art scene in paris a wa christian krohg , a realist painter , famous for his painting of prostitute . </s> of particular note is edvard munch , a symbolist/expressionist painter who became world-famous for the scream which is said to represent the anxiety of modern man . </s> other artist of note include harald sohlberg , a neo-romantic painter remembered for his painting of rros , and odd nerdrum , a figurative painter who maintains that his work is not art , but kitsch . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> : category : norwegian cuisine norway 's culinary tradition show the influence of long seafaring and farming tradition , with salmon ( fresh and cured ) , [ ( pickled or marinated ) , trout ] , [ [ codfish , and other seafood , balanced by cheese ( such a brunost ) , dairy product , and bread ( predominantly dark/darker ) . </s> lefse is a norwegian potato flatbread , usually topped with large amount of butter and sugar , most common around christmas . some traditional norwegian dish include lutefisk , smalahove , pinnekjtt , raspeball , and frikl . some quirky norwegian speciality is rakefisk , which is a fermented trout , consumed with thin flatbread ( flatbrd , not lefse ) and sour cream . and the most popular pastry among all population is vaffel . it is different from belgian in taste and consistency and is served with sour cream , brown cheese , butter and sugar , or strawberry or raspberry jam , which can all be mixed or eaten separately . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> sport are a central part of norwegian culture , and popular sport include association football , [ biathlon ] , [ [ cross-country skiing , ski jumping , long track speed skating , and , to a lesser degree , ice hockey . </s> association football is the most popular sport in norway in term of active membership . in <year> <number> polling , football ranked far behind biathlon and cross-country skiing in term of popularity a spectator sport . ice hockey is the biggest indoor sport . the norway woman 's national handball team woman 's handball national team ha won several title , including two summer olympics championship ( handball at the <year> summer olympics , handball at the <year> summer olympics ) , tournament . the woman 's team also ha two uefa european woman 's championship title ( <year> european competition for woman 's football , uefa woman 's euro <year> ) . the norway national football federation of international bandy . in term of licensed athlete , it is the second biggest winter sport in the world . a of january <year> , norway national bandy team the men 's national team ha captured one silver and one bronze , while norway woman 's national bandy team the woman 's national team ha managed five bronze at bandy # world championship . </s> norway first participated at the olympic game in <year> , and ha sent athlete to compete in every game since then , except for the sparsely attended <year> summer olympics and the <year> summer olympics in moscow when they participated in the <year> summer olympics boycott american-led boycott . norway lead all-time olympic game medal table at the winter olympic game by a considerable margin . famous norwegian winter and bjrn dhlie . </s> norway ha hosted the game on two occasion : </s> * <year> winter olympics in oslo </s> * <year> winter olympics in lillehammer </s> it also hosted the <year> winter youth olympics in lillehammer , making norway the first country to host both winter regular and youth olympics . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> a of <year> , norway rank <number> in the world economic forum 's travel and tourism competitiveness report . tourism in norway contributed to <number> of the gross domestic product a reported in <year> . every one in fifteen people throughout the country work in the tourism industry . tourism is seasonal in norway , with more than half of total tourist visiting between the month of may and august . </s> the main attraction of norway are the varied landscape that extend across the arctic circle . it is famous for it fjord-indented coastline and it mountain , ski resort , lake and wood . popular tourist destination in norway include oslo , lesund , bergen , stavanger , trondheim , kristiansand and troms . much of the nature of norway remains unspoiled , and thus attracts numerous hiker and skier . the fjord , mountain and waterfall in western norway and northern norway attract several hundred thousand foreign tourist each year . in the city , cultural idiosyncrasy such a the holmenkollen ski jump attract many visitor , a do landmark such a bergen 's bryggen and oslo 's vigeland sculpture park . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * aristocracy of norway </s> * established in the <number>s </s> category:872 establishment </s> category : state and territory established in <year> </s> category : state and territory established in <year> </s> category : country in europe </s> category : christian state <article_end> <article_start> </s> saint lucia ( , ; sainte-lucie ) is a sovereign state island country in the west indie in the eastern caribbean sea on the boundary with the atlantic ocean . the island wa previously called iyonola , the name given to the island by the native arawak and later , hewanorra , the name given by the native island carib , two separate amerindian people . part of the lesser antilles , it is located north/northeast of the island of saint vincent ( antilles ) , northwest of barbados and south of martinique . it cover a land area of and reported a population of <number> in the <year> census . it capital is castries . </s> the french were the first european to settle on the island . they signed a treaty with the native island carib in <year> . england took control of the island from <year> to <year> . in ensuing year , it wa at war with france fourteen time , and the rule of the island changed frequently ( it wa ruled seven time each by the french and british ) . in <year> , the british took definitive control of the island . because it switched so often between british and french control , saint lucia wa also known a the `` helen of the west indie `` after the greek mythological character , helen of troy . </s> representative government came about in <year> ( universal suffrage wa established in <year> ) . from <year> to <year> , the island wa a member of the west indie federation . on <number> february <year> , saint lucia became an independent state and a member of the commonwealth of nation . saint lucia is a mixed jurisdiction , meaning that it ha a legal system based in part on both the civil law ( legal system ) and english common law . the civil code of st. lucia of <year> wa based on the civil code of lower canada , a supplemented by english common law-style legislation . it is also a member of organisation internationale de la francophonie . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> one of the windward island , saint lucia wa named after saint lucy ( ad <number> <number> ) . it is one of two country in the world named after a woman ( ireland is named after the celtic goddess of fertility riu ) and the only country named after a historical woman . saint helena st. helena , another island , is also named for an historical womanthe mother of emperor constantinebut st. helena is a dependent territory of the united kingdom and is not a sovereign nation . legend state french sailor were shipwrecked at st. lucia on <number> december , the feast day of st. lucy , naming the island in honor of sainte lucie . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-colonial period <section_title_end> </s> the first proven inhabitant were the taino people , though there may have been other native people prior to this . the arawak are believed to have come from northern south america sometime around ad <year> <number> , a there are numerous archeology site on the island where specimen of their well-developed pottery have been found . there is evidence to suggest that the arawak called the island iouanalao , meaning 'land of the iguana ' , due to the island 's high number of iguana . </s> the more aggressive island carib arrived around ad <number> , and seized control from the arawak by killing their men and assimilating the woman into their own society . they called the island hewanarau , and later hewanorra ( ioanalao , or `` there where iguana are found `` ) . </s> <section_title_start> early european period <section_title_end> </s> christopher columbus may have sighted the island during his fourth voyage in <year> , since he made landfall on martinique , yet he doe not mention the island in his log . juan de la cosa noted the island on his map of <year> , calling it el falcon , and another island to the south la agujas . a spanish cedula from <year> mention the island within the spanish domain , and a globe in the vatican made in <year> , show the island a sanctum lucia . </s> in the late <year> , the french pirate franois le clerc ( known a jambe de bois , due to his wooden leg ) set up a camp on pigeon island ( saint lucia ) , from where he attacked passing spanish ship . in <year> , an english vessel called the oliphe blossome wa blown off-course on it way to guyana , and the <number> colonist started a settlement on saint lucia , after initially being welcomed by the carib chief anthonie . by <number> september <year> only <number> survived following continued attack by the carib chief augraumart , so the settler fled the island . </s> <section_title_start> french colony <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , thomas warner ( son of thomas warner ( explorer ) , the governor of st kitts ) claimed saint lucia for england . he brought <number> men to defend it from the french , but after only two year , only <number> survived with the rest dying mostly due to disease . in <year> , the french west india company resumed control of the island , which in <year> wa made an official french crown colony a a dependency of martinique . </s> <section_title_start> 18th and <number> centuries <section_title_end> </s> both the british and the french found the island attractive after the slave-based sugar industry developed , and during the <number> century the island changed ownership or wa declared neutral territory a dozen time , although the french settlement remained and the island wa a de facto french colony well into the eighteenth century . </s> in <year> , george i of great britain granted both saint lucia and saint vincent ( island ) to john montagu , <number> duke of montagu . he in turn appointed nathaniel uring , a merchant sea captain and adventurer , a deputy-governor . uring went to the island with a group of seven ship , and established settlement at petit carenage . unable to get enough support from british warship , he and the new colonist were quickly run off by the french . </s> during the seven year ' war , britain occupied saint lucia for a year . britain handed the island back to the french at the treaty of paris ( <year> ) in <year> . like the english and dutch on other island , the french began to develop the land for the cultivation of sugar cane a a commodity crop on large plantation in <year> . </s> the british occupied the island again between <year> and <year> . </s> in january <year> , during the french revolution , the national assembly ( french revolution ) sent four commissaires to st lucia to spread their revolutionary philosophy . by august <year> , slave began to abandon their estate and governor de gimat fled . in december <year> , lt. jean-baptiste raymond de lacrosse arrived with revolutionary pamphlet , and the impoverished white and free people of color began to arm themselves a patriot . on <number> february <year> , france declared war on england and holland , and general nicolas xavier de ricard took over a governor . the national convention abolished enslavement on <number> february <year> , but st. lucia fell to a british invasion led by vice admiral john jervis , <number> earl of st vincent on <number> april <year> . morne fortune became fort charlotte . soon , a patriot army of resistance , l'armee franaise dans le bois , began to fight back . thus started the first brigand war . </s> a short time later the british invaded the island a a part of the war with france that had recently broken out . on <number> february <year> a group of local under the nominal control of victor hugues defeated a battalion of british troop at vieux fort and rabot . in <year> , castries wa burned a part of the conflict . john moore ( british army officer ) retook fort charlotte in <year> with the <number> ( inniskilling ) regiment of foot after two day of bitter fighting . a an honour , the fusilier ' regimental colour wa displayed on the flagstaff of the captured fortress at morne fortune for an hour before being replaced by the union jack . moore would then participate in british effort to repress the slave rebel until falling ill of yellow fever , upon which he returned to britain before <year> . </s> in <year> , the british regained control of the island . many of the rebel escaped into the thick rainforest where they evaded capture and established maroon community . </s> the slavery on the island wa continued for a short time , but anti-slavery sentiment wa rising in britain . the british stopped the import of slave by anyone , white or coloured , when they slave trade act <year> in <year> . </s> france and great britain continued to contest saint lucia until the british secured it in <year> , a part of the treaty of paris ( <year> ) ending the napoleonic war . thereafter , saint lucia wa considered part of the british windward island colony . </s> the institution of slavery wa abolished on the island in <year> , a it wa slavery abolition act <year> . after abolition , all former slave had to serve a four-year `` apprenticeship , `` to accustom them to the idea of freedom . during this period , they worked for their former master for at least three-quarters of the work week . full freedom wa duly granted by the british in <year> . by that time , people of african ethnicity greatly outnumbered those of ethnic european background . some people of carib descent also comprised a minority on the island . </s> castries ' harbour wa protected by a system of <number> surrounding fort . along the top of morne fortune there are six military site , building work by the french started in <year> , and the british completed the work by <year> . they include fort charlotte ( old morne fortress ) , the apostle 's battery ( <year> <number> ) , the powder magazine built by the french in the <year> , provost 's redoubt ( <year> ) built a a lookout point , and the combermere barrack . </s> the best preserved installation is a battery at la toc point , completed in <year> it wa not abandoned till <year> . this fort in particular wa built by the british to repel any attack from the united state on the then valuable coaling ( ship ) of castries . </s> <section_title_start> 20th and <number> centuries <section_title_end> </s> the second world war visited the island directly during the battle of the caribbean , when a german u-boat attacked and sank two british ship in castries harbour on <number> march <year> . </s> in the mid-twentieth century , saint lucia joined the west indie federation ( <year> <number> ) when the colony wa dissolved . in <year> , saint lucia became one of the six member of the west indie associated state , with internal self-government . in <year> , it gained full independence under sir john compton of the conservative united worker party ( saint lucia ) united worker party ( uwp ) . the new country chose to remain within the british commonwealth and to retain queen elizabeth a monarchy of saint lucia , represented locally by a governor-general of saint lucia governor-general . </s> <section_title_start> post-independence era <section_title_end> </s> compton 's initial term a prime minister lasted only a few month , a he wa defeated by the left-leaning saint lucia labour party ( slp ) under allan louisy in the <year> saint lucian general election . the slp sought to improve tie with socialist country in the region such a cuba , though the economy wa severely affected by hurricane allen in <year> . louisy wa replaced a prime minister by winston cenac in <year> . the slp government faced a series of strike and cenac agreed to stand down , with michael pilgrim of the progressive labour party ( saint lucia ) briefly serving a acting prime minister until the <year> saint lucian general election . this election wa won by the uwp under john compton , who proceeded to rule the country uninterrupted until <year> ; he wa succeeded by vaughan lewis , who ruled for just over a year before losing the <year> saint lucian general election to the slp under kenny anthony . during this era the uwp adopted a generally pro-western , pro-business outlook , seeking to diversify the economy away from over-reliance on banana and boosting the tourism sector . compton wa also a keen advocate of regional integration . </s> anthony remained in power until <year> when the uwp , again led by compton , <year> saint lucian general election of parliament . compton pledged to boost the economy and tackle the rising crime rate . police attempt to curb crime were criticised in <year> when it emerged that several suspect had been unlawfully shot by police and the circumstance of their death covered up . in may <year> , after compton suffered a series of small stroke , finance and external affair minister stephenson king became acting prime minister and succeeded compton a prime minister when the latter died in september <year> . in november <year> , kenny anthony wa <year> saint lucian general election re-elected a prime minister for a third time . in the <year> saint lucian general election the united worker 's party ( uwp ) assumed power again , with allen chastanet becoming prime minister . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> the volcano island of saint lucia is more mountainous than most caribbean island , with the highest point being mount gimie , at above sea level . two other mountain , the piton , form the island 's most famous landmark . they are located between soufrire , saint lucia and choiseul , saint lucia on the western side of the island . saint lucia is the only island in the world that contains a drive-in volcano . forest cover about <number> of the land area . </s> there are a number of list of caribbean island # saint lucia off the coast , the largest of which are the maria island , st lucia in the south-east . </s> the capital city of saint lucia is castries ( population <number> ) where <number> of the population life . other major town include gros islet , soufrire , saint lucia , and vieux fort . the population tends to be concentrated around the coast , with the interior more sparsely populated , due to the presence of dense forest . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the local climate is tropical climate , specifically a tropical rainforest climate ( af ) under the kppen climate classification , moderated by northeast trade wind , with a dry season from <number> december to <number> may , and a wet season from <number> june to <number> november ( referred to by local a the hurricane season ) . </s> average daytime temperature are around , and average nighttime temperature are around . since it is fairly close to the equator , the temperature doe not fluctuate much between winter and summer . average annual rainfall range from on the coast to in the mountain rainforest . </s> <section_title_start> flora and fauna <section_title_end> </s> saint lucia contains five terrestrial ecoregions : windward island moist forest , leeward island dry forest , windward island dry forest , windward island xeric scrub , and lesser antilles mangrove . it had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> a specie of lizard , anolis luciae , is named for and is endemism to saint lucia . </s> <section_title_start> geology <section_title_end> </s> the geology of st. lucia can be described a composing three main area . the oldest , <year> megaannum , volcanic rock are exposed from castries northward and consist of eroded basalt and andesite centre . the middle , central highland , portion of the island consists of dissected andesite centre , <number> to <number> mya , while the lower southwest portion of the island contains recent activity from the soufriere volcanic centre ( svc ) . this svc , centered about the qualibou caldera , contains pyroclastic flow deposit , lava flow , intrusive rock , block and ash flow deposit , and volcanic crater . this depression 's perimeter includes the town of soufriere , mount tabac , mt . gimie , morne bonin , and gros piton . at in diameter , though the western portion is open towards the grenada basin ( geology ) , the depression formed a recently a <number> kya . the depression is noted for it geothermal gradient , especially at sulphur spring , saint lucia and soufrire estate , a phreatic eruption in <year> , and recent seismic activity ( <year> <number> ) . </s> eroded andesitic stratovolcanoes to the north east of the depression include mt . gimie , piton st esprit , and mt . grand magazin , all greater than <number> ma in age . andesitic and dacite pyroclastic flow from these volcano are found at morne tabac dome ( <number> kiloannus ) , morne bonin dome ( <number> kya ) , and bellevue ( <number> kya ) . avalanche deposit from the formation of the qualibou depression are found offshore , and in the massive block of rabot , pleisance , and coubaril . the dacitic dome of petit piton ( <number> kya ) and gros piton ( <number> kya ) were then extrusive rock onto the depression floor accompanied by the anse john ( <number> kya ) and la pointe ( <number> kya ) pyroclastic flow . later , pyroclastic flow include pumice-rich belfond and anse noir ( <number> kya ) . finally , the dacitic dome of terre blanche ( <number> kya ) and belfond ( <number> kya ) formed within the depression . </s> <section_title_start> government <section_title_end> </s> saint lucia is a commonwealth realm . elizabeth ii is monarchy of saint lucia , represented on the island by a governor-general of saint lucia governor-general . the prime minister of saint lucia is normally the head of the party commanding the support of the majority of the member of the house of assembly of saint lucia , which ha <number> seat . the other chamber of parliament of saint lucia , the senate of saint lucia , ha eleven appointed member . </s> saint lucia is a two-party parliamentary democracy . three political party participated in the <number> june <year> general election . the united worker party ( saint lucia ) , led by allen chastanet , won eleven of the seventeen seat . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relations <section_title_end> </s> saint lucia maintains friendly relation with the major power active in the caribbean , including the united state , the united kingdom , canada , and france . saint lucia ha no current international dispute . </s> saint lucia is a full and participating member of the caribbean community caribbean community ( caricom ) , organisation of eastern caribbean state ( oecs ) , and la francophonie . saint lucia is a commonwealth realm . </s> saint lucia became the <number> member of the united nation on <number> december <year> . a of january <year> , cosmos richardson , who presented his credential on <number> february <year> , wa saint lucia 's representative to the united nation . </s> <section_title_start> organisation of american state ( oas ) <section_title_end> </s> the charter of the oas wa signed in bogota in <year> and wa amended by several protocol which were named after the city and the year in which the protocol wa signed , such a managua in <year> forming part of the name of the protocol . </s> saint lucia entered the oas system on <number> february <year> . </s> <section_title_start> agreements which impact on financial relationships <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> the double taxation relief ( caricom ) treaty <year> <section_title_end> </s> at a caricom meeting , the representative of st. lucia , john compton signed the double taxation relief ( caricom ) treaty <year> on <number> july <year> . </s> the representative of seven caricom country signed similar agreement at sherbourne conference centre , st. michael , barbados . the country whose representative signed the treaty in barbados were antigua and barbuda , belize , grenada , jamaica , st. kitts and nevis , st. vincent and the grenadine , and trinidad and tobago . </s> this treaty covered tax , residence , tax jurisdiction , capital gain , business profit , interest , dividend , royalty and other area . </s> <section_title_start> fatca <section_title_end> </s> on <number> june <year> , saint lucia signed a model <number> agreement with the united state of america in relation to foreign account tax compliance act ( fatca ) . a of <number> september <year> , the status of the agreement is listed a `` in force `` . </s> preceding the <year> fatca agreement is one which wa entered into on <number> january <year> between the united state of america and saint lucia according to paragraph <number> of the model <number> agreement , the purpose of which wa to exchange tax information . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> saint lucia ha no regular military force . a special service unit ( ssu ) and the coast guard are both under the command of the royal saint lucia police . although the ssu is under the rslpf ( royal saint lucia police force ) , they are called in a the last line of defense or for more severe case . </s> in <year> , saint lucia signed the un treaty on the prohibition of nuclear weapon . </s> <section_title_start> administrative divisions <section_title_end> </s> the district of the island , established by the french colonial government and continued by the british , are : </s> * anse la raye quarter , <number> ; km2 </s> * canary quarter </s> * castries quarter , <number> ; km2 </s> * choiseul quarter , <number> ; km2 </s> * dauphin quarter </s> * dennery quarter , <number> ; km2 </s> * gros islet quarter </s> * laborie quarter , <number> ; km2 </s> * micoud quarter , <number> ; km2 </s> * soufrire quarter , <number> ; km2 </s> * vieux fort quarter , <number> ; km </s> an additional area is the forest reserve area quarter ( <number> ; km2 ) . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> the united nation categorizes saint lucia a a small island developing state , a designation similar to a developing country with a few substantial difference due to saint lucia 's island nature . the tertiary sector of the economy accounted for <number> of gdp , followed by industrial sector and agriculture at <number> and <number> , respectively . </s> an educated workforce and improvement in road , communication , water supply , sewerage , and port facility have attracted foreign investment in tourism and in petroleum storage and transshipment . however , with the u , canada , and europe in recession , tourism declined by double digit in early <year> . the recent change in the european union import preference regime and the increased competition from latin american banana have made economic diversification increasingly important in saint lucia . </s> saint lucia ha been able to attract foreign business and investment , especially in it offshore banking and tourism industry , which is saint lucia 's main source of revenue . the manufacturing sector is the most diverse in the eastern caribbean area , and the government is trying to revitalise the banana industry . despite negative growth in <year> , economic fundamental remain solid , and gdp growth should recover in the future . </s> inflation ha been relatively low , averaging <number> percent between <year> and <year> . saint lucia 's currency is the east caribbean dollar ( ec $ ) , a regional currency shared among member of the eastern caribbean currency union ( ecu ) . the eastern caribbean central bank ( eccl ) issue the ec $ , manages monetary policy , and regulates and supervises commercial banking activity in member country . in <year> , the government began a comprehensive restructuring of the economy , including elimination of price control and privatization of the state banana company . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> tourism is vital to saint lucia 's economy . it economic importance is expected to continue to increase a the market for banana have become more competitive . tourism tends to be more substantial during the dry season ( january to april ) , often referred to a the tourist season . saint lucia tends to be popular due to it tropical weather and scenery and it beach and resort . </s> other tourist attraction include a drive-in volcano , sulphur spring , saint lucia ( in soufrire ) , zip lining in at sault fall , dennery , the st lucia botanical garden , the majestic twin peak `` the piton `` , a world heritage site , the rain forest , several option of boat trip , frigate island nature reserve ( operated by the st. lucia national trust ) , dennery , and pigeon island national park , which is home to fort rodney , an old british military base . </s> the majority of tourist visit saint lucia a part of a cruise . most of their time tends to be spent in castries , although soufrire , saint lucia , marigot bay , rodney bay and gros islet are also tourist destination . </s> the current minister of tourism is dominic fedee , he ha been in his role since <year> . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> saint lucia reported a population of <number> in the <year> national census . in , the united nation population division estimated saint lucia 's population at . the country 's population is evenly divided between urban and rural area , with more than a third living in the capital , castries . </s> despite a high emigration rate , the population is growing rapidly at about <number> per year . migration from saint lucia is primarily to english-speaking world country , with the united kingdom having almost <number> saint lucian-born citizen , and over <number> of saint lucian heritage . the second most popular destination for saint lucian migrs is the united state , where a combined ( foreign and national-born saint lucians ) almost <number> reside . canada is home to a few thousand saint lucians . </s> <section_title_start> ethnic groups <section_title_end> </s> saint lucia 's population is predominantly of african and mixed african-european-carib descent , with a small indo-caribbean minority ( <number> ) . member of other or unspecified ethnic group , account for about <number> of the population . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> the official language is english . saint lucian french creole ( kwyl ) , which is colloquially referred to a patois ( `` patwa `` ) , is spoken by <number> of the population . this antillean creole is used in literature and music , and is gaining official acknowledgement . a it developed during the early period of french colonisation , the creole is derived chiefly from french and west african language , with some vocabulary from the island carib language and other source . antillean creole is also spoken in dominica , martinique , guadeloupe , and ( to a lesser extent ) st. vincent and grenada ; it also resembles the creole spoken in french guiana , haiti , mauritius and the seychelles . saint lucia is a member of la francophonie . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> christianity is the main religion in saint lucia . about <number> of the population is roman catholic . another <number> belong to protestant denomination , ( includes seventh day adventist <number> , pentecostal <number> , baptist <number> , anglican <number> , church of god <number> , other protestant <number> ) . evangelicals comprise <number> of the population and <number> are jehovah 's witness . in addition , about <number> of the population adheres to the rastafari movement . other religion include islam , bah ' faith , judaism , and buddhism . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> see health in saint lucia </s> <section_title_start> crime <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , saint lucia recorded <number> homicide , the highest in the country 's history . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> the culture of saint lucia ha been influenced by african , east indian , french , and english heritage . one of the secondary language is saint lucian french creole , spoken by almost all of the population . </s> saint lucia boast the second highest ratio of nobel prize laureate produced with respect to the total population of any sovereign country in the world . two winner have come from saint lucia : william arthur lewis ( economist ) won the bank of sweden prize in economic science in memory of alfred nobel in <year> , and the poet derek walcott received the nobel prize in literature in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> festivals <section_title_end> </s> saint lucian cultural festival include la woz celebrated on august <number> and la magwit on october <number> , the first representing a native saint lucian fraternal society known a the order of the rose that is fashioned in the mould of rosicrucianism , and the second representing it traditional rival , the native saint lucian equivalent of freemasonry known a the order of the marguerite . reference to their origin a version of pre-existing external secret society can be seen in a mural painted by dunstan st omer , depicting the holy trinity of osiris , horus , and isi . </s> the biggest festival of the year is the saint lucia jazz festival . held in early may at multiple venue throughout the island , it draw visitor and musician from around the world . the grand finale or main stage is held at the pigeon island island national landmark ( saint lucia ) which is located to the north of the island . </s> traditionally in common with other caribbean country , saint lucia held a carnival before lent . in <year> , the government moved carnival to mid-july to avoid competing with the much larger trinidad and tobago carnival and so a to attract more overseas visitor . </s> in may <year> , saint lucians commemorated the <number> anniversary of west indian heritage on the island . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> the windward island cricket team includes player from saint lucia and play in the regional four day competition . daren sammy became the first saint lucian to represent the west indie cricket team on his debut in <year> , and since <year> ha captained the side . in an international career spanning <year> to <year> , and including <number> odis and one test , nadine george mbe became the first woman to score a test century for the team . sammy and george were recognised by the saint lucian government a sportsman of the year and sportswoman of the year respectively for <year> . </s> for sailing enthusiast , the annual atlantic rally for cruiser ( arc ) race begin in the canary island and end in saint lucia . the year <year> marked the arc 's <number> year of existence . every november , the race attracts over <number> boat and <number> people to sail across the atlantic to the caribbean . </s> in <year> a modern state of the art horse racing facility opened . one of the main contributor will be the china horse club , operator of race track in asia . </s> <section_title_start> music and dance <section_title_end> </s> together with caribbean music genre such a calypso music , soca music , dancehall , reggae , compas , zouk ( musical movement ) , and salsa music , saint lucia ha a strong indigenous folk music tradition . each may since <year> , saint lucia ha hosted an internationally renowned saint lucia jazz festival . in <year> , the festival wa re-branded the saint lucia jazz & art festival which encompassed culture , visual art , alternative music , education , fashion , and food . </s> dancing in saint lucia is inspired by caribbean culture and enjoys an active following . a popular folk dance is the kwadril . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> caribbean cinema operates in saint lucia . the cinema is located at choc estate in castries . there is also a bank of st. lucia atm , domino 's pizza outlet , & a cafe [ ritual coffee shop ] near the cinema . </s> much of the scenery for the film dr. dolittle ( film ) dr. dolittle wa shot in saint lucia in <year> . water ( <year> film ) wa shot on the island , a were part of firepower ( film ) . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> the education act provides for free and compulsory education in saint lucia from the age of <number> to <number> . public spending on education wa at <number> among the <year> <number> gdp . </s> saint lucia ha a community college ( sir arthur lewis community college ) , one university campus operated by the university of the west indie open campus , and a few medical school american international medical university , international american university college of medicine , destiny university school of medicine and health science , and the oldest of which is spartan health science university . </s> monroe college , a private for-profit college and graduate school based in new york city , established a campus in saint lucia in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> saint lucia 's national dish is green fig and saltfish . </s> the island 's cuisine is a unique blend of west african , european ( mainly british and french ) and indian cuisine ; this creates dynamic meal dish such a macaroni pie , stew chicken , rice and pea , fish broth or fish water , and soup packed full with fresh locally produced vegetable . typical essential foodstuff are potato , onion , celery , thyme , coconut milk , the very hot scotch bonnet , flour , and cornmeal . all mainstream meat and poultry are eaten in st. lucia ; meat and seafood are normally stewed and browned to create a rich gravy sometimes served over ground provision or rice . the island is also home to the famous fried dough , known by many a a bake or johnny cake . these bakes can be served with different side , such a saltfish which is either sauted or lightly fried along with red , green pepper , onion , and seasoned well . this is the most common way for bake to be prepared , though it can also be served with meat such a stewed chicken or beef . </s> one popular saint lucian dessert is the pastry called a turnover . the pastry is made with sweetened coconut that is boiled with spice , some sugar , and whatever is satisfying . it is boiled until cooked to a light or dark brown colour ; then the mixture is separated into various size portion placed on a rolled out piece of dough . the dough size may vary too depending on how much is desired , and lastly , it is baked in the oven until the colour of the turnover is nicely browned . </s> due to saint lucia 's indo-caribbean population , curry is very popular ; however due to the blend of cooking style , curry dish have a distinct caribbean twist . roti is typically served a a fast food meal : the bread itself is very flat ( sometimes very thin ) and is wrapped around curried vegetable such a chickpea and potato , seafood such a shrimp and conch , or meat such a chicken , beef , goat , and liver . </s> <section_title_start> lgbtq non-acceptance <section_title_end> </s> lgbt right in saint lucia lesbian , gay , bisexual , and transgender ( lgbt ) people living in saint lucia face legal challenge not experienced by non-lgbt member of the population . saint lucia prohibits male-on-male sexual activity , punishing those found guilty with <number> year in jail however the law is not enforced . saint lucia wa also the only un member in the america to formally oppose the un declaration on sexual orientation and gender identity . </s> <section_title_start> gallery
