in <year> </s> category:1970s establishment in the caribbean </s> category:1979 establishment in north america </s> category : country in north america <article_end> <article_start> </s> haiti ( ; hati ; ayiti ) , officially the republic of haiti ( rpublique d'hati links=no ; repiblik d ayiti links=no ) and formerly known a hayti , is a country located on the island of hispaniola in the greater antilles archipelago of the caribbean sea , to the east of cuba and jamaica and south of the bahamas and the turk and caicos island . it occupies the western three-eighths of the island which it share with the dominican republic . to it south-west lie the small island of navassa island , which is claimed by haiti but is disputed a a united state united state minor outlying island under federal administration . haiti is in size , the third largest country in the caribbean by area , and ha an estimated population of <number> million , making it the most populous country in the caribbean . </s> the island wa originally inhabited by the indigenous tano people , who migrated from south america . the first european arrived on <number> december <year> during the christopher columbus # first voyage of christopher columbus , who initially believed he had found india or china . columbus subsequently founded the first european settlement in the america , la navidad , on what is now the northeastern coast of haiti . the island wa claimed by spanish empire and named la espaola , forming part of the spanish empire until the early <number> century . however , competing claim and settlement by the french led to the western portion of the island being peace of ryswick in <year> , which wa subsequently named saint-domingue . french colonist established lucrative sugarcane sugar plantation in the caribbean , worked by vast number of slave brought from africa , which made the colony one of the richest in the world . </s> in the midst of the french revolution ( <year> <number> ) , slave and free people of color launched the haitian revolution ( <year> <number> ) , led by a former slave and the first black general of the french army , toussaint louverture . after <number> year of conflict , napoleon bonaparte 's force were defeated by louverture 's successor , jean-jacques dessalines ( later emperor jacques i ) , who declared haiti 's sovereignty on <number> january <year> the first independent nation state of latin america and the caribbean , the second republic in the america , the first country to abolish slavery , and the only state in history established by a successful slave rebellion . apart from alexandre ption , the first president of the republic , all of haiti 's first leader were former slave . after a brief period in which the country wa split in two , president jean-pierre boyer united the country and then attempted to bring the whole of hispaniola under haitian control , precipitating a long series of war that ended in the <year> when haiti formally recognized the independence of the dominican republic . haiti 's first century of independence wa characterized by political instability , ostracism by the international community and the payment of a crippling debt to france . political volatility and foreign economic influence in the country prompted the u.s. to occupy the country from <year> to <year> . following a series of short-lived presidency , franois duvalier franois 'papa doc ' duvalier took power in <year> , ushering in a long period of autocratic rule that wa continued by his son jean-claude duvalier jean-claude 'baby doc ' duvalier that lasted until <year> ; the period wa characterized by state-sanctioned violence against the opposition and civilian , corruption , and economic stagnation . since <year> haiti ha been attempting to establish a more democratic political system . </s> haiti is a founding member of the united nation , organization of american state ( oas ) , association of caribbean state , and the organisation internationale de la francophonie . in addition to caricom , it is a member of the international monetary fund , world trade organization , and the community of latin american and caribbean state . historically poor and politically unstable , haiti ha the lowest list of country by human development index in the america . since the turn of the <number> century , the country ha endured a <year> haitian coup d'tat coup d'tat , which prompted a united nation stabilisation mission in haiti u.n. intervention , a well a <year> haiti earthquake that killed over <number> </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the name haiti ( or hayti ) come from the indigenous tano language which wa the native name given to the entire island of hispaniola to mean , `` land of high mountain . `` the h is silent in french and the in hati ha a diaeresis ( diacritic ) # french used to show that the second vowel is pronounced separately , a in the word nave . in english , this rule for the pronunciation is often disregarded , thus the spelling haiti is used . there are different anglicization for it pronunciation such a high-ti , high-ee-ti and haa-ee-ti , which are still in use , but hay-ti is the most widespread and best-established . the name wa restored by haitian revolutionary jean-jacques dessalines a the official name of independent saint-domingue , a a tribute to the amerindian predecessor . </s> in french , haiti 's nickname is the `` pearl of the antilles `` ( la perle de antilles ) because of both it natural beauty , and the amount of wealth it accumulated for the kingdom of france ; during the <number> century the colony wa the world 's leading producer of sugar and coffee . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-columbian history <section_title_end> </s> the island of hispaniola , of which haiti occupies the western three-eighths , ha been inhabited since about <year> bc by group of native american thought to have arrived from central or south america . genetic study show that some of these group were related to the yanomami of the amazon basin . amongst these early settler were the ciboney people , followed by the tano people , speaker of an arawakan tano language , element of which have been preserved in haitian creole . the tano name for the entire island wa haiti , or alternatively quisqeya . </s> in tano society the largest unit of political organization wa led by a cacique , or chief , a the european understood them . the island of hipaniola wa divided among five 'caciquedoms ' : the magua in the north east , the marien in the north west , the jaragua in the south west , the maguana in the central region of cibao , and the higey in the south east . </s> tano cultural artifact include cave painting in several location in the country . these have become national symbol of haiti and tourist attraction . modern-day logne , started a a french colonial town in the southwest , is beside the former capital of the caciquedom of xaragua . </s> <section_title_start> colonial era <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> spanish rule ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> navigator christopher columbus landed in haiti on <number> december <year> , in an area that he named mle-saint-nicolas , and claimed the island for the crown of castile . nineteen day later , his ship the santa mara ( ship ) ran aground near the present site of cap-hatien . columbus left <number> men on the island , who founded the settlement of la navidad on <number> december <year> . relation with the native people , initially good , broke down and the settler were later killed by the tano . </s> the sailor carried endemic eurasian infectious disease to which the native people lacked immunity ( medical ) , causing them to die in great number in epidemic . the first recorded smallpox epidemic in the america erupted on hispaniola in <year> . their number were further reduced by the harshness of the encomienda system , in which the spanish forced native to work in gold mine and plantation . </s> the spanish passed the law of burgos law of burgos , <year> <number> , which forbade the maltreatment of native , endorsed their proselytism to catholicism , and gave legal framework to encomiendas . the native were brought to these site to work in specific plantation or industry . </s> a the spanish re-focused their colonization effort on the greater rich of mainland central and south america , hispaniola became reduced largely to a trading and refueling post . a a result piracy in the caribbean became widespread , encouraged by european power hostile to spain such a france ( based on tortuga ( haiti ) ) and england . the spanish largely abandoned the western third of the island , focusing their colonization effort on the eastern two-thirds . the western part of the island wa thus gradually settled by french buccaneer ; among them wa bertrand d'ogeron , who succeeded in growing tobacco and recruited many french colonial family from martinique and guadeloupe . in <year> kingdom of france and imperial spain settled their hostility on the island by way of the treaty of ryswick of <year> , which divided hispaniola between them . </s> <section_title_start> french rule ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> france received the western third and subsequently named it saint-domingue , the french equivalent of captaincy general of santo domingo , the spanish colony on hispaniola . the french set about creating sugar and coffee plantation , worked by vast number of slave imported from africa , and saint-domingue grew to become their richest colonial possession . </s> the french settler were outnumbered by slave by almost <number> to <number> . according to the <year> census , haiti 's population consisted of nearly <number> european , <number> free colored and <number> african slave . in contrast , by <year> the white population of new france , a far larger territory , had numbered only <number> . in the north of the island , slave were able to retain many tie to african culture , religion and language ; these tie were continually being renewed by newly imported african . some west african slave held on to their traditional haitian vodou belief by secretly syncretizing it with catholicism . </s> the french enacted the code noir ( `` black code `` ) , prepared by jean-baptiste colbert and ratified by louis xiv , which established rule on slave treatment and permissible freedom . saint-domingue ha been described a one of the most brutally efficient slave colony ; one-third of newly imported african died within a few year . many slave died from disease such a smallpox and typhoid fever . they had low birth rate , and there is evidence that some woman abortion fetus rather than give birth to child within the bond of slavery . the colony 's environment also suffered , a forest were cleared to make way for plantation and the land wa overworked so a to extract maximum profit for french plantation owner . </s> a in it louisiana ( new france ) , the new france government allowed some right to free people of color ( gen de couleur ) , the mixed-race descendant of european male colonist and african female slave ( and later , mixed-race woman ) . over time , many were released from slavery and they established a separate social class . white french creole people father frequently sent their mixed-race son to france for their education . some men of color were admitted into the military . more of the free people of color lived in the south of the island , near port-au-prince , and many intermarried within their community . they frequently worked a artisan and tradesman , and began to own some property , including slave of their own . the free people of color petitioned the new france government to expand their right . </s> the brutality of slave life led many slave to escape to mountainous region , where they set up their own autonomous community and became known a maroon ( people ) . one maroon leader , franois mackandal , led a rebellion in the <year> , however he wa later captured and executed by the french . </s> <section_title_start> haitian revolution ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> inspired by the french revolution of <year> and principle of the right of man , the french settler and free people of color pressed for greater political freedom and more civil right . tension between these two group led to conflict , a a militia of free-coloreds wa set up in <year> by vincent og , resulting in his capture , torture and execution . sensing an opportunity , in august <year> the first slave army were established in northern haiti under the leadership of toussaint louverture inspired by the vodou houngan ( priest ) boukman , and backed by the spanish in santo domingo soon a full-blown slave rebellion had broken out across the entire colony . </s> in <year> , the french first republic government sent three commissioner with troop to re-establish control ; to build an alliance with the gen de couleur and slave commissioner lger-flicit sonthonax and tienne polverel abolished slavery in the colony . six month later , the national convention , led by maximilien de robespierre and the jacobin club , endorsed abolition of slavery timeline and extended it to all the french colony . </s> political leader in the united state , which wa a new republic itself , reacted with ambivalence , at time providing aid to enable planter ( plantation owner ) to put down the revolt . later in the revolution , the u provided support to native haitian military force , with the goal of reducing french influence in north america and the caribbean . </s> with slavery abolished , toussaint louverture pledged allegiance to france , and he fought off the british and spanish force who had taken advantage of the situation and invaded saint-domingue . the spanish were later forced to cede their part of the island to france under the term of the peace of basel in <year> , uniting the island under one government . however an insurgency against french rule broke out in the east , and in the west there wa fighting between louverture 's force and the free people of color led by andr rigaud in the war of the knife ( <year> <number> ) . many surviving free people of color left the island a refugee . </s> after louverture created a separatist constitution and proclaimed himself governor-general for life , napolon bonaparte in <year> sent an expedition of <number> soldier and a many sailor under the command of his brother-in-law , charles leclerc ( general , born <year> ) , to reassert french control . the french achieved some victory , but within a few month most of their french army had died from yellow fever . ultimately more than <number> french troop died in an attempt to retake the colony , including <number> general . the french managed to capture louverture , transporting him to france for trial . he wa imprisoned at fort de joux , where he died in <year> of exposure and possibly tuberculosis . </s> the slave , along with free gen de couleur and ally , continued their fight for independence , led by general jean-jacques dessalines , alexandre ption and henry christophe . the rebel finally managed to decisively defeat the french troop at the battle of vertires on <number> november <year> , leading the first ever nation to successfully gain independence through a slave revolt . under the overall command of dessalines , the haitian army avoided open battle , and instead conducted a successful guerrilla campaign against the napoleonic force , working with disease such a yellow fever to reduce the number of french soldier . later that year france withdrew it remaining <number> troop from the island and napoleon gave up his idea of re-establishing a north american empire , selling louisiana ( new france ) to the united state , in the louisiana purchase . it ha been estimated that between <number> and <number> european , and between <number> and <number> haitian ex-slaves , died in the revolution . in the process , dessalines became arguably the most successful military commander in the struggle against napoleonic france . </s> <section_title_start> independent haiti <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> first empire ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> the independence of saint-domingue wa proclaimed under the native name 'haiti ' by dessalines on <number> january <year> in gonaves and he wa proclaimed `` emperor for life `` a emperor jacques i by his troop . dessalines at first offered protection to the white planter and others . however , once in power , he ordered the <year> haiti massacre of nearly all white men , woman , child ; between january and april <year> , <number> to <number> white were killed , including those who had been friendly and sympathetic to the black population . only <year> haiti massacre # aftermath were selected out a exception and spared : polish haitian soldier , the majority of whom had deserted from the french army and fought alongside the haitian rebel ; the small group of german haitian colonist invited to the nord-ouest ( department ) north-west region ; and a group of doctor of medicine and professional . reportedly , people with connection to officer in the haitian army were also spared , a well a the woman who agreed to marry non-white men . </s> fearful of the potential impact the slave rebellion could have in the slave state , u.s. president thomas jefferson refused to recognize the new republic . the southern politician who were a powerful voting bloc in the american congress prevented u.s. recognition for decade until they withdrew in <year> to form the confederate state of america . </s> the revolution led to a wave of emigration . in <year> , <number> refugee from saint-domingue , both white planter and people of color , settled en masse in new orleans , doubling the city 's population , having been expelled from their initial refuge in cuba by spanish authority . in addition , the newly arrived slave added to the city 's african population . </s> the plantation system wa reestablished in haiti , albeit for wage , however many haitian were marginalized and resented the heavy-handed manner in which this wa enforced in the new nation 's politics . the rebel movement splintered , and dessalines wa assassinated by rival on <number> october <year> . </s> <section_title_start> state of haiti , kingdom of haiti and the republic ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> after dessalines ' death haiti became split into two , with the kingdom of haiti in the north directed by henri christophe , later declaring himself henri christophe , and a republic in the south centred on port-au-prince , directed by alexandre ption , an homme de couleur . christophe established a semi-feudal corve system , with a rigid education and economic code . ption 's republic wa le absolutist , and he initiated a series of land reform which benefited the peasant class . president ption also gave military and financial assistance to the revolutionary leader simn bolvar , which were critical in enabling him to liberate the viceroyalty of new granada . meanwhile the french , who had managed to maintain a precarious control of eastern hispaniola , were spanish reconquest of santo domingo by insurgent led by juan snchez ramrez , with the area returning to spanish rule in <year> following the battle of palo hincado . </s> <section_title_start> unification of hispaniola ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> beginning in <year> , president jean-pierre boyer , also an homme de couleur and successor to ption , reunified the island following the suicide of henry christophe . after republic of spanish haiti declared it independence from spain on <number> november <year> , boyer invaded , seeking to unification of hispaniola by force and ending slavery in santo domingo . </s> struggling to revive the agricultural economy to produce commodity crop , boyer passed the code rural , which denied peasant laborer the right to leave the land , enter the town , or start farm or shop of their own , causing much resentment a most peasant wished to have their own farm rather than work on plantation . </s> the american colonization society ( ac ) encouraged free negro in the united state to emigrate to haiti . starting in september <year> , more than <number> african american migrated to haiti , with transportation paid by the ac . many found the condition too harsh and returned to the united state . </s> in july <year> , charles x of france , during a period of restoration of the french monarchy , sent a french navy to reconquer haiti . under pressure , president boyer agreed to a treaty by which france formally recognized the independence of the nation in exchange for haiti indemnity controversy of <number> million franc . by an order of <number> april <year> , the king of france renounced his right of sovereignty and formally recognized the independence of haiti . the enforced payment to france hampered haiti 's economic growth for year , exacerbated by the fact that many western nation continued to refuse formal diplomacy recognition to haiti ; britain recognized haitian independence in <year> , and the united state not until <year> . haiti borrowed heavily from western bank at extremely high interest rate to repay the debt . although the amount of the reparation wa reduced to <number> million in <year> , by <year> <number> of the country 's gross domestic product wa being spent on debt repayment and the country did not finish repaying it until <year> . </s> <section_title_start> loss of the spanish portion of the island <section_title_end> </s> after losing the support of haiti 's elite , boyer wa ousted in <year> , with charles rivire-hrard replacing him a president . nationalist dominican force in eastern hispaniola led by juan pablo duarte seized control of santo domingo on <number> february <year> . the haitian force , unprepared for a significant uprising , capitulated to the rebel , effectively ending haitian rule of eastern hispaniola . in march rivire-hrard attempted to reimpose his authority , but the dominican republic put up stiff opposition and inflicted heavy loss . rivire-hrard wa removed from office by the mulatto hierarchy and replaced with the aged general philippe guerrier , who assumed the presidency on <number> may <year> . </s> guerrier died in april <year> , and wa succeeded by general jean-louis pierrot . pierrot 's most pressing duty a the new president wa to check the incursion of the dominican , who were harassing the haitian troop . dominican gunboat were also making depredation on haiti 's coast . president pierrot decided to open a campaign against the dominican , whom he considered merely a insurgent , however the haitian offensive of <year> wa stopped on the frontier . </s> on <number> january <year> pierrot announced a fresh campaign to re-imposed haitian suzerainty over eastern hispaniola , but his officer and men greeted this fresh summons with contempt . thus , a month later february <year> when pierrot ordered his troop to march against the dominican , the haitian army mutinied , and it soldier proclaimed his overthrow a president of the republic . with the war against the dominican having become very unpopular in haiti , it wa beyond the power of the new president , general jean-baptiste rich , to stage another invasion . </s> <section_title_start> second empire ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> on <number> february <year> , president rich died after only a year in power and wa replaced by an obscure officer , general faustin soulouque . during the first two year of soulouque 's administration the conspiracy and opposition he faced in retaining power were so manifold that the dominican were given a further breathing space in which to consolidate their independence . but , when in <year> france finally recognized the dominican republic a a free and independent state and provisionally signed a treaty of peace , friendship , commerce and navigation , haiti immediately protested , claiming the treaty wa an attack upon their own security . soulouque decided to invade the new republic before the french government could ratify the treaty . </s> on <number> march <year> , haitian soldier attacked the dominican garrison at la matas de farfn . the demoralized defender offered almost no resistance before abandoning their weapon . soulouque pressed on , capturing san juan province ( dominican republic ) . this left only the town of azua , dominican republic a the remaining dominican stronghold between the haitian army and the capital . on <number> april , azua fell to the <number>-strong haitian army , with a <number>-man dominican counterattack failing to oust them . the way to santo domingo wa now clear . but the news of discontent existing at port-au-prince , which reached soulouque , arrested his further progress and caused him to return with the army to his capital . </s> emboldened by the sudden retreat of the haitian army , the dominican counter-attacked . their flotilla went a far a dame-marie , grand'anse dame-marie , which they plundered and set on fire . soulouque , now self-proclaimed a emperor faustin i , decided to start a new campaign against them . in <year> , he again invaded the territory of the dominican republic . but owing to insufficient preparation , the army wa soon in want of victual and ammunition . in spite of the bravery of the soldier , the emperor had once more to give up the idea of a unified island under haitian control . after this campaign , britain and france interfered and obtained an armistice on behalf of the dominican , who declared independence a the dominican republic . </s> the suffering endured by the soldier during the campaign of <year> , and the loss and sacrifice inflicted on the country without yielding any compensation or any practical result provoked great discontent . in <year> a revolution began , led by general fabre geffrard , duke of tabara . in december of that year , geffrard defeated the imperial army and seized control of most of the country . a a result , the emperor abdicated his throne on <number> january <year> . refused aid by the french legation , faustin wa taken into exile aboard a british warship on <number> january <year> , and general geffrard succeeded him a president . </s> <section_title_start> late <number> centuryearly <number> century <section_title_end> </s> the period following soulouque 's overthrow down to the turn of the century wa a turbulent one for haiti , with repeated bout of political instability . president geffrard wa overthrown in a coup in <year> , a wa his successor , sylvain salnave , in <year> . under the presidency of michel domingue ( <year> <number> ) relation with the dominican republic were dramatically improved by the signing of a treaty , in which both party acknowledged the independence of the other , bringing an antnor firmin , and in <year> , the german used gunboat diplomacy to intimidate and then humiliate the haitian government of president tirsias simon sam ( <year> <number> ) during the lders affair . </s> in the first decade of the <number> century , haiti experienced great political instability and wa heavily in debt to france , germany and the united state . a series of short lived presidency came and went : president pierre nord alexis wa forced from power in <year> , a wa his successor franois c. antoine simon in <year> ; president cincinnatus leconte ( <year> <number> ) wa killed in a ( possibly deliberate ) explosion at the national palace ; michel oreste ( <year> <number> ) wa ousted in a coup , a wa his successor oreste zamor in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> united state occupation ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> germany increased it influence in haiti in this period , with a small community of german settler wielding disproportionate influence in haiti 's economy . the german influence prompted anxiety in the united state , who had also invested heavily in the country , and whose government defended their right to oppose foreign interference in the america under the monroe doctrine . in december <year> , the american removed $ <number> from the haitian national bank , but rather than seize it to help pay the debt , it wa removed for safe-keeping in new york , thus giving the united state control of the bank and preventing other power from doing so . this gave a stable financial base on which to build the economy , and so enable the debt to be repaid . </s> in <year> , haiti 's new president vilbrun guillaume sam sought to strengthen his tenuous rule by a mass execution of <number> political prisoner . outrage at the killing led to riot , and sam wa captured and killed by a lynch mob . fearing possible foreign intervention , or the emergence of a new government led by the anti-american haitian politician rosalvo bobo , president woodrow wilson sent u.s. marine into haiti in july <year> . the , under rear admiral william bank caperton , arrived in port-au-prince in an attempt to restore order and protect u.s. interest . within day , the marine had taken control of the capital city and it bank and custom house . the marine declared martial law and severely censored the press . within week , a new pro-u.s. haitian president , philippe sudr dartiguenave , wa installed and a new constitution written that wa favorable to the interest of the united state . the constitution ( written by future u president franklin d. roosevelt ) included a clause that allowed , for the first time , foreign ownership of land in haiti , which wa bitterly opposed by the haitian legislature and citizenry . </s> the occupation improved some of haiti 's infrastructure and centralized power in port-au-prince . <year> ; km of road were made usable , <number> bridge were built , many irrigation canal were rehabilitated , hospital , school , and public building were constructed , and drinking water wa brought to the main city . port-au-prince became the first caribbean city to have a phone service with automatic dialling . agricultural education wa organized , with a central school of agriculture and <number> farm in the country . however , many infrastructure project were built using the corve system that allowed the government/occupying force to take people from their home and farm , at gunpoint if necessary , to build road , bridge etc . by force , a process that wa deeply resented by ordinary haitian . sisal wa also introduced to haiti , and sugarcane and cotton became significant export , boosting prosperity . haitian traditionalist , based in rural area , were highly resistant to united state u.s.-backed change , while the urban elite , typically mixed-race , welcomed the growing economy , but wanted more political control . together they helped secure an end to the occupation in <year> , under the presidency of stnio vincent ( <year> <number> ) . the debt were still outstanding , though le due to increased prosperity , and the u.s. financial advisor-general receiver handled the budget until <year> . </s> the u.s. marine were instilled with a special brand of paternalism towards haitian `` expressed in the metaphor of a father 's relationship with his child . `` armed opposition to the u presence wa led by the cacos ( military group ) under the command of charlemagne pralte ; his capture and execution in <year> earned him the status of a national martyr . during senate hearing in <year> , the commandant of the marine corp reported that , in the <number> month of active unrest , <number> haitian had been killed . however , in a report to the secretary of the navy , he reported the death toll a being <number> . haitian historian have claimed the true number wa much higher . one went so far a to say , `` the total number of battle victim and casualty of repression and consequence of the war might have reached , by the end of the pacification period , four or five time that somewhere in the neighborhood of <number> person . `` this is not supported by most historian outside haiti . </s> recognition of the distinctive traditionalism of the haitian people had an influence on american writer , including eugene o'neill , james weldon johnson , langston hughes , zora neale hurston and orson welles . </s> <section_title_start> post-occupation era ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> after u force left in <year> , dominican republic dictator rafael trujillo duvalier dynasty ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> in <year> <number> haiti underwent severe political turmoil ; magloire wa forced to resign and leave the country in <year> and he wa followed by four short-lived presidency . in the haitian presidential election , <year> dr. franois duvalier wa elected president of haiti . known a 'papa doc ' and initially popular , duvalier remained president until his death in <year> . he advanced black interest in the public sector , where over time , people of color had predominated a the educated urban elite . not trusting the army , despite his frequent purge of officer deemed disloyal , duvalier created a private militia known a tonton macoute ( `` bogeyman `` ) , which maintained order by terrorizing the populace and political opponent . in <year> duvalier proclaimed himself 'president for life ' ; jrmie vesper against his rule that year in jrmie wa violently suppressed , with the ringleader publicly executed and hundred of mixed-raced citizen in the town killed . the bulk of the educated and professional class began leaving the country , and corruption became widespread . duvalier sought to create a personality cult , identifying himself with baron samedi , one of the loa , or spirit , of haitian vodou . despite the well-publicized abuse under his rule , duvalier 's firm anti-communism earned him the support of the american , who furnished the country with aid . </s> in <year> duvalier died , and he wa succeeded by his son jean-claude duvalier , nicknamed 'baby doc ' , who ruled until <year> . he largely continued his father 's policy , though curbed some of the worst excess in order to court international respectability . tourism , which had nosedived in papa doc 's time , again became a growing industry . however a the economy continued to decline baby doc 's grip on power began to weaken . haiti 's pig population wa slaughtered following an outbreak of swine fever in the late <year> , causing hardship to rural community who used them a an investment . the opposition became more vocal , bolstered by a visit to the country by pope john paul ii in <year> , who publicly lambasted the president . demonstration occurred in gonaves in <year> which then spread across the country ; under pressure from the united state , duvalier left the country for france in february <year> . </s> in total , roughly <number> to <number> haitian are estimated to have been killed during the reign of the duvalier . through the use of his intimidation tactic and execution , many intellectual haitian had fled , leaving the country with a massive brain-drain that it ha yet to recover from . </s> <section_title_start> post-duvalier era ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> following duvalier worried the elite , and in september of the following year he wa overthrown by the military , led by raoul cdras , in the <year> haitian coup d'tat . amidst the continuing turmoil many haitian attempted to flee the country . </s> in september <year> , the united state negotiated the departure of haiti 's military leader and the peaceful entry of <number> u troop under operation uphold democracy . this enabled the restoration of the democratically elected jean-bertrand aristide a president , who returned to haiti in october to complete his term . a part of the deal aristide had to implement free market reform in an attempt to improve the haitian economy , with mixed result , some source stating that these reform had a negative impact on native haitian industry . in november <year> , hurricane gordon ( <year> ) brushed haiti , dumping heavy rain and creating flash flooding that triggered mudslide . gordon killed an estimated <number> people , although some estimate go a high a <number> </s> <year> haitian general election were held in <year> which were won by ren prval , gaining <number> of the popular vote , albeit on a low turnout . aristide subsequently formed his by the opposition , then organized into the convergence dmocratique , over a dispute in the haitian legislative election , <year> . in subsequent year , there wa increasing violence between rival political faction and [ right abuse ] s. aristide spent year negotiating with the convergence dmocratique on new election , but the convergence 's inability to develop a sufficient electoral base made election unattractive . </s> in <year> <year> haitian coup d'tat an anti-aristide revolt began in northern haiti . the rebellion eventually reached the capital , and aristide wa forced into exile . the precise nature of the event are disputed ; some , including aristide and his bodyguard , franz gabriel , stated that he wa the victim of a `` new coup d'tat or modern kidnapping `` by u.s. force . mrs. aristide stated that the kidnapper wore u.s. special force uniform , but changed into civilian clothes upon boarding the aircraft that wa used to remove aristide from haiti . these charge were denied by the u government . a political violence and crime continued to grow , a united nation stabilisation mission in haiti united nation stabilisation mission ( minustah ) wa brought in to maintain order . however minustah proved controversial , a their at time heavy-handed approach to maintaining law and order and several instance of abuse , including the alleged sexual abuse of civilian , provoked resentment and distrust amongst ordinary haitian . boniface alexandre assumed interim authority until <year> , when ren prval wa re-elected president following haitian general election , <year> . </s> <section_title_start> post-aristide era ( <year> present ) <section_title_end> </s> amidst the continuing political chaos , a series of natural disaster hit haiti . in <year> hurricane jeanne # haiti skimmed the north coast , leaving <number> people dead in flooding and mudslide , mostly in the city of gonaves . in <year> haiti wa again struck by tropical storm ; tropical storm fay ( <year> ) , hurricane gustav , hurricane hanna and hurricane ike all produced heavy wind and rain , resulting in <number> death and about <number> in need of humanitarian aid . the state of affair produced by these storm wa intensified by already high food and fuel price that had caused a food crisis and political unrest in april <year> . </s> on <number> january <year> , at <number>:53pm local time , haiti wa struck by a moment magnitude scale-7.0 <year> haiti earthquake . this wa the country 's most severe earthquake in over <number> year . the earthquake wa reported to have left between <number> and <number> people dead and up to <number> million homeless . </s> the situation wa exacerbated by a subsequent massive haiti cholera outbreak that wa triggered when cholera-infected waste from a united nation peacekeeping station contaminated the country 's main river , the artibonite river . in <year> , it wa reported that roughly <number> haitian had died and nearly a million had been made ill. after year of denial the united nation apologized in <year> , but , they have refused to acknowledge fault , thus avoiding financial responsibility . </s> general presidential election . the run-off between michel martelly and mirlande manigat took place on <number> march <year> , and preliminary result , released on <number> april , named michel martelly the winner . in <year> both former dictator jean-claude duvalier and jean-bertrand aristide returned to haiti ; attempt to try duvalier for crime committed under his rule were shelved following his death . the victor , jovenel mose of the haitian tt kale party , wa subsequently sworn in a president in <year> . the <year> haitian protest are demonstration in city throughout haiti that began on <number> july <year> , in response to increased fuel price . over time these protest evolved into demand for the resignation of president mose . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> haiti form the western three-eighths of hispaniola , the second largest island in the greater antilles . at <number> sq km haiti is the third largest country in the caribbean behind cuba and the dominican republic , the latter sharing a dominican republichaiti border with haiti . the country ha a roughly horseshoe shape and because of this it ha a disproportionately long coastline , second in length ( ) behind cuba in the greater antilles . </s> haiti is the most mountainous nation in the caribbean , it terrain consists of mountain interspersed with small coastal plain and river valley . the climate is tropical , with some variation depending on altitude . the highest point is pic la selle , at . </s> the northern region consists of the massif du nord ( northern massif ) and the plaine du nord ( northern plain ) . the massif du nord is an extension of the cordillera central in the dominican republic . it begin at haiti 's eastern border , north of the guayamouc river , and extends to the northwest through the northern peninsula . the lowland of the plaine du nord lie along the northern border with the dominican republic , between the massif du nord and the north atlantic ocean . </s> the central region consists of two plain and two set of mountain range . the plateau central ( central plateau ) extends along both side of the guayamouc river , south of the massif du nord . it run from the southeast to the northwest . to the southwest of the plateau central are the montagnes noires , haiti , whose most northwestern part merges with the massif du nord . haiti 's most important valley in term of crop is the plaine de l'artibonite , which lie between the montagnes noires and the chane de matheux . this region support the country 's ( also hispaniola 's ) longest river , the artibonite river riviere l'artibonite , which begin in the western region of the dominican republic and continues for most of it length through central haiti , where it then empty into the gulf of gonve . also in this valley lie haiti 's second largest lake , lac de pligre , formed a a result of the construction of the pligre dam in the mid-1950s . </s> the southern region consists of the plaine du cul-de-sac ( the southeast ) and the mountainous southern peninsula ( also known a the tiburon peninsula , haiti ) . the plaine du cul-de-sac is a natural depression that harbor the country 's saline lake , such a trou caman and haiti 's largest lake , tang saumatre . the chane de la selle mountain range an extension of the southern mountain chain of the dominican republic ( the sierra de baoruco ) extends from the massif de la selle in the east to the massif de la hotte in the west . </s> haiti also includes several offshore island . the island of tortuga ( haiti ) ( le de la tortue ) is located off the coast of northern haiti . the arrondissements of haiti of gonve island is located on the island of the same name , in the gulf of gonve ; haiti 's largest island , gonve is moderately populated by rural villager . le vache ( cow island ) is located off the southwest coast ; also part of haiti are the cayemites , located in the gulf of gonve north of pestel , grand'anse . navassa island ( navassa island ) , located west of jrmie on the south west peninsula of haiti , is subject to an ongoing territorial dispute with the united state , who currently administer the island via the united state fish and wildlife service . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> haiti 's climate is tropical with some variation depending on altitude . port-au-prince range in january from an average minimum of to an average maximum of ; in july , from . the rainfall pattern is varied , with rain heavier in some of the lowland and the northern and eastern slope of the mountain . haiti 's dry season occurs from november to january . </s> port-au-prince receives an average annual rainfall of . there are two rainy season , apriljune and octobernovember . haiti is subject to periodic drought and flood , made more severe by deforestation . hurricane are a menace , and the country is also prone to drought , flooding and earthquake . </s> <section_title_start> geology <section_title_end> </s> there are thrust fault # blind thrust fault associated with the enriquillo-plantain garden fault zone enriquillo-plantain garden fault system over which haiti lie . after the earthquake of <year> , there wa no evidence of surface rupture and geologist ' finding were based on seismological , geological and ground deformation data . </s> the northern boundary of the fault is where the caribbean plate tectonic plate shift eastward by about per year in relation to the north american plate . the strike-slip fault system in the region ha two branch in haiti , the septentrional-oriente fault zone septentrional-oriente fault in the north and the enriquillo-plantain garden fault in the south . </s> a <year> earthquake hazard study , noted that the enriquillo-plantain garden fault zone could be at the end of it seismic cycle and concluded that a worst-case forecast would involve a <number> ; mw earthquake , similar in size to the <year> jamaica earthquake . a study team presented a hazard assessment of the enriquillo-plantain garden fault system to the <number> caribbean geologic conference in march <year> , noting the large strain . the team recommended `` high priority `` historical geologic rupture study , a the fault wa fully locked and had recorded few earthquake in the preceding <number> ; year . an article published in haiti 's le matin ( haiti ) newspaper in september <year> cited comment by geologist patrick charles to the effect that there wa a high risk of major seismic activity in port-au-prince ; and duly the magnitude <number> <year> haiti earthquake happened on this fault zone on <number> january <year> . </s> haiti also ha rare element such a gold , which can be found at the mont organis gold mining . </s> <section_title_start> environment <section_title_end> </s> the erosion released from the upper catchment and deforestation have caused periodic and severe flooding in haiti , a experienced , for example , on <number> september <year> . earlier in may that year , flood had killed over <number> people on haiti 's southern border with the dominican republic . </s> haiti 's forest covered <number> of the country a recently a <number> year ago , but that ha been halved to a current estimate of <number> tree cover , according to more recent environmental analysis . this estimate pose a stark difference from the erroneous figure of <number> which ha been oft-cited in discourse concerning the country 's environmental condition . haiti had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> scientist at the the earth institute # center for international earth science information network ( ciesin ) earth institute columbia university 's center for international earth science information network ( ciesin ) and the united nation environment programme are working on the haiti regenerative initiative an initiative aiming to reduce poverty and natural disaster vulnerability in haiti through ecosystem restoration and sustainable resource management . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> haiti is home to four ecoregions : hispaniolan moist forest , hispaniolan dry forest , hispaniolan pine forest , and greater antilles mangrove . </s> despite it small size , haiti 's mountainous terrain and resultant multiple climactic zone ha resulted in a wide variety of plant life . notable tree specie include the breadfruit tree , mango tree , acacia , mahogany , coconut palm , royal palm and cedrela odorata . the forest were formerly much more extensive , but have been subject to severe deforestation . </s> most mammal specie are not native , having being brought to the island since colonial time . however there are various native bat specie , a well a the endemic hispaniolan hutia and hispaniolan solenodon . various whale and dolphin specie can also be found off haiti 's coast . </s> there are over <number> specie of bird , <number> of these being endemic to hispaniola . notable endemic specie include the hispaniolan trogon , hispaniolan parakeet , grey-crowned tanager and the hispaniolan amazon . there are also several raptor ( bird ) specie , a well a pelican , ibis , hummingbird and duck . </s> reptile are common , with specie such a the rhinoceros iguana , chilabothrus fordii , american crocodile and gecko . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> the government of haiti is a semi-presidential system semi-presidential republic , a multiparty system wherein the president of haiti is head of state elected directly by popular election in haiti held every five year . the prime minister of haiti act a head of government and is appointed by the president , chosen from the majority party in the national assembly . executive power is exercised by the president and prime minister who together constitute the government . </s> legislative power is vested in both the government and the two chamber of the national assembly of haiti , the senate ( haiti ) ( snat ) and the chamber of deputy ( haiti ) ( chambre de dputs ) . the government is organized unitary state , thus the central government delegate power to the department without a constitutional need for consent . the current structure of haiti 's political system wa set forth in the constitution of haiti on <number> march <year> . </s> haitian politics have been contentious : since independence , haiti ha suffered <number> list of revolution and coup d'tat in haiti . haiti is the only country in the western hemisphere to undergo a successful haitian revolution ; however , a long history of oppression by dictator such a franois duvalier and his son jean-claude duvalier ha markedly affected the nation . since the end of the duvalier era haiti ha been transitioning to a democratic system . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> administratively , haiti is divided into ten department of haiti . the department are listed below , surveyed for of level of perceived domestic corruption . it is estimated that president jean-claude duvalier `` baby doc `` duvalier , his wife michle bennett , and their agent stole u $ <number> million from the country 's treasury between <year> and <year> . similarly , after the haitian army folded in <year> , the haitian national police ( hnp ) gained sole power of authority on the haitian million were stolen by former president jean-bertrand aristide . in march <year> , at the time of aristide 's kidnapping , a bbc article wrote that the bush administration state department stated that year . </s> conversely , according to the <year> united nation office on drug and crime ( unodc ) report , murder rate in haiti ( <number> per <number> ) are far below the regional average ( <number> per <number> ) ; le than that of jamaica ( <number> per <number> ) and nearly that of the dominican republic ( <number> per <number> ) , making it among the safer country in the region . in large part the haitian national police ( hnp ) ha been using innovative technology to crack down on crime . a notable bust in recent year led to the dismantlement of the largest kidnapping ring in the country with the use of an advanced software program developed by a united state military academy-trained haitian official that proved to be so effective that it ha led to it foreign adviser to make inquiry . </s> in <year> , the new york city police department ( nypd ) sent a team of veteran officer to haiti to assist in the rebuilding of it police force with special training in investigative technique , the prison ha a capacity of <number> detention ( imprisonment ) but the penitentiary wa obliged to keep <number> detainee , a <number> occupancy level . this lead to severe consequence for the inmate . </s> one cell could hold up to <number> inmate which wa originally designed for only <number> , therefore creating tight and uncomfortable living condition . the inmate are forced to create makeshift [ from the wall and ceiling . the men are on a <number>/ <number> hour lock up in the cell so the risk of disease is very high . unable to receive sufficient fund from the government a haiti endures severe natural disaster which take up their attention and resource , such a the <year> earthquake , ha caused deadly case of malnutrition ] , combined with the tight living condition , increase the risk of infectious disease such a [ [ tuberculosis which ha led to <number> death in january <year> alone at the port-au-prince penitentiary . </s> haitian law state that once arrested , there are <number> detainee who are in prolonged detained trial detention . therefore , <number> are not convicted . </s> unless family are able to provide the necessary fund for inmate to appear malnutrition-related ailment such a thiamine deficiency and anemia . prisoner too weak are crammed in the penitentiary infirmary . </s> in confined living space for <year> hour a day , inmate are not provided with latrine and are forced to defecation into plastic bag and leave them outside their cell . these condition were considered inhumane by the inter-american court of human right in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> haiti ha a predominantly free market economy , with a gdp of $ <number> billion and per caput gdp of $ <number> ( <year> estimate ) . the country us the haitian gourde a it currency . despite it tourism industry , haiti is one of the poorest country in the america , with poverty , corruption , political instability , poor infrastructure , lack of health care and lack of education cited a the main cause . unemployment is high and many haitian seek to emigrate . trade declined dramatically after the <year> haiti earthquake and subsequent <year> haiti cholera outbreak , with the country 's gross domestic product # cross-border comparison falling by <number> ( from u $ <number> billion to u $ <number> billion ) . haiti ranked restored and the brazilian army led a united nation stabilization mission in haiti peacekeeping operation . after almost four year of recession , the economy grew by <number> in <year> . in september <year> , haiti met the condition set out by the imf and world bank 's heavily indebted poor country program to qualify for cancellation of it external debt . </s> more than <number> percent of the government 's budget come from an agreement with petrocaribe , a venezuela-led oil alliance . </s> <section_title_start> foreign aid <section_title_end> </s> haiti received more than u $ <number>
