<year> ) . haiti had a trade deficit of u $ <number> billion in <year> , or <number> of gdp . </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , the city of jacmel wa the first area in the caribbean to have electricity and wa subsequently dubbed the city of light . </s> today , haiti relies heavily on an oil alliance with petrocaribe for much of it energy requirement . in recent year , hydroelectric , solar and wind energy have been explored a possible sustainable energy source . </s> a of <year> , among all the country in the america , haiti is producing the least amount of energy . le than a quarter of the country ha electric coverage . most region of haiti that do have energy are powered by generator . these generator are often expensive and produce a lot of pollution . the area that do get electricity experience power cut on a daily basis , and some area are limited to <number> hour of electricity a day . electricity is provided by a small number of independent company : sogener , e-power , and haytrac . there is no national electricity grid within the country . the most common source of energy used is wood , along with charcoal . in haiti , about <number> million metric ton of wood product are consumed yearly . like charcoal and wood , petroleum is also an important source of energy for haiti . since haiti can not produce it own fuel , all fuel is imported . yearly , around <number> ton of oil is imported into the country . </s> on <number> october <year> , evenson calixte , the general director of energy regulation ( anarse ) announced the <number> hour electricity project . to meet this objective , <number> megawatt need to installed in port-au-prince alone , with an additional <number> megawatt needed in all other region in the country . presently only <number> of the population ha access to electricity ; moreover , the national energy agency l'lectricit d'hati ( ed ' h ) is only able to meet <number> of overall electricity demand said fritz caillot , the minister of public work , transportation and communication ( travaux public , transport et communication ( tptc ) ) . </s> <section_title_start> personal income <section_title_end> </s> the world factbook report a shortage of skilled labor , widespread unemployment and underemployment , saying `` more than two-thirds of the labor force do not have formal job . `` it is also often stated that three-quarters of the population life on u $ <number> or le per day . </s> the cia world factbook also state that `` remittance are the primary source of foreign exchange , equaling one-fifth ( <number> ) of gdp and representing more than five time the earnings from export in <year> `` . the world bank estimate that over <number> of college graduate from haiti were living abroad in <year> . </s> occasionally , family who are unable to care for child financially may send them to live with a wealthier family a a restavek , or [ servant ] . in return the family are supposed to ensure that the child is educated and provided with food and shelter , however the system is open to abuse and ha proved controversial , with some likening it to child slavery . </s> <section_title_start> real estate <section_title_end> </s> in rural area , people often live in wooden hut with corrugated iron roof . outhouse are located in back of the hut . in port-au-prince , colorful shantytown surround the central city and go up the mountainside . </s> the middle and upper class live in suburb , or in the central part of the bigger city in apartment , where there is urban planning . many of the house they live in are like miniature fortress , located behind wall embedded with metal spike , barbed wire , broken glass , and sometimes all three . the gate to these house are barred at night , the house is locked ; guard dog patrol the yard . these house are often self-sufficient a well . the house have backup generator , because the electrical grid in haiti is unreliable . some even have rooftop reservoir for water , a the water supply is also unreliable . </s> <section_title_start> agriculture <section_title_end> </s> haiti is the world 's leading producer of chrysopogon zizanioides , a root plant used to make luxury perfume , essential oil and fragrance , providing for half the world 's supply . roughly <year> % of haitian work in the agricultural sector . haiti relies upon import for half it food need and <number> of it rice . </s> haiti export crop such a mango , cocoa bean , coffee , papaya , mahogany nut , spinach , and watercress . agricultural product comprise <number> of all export . in addition , local agricultural product include maize , bean , cassava , sweet potato , peanut , pistachio , banana , millet , pigeon pea , sugarcane , rice , sorghum , and wood . </s> <section_title_start> currency <section_title_end> </s> the haitian gourde ( htg ) is the national currency . the `` haitian gourde `` equates to <number> gourde ( goud ) , which is a fixed exchange rate that exists in concept only , but are commonly used a informal price . the vast majority of the business sector and individual in haiti will also accept u dollar , though at the outdoor market gourde may be preferred . local may refer to the usd a `` dollar amricain `` ( dola ameriken ) or `` dollar u `` ( pronounced oo-es ) . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> the tourism market in haiti is undeveloped and the government is heavily promoting this sector . haiti ha many of the feature that attract tourist to other caribbean destination , such a white sand beach , mountainous scenery and a year-round warm climate , however the country 's poor image overseas , at time exaggerated , ha hampered the development of this sector . in <year> , the country received <number> tourist ( mostly from cruise ship ) , and the industry generated u $ <number> million in <year> . </s> several hotel were opened in <year> , including an upscale best western # differentiation , a five-star royal oasis hotel by occidental hotel and resort in ption-ville , a four-star marriott international in the turgeau area of port-au-prince and other new hotel development in port-au-prince , le cayes , cap-hatien and jacmel . </s> the haitian carnival ha been one of the most popular carnival in the caribbean . in <year> , the government decided to stage the event in a different city outside port-au-prince every year in an attempt to decentralize the country . the national carnival usually held in one of the country 's largest city ( i.e . , port-au-prince , cap-hatien or le cayes ) follows the also very popular jacmel carnival , which take place a week earlier in february or march . </s> <section_title_start> caracol industrial park <section_title_end> </s> on <number> october <year> , haitian president michel martelly , u secretary of state hillary clinton , bill clinton , richard branson , ben stiller and sean penn inaugurated the caracol industrial park , the largest in the caribbean . costing u $ <number> million , the project , which includes a <number>-megawatt power plant , a water-treatment plant and worker housing , is intended to transform the northern part of the country by creating <number> job . </s> the park is part of a `` master plan `` for haiti 's north and north-east department , including the expansion of the cap-hatien international airport to accommodate large international flight , the construction of an international seaport in fort-libert and the opening of the $ <number> million roi henri christophe campus of a new university in limonade ( near cap-hatien ) on <number> january <year> . </s> south korean clothing manufacturer sae-a trading co. ltd , one of the park 's main tenant , ha created <number> permanent job out of the <number> projected and ha built <number> house in the surrounding area for it worker . the industrial park ultimately ha the potential to create a many a <number> job once fully developed . </s> <section_title_start> infrastructure <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> transportation <section_title_end> </s> haiti ha two main highway that run from one end of the country to the other . the northern highway , route nationale no . <number> ( national highway one ) , originates in port-au-prince , winding through the coastal town of montrouis and gonaves , before reaching it terminus at the northern port cap-hatien . the southern highway , route nationale no . <number> , link port-au-prince with le cayes via logne and petit-gove . the state of haiti 's road are generally poor , many being potholed and becoming impassable in rough weather . </s> according to the washington post , `` official from the u.s. army corp of engineer said saturday [ <number> january <year> ] that they assessed the damage from the [ <number> january ] quake in port-au-prince , haiti , and found that many of the road are n't any worse than they were before because they 've always been in poor condition . `` </s> the port at port-au-prince , port international de port-au-prince , ha more registered shipping than any of the other dozen port in the country . the port 's facility include crane ( machine ) , large berth ( mooring ) , and warehouse , but these facility are not in good condition . the port is underused , possibly due to the substantially high port fee . the port of saint-marc is currently the preferred port of entry for consumer good coming into haiti . reason for this may include it location away from volatile and traffic congestion port-au-prince , a well a it central location relative to numerous haitian city . </s> in the past , haiti used rail transport , however the rail infrastructure wa poorly maintained when in use and cost of rehabilitation is beyond the mean of the haitian economy . in <year> the regional development council of the dominican republic proposed a `` trans-hispaniola `` railway between both country . </s> <section_title_start> airports <section_title_end> </s> toussaint louverture international airport , located north/north east of port-au-prince proper in the commune of tabarre , is the primary transportation hub regarding entry and exit into the country . it ha haiti 's main jetway , and along with cap-hatien international airport located near the northern city of cap-hatien , handle the vast majority of the country 's international flight . city such a jacmel , jrmie , le cayes , and port-de-paix have smaller , le accessible airport that are serviced by regional airline and private aircraft . such company include : caribintair ( defunct ) , sunrise airway and tortug ' air ( defunct ) . </s> in <year> , plan for the development of an international airport on le -- vache were introduced by the prime minister . </s> <section_title_start> bus service <section_title_end> </s> tap tap bus are colorfully painted bus or pick-up truck that serve a share taxi . the `` tap tap `` name come from the sound of passenger tapping on the metal bus body to indicate they want off . these vehicle for hire are often privately owned and extensively decorated . they follow fixed route , do not leave until filled with passenger , and rider can usually disembark at any point . the decoration are a typically haitian form of art . </s> in august <year> , the first coach bus prototype wa made in haiti . </s> <section_title_start> communications <section_title_end> </s> in haiti , communication include the radio , television , fixed and mobile telephone , and the internet . haiti ranked last among north american country in the world economic forum 's network readiness index ( nri ) an indicator for determining the development level of a country 's information and communication technology . haiti ranked number <number> out of <number> overall in the <year> nri ranking , down from <number> in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> water supply and sanitation <section_title_end> </s> haiti face key challenge in the water supply and sanitation </s> sector : </s> notably , access to public service is very low , their quality is inadequate and public institution remain very weak despite foreign aid and the government 's declared intent to strengthen the sector 's institution . foreign and haitian ngo play an important role in the sector , especially in rural and urban slum area . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> haiti 's population is about <number> ( july <year> est . ) with half of the population younger than age <number> . in <year> , the first formal census gave a total population of <number> million . haiti average approximately <number> people per square kilometer ( ~900 per sq mi . ) , with it population concentrated most heavily in urban area , coastal plain , and valley . </s> most haitian are descendant of former black ethnic group of africa slave , including free people of color who are multiracial mixed-race . the remainder are of white haitian or arab haitian , the descendant of settler ( colonial remnant and contemporary immigration during world war i and world war ii ) . haitian of east asian descent or marabou ( ethnicity ) origin number approximately more than <number> </s> million of haitian live abroad in the haitian american , dominican republic , haitian cuban , canada ( primarily montreal ) , bahamas , france , french antilles , the turk and caicos , jamaica , puerto rico , venezuela , brazil , suriname and french guiana . there are an estimated <number> haitian in the united state , <number> in the dominican republic , <number> in cuba , <number> in canada , <number> in france , and up to <number> in the bahamas . there are also smaller haitian community in many other country , including chile , switzerland , japan and australia . </s> in <year> , the life expectancy at birth wa <number> year . </s> <section_title_start> population genetics <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> autosomal dna <section_title_end> </s> the gene pool of haiti is about <number> sub-saharan african , <number> ethnic group in europe , with the rest showing some trace of east asian gene ; according to a <year> autosomal genealogical dna testing . </s> <section_title_start> y-chromosome and mitochondrial dna <section_title_end> </s> a <year> genetic study on haitian and jamaican human y-chromosome dna haplogroup y-chromosomal ancestry ha revealed that both population `` exhibit a predominantly y-dna haplogroups in population of sub-saharan africa sub-saharan paternal component , with haplogroups haplogroup a ( y-dna ) a1b-v152 , haplogroup a ( y-dna ) a3-m32 , haplogroup b ( y-dna ) b2-m182 , haplogroup e ( y-dna ) e1a-m33 , haplogroup e ( y-dna ) e1b1a-m2 , haplogroup e ( y-dna ) e2b-m98 , and haplogroup r1b ( y-dna ) # r1b1c ( r-v88 ) r1b2-v88 `` comprising ( <number> ) of the haitian and ( <number> ) of jamaican paternal gene pool . y-chromosomes indicative of y-dna haplogroups in population of europe `` ( i.e . , haplogroups haplogroup g-m201 g2a * -p15 , haplogroup i-m170 i-m258 , haplogroup r1b ( y-dna ) # r1b1a2 ( r-m269 ) r1b1b-m269 , and haplogroup t-m184 t-m184 ) were detected at commensurate level in haiti ( <number> ) and jamaica ( <number> ) `` . </s> while y-haplogroups indicative of chinese o-m175 ( <number> ) and indian h-m69 ( <number> ) and l-m20 ( <number> ) ancestry were found at significant level in jamaica , arab haitian y-haplogroups were found in haiti . </s> <section_title_start> duffy antigens <section_title_end> </s> according to a <year> study examining the frequency of the duffy antigen system receptor for chemokines ( darc ( gene ) ) single-nucleotide polymorphism ( snp ) , ( <number> ) of haitian woman sampled exhibited the cc genotype ( absent among woman of european ancestry ) at level comparable to u african-american ( <number> ) , but more than jamaican female ( <number> ) . </s> <section_title_start> racial discrimination <section_title_end> </s> under colonial rule , mulatto were generally privileged above the black majority , though they possessed fewer right than the white population . following the country 's independence , they became the nation 's social elite . numerous leader throughout haiti 's history have been mulatto . during this time , the slave and the affranchis were given limited opportunity toward education , income , and occupation , but even after gaining independence , the social structure remains a legacy today a the disparity between the upper and lower class have not been reformed significantly since the colonial day . comprising <number> of the nation 's population , mulatto have retained their preeminence , evident in the political , economic , social and cultural hierarchy in haiti . a a result , the elite class today consists of a small group of influential people who are generally light in color and continue to establish themselves in high , prestigious position . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> the <year> cia factbook reported that around <number> of haitian profess to being roman catholicism in haiti while protestantism in haiti made up about <number> of the population ( baptist <number> , pentecostal <number> , seventh-day adventist <number> , methodist <number> , other <number> ) . other source put the protestant population higher than this , suggesting that it might have formed one-third of the population in <year> . like other country in latin america , haiti ha witnessed a general protestant expansion , which is largely evangelical protestant and pentecostal in nature . haitian cardinal ( catholicism ) chibly langlois is president of the national bishop conference of the catholic church . </s> haitian vodou , a religion with west african root similar to those of cuba and brazil , originated during colonial time in which slave were obliged to disguise their loa , or spirit , a catholic church saint , an element of a process called syncretism and is still practiced by some haitian today . due to the religious syncretism between catholicism and vodou , it is difficult to estimate the number of vodouists in haiti . the religion ha historically been persecuted and misrepresented in popular medium , however in <year> the government recognized the faith a an official religion of the nation . </s> minority religion in haiti include islam in haiti , bah ' faith in haiti bah ' faith , history of the jew in haiti , and buddhism . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> the two official language of haiti are french language and haitian creole . french is the principal written and administratively authorized language ( a well a the main language of the press ) and is spoken by <number> of haitian . it is spoken by all educated haitian , is the medium of instruction in most school , and is used in the business sector . it is also used in ceremonial event such a wedding , graduation and church mass . haiti is one of two independent nation in the america ( along with canada ) to designate french a an official language ; the other french-speaking area are all french overseas department and territory department of france , or overseas collectivity , of france , such a french guiana . </s> haitian creole , which ha recently undergone a standardization , is spoken by virtually the entire population of haiti . haitian creole is one of the french-based creole language . it vocabulary is <number> derived from french , but it grammar resembles that of some west african language . it also ha influence from taino , spanish , and portuguese . haitian creole is related to the other french-based creole language , but most closely to the antillean creole and louisiana creole french variant . </s> <section_title_start> emigration <section_title_end> </s> there is a large haitian diaspora community , predominantly based in the u and canada , france , and the wealthier caribbean island . </s> emigrant from haiti have constituted a segment of american and canadian society since before haitian revolution in <year> . many influential early american settler and black freeman , including jean baptiste point du sable and w. e. b . du bois , were of haitian origin . </s> jean baptiste point du sable , an immigrant from saint-domingue ( now the republic of haiti ) , founded the first nonindigenous settlement in what is now chicago , illinois , the third largest city in the united state . the state of illinois and city of chicago declared du sable the founder of chicago on <number> october <year> . </s> <section_title_start> largest cities <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> haiti ha a rich and unique cultural identity , consisting of a blend of traditional french and african custom , mixed with sizeable contribution from the spanish and indigenous tano culture . haiti 's culture is greatly reflected in it painting , music , and literature . gallery and museum in the united state and france have exhibited the work of the better-known artist to have come out of haiti . </s> <section_title_start> art <section_title_end> </s> haitian art is haitian art , particularly through it painting and sculpture . brilliant color , nave art perspective , and sly humor characterize haitian art . frequent subject in haitian art include big , delectable food , lush landscape , market activity , jungle animal , ritual , dance , and god . a a result of a deep history and strong african tie , symbol take on great meaning within haitian society . for example , a rooster often represents aristide and the red and blue color of the haitian flag often represent his lavalas party . many artist cluster in 'schools ' of painting , such a the cap-hatien school , which feature depiction of daily life in the city , the jacmel school , which reflects the steep mountain and bay of that coastal town , or the saint-soleil school , which is characterised by abstracted human form and is heavily influenced by vodou symbolism . </s> in the <year> the indigniste movement gained international acclaim , with it expressionist painting inspired by haiti 's culture and african root . notable painter of this movement include hector hyppolite , philom oban and prfte duffaut . some notable artist of more recent time include edouard duval-carri , frantz zphirin , leroy exil , prosper pierre louis and louisiane saint fleurant . sculpture is also practised in haiti ; noted artist in this form include george liautaud and serge jolimeau . </s> <section_title_start> music and dance <section_title_end> </s> haitian music combine a wide range of influence drawn from the many people who have settled here . it reflects french , african and spanish element and others who have inhabited the island of hispaniola , and minor native taino influence . style of music unique to the nation of haiti include music derived from haitian vodou ceremonial tradition , rara parading music , twoubadou ballad , mini-jazz rock band , rasin movement , haitian hip hop kreyl , mringue , and compas . youth attend party at nightclub called nightlife , ( pronounced `` deece-ko `` ) , and attend bal . this term is the french word for ball , a in a formal dance . </s> compas ( konpa ) ( also known a compas direct in french language , or konpa dirk in haitian creole language ) is a complex , ever-changing music that arose from african rhythm and european ballroom dancing , mixed with haiti 's bourgeois culture . it is a refined music , with mringue a it basic rhythm . haiti had no recorded music until <year> when jazz guignard wa recorded non-commercially . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> haiti ha always been a literary nation that ha produced poetry , novel , and play of international recognition . the saint domingue established the french language a the venue of culture and prestige , and since then it ha dominated the literary circle and the literary production . however , since the <number> century there ha been a sustained effort to write in haitian creole . the recognition of creole a an official language ha led to an expansion of novel , poem , and play in creole . in <year> , franketienne wa the first to break with the french tradition in fiction with the publication of dezafi , the first novel written entirely in haitian creole ; the work offer a poetic picture of haitian life . other well known haitian author include jean price-mars , jacques roumain , marie vieux-chauvet , pierre clitandre , ren depestre , edwidge danticat , lyonel trouillot and dany laferrire . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> haiti ha a small though growing cinema industry . well-known director working primarily in documentary film-making include raoul peck and arnold antonin . director producing fictional film include patricia benoit ( director ) , wilkenson bruna and richard senecal . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> haiti is famous for it creole cuisine ( which related to cajun cuisine ) , and it soup joumou . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> monument include the sans-souci palace and the citadelle laferrire , inscribed a a world heritage site in <year> . situated in the northern massif du nord , in one of haiti 's national park , the structure date from the early <number> century . the building were among the first built after haiti 's independence from france . </s> the citadelle laferrire , is the largest fortress in the america , is located in northern haiti . it wa built between <year> and <year> and is today referred to by some haitian a the eighth wonder of the world . </s> the institut de sauvegarde du patrimoine national ha preserved <number> historical monument and the historic center of cap-hatien . </s> jacmel , a colonial city that wa tentatively accepted a a world heritage site , wa extensively damaged by the <year> haiti earthquake . </s> <section_title_start> museums <section_title_end> </s> the anchor of christopher columbus 's largest ship , the santa mara ( ship ) now rest in the muse du panthon national hatien ( mupanah ) , in port-au-prince , haiti . </s> <section_title_start> folklore and mythology <section_title_end> </s> haiti is known for it folklore tradition . much of this is rooted in haitian vodou tradition . belief in zombie is also common . other folkloric creature include the soucouyant . </s> <section_title_start> national holiday and festivals <section_title_end> </s> the most festive time of the year in haiti is during carnival ( referred to a kanaval in haitian creole or mardi gras ) in february . there is music , parade float , and dancing and singing in the street . carnival week is traditionally a time of all-night party . </s> rara is a festival celebrated before easter . the festival ha generated a style of carnival music . </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> association football ( soccer ) is the most popular sport in haiti with hundred of small football club competing at the local level . basketball is growing in popularity . stade sylvio cator is the multi-purpose stadium in port-au-prince , where it is currently used mostly for association football match that fit a capacity of <number> people . in <year> fifa world cup , the haiti national football team were only the second caribbean team to make the fifa world cup ( after cuba 's entry in <year> ) . they lost in the opening qualifying stage against three of the pre-tournament favorite ; italy national football team , poland national football team , and argentina national football team . the national team won the <year> caribbean nation cup . </s> haiti ha participated in the haiti at the olympics since the year <year> and won a number of medal . haitian footballer joe gaetjens played for the united state men 's national soccer team in the <year> fifa world cup , scoring the winning goal in the <number> upset of england national football team . </s> <section_title_start> notable native and residents hip-hop recording artist </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> the educational system of haiti is based on the education in france . higher education , under the responsibility of the ministry of education , is provided by university and other public and private institution . </s> more than <number> of primary school are privately managed by nongovernmental organization , church , community , and for-profit operator , with minimal government oversight . according to the <year> millennium development goal ( mdg ) report , haiti ha steadily boosted net enrollment rate in primary education from <number> in <year> to <number> in <year> , achieving equal participation of boy and girl in education . charity organization , including food for the poor and haitian health foundation , are building school for child and providing necessary school supply . </s> according to cia <year> world factbook , haiti 's literacy rate is now <number> ( est . <year> ) . </s> the january <year> earthquake , wa a major setback for education reform in haiti a it diverted limited resource to survival . </s> many reformer have advocated the creation of a free , public and universal education system for all primary school-age student in haiti . the inter-american development bank estimate that the government will need at least u $ <number> billion to create an adequately funded system . </s> upon successful graduation of secondary school , student may continue into [ education ] . the higher education school in haiti include the university of haiti . there are also list of medical school in the caribbean and legal education offered at both the university of haiti and abroad . presently , brown university is cooperating with l'hpital saint-damien in haiti to coordinate a pediatrics curriculum . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> in the past , child 's vaccination rate have been low , <number> of the child in haiti under the age of <number> were vaccine , compared to rate of childhood vaccination in other country in the <year> % range . recently there have been mass vaccination campaign claiming to vaccinate a many a <number> of a target population against specific disease ( measles and rubella in this case ) . most people have no transportation or access to list of hospital in haiti . </s> the world health organization cite diarrheal disease , hiv/aids , meningitis , and respiratory infection a common cause of death in haiti . ninety percent of haiti 's child suffer from waterborne disease and intestinal parasite . hiv infection is found in <number> of haiti 's population ( est . <year> ) . the incidence of tuberculosis ( tb ) in haiti is more than ten time a high a in the rest of latin america . approximately <number> haitian fall ill with malaria each year . </s> most people living in haiti are at high risk for major infectious disease . food or waterborne disease water-borne disease include bacterial and protozoal diarrhea , typhoid fever and [ a and e ; common vector ( epidemiology ) vector ] -borne disease are [ [ dengue fever and malaria ; water-contact disease include leptospirosis . roughly <number> of haitian household lack running water . unsafe water , along with inadequate housing and unsanitary living condition , contributes to the high incidence of infectious disease . there is a chronic shortage of health care personnel and hospital lack resource , a situation that became readily apparent after the january <year> earthquake . the infant mortality rate in haiti in <year> wa <number> death per <number> live birth , compared to a rate of <number> per <number> in other country . </s> after the <year> earthquake , partner in health founded the hpital universitaire de mirebalais , the largest solar power solar-powered hospital in the world . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of haiti-related <article_start> </s> hungary ( magyarorszg ) is a country in central europe . spanning in the pannonian basin , it border slovakia to the north , ukraine to the northeast , romania to the east and southeast , serbia to the south , croatia and slovenia to the southwest , and austria to the west . with about <number> ; million inhabitant , hungary is a member state of the european union medium-sized member state of the european union . the language of hungary is hungarian language , which is the most widely spoken uralic language in the world , and among the few non-indo-european language to be widely spoken in europe . hungary 's capital and list of city and town of hungary is budapest ; other major urban area include debrecen , szeged , miskolc , pc , and gyr . </s> the territory of present hungary wa for century inhabited by a succession of people , including celt , ancient rome , germanic people , hun , west slav and the avars ( carpathians ) . the foundation of the hungarian state were established in the late ninth century ad by the hungarian grand prince rpd following the hungarian conquest of the carpathian basin . his great-grandson stephen i of hungary ascended the throne in <year> , converting his realm to a kingdom of hungary . by the <number> century , hungary became a regional power , reaching it kingdom of hungary ( <year> <number> ) . following the battle of mohcs in <year> , hungary wa partially ottoman hungary ( <year> <number> ) . the country came under habsburg monarchy entirely at the turn of the <number> century , and later compromise of <year> austrian empire to form the austrohungarian empire , a major european power . </s> the austro-hungarian empire collapsed after world war i , and the subsequent treaty of trianon established hungary 's current border , resulting in the loss of <number> of it territory , <number> of it population , and hungarian diaspora <number> of ethnic hungarian . following the tumultuous hungary between the world war , hungary joined the axis power in world war ii , suffering significant damage and casualty . postwar hungary became a satellite state of the soviet union , which contributed to the establishment of a hungarian people 's republic ( <year> <number> ) . following the failed hungarian revolution of <year> against the soviet-backed government , hungary became a goulash communism , though still repressive , member of the eastern bloc . the seminal end of communism in hungary ( <year> ) # attitude toward the warsaw pact opening of the previously-restricted border with austria in <year> accelerated the collapse of the eastern bloc , and collapse of the soviet government . on <number> october <year> , hungary became a democracy parliamentary republic . </s> hungary is considered a developed country with a world bank high-income economy high-income economy and a very high human development index . hungarian enjoy healthcare in hungary and tuition-free list of university in hungary . hungary 's culture of hungary history includes significant contribution to it hungarian art , music of hungary , hungarian literature , hungary at the olympics , science and technology in hungary.refers to the country a `` widely considered `` to be a `` home of music `` . it is the world tourism ranking thirteenth-most popular tourism in hungary in europe , drawing <number> ; million international tourist in <year> , owing to attraction such a the largest hot spring cave system in the world , lake hvz , the lake balaton and the hortobgy national park . </s> hungary 's cultural , historical , and academic prominence classify it a a middle power in global affair . hungary joined the european union in <year> and ha been part of the schengen area since <year> . it is a member of numerous international organisation , including the united nation , nato , wto , world bank , international investment bank , the asian infrastructure investment bank , the council of europe , and the visegrd group . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the `` h `` in the name of hungary ( and latin hungaria ) is most likely due to founded historical association with the hun , who had settled hungary prior to the pannonian avars . the rest of the word come from the latinized form of medieval greek oungroi ( ) . the greek name wa borrowed from old church slavonic grin , in turn borrowed from oghur language oghur-turkic onogurs ( 'ten [ tribe of the ] ogurs ' ) . onogur wa the collective name for the tribe who later joined the bulgars tribal confederacy that ruled the eastern part of hungary after the avars . </s> the hungarian endonym is magyarorszg , composed of magyar ( 'hungarian ' ) and orszg ( 'country ' ) . the name `` magyar `` , which refers to the people of the country , more accurately reflects the name of the country in some other language such a turkish language , persian language and other language a magyaristan or land of magyar or similar . the word magyar is taken from the name of one of the seven major semi-nomadic hungarian tribe , magyeri . the first element magy is likely from proto-ugric * m- 'man , person ' , also found in the name of the mansi people ( m , mai , m ) . the second element eri , 'man , men , lineage ' , survives in hungarian frj 'husband ' , and is cognate with mari language erge 'son ' , finnish language archaic yrk 'young man ' . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> before <number> <section_title_end> </s> the roman empire conquered the territory west of the danube river between <number> and <number> ; bc . from <number> ; bc to the end of the <number> century ad , pannonia , the western part of the carpathian basin , wa part of the roman empire . after the western roman empire collapsed in the <number> century ad under the stress of the migration of germanic people and carpus ( people ) pressure , the migration period continued to bring many invader into central europe , beginning with the hun ( c. <year> <number> ) . the most powerful ruler of the hunnic empire wa attila the hun ( <year> <number> ) who later became a central figure in hungarian mythology . after the disintegration of the hunnic empire , the gepids , an eastern germanic tribe , who had been vassalized by the hun , established their own kingdom in the carpathian basin . other group which reached the carpathian basin in the migration period were the goth , vandal , lombard , and early slav . in the <number>s , the pannonian avars founded the avar khaganate , a state that maintained supremacy in the region for more than two century . the frank under charlemagne defeated the avars in a series of campaign during the <number>s . by the mid-9th century , the pannonian slav # principality , also known a lower pannonia , wa established west of the danube river a part of the frankish march of pannonia . the first bulgarian empire conquered the land east of the danube river and took over rule of the local slavic tribe and remnant of the avars . </s> <section_title_start> medieval hungary ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> the freshly unified magyar tribe led by rpd ( by tradition a descendant of attila ) , settled in the carpathian basin starting in <number> . according to the finno-ugric language finno-ugrian theory , they originated from an ancient uralic languages-speaking population that formerly inhabited the forested area between the volga river and the ural mountain . </s> a a federation of united tribe , hungarian conquest of the carpathian basin , some <number> year after the division of the carolingian empire at the treaty of verdun in <number> , before the unification of the kingdom of england anglo-saxon kingdom . initially , the rising principality of hungary ( `` western tourkia `` in medieval greek source ) wa a state created by a semi-nomadic people . it accomplished an enormous transformation into a christian realm during the <number> century . </s> this state wa well-functioning and the nation 's military power allowed the hungarian to conduct successful hungarian invasion of europe , from constantinople to a far a today 's spain . the hungarian defeated no fewer than hungarian invasion of europe between <number> and <number> . a later
