hungarian language is the official language and predominant spoken language in hungary . hungarian is the language of europe with around <number> ; million native speaker and it is one of <number> official and working language of the european union . outside hungary it is also spoken by community of hungarian people in neighbouring country and by hungarian diaspora community worldwide . according to the <year> census , <number> people ( <number> ) speak hungarian in hungary , of whom <number> people ( <number> ) speak it a a first language , while <number> people ( <number> ) speak it a a second language . english ( <number> speaker , <number> ) , and german ( <number> speaker , <number> ) are the most widely spoken foreign language , while there are several recognised minority language in hungary ( armenian language , bulgarian language , croatian language , german language , greek language , romanian language , romani language , rusyn language , serbian language , slovak language , slovenian language , and ukrainian language ) . </s> hungarian ( magyar ) is a member of the uralic language , unrelated to any neighbouring language and distantly related to finnish language and estonian language . it is the largest of the uralic language in term of the number of speaker and the only one spoken in central europe . there are sizeable population of hungarian speaker in romania , the czech and slovak republic , the former yugoslavia , ukraine , israel , and the u.s . smaller group of hungarian speaker live in canada , slovenia , and austria , but also in australia , brazil , argentina , mexico , venezuela and chile . standard hungarian is based on the variety spoken in the capital of budapest , although use of the standard dialect is enforced , hungarian ha a number of urban and rural dialect . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> hungary is a historically christianity country . hungarian historiography identifies the foundation of the hungarian state with stephen i of hungary stephen i 's baptism and coronation with the szentkorona in a.d. <year> . stephen promulgated roman catholicism a the state religion , and his successor were traditionally known a the apostolic king . the catholic church in hungary remained strong through the century , and the archbishop of esztergom wa granted extraordinary temporal privilege a prince-primate ( hercegprms ) of hungary . </s> although contemporary hungary ha no official religion and recognises freedom of religion a a fundamental right , the hungarian constitution `` recognizes christianity 's nation-building role `` in it preamble and in article vii affirms that `` the state may cooperate with the church for community goal . `` </s> the <year> census showed that the majority of hungarian were christian ( <number> ) , with catholic church in hungary ( katolikusok ) ( <number> ) and hungarian reformed calvinist ( reformtusok ) ( <number> ) making up the bulk of these alongside lutheran ( evanglikusok ) ( <number> ) , greek catholic ( <number> ) , and other christian ( <number> ) . jewish ( <number> ) , buddhist ( <number> ) and muslim ( <number> ) community are in the minority . <number> of the population did not declare a religious affiliation while <number> declared themselves explicitly irreligious , another <number> atheist . </s> during the initial stage of the protestant reformation , most hungarian adopted first lutheranism and then calvinism in the form of the hungarian reformed church . in the second half of the <number> century , the jesuit led a counterreformation campaign and the population once again became predominantly catholic . this campaign wa only partially successful , however , and the ( mainly reformed ) hungarian nobility were able to secure freedom of worship for christian . in practice this meant cuius regio , eius religio ; thus , most individual locality in hungary are still identifiable a historically catholic , lutheran , or reformed . the country 's eastern region , especially around debrecen ( the `` calvinist rome `` ) , remain almost completely reformed , a trait they share with historically contiguous hungarian in romania across the romanian border . </s> eastern orthodox church in hungary is associated with the country 's ethnic minority : armenian , bulgarian , greek , romanian , rusyns , ukrainian , and serb . </s> historically , hungary wa home to a history of the jew in hungary with a pre-world war ii population of more than <number> , but it is estimated that just over <number> hungarian jew were killed between <year> and <year> during the holocaust in hungary . between <number> may and <number> july <year> alone , over <number> jew were deported on <number> train , most of them to auschwitz , where about <number> percent were gassed on arrival . some jew were able to escape , but most were either deported to concentration camp , where they were killed , or murdered in hungary by arrow cross party member . from over <number> jew living within hungary 's border in <year> <number> , about <number> are thought to have survived . there are about <number> jew in hungary today . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> education in hungary is predominantly public , run by the minister of education ( hungary ) . preschool-kindergarten education is compulsory education and provided for all child between three and six year old , after which school attendance is also compulsory education until the age of sixteen . primary education usually last for eight year . secondary education includes three traditional type of school focused on different academic level : the gymnasium ( school ) enrolls the most gifted child and prepares student for university study ; the secondary vocational school for intermediate student last four year and the technical school prepares pupil for vocational training and the world of work . the system is partly flexible and bridge exist , graduate from a vocational school can achieve a two year programme to have access to vocational higher education for instance . the trend in international mathematics and science study ( timss ) rated <year> -year-old pupil in hungary among the best in the world for math and science . </s> most of the list of university in hungary are public university , and student traditionally study without fee payment . the general requirement for university is the matura . the hungarian public [ education ] system includes university and other higher education institute , that provide both education curriculum and related degree up to doctoral degree and also contribute to research activity . health insurance for student is free until the end of their study . english and german language is important in hungarian higher education , there are a number of degree programme that are taught in these language , which attracts thousand of student exchange program every year . hungary 's higher education and training ha been ranked <number> out of <number> country in the global competitiveness report <year> . </s> hungary ha a long tradition of higher education reflecting the existence of established knowledge economy . the established list of university in hungary include some of the list of oldest university in continuous operation , the first wa the university of pc founded in <year> which is still functioning , although , in the year <year> , the university of veszprm wa destroyed by the troop of peter i csk , but it wa never rebuilt . sigismund established buda university in <year> . another , universitas istropolitana , wa established <year> in pozsony by mattias corvinus . </s> nagyszombat university wa founded in <year> and moved to buda in <year> and it is called etvs lornd university today . the world 's first institute of technology wa founded in selmecbnya , kingdom of hungary in <year> , it legal successor is the university of miskolc . the budapest university of technology and economics is considered the oldest institute of technology in the world with university rank and structure , it legal predecessor the institutum geometrico-hydrotechnicum wa founded in <year> by joseph ii , holy roman emperor . </s> hungary rank fourth ( above neighbour romania , and after china , the united state and russia ) in the all-time medal count at the international mathematical olympiad with <number> total medal , dating back to <year> . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> hungary maintains a universal health care system largely financed by government national health insurance . according to the oecd , <number> of the population is list of country by health insurance coverage , which is absolutely free for child , student , pensioner , poverty , disability , and church employee . hungary spends <number> of gdp on healthcare , spending $ <number> per caput , of which $ <number> is provided by the government . </s> hungary is one of the main destination of medical tourism in europe , particularly in dental tourism , in which it share is <number> in europe and <number> worldwide . plastic surgery is also a key sector , with <number> of the client coming from abroad . hungary is well known for it spa culture and is home to culture of hungary # spa culture , which attract `` spa tourism `` . </s> in common with other developed country , cardiovascular disease is a leading cause of mortality , accounting for <number> ( <number> ) of all death in <year> . however , this number peaked in <year> with <number> death , and ha been declining continuously since the fall of communism . the second leading cause of death is cancer with <number> ( <number> ) , which ha been stagnant since the <year> . death from accident dropped from <number> in <year> to <number> in <year> ; the number of suicide ha declined precipitously from <number> in <year> to <number> in <year> ( <number> per <number> people ) , the lowest since <year> . there are considerable health disparity between the western and eastern part of hungary ; [ disease ] , [ stroke ] , and [ [ suicide is prevalent in the mostly agricultural and low-income great hungarian plain region in the east , but infrequent in the high-income , middle class area of western transdanubia and central hungary . </s> smoking is a leading cause of death in the country , although it is in steep decline : the proportion of adult smoker declined to <number> in <year> from <number> in <year> , owing to strict regulation such a a nationwide smoking ban in every indoor public place and the limiting of tobacco sale to state-controlled `` national tobacco shop `` . </s> hungary rank a the global peace index in the world , with a homicide rate of <number> per <number> people . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> hungary is home to the largest synagogue in europe ( dohny street synagogue ) , built in <year> in moorish revival style with a capacity of <number> people , the largest medicinal bath in europe ( szchenyi medicinal bath ) , completed in <year> in modern renaissance style and located in the budapest city park , the biggest building in hungary with it length ( the parliament building ) , one of the largest basilica in europe ( esztergom basilica ) , the second largest territorial abbey in the world ( pannonhalma archabbey ) , and the largest early christian necropolis outside italy ( pc ) . </s> notable architectural style in hungary include historicism and art nouveau , or rather several variant of art nouveau . in contrast to historicism , hungarian art nouveau is based on the national architectural characteristic . taking the eastern origin of the hungarian into account , dn lechner ( <year> <number> ) , the most important figure in hungarian art nouveau , wa initially inspired by indian and syrian architecture , and later by traditional hungarian decorative design . in this way , he created an original synthesis of architectural style . by applying them to three-dimensional architectural element , he produced a version of art nouveau that wa specific to hungary . </s> turning away from the style of lechner , yet taking inspiration from his approach , the group of `` young people `` ( fiatalok ) , which included kroly k and dezs zrumeczky , were to use the characteristic structure and form of traditional hungarian architecture to achieve the same end . </s> besides the two principal style , budapest also display local version of trend originating from other european country . the sezession from vienna , the german jugendstil , art nouveau from belgium and france , and the influence of english and finnish architecture are all reflected in the building constructed at the turn of the <number> century . bla lajta initially adopted lechner 's style , subsequently drawing his inspiration from english and finnish trend ; after developing an interest in the ancient egypt style , he finally arrived at modern architecture . aladr rkay took almost the same route . istvn medgyaszay developed his own style , which differed from lechner 's , using stylised traditional motif to create decorative design in concrete . in the sphere of applied art , those chiefly responsible for promoting the spread of art nouveau were the school and museum of decorative art , which opened in <year> . </s> foreigner have unexpectedly `` discovered `` that a significantly large portion of the citizen live in old and architecturally valuable building . in the budapest downtown area almost all the building are about one hundred year old , with thick wall , high ceiling , and motif on the front wall . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> hungarian music consists mainly of traditional hungarian folk music and music by prominent composer such a liszt and bartk , considered to be among the greatest hungarian composer . other renowned composer are ern dohnnyi , franz schmidt , zoltn kodly , gabriel von wayditch , rudolf wagner-rgeny , lszl lajtha , franz lehr , imre klmn , sndor veress and mikls rzsa . hungarian traditional music tends to have a strong dactyl ( poetry ) rhythm , a the language is invariably stressed on the first syllable of each word . </s> hungary ha renowned composer of contemporary classical music , gyrgy ligeti , gyrgy kurtg , peter etvs , zoltn kodly and zoltn jeney among them . one of the greatest hungarian composer , bla bartk , wa also among the most significant musician of the <number> century . his music wa invigorated by the theme , mode , and rhythmic pattern of the hungarian and neighbouring folk music tradition he studied , which he synthesised with influence from his contemporary into his own distinctive style . </s> hungary ha made many contribution to the field of folk music , popular music and european classical music . hungarian folk music is a prominent part of the national identity and continues to play a major part in hungarian music . hungarian folk music ha been significant in former country part that belong ; since the <year> treaty of trianon ; to neighbouring country such a romania , slovakia , poland and especially in southern slovakia and transylvania ; both region have significant number of hungarian . </s> after the establishment of a music academy led by ferenc erkel and franz liszt hungary produced an important number of art musician : </s> * pianist : ern von dohnnyi , ervin nyiregyhzi , andor fldes , tam vsry , gyrgy sndor , gza anda , annie fischer , gyrgy cziffra , edward kilenyi , balint vazsonyi , andrs schiff , zoltn kocsis , dezs rnki , jen jand and others . </s> * violist : joseph joachim , leopold auer , jen hubay , jelly d'arnyi , joseph szigeti , sndor vgh , emil telmanyi , zathurecky , zsigmondy , franz von vecsey , zoltn szkely , tibor varga ( violinist ) and newcomer antal szalai , vilmos szabadi , kristf barti ( b . <number> ) and others . </s> * opera singer : astrid varnay , jzsef simndy , jlia vrady , julia hamari , kolos kovts ( bluebeard in bartk 's bluebeard ) </s> * conductor : eugene ormandy , george szell , antal dorti , jnos ferencsik , fritz reiner , sir georg solti , istvn kertsz ( conductor ) , ferenc fricsay , zoltn rozsnyai , sndor vgh , arpad joo , dm fischer , ivn fischer , pter etvs , zoltn kocsis , tam vsry , gilbert varga and others </s> * string quartet : budapest quartet , hungarian quartet , vgh quartet , takcs quartet , kodly quartet , der quartet , festetics quartet , </s> broughton claim that hungary 's `` infectious sound ha been surprisingly influential on neighboring country ( thanks perhaps to the common austro-hungarian history ) and it 's not uncommon to hear hungarian-sounding tune in romania , slovakia and poland `` .refers to the country a `` widely considered `` to be a `` home of music `` . it is also strong in the szabolcs-szatmr-bereg szabolcs-szatmr area and in the southwest part of transdanubia , near the border with croatia . the busjrs carnival in mohcs is a major hungarian folk music event , formerly featuring the long-established and well-regarded bogyiszl orchestra . </s> hungarian european classical music ha long been an `` experiment , made from hungarian antecedent and on hungarian soil , to create a conscious musical culture [ using the ] musical world of the folk song `` . `` every experiment , made from hungarian antecedent and on hungarian soil , to create a conscious musical culture ( music written by composer , a different from folk music ) , had instinctively or consciously striven to develop widely and universally the musical world of the folk song . folk poetry and folk music were deeply embedded in the collective hungarian people 's culture , and this unity did not cease to be effective even when it wa given from and expression by individual creative artist , performer and poet . `` although the hungarian upper class ha long had cultural and political connection with the rest of europe , leading to an influx of european musical idea , the rural peasant maintained their own tradition such that by the end of the <number> century hungarian composer could draw on rural peasant music to ( re ) create a hungarian classical style . for example , bartk collected folk song from across central and eastern europe , including romania and slovakia , while kodly wa more interested in creating a distinctively hungarian musical style . </s> during the era of communist rule in hungary ( <year> <number> ) , a song committee scoured and censored popular music for trace of subversion and ideological impurity . since then , however , the hungarian music industry ha begun to recover , producing successful performer in the field of jazz such a trumpeter rudolf tomsits , pianist-composer kroly binder and , in a modernised form of hungarian folk , ferenc seb and mrta sebestyn . the three giant of hungarian rock , ill ( band ) , metr ( band ) and omega ( band ) , remain very popular , especially omega , which ha following in germany and beyond a well a in hungary . older veteran underground band such a beatrice ( band ) , from the <year> , also remain popular . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> in the earliest time , hungarian language wa written in a old hungarian script runic-like script ( although it wa not used for literature purpose in the modern interpretation ) . the country switched to the latin alphabet after being christianized under the reign of stephen i of hungary ( <year> <number> ) . </s> the oldest remained written record in hungarian language is a fragment in the establishing charter of the abbey of tihany ( <year> ) which contains several hungarian term , among them the word feheruuaru rea meneh hodu utu rea , `` up the military road to szkesfehrvr `` the rest of the document wa written in latin . </s> the oldest remaining complete text in hungarian language is the funeral sermon and prayer ( halotti beszd s knyrgs ) ( <year> <number> ) , a translation of a latin sermon . </s> the oldest remaining poem in hungarian is the old hungarian 'lamentations of mary ' ( magyar mria-siralom ) , also a ( not very strict ) translation from latin , from the <number> century . it is also the oldest surviving uralic language poem . </s> among the first chronicle about hungarian history were gesta hungarorum ( `` deed of the hungarian `` ) by the unknown author usually called anonymus , and gesta hunnorum et hungarorum ( `` deed of the hun and the hungarian `` ) by simon kzai . both are in latin . these chronicle mix history with legend , so historically they are not always authentic . another chronicle is the kpes krnika ( illustrated chronicle ) , which wa written for louis i of hungary . </s> renaissance literature flourished under the reign of matthias corvinus of hungary ( <year> <number> ) . janus pannonius , although he wrote in latin , count a one of the most important person in hungarian literature , being the only significant hungarian humanist poet of the period . the first printing house wa also founded during matthias ' reign , by andrs hess , in buda . the first book printed in hungary wa the chronica hungarorum . </s> the most important poet of the period wa blint balassi ( <year> <number> ) and nikola zrinski ( <year> <number> ) . </s> balassi 's poetry show medieval influence , his poem can be divided into three section : love poem , war poem and religious poem . zrnyi 's most significant work , the epic peril of sziget ( `` peril of sziget `` , written in <year> /49 ) is written in a fashion similar to the iliad , and recount the heroic battle of szigetvr , where his great-grandfather died while defending the castle of szigetvr . </s> among the religious literary work the most important is the bible translation by gspr kroli ( the second hungarian bible translation in the history ) , the protestant pastor of gnc , in <year> . the translation is called the bible of vizsoly , after the town where it wa first published . ( see bible translation into hungarian for more detail . ) </s> the hungarian enlightenment took place about fifty year after the french age of enlightenment . the first enlightened writer were archduchess maria theresa of austria ( <year> <number> ) 's bodyguard ( gyrgy bessenyei , jnos batsnyi and others ) . the greatest poet of the time were mihly csokonai vitz and dniel berzsenyi . </s> the greatest figure of the language reform wa ferenc kazinczy . the hungarian language became feasible for all type of scientific explanation from this time , and furthermore many new word were coined for describing new invention . </s> hungarian literature ha recently gained some renown outside the border of hungary ( mostly through translation into german , french and english ) . some modern hungarian author have become increasingly popular in germany and italy especially sndor mrai , pter esterhzy , pter ndas and imre kertsz . the latter is a contemporary jewish writer who survived the holocaust and won the nobel prize for literature in <year> . </s> the older classic of hungarian literature and hungarian poetry have remained almost totally unknown outside hungary . jnos arany , a famous <number>-century hungarian poet , is still much loved in hungary ( especially his collection of ballad ) , among several other `` true classic `` like sndor petfi , the poet of the revolution of <year> , endre ady , mihly babits , dezs kosztolnyi , attila jzsef , mikls radnti and jnos pilinszky . other well-known hungarian author are lszl krasznahorkai , ferenc mra , gza grdonyi , zsigmond mricz , gyula illys , albert wa , mikls szentkuthy , magda szab and stephen vizinczey . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> traditional dish such a the world-famous goulash ( gulys stew or gulys soup ) feature prominently in hungarian cuisine . dish are often flavoured with paprika ( ground red pepper ) , a hungarian innovation . the paprika powder , obtained from a special type of pepper , is one of the most common spice used in typical hungarian cuisine . thick , heavy hungarian sour cream called tejfl is often used to soften the dish ' flavour . the famous hungarian hot river fish soup called fisherman 's soup or [ is usually a rich mixture of several kind of poached fish . </s> other dish are chicken paprikash , foie gras ] made of goose liver , [ [ prklt stew , vadas , ( game stew with vegetable gravy and sptzle ) , trout with almond and salty and sweet dumpling , like trs csusza , ( dumpling with fresh quark ( cheese ) cheese and thick sour cream ) . dessert include the iconic dobos cake , strudel ( rtes ) , filled with apple , cherry , poppy seed or cheese , palacsinta , plum dumpling ( kle ) , somli dumpling , dessert soup like chilled sour cherry soup and sweet chestnut puree , gesztenyepr ( cooked chestnut mashed with sugar and rum and split into crumb , topped with whipped cream ) . pretzel and kifli are widely popular pastry . </s> the csrda is the most distinctive type of hungarian inn , an old-style tavern offering traditional cuisine and beverage . boroz usually denotes a cosy old-fashioned wine tavern , pince is a beer or wine cellar and a srz is a pub offering draught beer and sometimes meal . the bisztr is an inexpensive restaurant often with self-service . the bf is the cheapest place , although one may have to eat standing at a counter . pastry , cake and coffee are served at the confectionery called cukrszda , while an eszpressz is a caf . </s> plinka is a fruit brandy , distilled from fruit grown in the orchard situated on the great hungarian plain . it is a spirit native to hungary and come in a variety of flavour including apricot ( barack ) and cherry ( cseresznye ) . however , plum ( szilva ) is the most popular flavour . beer go well with many traditional hungarian dish . the five main hungarian beer brand are : borsod brewery , soproni , arany szok , kbnyai , and dreher brewery . in hungary , people traditionally do not clink their glass or mug when drinking beer . there is an urban legend in hungarian culture that austrian general clinked their beer glass to celebrate the execution of the <number> martyr of arad in <year> . many people still follow the tradition , although younger people often disavow it , citing that the vow wa only meant to last <number> year . </s> wine : a hugh johnson ( wine ) say in the history of wine , the territory of hungary is ideal for wine-making and the country can be divided to six wine region : north-transdanubia , lake balaton , south-pannnia , duna-region or alfld , upper-hungary and tokaj-hegyalja . the roman brought vine to pannonia , and by the <number> century ad , there are record of extensive vineyard in what is now hungary . the hungarian brought their wine-making knowledge from the east . according to ahmad ibn rustah , the hungarian tribe were familiar with wine-making long time before the hungarian conquest of the carpathian basin . </s> hungarian wine region offer a great variety of style : the main product of the country are elegant and full-bodied dry white with good acidity , although complex sweet white ( tokaj ) , elegant ( eger ) and full-bodied robust red ( villny and szekszrd ) . the main variety are : olaszrizling , hrslevel , furmint , pinot gris or szrkebart , chardonnay ( white ) , kkfrankos ( or blaufrankisch in german ) , kadarka , portugieser , zweigelt , cabernet sauvignon , cabernet franc and merlot . the most famous wine from hungary are tokaji asz and egri bikavr . tokaji , meaning `` of tokaj `` , or `` from tokaj `` in hungarian , is used to label wine from the wine region of tokaj-hegyalja . tokaji wine ha received accolade from numerous great writer and composer including beethoven , liszt , schubert and goethe ; joseph haydn 's favourite wine wa a tokaji . louis xv and frederick the great tried to outdo one another when they entertained guest with tokaji . napoleon iii , the last emperor of france , ordered <year> barrel of tokaji at the french royal court every year . gustav iii , king of sweden , loved tokaji . in russia , customer included peter the great and empress elizabeth , while catherine the great actually established a russian garrison in the town of tokaj with the aim of assuring regular wine delivery to st. petersburg . </s> for over <number> year , a blend of forty hungarian herb ha been used to create the liqueur unicum . unicum is a bitter , dark-coloured liqueur that can be drunk a an apritif or after a meal , thus helping the digestion . </s> <section_title_start> recreation <section_title_end> </s> hungary is a land of thermal water . a passion for spa culture and hungarian history have been connected from the very beginning . hungarian spa feature ancient rome , greek architecture , architecture of turkey , and northern country architectural element . </s> because of an advantageous geographical location , good quality thermal water can be found in great quantity on over <number> of hungary 's territory . approximately <number> thermal spring can be found in hungary ( more than <number> just in the capital area ) . there are approximately <number> public bath in hungary . </s> the ancient rome heralded the first age of spa in hungary . the remains of their bath complex are still to be seen in buda . spa culture wa revived during the turkish invasion and the thermal spring of buda were used for the construction of a number of bathhouse , some of which such a ( kirly bath , rudas bath ) are still functioning . </s> in the <number> century , the advancement in deep drilling and medical science provided the springboard for a further leap in bathing culture . grand spa such a gellrt bath , lukcs bath , margaret island , and szchenyi medicinal bath are a reflection of this resurgence in popularity . the szchenyi thermal bath is the largest spa complex in europe and it wa the first thermal bath built in the pest side of budapest . this building is a noted example of modern renaissance style . located on the buda side of budapest , the gellrt spa is the most famous and luxurious thermal complex of the capital city . </s> <section_title_start> folk art <section_title_end> </s> ugrs ( jumping dance ) are old style dance dating back to the middle age . </s> solo or couple dance accompanied by old style music , shepherd and other solo man 's dance from transylvania , and marching dance along with remnant of medieval weapon dance belong in this group . </s> karikz is a circle dance performed by woman only accompanied by singing of folk song . </s> csrds are new style dance developed in the <year> th century . csrds is the hungarian name for the national dance , with hungarian embroidered costume and energetic music . from the men 's intricate bootslapping dance to the ancient woman 's circle dance , csrds demonstrates the infectious exuberance of the hungarian folk dancing still celebrated in the village . </s> verbunkos is a solo man 's dance evolved from the recruiting performance of the austria-hungary austro-hungarian army . </s> the legnyes is a men 's solo dance done by the ethnic hungarian people living in the kalotaszeg region of transylvania . although usually danced by young men , it can be also danced by older men . the dance is generally performed freestyle by one dancer at a time in front of a band . woman participate in the dance by standing in line to the side , and singing or shouting verse while the men dance . each man performs a number of point ( dance phrase ) , typically four to eight without repetition . each point consists of four part , each lasting four count . the first part is usually the same for everyone ( there are only a few variation ) . </s> it wa in the beginning of the <number>-century that the present style of hungarian folk art took shape , incorporating both renaissance and baroque element , depending on the area , a well a persian sassanide influence . flower and leaf , sometimes a bird or a spiral ornament , are the principal decorative theme . the most frequent ornament is a flower with a centrepiece resembling the eye of a peacock 's feather . </s> nearly all the manifestation of folk art practiced elsewhere in europe also flourished among the [ people magyar ] peasantry at one time or another , their ceramic and textile being the most highly developed of all . </s> the finest achievement in their textile art are the embroidery which vary from region to region . those of kalotaszeg in transylvania are charming product of oriental design , sewn chiefly in a single colour ; red , blue , or black . soft in line , the embroidery are applied on altar cloth , pillow-cases and sheet . </s> in hungary proper , srkz in transdanubia and the mezkvesd in the great hungarian plain produce the finest embroidery . in the tolna ( county ) region the woman 's cap show black and white design a delicate a lace , and give evidence of the people 's wonderfully subtle artistic feeling . the embroidery motif applied to woman 's wear have also been transposed to tablecloth and runner suitable for modern use a wall decoration . </s> these vessel , made of black clay , reflect more than three hundred year of traditional transdanubian folk pattern and shape . no two are precisely alike , since all work is done by hand , including both the shaping and the decorating . the imprint are made by the thumb or a finger of the ceramist who make the piece . </s> <section_title_start> porcelain <section_title_end> </s> founded in <year> , herend porcelain is one of the world 's largest ceramic factory , specialising in luxury hand painted and gilded porcelain . in the mid-19th century it wa purveyor to the habsburg dynasty and aristocratic customer throughout europe . many of it classic pattern are still in production . after the fall of communism in hungary , the factory wa privatised and is now <number> owned by it management and worker , exporting to over <number> country of the world . </s> zsolnay porcelain manufacture is a hungarian manufacturer of porcelain , pottery , ceramic , tile and stoneware . the company introduced the eosin glazing process and pyrogranite ceramic . </s> the zsolnay factory wa established by mikls zsolnay in pc , hungary , to produce stoneware and ceramic in <year> . in <year> , his son , vilmos zsolnay ( <year> <number> ) joined the company and became it manager and director after several year . he led the factory to worldwide recognition by demonstrating it innovative product at world fair and international exhibition , including the <year> world fair in vienna , then at the <year> world fair in paris , where zsolnay received a grand prix . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> hungary at the olympics have been successful contender in the olympic game , only ten country established in the <number>s </s> category : christian state <article_end> <article_start> </s> japan ( , nippon or nihon ) is an island country in east asia , located in the northwest pacific ocean . it is bordered on the west by the sea of japan , and extends from the sea of okhotsk in the north toward the east china sea and taiwan in the south . part of the ring of fire , japan span japanese archipelago of list of island of japan covering ; the five main island are hokkaido , honshu , shikoku , kyushu , and okinawa island . tokyo is japan 's capital and largest city ; other major city include yokohama , osaka , nagoya , sapporo , fukuoka , kobe , and kyoto . </s> japan is the list of country and dependency by population eleventh-most populous country in the world , a well a one of the list of country and dependency by population density and urbanization by country . about three-fourths of the geography of japan country 's terrain is mountainous , concentrating it population of <number> million on narrow coastal plain . japan is divided into prefecture of japan and list of region of japan . the greater tokyo area is the list of largest city in the world , with more than <number> million resident . </s> japan japanese paleolithic since the upper paleolithic period ( <number> bc ) , though the first mention of the archipelago appear in book of han from the <number> century ad . between the <number> and <number> century , the kingdom of japan became unified under an emperor of japan and his imperial house of japan based in heian-ky . beginning in the <number> century , political power wa held by a series of military dictator ( shogun ) and feudal lord ( daimyo ) , and enforced by a class of warrior nobility ( samurai ) . after a sengoku period century-long period of civil war , the country wa reunified in <year> under the tokugawa shogunate , which enacted an sakoku . in <year> , a perry expedition forced japan to bakumatsu , which led to boshin war and the meiji restoration in <year> . in the meiji ( era ) , the empire of japan adopted a meiji constitution western-styled constitution and pursued a program of industrialisation and modernization theory . in <year> , japan second sino-japanese war ; in <year> , it entered world war ii a an axis power . after suffering defeat in the pacific war and atomic bombing of hiroshima and nagasaki , japan surrender of japan in <year> and came under a seven-year occupation of japan , during which it adopted a constitution of japan . since <year> , japan ha maintained a unitary state parliamentary system constitutional monarchy with a bicameralism legislature , the national diet . </s> japan is a great power and a member of numerous international organization , including the united nation ( since <year> ) , the oecd , and the group of seven . although it ha article <number> of the japanese constitution , the country maintains japan self-defense force self-defense force that are ranked a the world 's military # capability development fourth-most powerful military . after world war ii , japan experienced japanese economic miracle , becoming the list of country by largest historical gdp second-largest economy in the world by <year> before being surpassed by china in <year> . despite economic stagnation since the lost decade ( japan ) , the economy of japan country 's economy remains the list of country by gdp ( nominal ) third-largest by nominal gdp and the list of country by gdp ( ppp ) fourth-largest by ppp . a leader in the automotive industry in japan and electronics industry in japan , japan ha made significant contribution to science and technology in japan . ranked the list of country in asia and oceania by human development index second-highest country on the human development index in asia after singapore , japan ha the world 's list of country by life expectancy second-highest life expectancy , though it is experiencing a aging of japan . the culture of japan is well-known around the world , including it japanese art , japanese cuisine , music of japan , and japanese popular culture , which encompasses prominent anime and video game in japan industry . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the name for japan in japanese language is written using the kanji and pronounced nippon or nihon . before it wa adopted in the early <number> century , the country wa known in china a wa ( japan ) ( ) and in japan by the endonym yamato . nippon , the original sino-japanese reading of the character , is favored for official us , including on japanese yen and postage stamp . nihon is typically used in everyday speech and reflects shift in japanese phonology during the edo period . the character mean `` sun origin `` . it is the source of the popular western epithet `` land of the rising sun `` . </s> the name japan is based on the chinese pronunciation and wa introduced to european language through early trade . in the <number> century , marco polo recorded the early mandarin chinese or wu chinese pronunciation of the character labels=no a cipangu . the old malay language name for japan , japang or japun , wa borrowed from a southern coastal chinese dialect and encountered by portuguese empire trader in southeast asia , who brought the word to europe in the early <number> century . the first version of the name in english appears in a book published in <year> , which spelled the name a giapan in a translation of a <year> portuguese letter . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> prehistoric to classical history <section_title_end> </s> a japanese paleolithic from around <number> ; bc constitutes the first known habitation of the japanese archipelago . this wa followed from around <number> ; bc ( the start of the jmon period ) by a mesolithic to neolithic semi-sedentary [ culture characterized by pit-house pit dwelling ] and rudimentary agriculture . [ [ jmon pottery from the period are among the oldest surviving example of pottery . from around <year> bc , yayoi period # origin of the yayoi people began to enter the archipelago from kyushu , intermingling with the jomon people ; the yayoi period saw the introduction of practice including paddy field wet-rice farming , a new yayoi pottery , and metallurgy from china and korea . according to legend , emperor jimmu ( grandson of amaterasu ) founded yamatai in central japan in <number> bc , beginning a imperial house of japan . </s> japan first appears in written history in the chinese book of han , completed in <number> ad . buddhism wa introduced to japan from baekje ( a korean kingdom ) in <number> , but the development of buddhism in japan wa primarily influenced by china . despite early resistance , buddhism wa promoted by the ruling class , including figure like prince shtoku , and gained widespread acceptance beginning in the asuka period ( <year> <number> ) . </s> the far-reaching taika reform in <number> nationalized all land in japan , to be equal-field system among cultivator , and ordered the compilation of a household registry a the basis for a new system of taxation . the jinshin war of <number> , a bloody conflict between prince ama and his nephew prince tomo , became a major catalyst for further administrative reform . these reform culminated with the promulgation of the taih code , which consolidated existing statute and established the structure of the central and subordinate local government . these legal reform created the ritsury state , a system of chinese-style centralized government that remained in place for half a millennium . </s> the nara period ( <year> <number> ) marked the emergence of a japanese state centered on the imperial court in heij palace heij-ky ( modern nara , nara ) . the period is characterized by the appearance of a nascent japanese literature with the completion of the kojiki ( <number> ) and nihon shoki ( <number> ) , a well a the development of buddhist-inspired artwork and historic monument of ancient nara . a <year> <number> japanese smallpox epidemic smallpox epidemic in <year> <number> is believed to have killed a much a one-third of japan 's population . in <number> , emperor kanmu moved the capital , settling on heian-ky ( modern kyoto ) in <number> . this marked the beginning of the heian period ( <year> <number> ) , during which a distinctly indigenous japanese culture emerged . murasaki shikibu 's the tale of genji and the lyric of japan 's national anthem `` kimigayo `` were written during this time . </s> <section_title_start> feudal era <section_title_end> </s> japan 's feudal era wa characterized by the emergence and dominance of a ruling class of warrior , the samurai . in <year> , following the defeat of the taira clan in the genpei war , samurai minamoto no yoritomo established a military government at kamakura , kanagawa . after yoritomo 's death , the hj clan came to power a regent for the shguns . the zen school of buddhism wa introduced from china in the kamakura period ( <year> <number> ) and became popular among the samurai class . the kamakura shogunate repelled mongol invasion of japan in <year> and <year> but wa eventually kenmu restoration by emperor go-daigo . go-daigo wa defeated by ashikaga takauji in <year> , beginning the muromachi period ( <year> <number> ) . the succeeding ashikaga shogunate failed to control the feudal warlord ( daimys ) and a nin war , opening the century-long sengoku period ( `` warring state `` ) . </s> during the <number> century , portuguese trader and society of jesus missionary reached japan for the first time , initiating direct nanban trade and nanban art exchange between japan and the west . oda nobunaga used european technology and firearm to conquer many other daimys ; his consolidation of power began what wa known a the azuchimomoyama period . after honn-ji incident in <year> , his successor toyotomi hideyoshi unified the nation in the early <year> and launched japanese invasion of korea ( <year> <number> ) . </s> tokugawa ieyasu served a council of five elder for hideyoshi 's son toyotomi hideyori and used his position to gain political and military support . when open war broke out , ieyasu defeated rival clan in the battle of sekigahara in <year> . he wa appointed shgun by emperor go-yzei in <year> and established the tokugawa shogunate at edo ( modern tokyo ) . the shogunate enacted measure including buke shohatto , a a code of conduct to control the autonomous daimys , and in <year> the isolationist sakoku ( `` closed country `` ) policy that spanned the two and a half century of tenuous political unity known a the edo period ( <year> <number> ) . modern japan 's economic growth began in this period , resulting in kaid and water transportation route , a well a financial instrument such a future contract , banking and insurance of the osaka rice broker . the study of western science ( rangaku ) continued through contact with the dutch enclave in nagasaki . the edo period gave rise to kokugaku ( `` national study `` ) , the study of japan by the japanese . </s> <section_title_start> modern era <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , matthew c. perry and the `` black ship `` of the united state navy forced the opening of japan to the outside world with the convention of kanagawa . subsequent similar treaty with other western country brought economic and political crisis . the resignation of the shgun led to the boshin war and the establishment of a abolition of the han system nominally unified under the emperor ( the meiji restoration ) . adopting western political , judicial , and military institution , the cabinet of japan organized the privy council ( japan ) , introduced the meiji constitution , and assembled the national diet . during the meiji era ( <year> <number> ) , the empire of japan emerged a the most developed nation in asia and a an industrialized world power that pursued military conflict to expand it sphere of influence . after victory in the first sino-japanese war ( <year> <number> ) and the russo-japanese war ( <year> <number> ) , japan gained control of taiwan , korea and the southern half of sakhalin . the japanese population doubled from <number> million in <year> to <number> million by <year> , with a significant shift to urbanization . </s> the early <number> century saw a period of taish period ( <year> <number> ) overshadowed by increasing expansionism and japanese militarism . japan during world war i allowed japan , which joined the side of the victorious ally of world war i , to capture german colonial empire in the pacific and in china . the <year> saw a political shift towards statism in shwa japan , a period of lawlessness following the <year> great tokyo earthquake , the passing of peace preservation law # public security preservation law of <year> , and a series of may <number> incident . this process accelerated during the <year> , spawning a number of radical nationalist group that shared a hostility to liberal democracy and a dedication to expansion in asia . in <year> , japan japanese invasion of manchuria ; following lytton report , it resigned from the league of nation two year later . in <year> , japan signed the anti-comintern pact with nazi germany ; the <year> tripartite pact made it one of the axis power . </s> the empire of japan invaded other part of china in <year> , precipitating the second sino-japanese war ( <year> <number> ) . in <year> , the empire japanese invasion of french indochina , after which the united state placed an oil embargo on japan . on december <number> , <year> , japanese force carried out surprise attack on pearl harbor , a well a on united kingdom force in battle of malaya , bombing of singapore ( <year> ) , and battle of hong kong , among others , beginning pacific war . throughout area occupied by japan during the war , numerous abuse were committed against local inhabitant , with many forced into comfort woman . after ally of world war ii victory during the next four year , which culminated in the soviet invasion of manchuria and the atomic bombing of hiroshima and nagasaki in <year> , japan agreed to an surrender of japan . the war cost japan japanese colonial empire and million of life . the ally ( led by the united state ) repatriated million of japanese diaspora from their former colony and military camp throughout asia , largely eliminating the japanese empire and it influence over the territory it conquered . the ally convened the international military tribunal for the far east to prosecute japanese leader for japanese war crime . </s> in <year> , japan adopted a new constitution of japan emphasizing liberal democratic practice . the occupation of japan ended with the treaty of san francisco in <year> , and japan wa granted membership in the united nation in <year> . a japanese economic miracle propelled japan to become the second-largest economy in the world ; this ended in the mid-1990s after the popping of an japanese asset price bubble , beginning the lost decade ( japan ) `` lost decade `` . on march <number> , <year> , japan suffered one of the <year> thoku earthquake and tsunami , triggering the fukushima daiichi nuclear disaster . on may <number> , <year> , after the historic abdication of emperor akihito , his son naruhito became emperor , beginning the reiwa era . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> japan comprises <year> island extending along the pacific coast of asia . it stretch over northeastsouthwest from the sea of okhotsk to the east china sea . the county 's five main island , from north to south , are hokkaido , honshu , shikoku , kyushu and okinawa island . the ryukyu island , which include okinawa , are a chain to the south of kyushu . the nanp island are south and east of the main island of japan . together they are often known a the japanese archipelago . , japan 's territory is . japan ha the sixth longest list of country by length of coastline in the world at . because of it far-flung outlying island , japan ha the sixth largest exclusive economic zone of japan in the world , covering . </s> because of it mountainous terrain , approximately <number> of japan 's land is uninhabitable . the habitable zone , mainly in coastal area , have extremely high population density : japan is one of the list of country by population density . , approximately <number> of japan 's total area is land reclamation ( umetatechi ) . </s> japan is substantially prone to earthquake , tsunami and volcano because of it location along the pacific ring of fire . it ha the list of country by natural disaster risk a measured in the <year> world risk index . japan ha <number> active volcano . destructive earthquake , often resulting in tsunami , occur several time each century ; the <year> great kant earthquake killed over <number> people . more recent major quake are the <year> great hanshin earthquake and the <year> thoku earthquake and tsunami , which triggered a large tsunami . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the climate of japan is predominantly temperate but varies greatly from north to south . the northernmost region , hokkaido , ha a [ continental climate ] with long , cold winter and very warm to cool summer . precipitation ( meteorology ) is not heavy , but the island usually develop deep snowbank in the winter . </s> in the sea of japan region on honshu 's west coast , northwest winter wind bring heavy snowfall during winter . in the summer , the region sometimes experience extremely hot temperature because of the foehn wind . the central highland ( japan ) ha a typical inland humid continental climate , with large temperature difference between summer and winter . the mountain of the chgoku region and shikoku region shelter the seto inland sea from seasonal wind , bringing mild weather year-round . </s> the pacific coast feature a [ subtropical ] climate that experience milder winter with occasional snowfall and hot , humid summer because of the southeast seasonal wind . the ryukyu and nanp island have a subtropics , with warm winter and hot summer . precipitation is very heavy , especially during the rainy season . the main east asian rainy season begin in early may in okinawa , and the rain front gradually move north . in late summer and early autumn , typhoon often bring heavy rain . according to the environment ministry , heavy rainfall and increasing temperature have caused problem in the agricultural industry and elsewhere . the highest temperature ever measured in japan , , wa recorded on july <number> , <year> , and repeated on august <number> , <year> . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> japan ha nine forest ecoregions in japan which reflect the climate and geography of the island . they range from tropical and subtropical moist broadleaf forest in the ryky and bonin island , to temperate broadleaf and mixed forest in the mild climate region of the main island , to temperate coniferous forest in the cold , winter portion of the northern island . japan ha over <number> specie of wildlife of japan , including the brown bear , the japanese macaque , the japanese raccoon dog , the small japanese field mouse , and the japanese giant salamander . </s> a large network of list of national park of japan ha been established to protect important area of <section_title_start> environment <section_title_end> </s> in the period of rapid economic growth after world war ii , environmental policy were downplayed by the government and industrial corporation the switching-off of nuclear power in japan japan 's nuclear fleet after the <year> fukushima nuclear disaster . japan rank <number> in the <year> environmental performance index , which measure a nation 's commitment to environmental sustainability . japan is the world 's fifth largest emitter of carbon dioxide . a the host and signatory of the <year> kyoto protocol , japan is under treaty obligation to reduce it carbon dioxide emission and to take other step to curb climate change . in <year> the government of japan announced a target of carbon neutrality carbon-neutrality by <year> . environmental issue include urban air pollution ( nox , suspended particulate matter , and toxics ) , waste management , water eutrophication , nature conservation , climate change in japan , chemical management and international co-operation for conservation . </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> japan is a unitary state and constitutional monarchy in which the power of the emperor of japan is limited to a ceremonial role . executive power is instead wielded by the prime minister of japan and his cabinet of japan , whose sovereignty is vested in the japanese people . naruhito is the emperor of japan , having succeeded his father akihito upon his accession to the chrysanthemum throne in <year> . </s> japan 's legislative organ is the national diet , a bicameralism parliament . it consists of a lower house of representative ( japan ) with <number> seat , elected by popular vote every four year or when dissolved , and an upper house of councillor ( japan ) with <number> seat , whose popularly-elected member serve six-year term . there is universal suffrage for adult over <number> year of age , with a secret ballot for all elected office . the prime minister a the [ of government ] ha the power to appoint and dismiss minister of state , and is imperial investiture by the emperor after being designated from among the member of the diet . elected in the <year> liberal democratic party ( japan ) leadership election , yoshihide suga is japan 's prime minister . </s> historically influenced by chinese law , the law of japan developed independently during the edo period through text such a kujikata osadamegaki . since the late <number> century , the judicial system of japan ha been largely based on the civil law ( legal system ) of europe , notably germany . in <year> , japan established a civil code based on the german brgerliches gesetzbuch , which remains in effect with postworld war ii modification . the constitution of japan , adopted in <year> , is the oldest unamended constitution in the world . statutory law originates in the legislature , and the constitution requires that the emperor promulgate legislation passed by the diet without giving him the power to oppose legislation . the main body of japanese statutory law is called the six code . japan 's court system is divided into four basic tier : the supreme court of japan and three level of lower court . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> japan is divided into prefecture of japan , each overseen by an elected governor ( exhibit synthesis and competition between native japanese esthetic and imported idea . the interaction between japanese and european art ha been significant : for example ukiyo-e print , which began to be exported in the <number> century in the movement known a japonism , had a significant influence on the development of modern art in the west , most notably on post-impressionism . japanese manga developed in the <number> century and have become popular worldwide . </s> japanese architecture is a combination between local and other influence . it ha traditionally been typified by wooden or mud plaster structure , elevated slightly off the ground , with tiled or thatched roof . the ise grand shrine have been celebrated a the prototype of japanese architecture . minka and many japanese buddhist architecture see the use of tatami mat and shji that break down the distinction between room and indoor and outdoor space . since the <number> century , japan ha incorporated much of western modern architecture into construction and design . it wa not until after world war ii that japanese architect made an impression on the international scene , firstly with the work of architect like kenz tange and then with movement like metabolist movement . </s> <section_title_start> literature and philosophy <section_title_end> </s> the earliest work of japanese literature include the kojiki and nihon shoki chronicle and the man'ysh list of japanese poetry anthology , all from the <number> century and written in chinese character . in the early heian period , the system of phonogram ( linguistics ) known a kana ( [ and katakana ] ) wa developed . [ [ the tale of the bamboo cutter is considered the oldest extant japanese narrative . an account of court life is given in the pillow book by sei shnagon , while the tale of genji by murasaki shikibu is often described a the world 's first novel . </s> during the edo period , the chnin ( `` townspeople `` ) overtook the samurai aristocracy a producer and consumer of literature . the popularity of the work of saikaku , for example , reveals this change in readership and authorship , while matsuo bash revivified the poetic tradition of the kokinsh with his [ ( haiku ] ) and wrote the poetic travelogue [ [ oku no hosomichi . the meiji era saw the decline of traditional literary form a japanese literature integrated western influence . natsume sseki and mori gai were significant novelist in the early <number> century , followed by rynosuke akutagawa , jun'ichir tanizaki , kaf nagai and , more recently , haruki murakami and kenji nakagami . japan ha two nobel prize in literature nobel prize-winning author ; yasunari kawabata ( <year> ) and kenzabur e ( <year> ) . </s> japanese philosophy ha historically been a information fusion of both foreign , particularly chinese philosophy and western philosophy , and uniquely japanese element . in it literary form , japanese philosophy began about fourteen century ago . confucian ideal remain evident in the japanese society and the self , and in the organization of the government and the structure of society . buddhism ha profoundly impacted japanese psychology , metaphysics , and esthetic . </s> <section_title_start> performing art <section_title_end> </s> japanese music is eclectic and diverse . many traditional japanese musical instrument , such a the koto ( instrument ) , were introduced in the <number> and <number> century . the popular music of japan # folk music , with the guitar-like shamisen , date from the <number> century . western classical music , introduced in the late <number> century , form an integral part of japanese culture . taiko # kumi-daiko kumi-daiko ( ensemble drumming ) wa developed in postwar japan and became very popular in north america . popular music in post-war japan ha been heavily influenced by american and european trend , which ha led to the evolution of j-pop . karaoke is a significant cultural activity . </s> the four traditional theater from japan are noh , kygen , kabuki , and bunraku . noh is one of the oldest continuous theater tradition in the world . </s> <section_title_start> custom and holiday <section_title_end> </s> is a japanese idiom which denotes a form of the transience of the world . is a central idea in japanese culture , meaning to acknowledge one 's own mistake and to pledge improvement . refers to the japanese belief that mystical power dwell in word and name . </s> officially , japan ha <number> national , government-recognized holiday . public holiday in japan are regulated by the of <year> . beginning in <year> , japan implemented the happy monday system , which moved a number of national holiday to monday in order to obtain a long weekend . the national holiday in japan are japanese new year new year 's day on january <number> , coming of age day on the second monday of january , national foundation day on february <number> , the emperor 's birthday on february <number> , vernal equinox day on march <number> or <number> , shwa day on april <number> , constitution memorial day on may <number> , greenery day on may <number> , child 's day ( japan ) child 's day on may <number> , marine day on the third monday of july , mountain day on august <number> , respect for the aged day on the third monday of september , september equinox on september <number> or <number> , health and sport day on the second monday of october , culture day on november <number> , and labor thanksgiving day on november <number> </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> japanese cuisine offer a vast array of japanese regional cuisine that use traditional recipe and local ingredient . seafood and japanese rice or japanese noodle are traditional staple . japanese curry , since it introduction to japan from british raj , is so widely consumed that it can be termed a national dish , alongside ramen and sushi . traditional japanese sweet are known a wagashi . ingredient such a red bean paste and mochi are used . more modern-day taste includes green tea ice cream . </s> popular japanese beverage include sake , which is a brewed rice beverage that typically contains <year> % alcohol and is made by multiple fermentation of rice . beer ha been brewed in japan since the late <number> century . green tea is produced in japan and prepared in form such a matcha , used in the japanese tea ceremony . </s> <section_title_start> medium <section_title_end> </s> according to the <year> nhk survey on television viewing in japan , <number> percent of japanese watch television daily . japanese television drama are viewed both within japan and internationally ; other popular show are in the genre of japanese variety show , comedy , and news program . japanese newspaper are among the most circulated in the world . </s> japan ha one of the oldest and largest film industry globally . ishir honda 's godzilla ( <year> film ) became an international icon of japan and spawned an entire subgenre of kaiju film , a well a the longest-running film franchise in history . japanese animated film and television series , known a anime , were largely influenced by japanese manga and have been extensively popular in the west . japan is a world-renowned powerhouse of animation . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> traditionally , sumo is considered japan 's national sport . woman 's world cup in <year> . golf is also popular in japan . </s> in motorsport , japanese automotive manufacturer have been successful in multiple different category , with title and victory in championship and the weathertech sportscar championship . three japanese driver have achieved podium finish in formula one , and driver from japan have victory at the indianapolis <number> and the
