nation </s> category : northeast asian country </s> category : transcontinental country <article_end> <article_start> <article_end> <article_start> </s> grenada ( ; grenadian creole french : gwenad ) is a country in the west indie in the caribbean sea at the southern end of the grenadine island chain . grenada consists of the island of grenada itself , two smaller island , carriacou and petite martinique , and several small island which lie to the north of the main island and are a part of the grenadine . it is located northwest of trinidad and tobago , northeast of venezuela and southwest of saint vincent and the grenadine . it size is , and it had an estimated population of <number> in july <year> . it capital is st. george 's , grenada st. george 's . grenada is also known a the `` island of spice `` due to it production of nutmeg and mace ( spice ) crop . </s> before the european colonization of the america , grenada wa inhabited by the indigenous people of the america arawak and later by the island carib . christopher columbus sighted grenada in <year> during his voyage of christopher columbus to the america . although it wa deemed the property of the monarchy of spain , there are no record to suggest the spanish ever landed or settled on the island . following several unsuccessful attempt by european to colonise the island due to resistance from the island carib , french colonial empire settlement and colonisation began in <year> and continued for the next century . on <number> february <year> , grenada wa ceded to the british empire under the treaty of paris ( <year> ) . british rule continued until <year> ( except for a capture of grenada ( <year> ) between <year> and <year> ) . from <year> to <year> grenada wa part of the federation of the west indie , a short-lived federation of british west indie . on <number> march <year> , it wa granted full autonomy over it internal affair a an associated state . </s> independence wa granted on <number> february <year> under the leadership of eric gairy , who became the first list of head of government of grenada of the sovereign state . the new country became a member of the commonwealth , with queen elizabeth a head of state . in march <year> , the marxismleninism marxistleninist new jewel movement overthrew gairy 's government in a bloodless coup bloodless coup d'tat and established the people 's revolutionary government ( grenada ) people 's revolutionary government ( prg ) , headed by maurice bishop a prime minister . bishop wa later arrested and executed by member of the people 's revolutionary army , prompting a united state invasion of grenada u.s.-led invasion in october <year> . since then , democratic governance ha been restored and the island ha remained politically stable . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the origin of the name `` grenada `` is obscure , but it is likely that spanish sailor named the island for the andalusian city of granada . it carried at least two other name during the age of discovery . </s> on his voyage of christopher columbus to the region in <year> , christopher columbus sighted grenada and named it `` la concepcin `` in honour of the mary , mother of jesus . it is said that he may have actually named it `` assumpcin `` , but it is uncertain , a he is said to have sighted what are now grenada and tobago from a distance and named them both at the same time . however , it became accepted that he named tobago `` assumpcin `` and grenada `` la concepcin `` . </s> in <year> , the italian explorer amerigo vespucci traveled through the region with the spanish explorer alonso de ojeda and mapmaker juan de la cosa . vespucci is reported to have renamed the island `` mayo `` , although this is the only map where the name appears . </s> however , by the <year> , spanish map used the name `` granada `` , and referred to the island to the north a los granadillo ( `` little granada `` ) . although it wa deemed the property of the monarchy of spain , there are no record to suggest the spanish ever attempted to settle grenada . </s> the french maintained the name ( `` la grenade `` in french ) after settlement and colonisation in <year> . on <number> february <year> , the island of la grenade wa ceded to the british under the treaty of paris ( <year> ) . the british renamed it `` grenada `` , one of many place-name anglicisation they made there . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-columbian history <section_title_end> </s> grenada wa first populated by people from south america , possibly during the caribbean ortoiroid people , although definitive evidence is lacking . the earliest potential human presence come from proxy ( statistic ) evidence of lake core , beginning ~3600 bc . le ephemeral , permanent village began around ~ad <number> . the population peaked between ad <number> , with major change in population afterwards , potentially the result of regional drought and/or the island carib `` carib invasion `` , although the latter rest on highly circumstantial evidence . </s> <section_title_start> european arrival <section_title_end> </s> it is thought that christopher columbus wa the first european to see grenada in <year> during his voyage of christopher columbus , naming it 'concepcin ' . the spanish did not follow up on this and it wa the english who were the first to attempt to colonise the island in <year> ; however they were driven away by the native carib people . </s> <section_title_start> french colony ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> in <year> a french expedition of <number> men from martinique led by jacques dyel du parquet founded a permanent settlement on grenada . they signed a peace treaty with the carib chief chief kairouane , but within month conflict broke out between the two community . this lasted until <year> when the island wa completely subjugated by the french . the indigenous people who survived either left for neighbouring island or retreated to remoter part of grenada , where they ultimately disappeared during the <year> . warfare continued during the <year> between the french on grenada and the carib of present-day dominica and st. vincent and the grenadine . </s> the french named their french colonial empire la grenade , and the economy wa initially based on sugar cane and indigo , worked by african slave . the french established a capital known a st george 's , grenada ( later st. george 's ) . to shelter from hurricane the french navy would often take refuge in the capital 's natural harbour , a no nearby french island had a natural harbour to compare with that of fort royal . the british captured grenada during the seven year ' war in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> british colonial period <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> early colonial period <section_title_end> </s> grenada wa formally ceded to kingdom of great britain by the treaty of paris ( <year> ) in <year> . the french french capture of grenada <year> re-captured the island during the american revolutionary war , after comte d'estaing won the bloody land and naval battle of grenada in july <year> . however the island wa restored to britain with the peace of paris ( <year> ) in <year> . a decade later dissatisfaction with british rule led to a fdon rebellion pro-french revolt in <year> <number> led by julien fdon , which wa successfully defeated by the british . </s> a grenada 's economy grew , more and more african slave were forcibly transported to the island . britain eventually outlawed the slave trade within the british empire in <year> , and slavery wa outlawed completely in <year> . in an effort to ameliorate the subsequent labour shortage , migrant from india were brought to grenada in <year> . </s> nutmeg wa introduced to grenada in <year> when a merchant ship called in on it way to england from the east indie . the ship had a small quantity of nutmeg tree on board which they left in grenada , and this wa the beginning of grenada 's nutmeg industry that now supply nearly <number> of the world 's annual crop . </s> <section_title_start> later colonial period <section_title_end> </s> in <year> grenada wa made a crown colony . theophilus a. marryshow founded the representative government association ( rga ) in <year> to agitate for a new and participative constitutional dispensation for the grenadian people . partly a a result of marryshow 's lobbying , the wood commission of <year> <number> concluded that grenada wa ready for constitutional reform in the form of a modified crown colony government . this modification granted grenadian the right to elect five of the <number> member of the legislative council , on a restricted property franchise enabling the wealthiest <number> of adult grenadian to vote . marryshow wa named a <year> birthday honour # commander of the order of the british empire ( cbe ) commander of the order of the british empire ( cbe ) in <year> . </s> in <year> eric gairy founded the grenada united labour party ( gulp ) , initially a a trade union , which led the <year> general strike for better working condition . this sparked great unrestso many building were set ablaze that the disturbance became known a the `` red sky `` daysand the british authority decided to call in military reinforcement to help regain control of the situation . on <number> october <year> , grenada held it <year> grenadian general election on the basis of universal adult suffrage , with gairy 's party winning six of the eight seat contested . </s> from <year> to <year> grenada wa part of the federation of the west indie . after the federation 's collapse grenada wa granted full autonomy over it internal affair a an associated state on <number> march <year> . herbert blaize of the grenada national party ( gnp ) wa the first premier of the associated state of grenada from march to august <year> . eric gairy served a premier of grenada # premier of associated state of grenada ( <year> ) from august <year> until february <year> . </s> <section_title_start> post-independence era <section_title_end> </s> independence wa granted on <number> february <year> , under the leadership of eric gairy , who became the first prime minister of grenada . grenada opted to remain within the british commonwealth , retaining queen elizabeth a monarchy of grenada , represented locally by a governor-general of grenada governor-general . civil conflict gradually broke out between eric gairy 's government and some opposition party , including the marxist new jewel movement ( njm ) . gairy and the gulp won the <year> grenadian general election , albeit with an reduced majority ; however the opposition deemed the result invalid due to fraud and the violent intimidation performed by the so-called 'mongoose gang ' , a private militia loyal to gairy . </s> on <number> march <year> , whilst gairy wa out of the country , the njm launched a bloodless coup which removed gairy , suspended the constitution , and established a people 's revolutionary government ( prg ) , headed by maurice bishop who declared himself prime minister . his marxismleninism marxistleninist government established close tie with cuba , nicaragua , and other communist bloc country . all political party except for the new jewel movement were banned and no election were held during the four year of prg rule . </s> <section_title_start> invasion by the united state ( <year> ) <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> coup and execution of maurice bishop <section_title_end> </s> some year later a dispute developed between bishop and certain high-ranking member of the njm . though bishop cooperated with cuba and the ussr on various trade and foreign policy issue , he sought to maintain a `` non-aligned `` status . bishop had been taking his time making grenada wholly socialist , simultaneously encouraging private-sector development in an attempt to make the island a popular tourist destination . hardline marxist party member , including communist deputy prime minister bernard coard , deemed bishop insufficiently revolutionary and demanded that he either step down or enter into a power-sharing arrangement . </s> on <number> october <year> bernard coard and his wife , phyllis , backed by the grenadian army , led a coup against the government of maurice bishop and placed bishop under [ arrest ] . these action led to street demonstration in various part of the island because bishop had widespread support from the population . because bishop wa a widely popular leader , he wa freed by impassioned supporter who marched en masse on his guarded residence from a rally in the capital 's central square . bishop then led the crowd to the island 's military headquarters to reassert his power . grenadian soldier were dispatched in armored vehicle by the coard faction to retake the fort . a confrontation between soldier and civilian at the fort ended in gunfire and panic . three soldier and at least eight civilian died in the tumult that also injured <number> others , a school-sponsored study later found . when the initial shooting ended with bishop 's surrender , he and seven of his closest supporter were taken prisoner and executed by a firing squad of soldier . besides bishop , the group included three of his cabinet minister , a trade union leader and three service-industry worker . </s> after the execution of bishop , the people 's revolutionary army ( grenada ) people 's revolutionary army ( pra ) formed a military marxist government with general hudson austin a chairman . the army declared a four-day total curfew , during which anyone leaving their home without approval would be shot on sight . </s> <section_title_start> united state and allied response and reaction <section_title_end> </s> the overthrow of a moderately socialist government by one which wa strongly pro-communist concerned the administration of u president ronald reagan . reagan also claimed that particularly worrying wa the presence of cuban construction worker and military personnel building a point saline international airport on grenada . bishop had stated the purpose of the airstrip wa to allow commercial jet to land , but some u military analyst argued that the only reason for constructing such a long and reinforced runway wa so that it could be used by heavy military transport plane . the contractor , american and european company , and the european economic community , which provided partial funding , all claimed the airstrip did not have military capability . reagan claimed that cuba , under the direction of the soviet union , would use grenada a a refuelling stop for cuban and soviet airplane loaded with weapon destined for central american communist insurgent . </s> on <number> october <year> , combined force from the united state and from the regional security system ( r ) based in barbados invaded grenada in an operation codenamed invasion of grenada . the u stated this wa done at the behest of the government of barbados and dominica and the governor-general of grenada , paul scoon . progress wa rapid and within four day the american had removed the military government of hudson austin . </s> the invasion wa heavily criticized by the government of britain , trinidad and tobago , and canada . the united nation general assembly condemned it a `` a flagrant violation of international law `` by a vote of <number> in favor to <number> , with <number> abstention . the united nation security council considered a similar resolution , which wa supported by <number> nation . however , the united state vetoed the motion . </s> <section_title_start> post-invasion arrests <section_title_end> </s> after the invasion , the pre-revolutionary grenadian constitution came into operation once again . eighteen member of the prg/pra were arrested on charge related to the murder of maurice bishop and seven others . the <number> included the top political leadership of grenada at the time of the execution , along with the entire military chain of command directly responsible for the operation that led to the execution . fourteen were capital punishment , one wa found not guilty , and three were sentenced to <number> year in prison . the death sentence were eventually commuted to term of imprisonment . those in prison have become known a 'the grenada <number> ' . </s> <section_title_start> grenada since <year> <section_title_end> </s> when u troop withdrew from grenada in december <year> , nicholas brathwaite of the national democratic congress ( grenada ) wa appointed prime minister of an interim administration by governor-general scoon until election could be organised . the first democratic election since <year> were <year> grenadian general election , and were won by the grenada national party under herbert blaize , who served a prime minister until his death in december <year> . </s> ben jones ( grenada ) briefly succeeded blaize a prime minister and served until the <year> grenadian general election , which wa won by the national democratic congress under nicholas brathwaite who returned a prime minister for a second time until he resigned in february <year> . he wa succeeded by george brizan who served for a brief period until the <year> grenadian general election which wa won by the new national party ( grenada ) under keith mitchell , who went on to win the <year> grenadian general election and <year> election , serving for a record <number> year until <year> . mitchell re-established relation with cuba and also reformed the country 's banking system , which had come in for criticism over potential money laundering concern . </s> in <year> <number> , much of the controversy of the late <year> and early <year> wa once again brought into the public consciousness with the opening of the truth and reconciliation commission . the commission wa chaired by a holy order , father mark haynes , and wa tasked with uncovering injustice arising from the pra , bishop 's regime , and before . it held a number of hearing around the country . brother robert fanovich , head of presentation brother ' college ( pbc ) in st. george 's tasked some of his senior student with conducting a research project into the era and specifically into the fact that maurice bishop 's body wa never discovered . paterson also uncovered that there wa still a lot of resentment in grenadian society resulting from the era and a feeling that there were many injustice still unaddressed . </s> on <number> september <year> , after being hurricane-free for <number> year , the island wa directly hit by hurricane ivan . ivan struck a a saffir-simpson hurricane scale , resulting in <number> death and damage or destruction to <number> of the island 's home . on <number> july <year> , hurricane emily ( <year> ) , a category <number> hurricane at the time , struck the northern part of the island with wind , killing one person and causing an estimated usd $ <number> ; million ( ec $ <number> ; million ) worth of damage . agriculture , and in particular the nutmeg industry , suffered serious loss , but that event ha begun change in crop management and it is hoped that a new nutmeg tree gradually mature , the industry will gradually rebuild . </s> mitchell wa defeated in the <year> grenadian general election by the ndc under tillman thomas , however he won the <year> grenadian general election by a landslide and the nnp returned to power , winning again by another landslide <year> grenadian general election . in march <year> , <year> coronavirus pandemic in grenada grenada confirmed it first case of covid-19 , of which the economic effect are expected to rival past downturn , including hurricane ivan . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> the island of grenada is the southernmost island in the antilles archipelago , bordering the eastern caribbean sea and western atlantic ocean , and roughly north of both venezuela and trinidad and tobago . it sister island make up the southern section of the grenadine , which include carriacou , petite martinique , ronde island , caille island , diamond island ( grenadine ) , large island , saline island , and frigate island ( grenadine ) ; the remaining island to the north belong to st vincent and the grenadine . most of the population life on grenada , and major town there include the capital , st. george 's , grenada st. george 's , grenville , grenada and gouyave . the largest settlement on the sister island is hillsborough , grenada on carriacou . </s> grenada is of volcanic origin , a evident in it soil , mountainous interior , and several explosion crater , including lake antoine , grenada , grand etang lake and levera pond . grenada 's highest point is mount saint catherine ( grenada ) mount st. catherine , rising to above sea level . other major mountain include mount granby and south east mountain . several small river with waterfall flow into the sea from these mountain . the coastline contains several bay , most notably on the southern coast which is split into numerous thin peninsula . </s> grenada is home to four ecoregions : windward island moist forest , leeward island dry forest , windward island dry forest , and windward island xeric scrub . it had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the climate is tropical : hot and humid in the dry season and cooled by the moderate rain fall in the wet season . grenada , being on the southern edge of the [ belt ] , ha suffered only three hurricane in fifty year . </s> hurricane janet passed over grenada on <number> september <year> , with wind of , causing severe damage . the most recent storm to hit have been hurricane ivan on <number> september <year> , causing severe damage and thirty-nine death , and hurricane emily on <number> july <year> , causing serious damage in carriacou and in the north of grenada , which had been relatively lightly affected by hurricane ivan . </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> grenada is a commonwealth realm with queen elizabeth ii a [ of state ] , represented locally by a list of governors-general of grenada governor-general . executive ( government ) lie with the head of government , the prime minister of grenada . the governor-general role is largely ceremonial , while the prime minister is usually the leader of the largest party in parliament of grenada . </s> the parliament of grenada consists of a senate ( <number> member ) and a house of representative ( <number> member ) . senator are appointed by the government and the opposition , while the representative are elected by the population for five-year term . grenada operates a multi-party system , with the largest party being the center-right new national party ( grenada ) ( nnp ) and the center-left national democratic congress ( grenada ) ( ndc ) . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relations <section_title_end> </s> grenada is a full and participating member of both the caribbean community ( caricom ) and the organisation of eastern caribbean state ( oecs ) . </s> <section_title_start> the commonwealth <section_title_end> </s> grenada is , along with much of the caribbean region , a member of the commonwealth of nation . the organization , which primarily consists of former british colony , focus on fostering international relation between it member . </s> <section_title_start> organization of american state ( oas ) <section_title_end> </s> grenada is one of the <number> state which ha ratified the organization of american state charter and is a member of the organization . grenada entered into the inter-american system in <year> according to the oas 's website . </s> <section_title_start> double taxation relief ( caricom ) treaty <section_title_end> </s> on <number> july <year> at lloyd erskine sandiford centre in st. michael , barbados , george brizan signed the double taxation relief ( caricom ) treaty on behalf of the government of grenada . this treaty covered concept such a tax , residence , tax jurisdiction , capital gain , business profit , interest , dividend , royalty and other area . </s> <section_title_start> fatca <section_title_end> </s> on <number> june <year> , grenada signed a model <number> agreement with the united state of america in relation to foreign account tax compliance act ( fatca ) . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> grenada ha no standing military , leaving typical military function to the royal grenada police force ( including a special service unit ) and the coast guard of grenada . </s> in <year> , grenada signed the un treaty on the treaty on the prohibition of nuclear weapon . </s> <section_title_start> administrative divisions <section_title_end> </s> grenada is divided into parish of grenada : carriacou and petite martinique ( not pictured ) have the status of a dependency . </s> <section_title_start> human rights <section_title_end> </s> male homosexuality is illegal in grenada and punishable by prison time . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> grenada ha a small economy in which tourism is the major foreign exchange market earner . major short-term concern are the rising government budget deficit and the deterioration in the external account balance . grenada share a common central bank and a common currency ( the east caribbean dollar ) with seven other member of the organisation of eastern caribbean state ( oecs ) . </s> grenada ha suffered from a heavy external debt problem , with government debt service payment running at about <number> of total revenue in <year> ; grenada wa listed a ninth from bottom in a study of <number> developing country . </s> <section_title_start> agriculture and exports <section_title_end> </s> grenada is an exporter of several different spice , most notably nutmeg , it top export and depicted on the national flag , and mace ( spice ) . other major export include banana , cocoa , fruit and vegetable , clothing , chocolate and fish . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> tourism is the mainstay of grenada 's economy . conventional beach and water-sports tourism is largely focused in the southwest region around st george , the airport and the coastal strip . ecotourism is growing in significance . most small ecofriendly guesthouse are located in the saint david parish , grenada and saint john parish , grenada parish . the tourism industry is increasing dramatically with the construction of a large cruise ship pier and esplanade . </s> tourism is concentrated in the southwest of the island , around st. george 's , grand anse , lance aux epines , and point saline . grenada ha many beach around it coastline , including the long grand anse beach in st george , often hailed a one of the best beach in the world . grenada 's many waterfall are also popular with tourist . the nearest to st. george 's is the annandale waterfall , but other notable one like mt . carmel , concord , seven sister and tufton hall also being within easy reach . </s> several festival also draw in tourist , such a carriacou maroon and string band music festival in april , the annual budget marine spice island bill fish tournament , the island water world sailing week and the grenada sailing festival work boat regatta . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> education in grenada consists of kindergarten , pre-primary school , primary school , secondary school and tertiary education . the government ha prioritised education , spending <number> of it budget to the sector in <year> , the third highest rate in the world . literacy rate are very high , with <number> of the population being able to read and write . school include : </s> <section_title_start> primary school <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> secondary school <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> tertiary education <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> maurice bishop international airport is the country 's main airport , connecting the country with other caribbean island , the united state , canada , and europe . there is also an airport on carriacou . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> a majority of grenadian ( <number> ) are descendant of the atlantic slave trade . few of the indigenous carib and arawak population survived the french purge at sauteurs . a small percentage of descendant of indentured worker from india were brought to grenada between <year> and <year> , predominantly from the state of bihar and uttar pradesh . today , grenadian of indian descent constitute <number> of the population . there is also a small community of french and english descendant . the rest of the population is of mixed descent ( <number> ) . </s> grenada , like many of the caribbean island , is subject to a large amount of out-migration , with a large number of young people seeking more prospect abroad . popular migration point for grenadian include more prosperous island in the caribbean ( such a barbados ) , north american city ( such a new york city , toronto and montreal ) , the united kingdom ( in particular , london and yorkshire ; see grenadian british ) and australia . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> figure are <year> estimate </s> * protestant <number> ; includes </s> * * pentecostalism <number> </s> * * seventh-day adventist church <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> english is the country 's official language but the main spoken language is either of two creole language ( grenadian creole english and , le frequently , grenadian creole french ) ( sometimes called 'patois ' ) which reflects the african , european , and native heritage of the nation . the creole contain element from a variety of african language , french and english . grenadian creole french is mainly spoken in smaller rural area . </s> some hindi/bhojpuri term are still spoken amongst the indo-grenadian community descendant . </s> the indigenous language were ieri language and karina language ( carib ) . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> island culture is heavily influenced by the ethnic group of africa root of most of the grenadian , coupled with the country 's long experience of colonial rule under the british . although french influence on grenadian culture is much le visible than on some other caribbean island , surname and place name in french remain , and the everyday language is laced with french word and the local creole , or patois . stronger french influence is found in the well seasoned spice and style of cooking similar to those found in new orleans , and some french architecture ha survived from the <year> . indian and island carib influence is also seen , especially in the island 's cuisine . </s> oil down , a stew , is considered to be the national dish . the name refers to a dish cooked in coconut milk until all the milk is absorbed , leaving a bit of coconut oil in the bottom of the pot . early recipe call for a mixture of salted pigtail , pig 's foot ( trotter ) , salt beef and chicken , dumpling made from flour , and provision like breadfruit , green banana , yam and potato . callaloo leaf are sometimes used to retain the steam and add extra flavour . </s> soca music , calypso music , and reggae are popular music genre and are played at grenada 's annual carnival . over the year rap music became popular amongst grenadian youth , and there have been numerous young rapper emerging in the island 's underground rap scene . zouk ( musical movement ) is also being slowly introduced onto the island . </s> an important aspect of the grenadian culture is the tradition of storytelling , with folklore bearing both african and french influence . the character , anansi , a spider who is a trickster , originated in west africa and is prevalent on other island a well . french influence can be seen in la diablesse , a well-dressed she-devil , and loogaroo ( from `` loup-garou `` ) , a werewolf . </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> olympics <section_title_end> </s> grenada ha competed in every summer olympics since the <year> summer olympics in los angeles . kirani james won the first olympic gold medal for grenada in the athletics at the <year> summer olympics men 's <number> metre men 's <number> meter in <year> summer olympics in london and silver in <year> summer olympics . </s> <section_title_start> cricket <section_title_end> </s> a with other island from the caribbean , cricket is the national and most popular sport and is an intrinsic part of grenadian culture . the grenada national cricket team form a part of the windward island cricket team in regional domestic cricket , however it play a a separate entity in minor regional match , a well a having previously played twenty20 cricket in the stanford <number>/20 . </s> the grenada national cricket stadium in st. george 's , grenada st. george 's host domestic and international cricket match . devon smith , west indie record holder to win the list-a cricket list-a west indian wicb cup for the second time , wa born in the small town of hermitage ( carriacou ) . </s> in april <year> grenada jointly hosted ( along with several other caribbean nation ) the <year> cricket world cup . the island 's prime minister wa the caricom representative on cricket and wa instrumental in having the world cup game brought to the region . after hurricane ivan , the government of the people 's republic of china ( prc ) paid for the new $ <number> ; million queen 's park , grenada and provided the aid of over <number> labourer to build and repair it . during the opening ceremony , the anthem of the republic of china ( roc , taiwan ) wa accidentally played instead of the prc 's anthem , leading to the firing of top official . </s> <section_title_start> notable people <section_title_end> </s> * sydney gun-munro , first establishment in north america </s> category : country in north america <article_end> <article_start> </s> spain ( espaa , ) , officially the kingdom of spain ( reino de espaa links=no ) , is a country in southwestern europe with some pocket of territory across the strait of gibraltar and the atlantic ocean . it continental european territory is situated on the iberian peninsula . it territory also includes two archipelago : the canary island off the coast of north africa , and the balearic island in the mediterranean sea . the african exclaves of ceuta , melilla , and pen de vlez de la gomera make spain the only european country to have a physical border with an african country ( morocco ) . plaza de soberana in the alboran sea are also part of spanish territory . peninsular spain the country 's mainland is bordered to the south and east by the mediterranean sea ; to the north and northeast by france , andorra , and the bay of biscay ; and to the west and northwest by portugal and the atlantic ocean respectively . </s> with an area of , spain is the largest country in southern europe , the second-largest country in western europe and the european union , and the list of european country by area fourth-largest country by area on the europe . with a population exceeding <number> million , spain is the list of european country by population sixth-most populous country in europe , and the member state of the european union # list fourth-most populous country in the european union . spain 's capital and largest city is madrid ; other major list of metropolitan area in spain include barcelona , valencia , seville , zaragoza , mlaga , and bilbao . </s> modern human first arrived in the iberian peninsula around <number> year ago . various culture developed alongside phoenician , ancient greece , celt and carthaginian iberia migration and settlement . the roman conquered the region around <number> bc , naming it hispania , after the earlier phoenician name , sp ( a ) n or spania . spain remained under roman rule until fall of the western roman empire in the fourth century , which ushered in germanic people tribal confederation from central europe . the visigoth emerged a the dominant faction by the fifth century , with visigothic kingdom spanning much of the peninsula . </s> in the early eighth century , the visigothic kingdom wa conquered by the umayyad caliphate , ushering over <number> year of al-andalus muslim rule . islamic spain became a major economic and intellectual center , with the city of cordoba being among the largest and richest in europe . several christian kingdom emerged in the northern periphery of iberia , chief among them kingdom of len , kingdom of castile , kingdom of aragon , kingdom of portugal and kingdom of navarre . over the next seven century , an intermittent southward expansion of these kingdomsmetahistorically framed a a reconquest , or reconquista reconquistaculminated with the christian seizure of the last muslim polity , the emirate of granada , in <year> . that same year , christopher columbus arrived in the new world on behalf of the catholic monarch , whose dynastic union of castile and aragon is sometimes considered the emergence spain a a unified country . from the <number> until the early <number> century , spain ruled spanish empire , which wa among the first list of largest empire ; it immense cultural and linguistic legacy includes over <number> million hispanophones , making spanish the world 's list of language by number of native speaker second-most spoken native language , after mandarin chinese . spain host the world 's list of world heritage site in spain third-largest number of unesco world heritage site . </s> spain is a secular state parliamentary democracy and a constitutional monarchy , with king felipe vi of spain a [ of state ] . it is a highly developed country and a [ income country ] , with the world 's list of country by gdp ( nominal ) fourteenth-largest economy by nominal gdp and the list of country by gdp ( ppp ) sixteenth-largest by ppp . spain is a member of the united nation ( un ) , the european union ( eu ) , the eurozone , the council of europe ( coe ) , the organization of ibero-american state ( oei ) , the union for the mediterranean , the north atlantic treaty organization ( nato ) , the organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) , organization for security and co-operation in europe ( osce ) , the schengen area , the world trade organization ( wto ) and many other international organisation . while not an official member , spain ha a `` permanent invitation `` to the g20 summit , participating in every summit , which make it a de facto member of the group . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the origin of the roman empire name hispania , and the modern espaa , are uncertain , although the phoenician and carthaginian referred to the region a spania , therefore the most widely accepted etymology is a semitic languages-phoenician language one . there have been a number of account and hypothesis of it origin : </s> the renaissance scholar antonio de nebrija proposed that the word hispania evolved from the iberian language word hispalis , meaning `` city of the western world `` . </s> argued that the root of the term span is the phoenician language word spy , meaning `` to forge metal `` . therefore , i-spn-ya would mean `` the land where metal are forged `` . it may be a derivation of the phoenician i-shpania , meaning `` island of rabbit `` , `` land of rabbit `` or `` edge `` , a reference to spain 's location at the end of the mediterranean ; roman coin struck in the region from the reign of hadrian show a female figure with a rabbit at her foot , and strabo called it the `` land of the rabbit `` . the word in question ( compare modern hebrew shafan ) actually mean `` hyrax `` , possibly due to phoenician confusing the two animal . </s> hispania may derive from the poetic use of the term hesperia ( mythology ) , reflecting the ancient greece perception of italy a a `` western land `` or `` land of the setting sun `` ( hesperia , in greek language ) and spain , being still further west , a hesperia ultima . </s> there is the claim that `` hispania `` derives from the basque language word ezpanna meaning `` edge `` or `` border `` , another reference to the fact that the iberian peninsula constitutes the southwest corner of the european continent . </s> two <number>-century spanish jewish scholar , isaac abravanel and solomon ibn verga , gave an explanation now considered folkloric . both men wrote in two different published work that the first jew to reach spain were brought by ship by phiros who wa confederate with the king of babylon when he laid siege to jerusalem . phiros wa a greek by birth , but who had been given a kingdom in spain . phiros became related by marriage to espan , the nephew of king heracles , who also ruled over a kingdom in spain . heracles later renounced his throne in preference for his native greece , leaving his kingdom to his nephew , espan , from whom the country of espaa ( spain ) took it name . based upon their testimony , this eponym would have already been in use in spain by c. <number> bce . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> iberia enters written record a a land populated largely by the iberian , basque and celt . early on it coastal area were settled by phoenician who founded western europe 's most ancient city cdiz and mlaga . phoenician influence expanded a much of the peninsula wa eventually incorporated into the carthaginian empire , becoming a major theatre of the punic war against the expanding roman empire . after an roman conquest of hispania , the peninsula came fully under hispania . during the early middle age it came under visigothic kingdom rule , and then much of it wa conquered by muslim invader from north africa . in a reconquista , the small christian kingdom in the north gradually regained control of the peninsula . the last muslim state fall of granada , the same year columbus reached the america . a spanish empire began which saw spain become the strongest kingdom in europe , the leading world power for one and a half century , and the largest overseas empire for three century . </s> continued war and other problem eventually led to a diminished status . the peninsular war led to chaos , triggering independence movement that tore apart most of the empire and left the country politically unstable . spain suffered a devastating spanish civil war in the <year> and then came under the rule of an francoist spain , which oversaw a period of stagnation that wa followed by a surge in the growth of the economy . eventually , democracy wa spanish transition to democracy in the form of a parliamentary constitutional monarchy . spain joined the european union , experiencing a cultural renaissance and steady economic growth until the beginning of the <number> century , that started a new globalised world with economic and ecological challenge . </s> <section_title_start> prehistory and pre-roman people <section_title_end> </s> archaeological research at archaeological site of atapuerca indicates the iberian peninsula wa populated by [ <number> ; million year ago . in atapuerca mountain atapuerca ] fossil have been found of the earliest known [ in europe , the [ [ homo antecessor ] . modern human first arrived in iberia , from the north on foot , about <number> year ago . the best known artefact of these prehistoric human settlement are the famous painting in the [ [ altamira ( cave ) of cantabria in northern iberia , which were created from <number> to <number> before common era by cro-magnon . archaeological and genetic evidence suggests that the iberian peninsula acted a one of several major refugia from which northern europe wa repopulated following the end of the quaternary glaciation . </s> the largest group inhabiting the iberian peninsula before the roman conquest were the iberian and the celt . the iberian inhabited the mediterranean side of the peninsula , from the northeast to the southeast . the celt inhabited much of the inner and atlantic side of the peninsula , from the northwest to the southwest . basque people occupied the western area of the pyrenees mountain range and adjacent area , the phoenician-influenced tartessos culture flourished in the southwest and the lusitanians and vettones occupied area in the central west . several city were founded along the coast by phoenician , and trading outpost and colony were established by greek colony in the east . eventually , phoenician-carthaginians expanded inland towards the meseta ; however , due to the bellicose inland tribe , the carthaginian got settled in the coast of the iberian peninsula . </s> <section_title_start> roman hispania and the visigothic kingdom <section_title_end> </s> during the second punic war , roughly between <number> and <number> ; bc the expanding roman republic captured carthaginian trading colony along the mediterranean coast . although it took the roman nearly two century to complete the roman conquest of the iberian peninsula , they retained control of it for over six century . roman rule wa bound together by law , language , and the roman road . </s> the culture of the celtic and iberian population were gradually romanization of hispania ( latinised ) at different rate depending on what part of hispania baetica they lived in , with local leader being admitted into the roman aristocratic class . hispania served a a granary for the roman market , and it harbour exported gold , wool , olive oil , and wine . agricultural production increased with the introduction of irrigation project , some of which remain in use . emperor hadrian , trajan , theodosius i , and the philosopher seneca the younger were born in hispania . christianity wa introduced into hispania in the <number> century ad and it became popular in the city in the <number> century ad . most of spain 's present language and religion , and the basis of it law , originate from this period . </s> the weakening of the western roman empire 's jurisdiction in hispania began in <number> , when the germanic people suebi and vandal , together with the sarmatian alans entered the peninsula at the invitation of a roman usurper . these tribe had crossed the rhine in early <number> and ravaged gaul . the suebi established a kingdom in what is today modern galicia ( spain ) and northern portugal whereas the vandal established themselves in southern spain by <number> before crossing over to north africa in <number> and battle of carthage ( <number> ) carthage in <number> . a the western empire disintegrated , the social and economic base became greatly simplified : but even in modified form , the successor regime maintained many of the institution and law of the late empire , including christianity and assimilation to the evolving roman culture . </s> the byzantine established an occidental province , spania , in the south , with the intention of reviving roman rule throughout iberia . eventually , however , hispania wa reunited under visigothic kingdom . these visigoth , or western goth , after sack of rome ( <number> ) under the leadership of alaric i ( <number> ) , turned towards the iberian peninsula , with athaulf for their leader , and occupied the northeastern portion . wallia extended his rule over most of the peninsula , keeping the suebians shut up in galicia . theodoric i took part , with the roman and frank , in the battle of the catalaunian plain , where attila wa routed . euric ( <number> ) , who put an end to the last remnant of roman power in the peninsula , may be considered the first monarch of spain , though the suebians still maintained their independence in galicia . euric wa also the first king to give written law to the visigoth . in the following reign the catholic king of france assumed the role of protector of the hispano-roman catholic against the arianism of the visigoth , and in the franco-visigothic war which ensued alaric ii and amalaric lost their life . </s> athanagild , having risen against king agila , called in the byzantine and , in payment for the succour they gave him , ceded to them the maritime place of the southeast ( <number> ) . liuvigild restored the political unity of the peninsula , subduing the suebians , but the religious division of the country , reaching even the royal family , brought on a civil war . st. hermengild , the king 's son , putting himself at the head of the catholic , wa defeated and taken prisoner , and suffered martyrdom for rejecting communion with the arians . recared , son of liuvigild and brother of st. hermengild , added religious unity to the political unity achieved by his father , accepting the catholic faith in the third council of toledo ( <number> ) . the religious unity established by this council wa the basis of that fusion of goth with hispano-romans which produced the spanish nation . sisebut and suintila completed the expulsion of the byzantine from spain . </s> intermarriage between visigoth and hispano-romans wa prohibited , though in practice it could not be entirely prevented and wa eventually legalised by liuvigild . the spanish-gothic scholar such a braulio of zaragoza and isidore of seville played an important role in keeping the classical greco-roman world . isidore wa one of the most influential cleric and philosopher in the middle age in europe , and his theory were also vital to the conversion of the visigothic kingdom from an arianism domain to a catholic one in the council of toledo . isidore created the first western etymologiae which had a huge impact during the middle age . </s> <section_title_start> muslim era and reconquista <section_title_end> </s> in the <number> century , nearly all of the iberian peninsula wa umayyad conquest of hispania ( <year> <number> ) by largely moorish muslim army from north africa . these conquest were part of the expansion of the umayyad caliphate . only a small area in the mountainous north-west of the peninsula managed to resist the initial invasion . legend ha it that julian , count of ceuta , the governor of ceuta , in revenge for the violation of his daughter , florinda la cava , by king roderic , invited the muslim and opened to them the gate of the peninsula . </s> under sharia , christian and jew were given the subordinate status of dhimmi . this status permitted christian and jew to practice their religion a people of the book but they were required to pay a special tax and had legal and social right inferior to those of muslim . </s> conversion to islam proceeded at an increasing pace . the muwallad ( muslim of ethnic iberian peninsula origin ) are believed to have formed the majority of the population of al-andalus by the end of the <number> century . </s> the muslim community in the iberian peninsula wa itself diverse and beset by social tension . the berber people of north africa , who had provided the bulk of the invading army , berber revolt from the middle east . over time , large moorish population became established , especially in the guadalquivir river valley , the coastal plain of valencian community , the ebro river valley and ( towards the end of this period ) in the mountainous region of granada . </s> crdoba , spain , the capital of the caliphate since abd-ar-rahman iii , wa the largest , richest and most sophisticated city in western europe . mediterranean trade and cultural exchange flourished . muslim imported a rich intellectual tradition from the middle east and north africa . some important philosopher at the time were averroes , ibn arabi and maimonides . the romanisation ( cultural ) culture of the iberian peninsula interacted with muslim and jewish culture in complex way , giving the region a distinctive culture . outside the city , where the vast majority lived , the land ownership system from roman time remained largely intact a muslim leader rarely dispossessed landowner and the introduction of new crop and technique led to an expansion of agriculture introducing new produce which originally came from asia or the former territory of the roman empire . </s> in the <number> century , the muslim holding fractured into rival taifa state ( arab , berber , and slav ) , allowing the small christian state the opportunity to greatly enlarge their territory . the arrival from north africa of the islamic ruling sect of the almoravid and the almohads restored unity upon the muslim holding , with a stricter , le tolerant application of islam , and saw a revival in muslim fortune . this re-united islamic state experienced more than a century of success that partially reversed christian gain . </s> the reconquista ( reconquest ) wa the centuries-long period in which christian rule wa re-established over the iberian peninsula . the reconquista is viewed a beginning with the battle of covadonga won by pelagius of asturias in <number> and wa concurrent with the period of muslim rule on the iberian peninsula . the christian army 's victory over muslim force led to the creation of the christian kingdom of asturias along the northwestern coastal mountain . shortly after , in <number> , muslim force were driven from galicia ( spain ) , which wa to eventually host one of medieval europe 's holiest site , santiago de compostela and wa incorporated into the new christian kingdom . </s> the viking invaded galicia in <number> , but were heavily defeated by ramiro i of asturias at a corua . many of the viking ' casualty were caused by the galician ' ballista powerful torsion-powered projectile weapon that looked rather like giant crossbow . <number> viking ship were captured and burned . viking raided galicia in <number> , during the reign of ordoo i of asturias . ordoo wa at the moment engaged against his constant enemy the moor ; but a count of the province , don pedro , attacked the viking and defeated them . </s> the kingdom of len wa the strongest christian kingdom for century . in <year> the first modern parliamentary session in europe wa held in len ( spain ) ( cortes of len ) . the kingdom of castile , formed from leonese territory , wa it successor a strongest kingdom . the king and the nobility fought for power and influence in this period . the example of the roman emperor influenced the political objective of the crown , while the noble benefited from feudalism . </s> muslim army had also moved north of the pyrenees but they were defeated by frankish force at the battle of tour , francia and pushed out of the very southernmost region of france along the seacoast by the <number>s . later , frank force established marca hispanica on the southern side of the pyrenees . these area were to grow into the kingdom of kingdom of navarre and kingdom of aragon . for several century , the fluctuating frontier between the muslim and christian controlled area of iberia wa along the ebro and douro valley . </s> the transmission of the classic is the main islamic contribution to medieval europe . the old spanish languagemore commonly known ( especially later in history and at present ) a `` spanish `` after becoming the national language and lingua franca of spainevolved from vulgar latin , a did other romance language of spain like the old catalan , astur-leonese and galician-portuguese language , a well a other romance language in latin europe . basque language , the only mediterranean . by the middle decade of a war- and great plague of seville-ridden <number>-century europe , the spanish habsburg had enmeshed the country in continent-wide religious-political conflict . these conflict drained it of resource and undermined the economy generally . spain managed to hold on to most of the scattered habsburg monarchy , and help the imperial force of the holy roman during which it surrendered several small territory to france and england ; however , it maintained and enlarged it vast overseas empire , which remained intact until the beginning of the <number> century . </s> the decline culminated in a controversy over succession to the throne which consumed the first year of the <number> century . the war of the spanish succession wa a wide-ranging international conflict combined with a civil war , and wa to cost the kingdom it european possession and it position a one of the leading power on the continent . </s> during this war , a new dynasty originating in france , the house of bourbon , wa installed . long united only by the crown , a true spanish state wa established when the first bourbon king , philip v of spain , united the crown of castile and aragon into a single state , abolishing many of the old regional privilege and law . </s> the <number> century saw a gradual recovery and an increase in prosperity through much of the <section_title_start> civil war and francoist dictatorship <section_title_end> </s> the spanish civil war broke out in <year> : on <number> and <number> july , part of the military spanish coup of july <year> carried out a coup d'tat that triumphed in only part of the country . the situation led to a civil war , in which the territory wa divided into two zone : one republican faction ( spanish civil war ) , that counted on outside support from the soviet union and mexico ( and from foreign involvement in the spanish civil war # international brigade ) , and the other controlled by the putschists ( the nationalist faction ( spanish civil war ) ) , most critically supported by nazi germany and fascist italy ( <year> <number> ) . the republic wa not supported by the western power due to the british-led policy of non-intervention . general francisco franco wa sworn in a the supreme leader of the rebel on <number> october <year> . an uneasy relationship between the republican government and the grassroots anarchist who had initiated a partial spanish revolution of <year> also ensued . </s> the civil war wa viciously fought and there were spanish civil war # atrocity . the spanish civil war claimed the life of over <number> people and caused the flight of up to a half-million citizen from the country . on <number> april <year> , five month before the beginning of world war ii , the rebel side led by franco emerged victorious , imposing a dictatorship over the whole country . </s> the regime remained chiefly neutrality ( international relation ) `` neutral `` from a nominal standpoint in the second world war ( it briefly switched it position to `` non-belligerent `` ) , although it wa spain in world war ii to axis power and provided the nazi wehrmacht with blue division . the only legal party under franco 's dictatorship wa the falange espaola tradicionalista y de la jons ( fet y de la jons ) , formed in <year> upon the merging of the fascist falange espaola de la jons and the carlist traditionalist and to which the rest of right-wing group supporting the rebel also added . the name of `` movimiento nacional `` , sometimes understood a a wider structure than the fet y de la jons proper , largely imposed over the later 's name in official document along the <year> . </s> after world war ii spain wa politically and economically isolated , and wa kept out of the united nation . this changed in <year> , during the cold war period , when it became strategically important for the u to establish a military presence on the iberian peninsula a a counter to any possible move by the soviet union into the mediterranean basin . in the <year> , spain registered an spanish miracle which wa propelled by spanish miracle # industrialisation , a spanish
