covid-19 virus wa confirmed to have covid-19 pandemic in spain . on <number> march , the death toll in spain wa the second highest in the world . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> at , spain is the world 's list of country and outlying territory by area fifty-second largest country and area and population of european country europe 's fourth largest country . it is some smaller than france and larger than the u state of california . mount teide ( tenerife ) is the highest mountain peak in spain and is the third largest volcano in the world from it base . spain is a list of transcontinental country , having territory in both europe and africa . </s> spain lie between latitude <number> parallel north <number> and <number> parallel north <number> n , and longitude <number> meridian west <number> w and <number> meridian east <number> e. </s> on the west , spain is bordered by portugal ; on the south , it is bordered by gibraltar ( a british overseas territory ) and morocco , through it exclaves in north africa ( ceuta and melilla , and the peninsula of pen de vlez de la gomera ) . on the northeast , along the pyrenees mountain range , it is bordered by france and andorra . along the pyrenees in province of girona , a small exclave town called llvia is surrounded by france . </s> extending to , the portugalspain border is the list of country and territory by land border within the european union . </s> <section_title_start> island <section_title_end> </s> spain also includes the balearic island in the mediterranean sea , the canary island in the atlantic ocean and a number of uninhabited island on the mediterranean side of the strait of gibraltar , known a plaza de soberana ( `` place of sovereignty `` , or territory under spanish sovereignty ) , such a the chafarinas island and pen de alhucemas . the peninsula of pen de vlez de la gomera is also regarded a a plaza de soberana . the isle of alboran island , located in the mediterranean between spain and north africa , is also administered by spain , specifically by the municipality of almera , andalusia . the little pheasant island in the river bidasoa is a spanish-french condominium ( international law ) . </s> the ten most populous island of spain ( <year> ) : </s> { class= `` wikitable `` style= `` font-size : <number> `` </s> - </s> ! island ! ! population </s> - </s> tenerife <number> </s> - </s> mallorca <number> </s> - </s> gran canaria <number> </s> - </s> lanzarote <number> </s> - </s> ibiza ( eivissa ) <number> </s> - </s> fuerteventura <number> </s> - </s> menorca <number> </s> - </s> la palma <number> </s> - </s> la gomera <number> </s> - </s> formentera <number> </s> } </s> <section_title_start> mountain and river <section_title_end> </s> mainland spain is a mountainous country , dominated by high plateau and mountain chain . after the pyrenees , the main mountain range are the cantabrian mountain ( cantabrian range ) , sistema ibrico ( iberian system ) , sistema central ( central system ) , monte de toledo , sierra morena and the sistema btico ( baetic system ) whose highest peak , the mulhacn , located in sierra nevada ( spain ) , is the highest elevation in the iberian peninsula . the highest point in spain is the teide , a active volcano in the canary island . the meseta central ( often translated a `` inner plateau `` ) is a vast plateau in the heart of peninsular spain . </s> there are several major river in spain such a the tagus ( tajo ) , ebro , guadiana river , douro ( duero ) , guadalquivir , jcar river , segura , turia river and minho river ( mio ) . alluvial plain are found along the coast , the largest of which is that of the guadalquivir in andalusia . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> three main climatic zone can be separated , according to geographical situation and orography condition : </s> * the mediterranean climate , characterised by warm/hot and dry summer , is dominant in the peninsula . it ha two variety : csa and csb according to the kppen climate classification . </s> * * the csa zone is associated to area with hot summer . it is predominant in the mediterranean and southern atlantic coast and inland throughout andalusia , extremadura and much , if not most , of the centre of the country . the csa zone cover climatic zone with both relatively warm and cold winter which are considered extremely different to each other at a local level , reason for which kppen classification is often eschewed within spain . local climatic map generally divide the mediterranean zone ( which cover most of the country ) between warm-winter and cold-winter zone , rather than according to summer temperature . </s> * * the csb zone ha warm rather than hot summer , and extends to additional cool-winter area not typically associated with a mediterranean climate , such a much of central and northern-central of spain ( e.g . western castile and len castilelen , northeastern castilla-la mancha and northern community of madrid ) and into much rainier area ( notably galicia ( spain ) ) . note area with relatively high rainfall such a galicia are not considered mediterranean under local classification , but classed a oceanic . </s> * the semi-arid climate ( bsk , bsh ) , is predominant in the southeastern quarter of the country , but is also widespread in other area of spain . it cover most of the region of murcia , southern valencian community and eastern andalusia , where true hot desert climate also exist . further to the north , it is predominant in the upper and mid reach of the ebro valley , which cross southern navarre , central aragon and western catalonia . it also is found in madrid , extremadura , castilla-la mancha , and some location of western andalusia . the dry season extends beyond the summer and average temperature depends on altitude and latitude . </s> * the oceanic climate ( cfb ) , located in the northern quarter of the country , especially in the atlantic region ( basque country ( autonomous community ) , cantabria , asturias , and partly galicia and castilelen ) . additionally it is also found in northern navarre , in most highland area along the sistema ibrico and in the pyrenees valley , where a humid subtropical variant ( cfa ) also occurs . winter and summer temperature are influenced by the ocean , and have no seasonal drought . </s> apart from these main type , other sub-types can be found , like the alpine climate in area with very high altitude , the [ subtropical climate ] in area of northeastern spain and the continental climate ( dfc , dfb / dsc , dsb ) in the pyrenees a well a part of the cordillera cantbrica , the sistema central , sierra nevada ( spain ) and the sistema ibrico , and a typical desert climate ( bwk , bwh ) in the zone of almera , murcia and eastern canary island . low-lying area of the canary island average above during their coldest month , thus having a tropical climate . </s> <section_title_start> fauna and flora <section_title_end> </s> the fauna present a wide diversity that is due in large part to the geographical position of the iberian peninsula between the atlantic and the mediterranean and between africa and eurasia , and the great diversity of habitat and biotopes , the result of a considerable variety of climate and well differentiated region . </s> the vegetation of spain is varied due to several factor including the diversity of the terrain , the climate and latitude . spain includes different phytogeographic region , each with it own floral characteristic resulting largely from the interaction of climate , topography , soil type and fire , and biotic component factor . the country had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> the constitutional history of spain date back to the constitution of <year> . in june <year> , spain 's new king juan carlos dismissed carlos aria navarro and appointed the reformer adolfo surez a prime minister . the resulting <year> spanish general election convened the constituent cortes ( the spanish parliament , in it capacity a a constitutional assembly ) for the purpose of drafting and approving the constitution of <year> . after a national referendum on <number> december <year> , <number> of voter approved of the new constitution a culmination of the spanish transition to democracy . </s> a a result , spain is now composed of <number> autonomous community of spain and two autonomous community of spain # autonomous city and `` plaza de soberana `` with varying degree of autonomy thanks to it constitution , which nevertheless explicitly state the indivisible unity of the spanish nation . the constitution also specifies that spain ha no state religion and that all are free to practice and believe a they wish . </s> the spanish administration approved the gender equality act in <year> aimed at furthering gender equality in spanish political and economic life . according to inter-parliamentary union data a of <number> september <year> , <number> of the <number> member of the congress were woman ( <number> ) , while in the senate , there were <number> woman out of <number> ( <number> ) , placing spain <number> on their list of country ranked by proportion of woman in the lower house ( or unicameral ) house . the gender empowerment measure of spain in the united nation human development report is <number> , <number> in the world . </s> <section_title_start> government <section_title_end> </s> spain is a constitutional monarchy , with a hereditary monarch and a bicameral parliament , the cortes generales ( general court ) . </s> the legislative branch is made up of the congress of deputy ( congreso de los diputados ) , a lower house with <number> member , elected by popular vote on block list by proportional representation to serve four-year term , and the spanish senate ( senado ) , an upper house with <number> seat of which <number> are directly elected by popular vote , using a limited voting method , and the other <number> appointed by the regional legislature to also serve four-year term . </s> the executive branch consists of a council of minister of spain presided over by the prime minister , who is prime minister of spain # royal nomination , congressional confirmation by the monarchy of spain after holding consultation with representative from the different parliamentary group , voted in by the member of the lower house during an investiture session and then formally appointed by the monarch . </s> * head of state ( king ) </s> * * felipe vi of spain , since <number> june <year> </s> * government </s> * * prime minister of spain ( head of government ) or `` president of the government `` ( presidente del gobierno ) : pedro snchez prez-castejn , elected <number> june <year> . </s> * * deputy prime minister ( designated by the prime minister ) : currently carmen calvo poyato ( <number> ) , pablo iglesias turrin ( <number> ) , nadia calvio santamara ( <number> ) , teresa ribera rodrguez ( <number> ) . </s> * * minister ( designated by the prime minister ) . </s> the prime minister , deputy prime minister and the rest of minister convene at the council of minister of spain . </s> spain is organisationally structured a a so-called estado de la autonomas ( `` state of autonomy `` ) ; it is one of the most decentralised country in europe , along with switzerland , germany and belgium ; for example , all autonomous community have their own elected parliament , government , public administration of spain , budget , and resource . health and education system among others are managed by the spanish community , and in addition , the basque country and navarre also manage their own public finance based on fuero provision . in catalonia , the basque country , navarre and the canary island , a full-fledged autonomous police corp replaces some of the state police function ( see mossos d'esquadra , ertzaintza , polica foral/foruzaingoa and polica canaria ) . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> after the return of democracy following the death of francisco franco in <year> , spain 's foreign policy priority were to break out of the diplomatic isolation of the spain under franco and expand diplomatic relation , enter the european union , and define security relation with the west . </s> a a member of nato since <year> , spain ha established itself a a participant in multilateral international security activity . spain 's eu membership represents an important part of it foreign policy . even on many international issue beyond western europe , spain prefers to coordinate it effort with it eu partner through the european political co-operation mechanism . </s> spain ha maintained it special relation with hispanic america and the philippine . it policy emphasis the concept of an ibero-american community , essentially the renewal of the concept of `` hispanidad `` or `` hispanismo `` , a it is often referred to in english , which ha sought to link the iberian peninsula with hispanic america through language , commerce , history and culture . it is fundamentally `` based on shared value and the recovery of democracy . `` </s> ; territorial dispute </s> disputed status of gibraltar , a british overseas territory in the southernmost part of the iberian peninsula . then a spanish town , it wa conquered by an anglo-dutch force in <year> during the war of the spanish succession on behalf of charles vi , holy roman emperor , pretender to the spanish throne . </s> the legal situation concerning gibraltar wa settled in <year> by the treaty of utrecht , in which spain ceded the territory in perpetuity to the british crown stating that , should the british abandon this post , it would be offered to spain first . since the <year> spain ha called for the return of gibraltar . the overwhelming majority of gibraltarian strongly oppose this , along with any proposal of shared sovereignty . un resolution call on the united kingdom and spain to reach an agreement over the status of gibraltar . </s> the spanish claim make a distinction between the disputed status of the isthmus between gibraltar and spain that connects the rock to the spanish mainland on the one hand , and the rock and city of gibraltar on the other . while the rock and city were ceded by the treaty of utrecht , spain asserts that the `` occupation of the isthmus is illegal and against the principle of international law `` . the united kingdom relies on de facto argument of possession by prescription ( sovereignty transfer ) in relation to the isthmus , a there ha been `` continuous possession [ of the isthmus ] over a long period `` . </s> another claim by spain is about the savage island , part of portugal . in clash with the portuguese position , spain claim that they are rock rather than island , and therefore spain doe not accept any extension of the portuguese exclusive economic zone ( <number> nautical mile ) generated by the island , while acknowledging the selvagens having territorial water ( <number> nautical mile ) . on <number> july <year> , spain sent a letter to the un expressing these view . </s> spain claim the sovereignty over the perejil island , a small , uninhabited rocky islet located in the south shore of the strait of gibraltar . the island lie just off the coast of morocco , from ceuta and from mainland spain . it sovereignty is disputed between spain and morocco . it wa the subject of an armed incident between the two country in <year> . the incident ended when both country agreed to return to the status quo ante which existed prior to the moroccan occupation of the island . the islet is now deserted and without any sign of sovereignty . </s> besides the perejil island , the spanish-held territory claimed by other country are two : morocco claim the spanish city of ceuta and melilla and the plaza de soberana islet off the northern coast of africa . portugal doe not recognise spain 's sovereignty over the territory of olivenza which wa annexed by spain in <year> after the war of the orange . portugal stance ha been the territory being de iure portuguese territory and de facto spanish . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the armed force of spain are known a the spanish armed force ( fuerzas armada espaolas ) . their commander-in-chief is the king of spain , felipe vi of spain . the next military authority in line are the prime minister and the minister of defence . the fourth military authority of the state is the chief of the defence staff ( spain ) ( jemad ) . the defence staff ( spain ) ( estado mayor de la defensa ) assist the jemad a auxiliary body . </s> the spanish armed force are divided into three branch : </s> * spanish army army ( ejrcito de tierra ) </s> * spanish navy navy ( armada ) </s> * spanish air force air force ( ejrcito del aire ) </s> military conscription wa suppressed in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> human right <section_title_end> </s> the spanish constitution of <year> `` protect all spaniard and all the people of spain in the exercise of human right , their culture and tradition , language and institution `` . </s> according to amnesty international ( ai ) , government investigation of alleged police abuse are often lengthy and punishment were light . violence against woman wa a problem , which the government took step to address . </s> spain provides one of the highest degree of liberty in the world for it lgbt community . among the country studied by pew research center in <year> , spain is rated first in acceptance of homosexuality , with <number> of those surveyed saying that homosexuality should be accepted . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> the spanish state is divided into <number> autonomous community and <number> autonomous city , both group being the highest or first-order administrative division in the country . autonomous community are divided into province , of which there are <number> in total , and in turn , province are divided into municipality . in catalonia , two additional division exist , the comarques ( sing . comarca ) and the vegueries ( sing . vegueria ) both of which have administrative power ; comarques being aggregation of municipality , and the vegueries being aggregation of comarques . the concept of a comarca exists in all autonomous community , however , unlike catalonia , these are merely historical or geographical subdivision . </s> <section_title_start> autonomous community <section_title_end> </s> spain 's autonomous community are the first level administrative division of the country . they were created after the current constitution came into effect ( in <year> ) in recognition of the right to self-government of the `` nationality and region of spain `` . the autonomous community were to comprise adjacent province with common historical , cultural , and economic trait . this territorial organisation , based on devolution , is known in spain a the `` state of autonomy `` . </s> the basic institutional law of each autonomous community is the statute of autonomy . the statute of autonomy establish the name of the community according to it historical and contemporary identity , the limit of it territory , the name and organisation of the institution of government and the right they enjoy according to the constitution . </s> the government of all autonomous community must be based on a division of power and comprise </s> * a legislative assembly whose member must be elected by universal suffrage according to the system of proportional representation and in which all area that integrate the territory are fairly represented ; </s> * a government council , with executive and administrative function headed by a president , elected by the legislative assembly and nominated by the king of spain ; </s> * a supreme court , under the supreme court of spain , which head the judiciary in the autonomous community . </s> catalonia , galicia and the basque country , which identified themselves a nationality , were granted self-government through a rapid process . andalusia also took that denomination in it first statute of autonomy , even though it followed the longer process stipulated in the constitution for the rest of the country . progressively , other community in revision to their statute of autonomy have also taken that denomination in accordance to their historical and modern identity , such a the valencian community , the canary island , the balearic island , and aragon . </s> the autonomous community have wide legislative and executive autonomy , with their own parliament and regional government . the distribution of power may be different for every community , a laid out in their statute of autonomy , since devolution wa intended to be asymmetrical . only two communitiesthe basque country and navarrehave full fiscal autonomy . beyond fiscal autonomy , the nationalitiesandalusia , the basque country , catalonia , and galiciawere devolved more power than the rest of the community , among them the ability of the regional president to dissolve the parliament and call for election at any time . in addition , the basque country , catalonia and navarre have police corp of their own : ertzaintza , mossos d'esquadra and the polica foral respectively . other community have more limited force or none at all , like the polica autnoma andaluza in andalusia or the bescam in madrid . </s> nonetheless , recent amendment to existing statute of autonomy or the promulgation of new statute altogether , have reduced the asymmetry between the power originally granted to the nationality and the rest of the region . </s> finally , along with the <number> autonomous community , two autonomous city are also part of the state of autonomy and are first-order territorial division : ceuta and melilla . these are two exclaves located in the northern african coast . </s> <section_title_start> province and municipality <section_title_end> </s> autonomous community are divided into province of spain , which served a their territorial building block . in turn , province are divided into municipality of spain . the existence of both the province and the municipality is guaranteed and protected by the constitution , not necessarily by the statute of autonomy themselves . municipality are granted autonomy to manage their internal affair , and province are the territorial division designed to carry out the activity of the state . </s> the current provincial division structure is basedwith minor changeson the <year> territorial division of spain by javier de burgos , and in all , the spanish territory is divided into <number> province . the community of asturias , cantabria , la rioja , the balearic island , madrid , murcia and navarre are the only community that comprise a single province , which is coextensive with the community itself . in these case , the administrative institution of the province are replaced by the governmental institution of the community . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> spain 's capitalist mixed economy is the list of country by gdp ( nominal ) worldwide and the list of sovereign state in europe by gdp ( nominal ) in the european union , a well a the eurozone 's <number> largest . </s> the centre-right government of former prime minister jos mara aznar worked successfully to gain admission to the group of country launching the euro in <year> . unemployment in spain stood at <number> in june <year> , below spain 's early <year> unemployment rate of at over <number> . the youth unemployment in spain rate ( <number> in march <year> ) is extremely high compared to eu standard . perennial weak point of spain 's economy include a large informal economy , and an education system which oecd report place among the poorest for developed country , together with the united state and uk . </s> by the mid-1990s the economy had commenced the growth that had been disrupted by the global recession of the early <year> . the strong economic growth helped the government to reduce the government debt a a percentage of gdp and spain 's high unemployment rate began to steadily decline . with the government budget in balance and inflation under control spain wa admitted into the eurozone in <year> . </s> since the <year> some spanish company have gained multinational status , often expanding their activity in culturally close latin america . spain is the second biggest foreign investor there , after the united state . spanish company have also expanded into asia , especially china and india . this early global expansion is a competitive advantage over it competitor and european neighbour . the reason for this early expansion is the booming interest towards spanish language and culture in asia and africa and a corporate culture that learned to take risk in unstable market . </s> spanish company invested in field like renewable energy commercialisation ( iberdrola wa the world 's largest renewable energy operator ) , technology company like telefnica , abengoa , mondragon corporation ( which is the world 's largest worker cooperative worker-owned cooperative ) , movistar , hisdesat , indra sistemas , train manufacturer like construcciones y auxiliar de ferrocarriles , talgo , global corporation such a the textile company inditex , petroleum company like repsol or cepsa and infrastructure , with six of the ten biggest international construction firm specialising in transport being spanish , like ferrovial , acciona , grupo ac , obrascn huarte lain and fomento de construcciones y contratas . </s> in <year> the economist intelligence unit 's quality of life survey placed spain among the top <number> in the world . in <year> the same survey ( now called the `` where-to-be-born index `` ) , ranked spain <number> in the world . </s> in <year> , the basque country ( autonomous community ) city of bilbao wa awarded with the lee kuan yew world city prize , and it mayor at the time , iaki azkuna , wa awarded the world mayor prize in <year> . the basque capital city of vitoria-gasteiz received the european green capital award in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> automotive industry <section_title_end> </s> the automotive industry is one of the largest employer in the country . in <year> spain wa the <number> largest automobile producer country in the world and the <number> largest car manufacturer in europe after germany . </s> by <year> , the automotive industry wa generating <number> percent of spain 's gross domestic product , employing about nine percent of the manufacturing industry . by <year> the automobile industry wa the <number> most exported industry while in <year> about <number> of the total production wa for export . </s> german company poured <number> billion into spain in <year> , making the country the second-largest destination for german foreign direct investment behind only the u.s . the lion 's share of that investment4 billionwent to the country 's auto industry . </s> <section_title_start> agriculture <section_title_end> </s> crop area were farmed in two highly diverse manner . area relying on non-irrigated cultivation ( secano ) , which made up <number> of the entire crop area , depended solely on rainfall a a source of water . they included the humid region of the north and the northwest , a well a vast arid zone that had not been irrigated . the much more productive region devoted to irrigated cultivation ( regado ) accounted for <number> million hectare in <year> , and the government hoped that this area would eventually double , a it already had doubled since <year> . particularly noteworthy wa the development in province of almeraone of the most arid and desolate province of spainof winter crop of various fruit and vegetable for export to europe . </s> though only about <number> of spain 's cultivated land wa irrigated , it wa estimated to be the source of between <number> and <number> of the gross value of crop production and of <number> of the value of agricultural export . more than half of the irrigated area wa planted in maize , fruit tree , and vegetable . other agricultural product that benefited from irrigation included grape , cotton , sugar beet , potato , legume , olive tree , mango , strawberry , tomato , and fodder grass . depending on the nature of the crop , it wa possible to harvest two successive crop in the same year on about <number> of the country 's irrigated land . </s> citrus fruit , vegetable , cereal grain , olive oil , and winespain 's traditional agricultural productscontinued to be important in the <year> . in <year> they represented <number> , <number> , <number> , <number> , and <number> , respectively , of the country 's agricultural production . because of the changed diet of an increasingly affluent population , there wa a notable increase in the consumption of livestock , poultry , and dairy product . meat production for domestic consumption became the single most important agricultural activity , accounting for <number> of all farm-related production in <year> . increased attention to livestock wa the reason that spain became a net importer of grain . ideal growing condition , combined with proximity to important north european market , made citrus fruit spain 's leading export . fresh vegetable and fruit produced through intensive irrigation farming also became important export commodity , a did sunflower seed oil that wa produced to compete with the more expensive olive oil in oversupply throughout the mediterranean country of the european economic community . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , spain wa the second most visited country in the world , recording <number> million tourist which marked the fifth consecutive year of record-beating number . the headquarters of the world tourism organization are located in madrid . </s> spain 's geographic location , popular coastline , diverse landscape , historical legacy , vibrant culture , and excellent infrastructure ha made the country 's international tourist industry among the largest in the world . in the last five decade , international tourism in spain ha grown to become the second largest in the world in term of spending , worth approximately <number> ; billion euro or about <number> of gdp in <year> . </s> castile and leon is the spanish leader in rural tourism linked to it environmental and architectural heritage . </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> spain is one of the world 's leading country in the development and production of renewable energy in spain . in <year> spain became the solar power in spain world leader when it overtook the united state with a massive power station plant called alvarado i , near badajoz alvarado , badajoz . spain is also europe 's main producer of wind energy . in <year> it wind turbine generated <number> gwh , which accounted for <number> of all electrical energy produced in spain . on <number> november <year> , wind energy reached an instantaneous historic peak covering <number> of mainland electricity demand and generating an amount of energy that is equivalent to that of <number> nuclear reactor . other renewable energy used in spain are [ power plant hydroelectric ] , gasification of biomass and marine energy ( <number> power plant under construction ) . </s> non-renewable energy source used in spain are nuclear power plant ( <number> operative reactor ) , natural gas power plant , coal power plant , and oil power plant . fossil fuel together generated <number> of spain 's electricity in <year> , just below the oecd mean of <number> . nuclear power generated another <number> , and wind and hydro about <number> each . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> the spanish road system is mainly centralised , with six highway connecting madrid ] to the [ [ basque country ( autonomous community ) , catalonia , valencian community , west andalusia , extremadura and galicia ( spain ) . additionally , there are highway along the atlantic ( ferrol , spain to vigo ) , cantabrian ( oviedo to san sebastin ) and mediterranean sea ( girona to cdiz ) coast . spain aim to put one ; million electric car on the road by <year> a part of the government 's plan to save energy and boost efficient energy use . the former minister of industry miguel sebastin gascn said that `` the electric vehicle is the future and the engine of an industrial revolution . `` </s> spain ha the most extensive high-speed rail network in europe , and the second-most extensive in the world after china . a of <year> , spain ha a total of over of high-speed track linking mlaga , seville , madrid , barcelona , valencia and valladolid , with the train operated at commercial speed up to . on average , the spanish high-speed train is the fastest one in the world , followed by the japanese shinkansen and the french tgv . regarding punctuality , it is second in the world ( <number> on-time arrival ) after the japanese shinkansen ( <number> ) . should the aim of the ambitious ave programme ( spanish high speed train ) be met , by <year> spain will have of high-speed train linking almost all provincial city to madrid in le than three hour and barcelona within four hour . </s> there are <number> public airport in spain . the busiest one is the madrid airport ( barajas ) , with <number> ; million passenger in <year> , being the world 's busiest airport by passenger traffic world 's <number> busiest airport , a well a the european union 's fourth busiest . the barcelona airport ( el prat ) is also important , with <number> ; million passenger in <year> , being the world coast . the population of spain ha risen <number> <number>/2 time since <year> , when it stood at <number> ; million , principally due to the spectacular demographic boom in the <year> and early <year> . </s> in <year> , the average total fertility rate ( tfr ) across spain wa <number> child born per woman , one of the lowest in the world , below the replacement rate of <number> , it remains considerably below the high of <number> child born per woman in <year> . spain subsequently ha one of the oldest population in the world , with the average age of <number> year . </s> native spaniard make up <number> of the total population of spain . after the list of country and territory by fertility rate plunged in the <year> and spain 's population growth rate dropped , the population again of the population . the immigrant originate mainly in latin america ( <number> ) , north africa ( <number> ) , eastern europe ( <number> ) , and sub-saharan africa ( <number> ) . in <year> , spain dutch , and norwegian . they reside primarily on the mediterranean coast and the balearic island , where many choose to live their retirement or telecommute . </s> substantial population descended from spanish colonist and immigrant exist in other part of the world , most notably in latin america . beginning in the late <number> century , large number of iberian colonist settled in what became murcia region of murcia <number> style= `` background : silver ; `` </s> } </s> <section_title_start> people <section_title_end> </s> the spanish constitution of <year> , in it second article , recognises several contemporary politynationalities and region of spain and region , within the context of the spanish nation . </s> spain ha been described a a de facto plurinationalism . the identity of spain rather accrues of an overlap of different territorial and ethnolinguistic identity than of a sole spanish identity . in some case some of the territorial identity may conflict with the dominant spanish culture . distinct traditional identity within spain include the basque people , catalan people , galician people , andalusians and valencian people , although to some extent all of the <number> autonomous community may claim a distinct local identity . </s> it is this last feature of `` shared identity `` between the more local level or autonomous community and the spanish level which make the identity question in spain complex and far from univocal . </s> <section_title_start> minority group <section_title_end> </s> spain ha a number of descendant of population from former colony , especially latin america and north africa . smaller number of immigrant from several sub-saharan country have recently been settling in spain . there are also sizeable number of asian immigrant , most of whom are of middle eastern , south asian and chinese origin . the single largest group of immigrant are european ; represented by large number of romanian , briton , german , french and others . </s> the arrival of the rom in spain , a romani people , began in the <number> century ; estimate of the spanish rom population range from <number> to over one million . there are also the mercheros ( also quinquis ) , a formerly nomadic minority group . their origin is unclear . </s> historically , sephardi jew and moriscos are the main minority group originated in spain and with a contribution to spanish culture . the spanish government is offering spanish nationality to sephardi jew . </s> <section_title_start> immigration <section_title_end> </s> according to the official spanish statistic ( instituto nacional de estadstica ( spain ) ) there were <number> ; million foreign resident in spain in <year> ( <number> ) while all citizen born outside of spain were <number> ; million in <year> , <number> of the total population . </s> according to residence permit data for <year> , more than <number> were romanian , about <number> were moroccan people , approximately <number> were british , and <number> were ecuadorian people . other sizeable foreign community are colombian , bolivian , german , italian , bulgarian , and chinese . there are more than <number> migrant from sub-saharan africa living in spain , principally senegalese people and nigerian people . since <year> , spain ha experienced high population growth a a result of immigration flow , despite a birth rate that is only half the replacement level . this sudden and ongoing inflow of immigrant , particularly those arriving illegally by sea , ha caused noticeable social tension . </s> within the eu , spain had the <number> highest immigration rate in percentage term after cyprus , but by a great margin , the highest in absolute number , up to <year> . the number of immigrant in spain had grown up from <number> people in <year> to <number> ; million in <year> out of a total population of <number> ; million . in <year> alone , a regularisation programme increased the legal immigrant population by <number> people . there are a number of reason for the high level of immigration , including spain 's cultural tie with latin america , it geographical position , the porosity of it border , the large size of it underground economy and the strength of the agricultural and construction sector , which demand more low cost labour than can be offered by the national workforce . </s> another statistically significant factor is the large number of resident of eu origin typically retiring to spain 's mediterranean coast . in fact , spain wa europe 's largest absorber of migrant from <year> to <year> , with it immigrant population more than doubling a <number> ; million people arrived . in <year> , prior to the onset of the economic crisis , the financial time reported that spain wa the most favoured destination for western european considering a move from their own country and seeking job elsewhere in the eu . </s> in <year> , the government instituted a `` plan of voluntary return `` which encouraged unemployed immigrant from outside the eu to return to their home country and receive several incentive , including the right to keep their unemployment benefit and transfer whatever they contributed to the spanish social security . the programme had little effect ; during it first two month , just <number> immigrant took up the offer . what the programme failed to do , the sharp and prolonged economic crisis ha done from <year> to <year> in that ten of thousand of immigrant have left the country due to lack of job . in <year> alone , more than half a million people left spain . for the first time in decade the net migration rate wa expected to be negative , and nine out of <number> emigrant were foreigner . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> spain is legally multilingual , and the constitution establishes that the nation will protect `` all spaniard and the people of spain in the exercise of human right , their culture and tradition , language and institution . </s> spanish language ( espaol ) recognised in the constitution a name given to the spanish language ( castellano ) is the official language of the entire country , and it is the right and duty of every spaniard to know the language . the constitution also establishes that `` the other spanish language `` that is , the other language of spainwill also be official in their respective autonomous community in accordance to their statute of autonomy , their organic regional legislation , and that the `` richness of the distinct linguistic modality of spain represents a patrimony which will be the object of special respect and protection . `` </s> the other official language of spain , co-official with spanish are : </s> * catalan language ( catal or valenci ) in catalonia , the valencian community and the balearic island ; </s> * galician language ( galego ) in galicia ( spain ) ; </s> * basque language ( euskara ) in the basque country ( autonomous community ) and navarre ; and </s> * occitan language ( arans ) in catalonia . </s> a a percentage of the general population of all spain , spanish is natively spoken by <number> , catalan by <number> , galician by <number> and basque by <number> of all spaniard . occitan is spoken by le than <number> people , only in the small region of val d'aran . </s> other romance language minority language , though not official , have special recognition , such a the astur-leonese language ( asturianu , bable or llions ) in asturias and in northwestern castile and len , and aragonese language ( aragon ) in aragon . </s> in the north african spanish autonomous city of melilla , riff language is spoken by a significant part of the population . similarly , in ceuta moroccan arabic is spoken by a significant percentage of the population . in the tourist area of the mediterranean coast and the island , english and german are widely spoken by tourist , foreign resident , and tourism worker . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> state education in spain is free and compulsory from the age of six to sixteen . the current education system is regulated by the <year> educational law , loe ( ley orgnica de educacin ) , or fundamental law for the education . in <year> , the loe wa partially modified by the newer and controversial lomce law ( ley orgnica para la mejora de la calidad educativa ) , or fundamental law for the improvement of the education system , commonly called ley wert ( wert law ) . since <year> to <year> , spain ha had seven different educational law ( lge , loece , lode , logse , lopeg , loe and lomce ) . </s> the level of education are preschool education , primary education , secondary education and post-16 education . in regard to the professional development education or the vocational education , there are three level besides the university degree : the formacin profesional bsica ( basic vocational education ) ; the ciclo formativo de grado medio or cfgm ( medium level vocation education ) which can be studied after studying the secondary education , and the ciclo formativo de grado superior or cfgs ( higher level vocational education ) , which can be studied after studying the post-16 education level . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> the health care system of spain ( spanish national health system ) is considered one of the best in the world , in <number> position in the ranking elaborated by the world health organization . the health care is public , universal and free for any legal citizen of spain . the total health spending is <number> of the gdp , slightly above the average of <number> of the oecd . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> roman catholicism , which ha a long history in spain , remains the dominant religion . although it no longer ha official status by law , in all public school in spain student have to choose either a religion or ethic class . catholicism is the religion most commonly taught , although the teaching of islam , judaism , and evangelical christianity is also recognised in law . according to a <year> study by the spanish centre for sociological research , about <number> of spaniard self-identify a christianity in spain , <number> other faith , and about <number> identify with irreligion . most spaniard do not participate regularly in religious service . a <year> study show that of the spaniard who identify themselves a religious , <number> hardly ever or never go to church , <number> go to church some time a year , <number> some time per month and <number> every sunday or multiple time per week . recent poll and survey suggest that <number> to <number> of the spanish population is irreligious . </s> the spanish constitution enshrines secularism in governance , a well a freedom of religion or belief for all , saying that no religion should have a `` state character , `` while allowing for the state to `` cooperate `` with religious group . </s> there have been four spanish pope . pope damasus i , pope calixtus iii , pope alexander vi and antipope benedict xiii . spanish mysticism provided an important intellectual resource against protestantism with carmelite like teresa of vila , a counter-reformation nun and john of the cross , a priest , taking the lead in their reform movement . later , they became doctor of the church . the society of jesus wa co-founded by ignatius of loyola , whose spiritual exercise and movement led to the establishment of hundred of college and university in the world , including <number> in the united state alone . the society 's co-founder , francis xavier , wa a missionary who reached india and later japan . in the <year> , jesuit pedro arrupe and ignacio ellacura supported the movement of liberation theology . </s> protestant church have about <number> member . there are about <number> jehovah 's witness . the church of jesus christ of latter-day saint ha approximately <number> adherent in <number> congregation in all region of the country and ha a madrid spain temple in the moratalaz district of madrid . </s> a study made by the union of islamic community of spain demonstrated that there were more than <number> inhabitant of muslim background living in spain , accounting for <number> of the total population of spain . the vast majority wa composed of immigrant and descendant originating from the maghreb ( especially morocco ) and other african country . more than <number> ( <number> ) of them had spanish nationality . </s> the recent wave of immigration have also led to an increasing number of hindu , buddhist , sikh and muslim . </s> after the reconquista in <year> , muslim did not live in spain for century . late <number>-century colonial expansion in northwestern africa gave a number of resident in spanish morocco and western sahara full citizenship . their rank have since been bolstered by recent immigration , especially from morocco and algeria . </s> judaism wa practically non-existent in spain from the <year> expulsion until the <number> century , when jew were again permitted to enter the country . currently there are around <number> jew in spain , or <number> of the total population . most are arrival in the past century , while some are descendant of earlier spanish jew . approximately <number> jew are thought to have lived in spain prior to it expulsion . however the jewish encyclopedia state the number over <number> to be too large and <number> a too small : <number> is given a expelled a possibly too small in favour of <number> , and the number of convert after the <year> pogrom a le . other source suggest <number> convert mostly after the pogrom of <year> and upwards of <number> expelled . descendant of these sephardic jew expelled in <year> are given spanish nationality if they request it . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> spain is a western world . almost every aspect of spanish life is permeated by it roman heritage , making spain one of the major romance-speaking europe of europe . spanish culture is marked by strong historic tie to catholicism , which played a pivotal role in the country 's formation and subsequent identity . spanish art , architecture , cuisine , and music have been shaped by successive wave of foreign invader , a well a by the country 's mediterranean climate and geography . the centuries-long colonial era globalised spanish language and culture , with spain also absorbing the cultural and commercial product of it diverse empire . </s> <section_title_start> world heritage site <section_title_end> </s> spain ha <number> world heritage site . these include the landscape of monte perdido in the pyrenees , which is shared with france , the prehistoric rock art site of the ca valley and siega verde , which is shared with portugal , the heritage of mercury . almadn and idrija , shared with slovenia and the ancient and primeval beech forest of the carpathians and other region of europe , shared with other country of europe . in addition , spain ha also <number> intangible cultural heritage , or `` human treasure `` . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> the earliest recorded example of vernacular romance-based literature date from the same time and location , the rich mix of muslim , jewish , and christian culture in muslim spain , in which maimonides , averroes , and others worked , the kharjas ( jarchas ) </s> during the reconquista , the epic poem cantar de mio cid wa written about a real manhis battle , conquest , and daily life . the valencian chivalric romance tirant lo blanch written in valencian language is also remarkable . </s> other major play from the medieval time were mester de juglara , mester de clereca , coplas por la muerte de su padre or the book of good love ( the book of good love ) . </s> during the renaissance the major play are la celestina and el lazarillo de tormes , while many religious literature wa created with poet a luis de len , san juan de la cruz , santa teresa de jess , etc . </s> the baroque is the most important period for spanish culture . we are in the time of the spanish empire . the famous don quixote by miguel de cervantes wa written in this time . other writer from the period are : francisco de quevedo , lope de vega , pedro caldern de la barca or tirso de molina . </s> during the age of enlightenment we find name such a leandro fernndez de moratn , benito jernimo feijo , gaspar melchor de jovellanos or leandro fernndez de moratn . </s> during the romanticism , jos zorrilla created one of the most emblematic figure in european literature in don juan tenorio . other writer from this period are gustavo adolfo bcquer , jos de espronceda , rosala de castro or mariano jos de larra . </s> artist such a benito prez galds , emilia pardo bazn , leopoldo ala ( clarn ) , concepcin arenal , vicente blasco ibez and menndez pelayo created realism ( art ) artwork . realism offered depiction of contemporary life and society 'as they were ' . in the spirit of general `` realism `` , realist author opted for depiction of everyday and banal activity and experience , instead of romanticised or stylised presentation . </s> the group that ha become known a the generation of <year> wa marked by the destruction of spain 's fleet in cuba by u gunboat in <year> , which provoked a cultural crisis in spain . the `` disaster `` of <year> led established writer to seek practical political , economic , and social solution in essay grouped under the literary heading of regeneracionismo . for a group of younger writer , among them miguel de unamuno , po baroja , and jos martnez ruiz ( azorn ) , the disaster and it cultural repercussion inspired a deeper , more radical literary shift that affected both form and content . these writer , along with ramn del valle-incln , antonio machado , ramiro de maeztu , and ngel ganivet , came to be known a the generation of '98 . </s> the generation of <year> or novecentismo . the next supposed `` generation `` of spanish writer following those of '98 already call into question the value of such terminology . by the year <year> the year of the outbreak of the first world war and of the publication of the first major work of the generation 's leading voice , jos ortega y gasseta number of slightly younger writer had established their own place within the spanish cultural field . </s> leading voice include the poet juan ramn jimnez , the academic and essayist ramn menndez pidal , gregorio maran , manuel azaa , maria zambrano , eugeni d'ors , clara campoamor and ortega y gasset , and the novelist gabriel mir , ramn prez de ayala , and ramn gmez de la serna . while still driven by the national and existential question that obsessed the writer of '98 , they approached these topic with a greater sense of distance and objectivity . salvador de madariaga , another prominent intellectual and writer , wa one of the founder of the college of europe and the composer of the constitutive manifest of the liberal international . </s> the generation of <year> , where poet pedro salina , jorge guilln , federico garca lorca , vicente aleixandre , dmaso alonso . all were scholar of their national literary heritage , again evidence of the impact of the call of regeneracionistas and the generation of <year> for spanish intelligence to turn at least partially inwards . </s> spain 's two most preeminent writer in the second half of the <number> century were the nobel prize in literature laureate camilo jos cela and miguel delibes from generation of '36 . spain is one of the country with the most laureate of the nobel prize in literature , and including latin american nobel laureate , spanish language literature rank among the highest in number of laureate . the spanish writer are : jos echegaray , jacinto benavente , juan ramn jimnez , vicente aleixandre and camilo jos cela . the portuguese writer jos saramago , also awarded with the prize , lived for many year in spain and spoke both portuguese and spanish . saramago wa also well known by his iberism idea . </s> the generation of '50 are also known a the child of the civil war . rosa chacel , gloria fuertes , jaime gil de biedma , juan goytisolo , carmen martn gaite , ana mara matute , juan mar , blas de otero , gabriel celaya , antonio gamoneda , rafael snchez ferlosio or ignacio aldecoa . </s> premio planeta de novela and miguel de cervantes prize are the two main award nowadays in spanish literature . </s> <section_title_start> philosophy <section_title_end> </s> seneca the elder wa a philosopher residing in spain during the time of the roman empire . </s> during the period of muslim rule in al-andalus , muslim , jewish and christian philosophy flourished , including the work of such philosopher such a ibn arabi , averroes and maimonides . </s> in the middle age ramon llull flourished in spain . </s> humanist luis vives worked in spain during the renaissance , a did francisco de vitoria ( creator of the school of salamanca and scholar on international law ) and bartolom de la casas . </s> the age of enlightenment in spain arrived later and wa le strong than in other european country , but during the xix century liberal idea arrived in spanish society . at the end of the century , socialist and libertarian idea also flourished , with thinker such a francisco pi y margall , ricardo mella and francisco ferrer guardia . </s> in the first half of the <number> century among the most prominent philosopher were maria zambrano and jos ortega y gasset . </s> contemporary philosopher include fernando savater and adela cortina , creator of the term aporophobia . </s> <section_title_start> art <section_title_end> </s> artist from spain have been highly influential in the development of various european and hispanic america art movement . due to historical , geographical and generational diversity , spanish art ha known a great number of influence . the mediterranean heritage with greco-roman and some moorish and influence in spain , especially in andalusia , is still evident today . european influence include italy , germany and france , especially during the renaissance , baroque and neoclassicism period . there are many other autochthonous style such a the pre-romanesque art and architecture , herrerian architecture or the isabelline gothic . </s> during the golden age painter working in spain included el greco , jos de ribera , bartolom esteban murillo and francisco zurbarn . also in the baroque period , diego velzquez created some of the most famous spanish portrait , such a la meninas and la hilanderas ( velzquez ) . </s> francisco goya painted during a historical period that includes the peninsular war , the fight between liberal and absolutist , and the rise of contemporary nations-states . </s> joaqun sorolla is a well-known modern impressionist painter and there are many important spanish painter belonging to the modernism art movement , including pablo picasso , salvador dal , juan gris and joan mir . </s> <section_title_start> sculpture <section_title_end> </s> the plateresque style extended from beginning of the <number> century until the last third of the century and it stylistic influence pervaded the work of all great spanish artist of the time . alonso berruguete ( valladolid school ) is called the `` prince of spanish sculpture `` . his main work were the upper stall of the choir of the cathedral of toledo , the tomb of cardinal tavera in the same cathedral , and the altarpiece of the visitation in the church of santa rsula in the same locality . other notable sculptor were bartolom ordez , diego de silo , juan de juni and dami forment . </s> there were two school of special flair and talent : the sevillian school of sculpture , to which juan martnez montas belonged , whose most celebrated work are the crucifix in the cathedral of seville , another in vergara , and a saint john ; and the granadan school of sculpture , to which alonso cano belonged , to whom an immaculate conception and a virgin of rosary , are attributed . </s> other notable andalusian baroque sculptor were pedro de mena , pedro roldn and his daughter luisa roldn , juan de mesa and pedro duque cornejo . in the <number> century the most important spanish sculptor were julio gonzlez ( sculptor ) , pablo gargallo , eduardo chillida , and pablo serrano . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> spanish cinema ha achieved major international success including academy award for recent film such a pan 's labyrinth and volver . in the long history of spanish cinema , the great filmmaker luis buuel wa the first to achieve world recognition , followed by pedro almodvar in the <year> ( la movida madrilea ) . mario camus and pilar mir worked together in curro jimnez . </s> spanish cinema ha also seen international success over the year with film by director like segundo de chomn , florin rey , luis garca berlanga , carlos saura , julio medem , isabel coixet , alejandro amenbar , icar bollan and brother david trueba and fernando trueba . </s> actress sara montiel and penlope cruz or actor antonio banderas are among those who have become cinema in the united state star . </s> international film festival of seminci and san sebastin international film festival are the oldest and more relevant in spain . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> due to it historical and geographical diversity , spanish architecture ha drawn from a host of influence . an important provincial city founded by the roman and with an extensive roman era infrastructure , crdoba , spain became the cultural capital , including fine arabic style architecture , during the time of the islamic umayyad dynasty . later arab style architecture continued to be developed under successive islamic dynasty , ending with the nasrid dynasty , which built it famed palace complex in granada . </s> simultaneously , the christian kingdom gradually emerged and developed their own style ; developing a pre-romanesque style when for a while isolated from contemporary mainstream european architectural influence during the earlier middle age , they later integrated the romanesque architecture and gothic architecture stream . there wa then an extraordinary flowering of the gothic style that resulted in numerous instance being built throughout the entire territory . the mudjar style , from the <number> to <number> century , wa developed by introducing arab style motif , pattern and element into european architecture . </s> the arrival of modernism in the academic arena produced much of the architecture of the <number> century . an influential style centred in barcelona , known a modernisme , produced a number of important architect , of which gaud is one . the international style ( architecture ) wa led by group like gatepac . spain is currently experiencing a revolution in contemporary architecture and : category : spanish architect like rafael moneo , santiago calatrava , ricardo bofill a well a many others have gained worldwide renown . </s> <section_title_start> music and dance <section_title_end> </s> spanish music is often considered abroad to be synonymous with flamenco , a west andalusian musical genre , which , contrary to popular belief , is not widespread outside that region . various regional style of folk music abound in aragon , catalonia , valencia , castile , the basque country , galicia , cantabria and asturias . pop , rock , hip hop and heavy metal are also popular . </s> in the field of classical music , spain ha produced a number of noted composer such a isaac albniz , manuel de falla and enrique granados and singer and performer such a plcido domingo , jos carreras , montserrat caball , alicia de larrocha , alfredo kraus , pablo casals , ricardo vies , jos iturbi , pablo de sarasate , jordi savall and teresa berganza . in spain there are over forty professional orchestra , including the barcelona symphony and catalonia national orchestra , orquesta nacional de espaa and the orquesta sinfnica de madrid . major opera house include the teatro real , the gran teatre del liceu , teatro arriaga and the el palau de le art reina sofa . </s> thousand of music fan also travel to spain each year for internationally recognised summer music festival snar which often feature the top up and coming pop and techno act , and festival internacional de benicssim which tends to feature alternative rock and dance act . both festival mark spain a an international music presence and reflect the taste of young people in the country . </s> vitoria-gasteiz jazz festival is one of the main one on it genre . </s> the most popular traditional musical instrument , the guitar , originated in spain . typical of the north are the traditional bag piper or gaita ( bagpipe ) , mainly in asturias and galicia . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> spanish cuisine consists of a great variety of dish which stem from difference in geography , culture and climate . it is heavily influenced by seafood available from the water that surround the country , and reflects the country 's deep mediterranean root . spain 's extensive history with many cultural influence ha led to a unique cuisine . in particular , three main division are easily identified : </s> mediterranean spain all such coastal region , from catalonia to andalusia heavy use of seafood , such a pescato frito ( fried fish ) ; several cold soup like gazpacho ; and many rice-based dish like paella from valencia and arrs negre ( black rice ) from catalonia . </s> inner spain castile hot , thick soup such a the bread and garlic-based castilian soup , along with substantial stew such a cocido madrileo . food is traditionally conserved by salting , such a spanish ham , or immersed in olive oil , such a manchego cheese . </s> atlantic spain the whole northern coast , including asturian cuisine , basque cuisine , cantabrian cuisine and galician cuisine vegetable and fish-based stew like caldo gallego and marmitako . also , the lightly cured lacn gallego ham . the best known cuisine of the northern country often rely on ocean seafood , a in the basque-style cod , albacore or anchovy or the galician octopus-based polbo feira and shellfish dish . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> while variety of football have been played in spain a far back a roman time , sport in spain ha been dominated by football since the early <number> century . real madrid c.f . and fc barcelona are two of the most successful football club in the world . spain national football team the country 's national football team won the uefa european football championship in <year> , <year> and <year> and the fifa world cup in <year> fifa world cup , and is the first team ever to win three back-to-back major international tournament . </s> basketball , tennis , cycling , team handball , spain national futsal team , motorcycling and , lately , formula one also can boast of spanish champion . today , spain is a major world sport powerhouse , especially since the <year> summer olympics that were hosted in barcelona , which stimulated a great deal of interest in sport in the country . the tourism industry ha led to an improvement in sport infrastructure , especially for water sport , golf and skiing . in their respective region , the traditional game of basque pelota and valencian pilota both are popular . </s> <section_title_start> public holiday and festival <section_title_end> </s> public holiday celebrated in spain include a mix of religious ( roman catholic ) , national and local observance . each municipality is allowed to declare a maximum of <number> public holiday per year ; up to nine of these are chosen by the national government and at least two are chosen locally . national day of spain spain 's national day ( fiesta nacional de espaa ) is celebrated on <number> october , the anniversary of the exploration of north america and commemorate our lady of the pillar feast , patroness of aragon and throughout spain . </s> there are many festival and festivity in spain . some of them are known worldwide , and million of tourits from all over the world go to spain annually to experience one of these festival . one of the most famous is san fermn , in pamplona . while it most famous event is the encierro , or the running of the bull , which happens at <number>:00 ; am from <number> july to <number> july , the seven days-long celebration involves many other traditional and folkloric event . the event were central to the plot of the sun also rise , by ernest hemingway , which brought it to the general attention of english-speaking people . a the result , it ha become one of the most internationally renowned fiesta in spain , with over <number> people attending every year . </s> other festival include : la tomatina tomato festival in buol , valencian community , the carnival in the canary island , the falles in valencia or the holy week in andalusia and castile and len . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * outline of spain </s> * list of world heritage site in spain </s> <section_title_start> note
