exception where the republic of ireland national football team and northern ireland national football team field separate international team . northern ireland ha produced two world snooker champion . </s> <section_title_start> field sports <section_title_end> </s> gaelic football , [ and gaelic handball handball ] are the best-known of the irish traditional sport , collectively known a [ [ gaelic game . gaelic game are governed by the gaelic athletic association ( gaa ) , with the exception of lady ' gaelic football and camogie ( woman 's variant of hurling ) , which are governed by separate organisation . the headquarters of the gaa ( and the main stadium ) is located at the <number> capacity croke park in north dublin . many major gaa game are played there , including the semi-finals and final of the all-ireland senior football championship and all-ireland senior hurling championship . during the redevelopment of the lansdowne road in <year> <number> , international rugby and soccer were played there . all gaa player , even at the highest level , are amateur , receiving no wage , although they are permitted to receive a limited amount of sport-related income from commercial sponsorship . </s> the irish football association ( ifa ) wa originally the governing body for soccer across the island . the game ha been played in an organised fashion in ireland since the <year> , with cliftonville f.c . in belfast being ireland 's oldest club . it wa most popular , especially in it first decade , around belfast and in ulster . however , some club based outside belfast thought that the ifa largely favoured ulster-based club in such matter a selection for the national team . in <year> , following an incident in which , despite an earlier promise , the ifa moved an irish cup semi-final replay from dublin to belfast , dublin-based club broke away to form the football association of the irish free state . today the southern association is known a the football association of ireland ( fai ) . despite being initially blacklisted by the home nation ' association , the fai wa recognised by fifa in <year> and organised it first international fixture in <year> ( against italy national football team ) . however , both the ifa and fai continued to select their team from the whole of ireland , with some player earning international cap for match with both team . both also referred to their respective team a ireland . </s> in <year> , fifa directed the association only to select player from within their respective territory and , in <year> , directed that the fai 's team be known only a `` republic of ireland national football team `` and that the ifa 's team be known a `` northern ireland national football team `` ( with certain exception ) . northern ireland qualified for the fifa world cup final in <year> fifa world cup ( reaching the quarter-finals ) , <year> fifa world cup and <year> fifa world cup and the uefa european championship in uefa euro <year> . the republic qualified for the world cup final in <year> fifa world cup ( reaching the quarter-finals ) , <year> fifa world cup , <year> fifa world cup and the european championship in uefa euro <year> , uefa euro <year> and uefa euro <year> . across ireland , there is significant interest in the premier league and , to a lesser extent , scottish premier league soccer league . </s> ireland field a single ireland national rugby union team and a single association , the irish rugby football union , governs the sport across the island . the irish rugby team have played in every rugby world cup , making the quarter-finals in six of them . ireland also hosted game during the <year> rugby world cup and the <year> rugby world cup ( including a quarter-final ) . there are four professional irish team ; all four play in the pro14 and at least three compete for the heineken cup . irish rugby ha become increasingly competitive at both the michael carruth won a gold medal and wayne mccullough won a silver medal in the <year> summer olympics . in <year> kenneth egan won a silver medal in the beijing game . paddy barnes secured bronze in those game and gold in the <year> european amateur boxing championship ( where ireland came <number> in the overall medal table ) and <year> commonwealth game . katie taylor ha won gold in every kg lightweight . </s> golf is very popular , and golf tourism is a major industry attracting more than <number> golfing visitor annually . the <year> ryder cup wa held at the kildare hotel and golf club in county kildare . pdraig harrington became the first irishman since fred daly ( golfer ) in <year> to win the the open championship at carnoustie in july <year> . he successfully defended his august <year> , mcilroy won his <number> major championship by winning the uspga championship by a record margin of <number> shot . </s> <section_title_start> recreation <section_title_end> </s> the west coast of ireland , lahinch and donegal bay in particular , have popular surfing beach , being fully exposed to the atlantic ocean . donegal bay is shaped like a funnel and catch west/south-west atlantic wind , creating good surf , especially in winter . since just before the year <year> , bundoran ha hosted european championship surfing . scuba diving is increasingly popular in ireland with clear water and large population of sea life , particularly along the western seaboard . there are also many shipwreck along the coast of ireland , with some of the best wreck dive being in malin head and off the county cork coast . </s> with thousand of lake , over of fish-bearing river and over of coastline , ireland is a popular angling destination . the temperate irish climate is suited to sport angling . while salmon and trout fishing remain popular with angler , salmon fishing in particular received a boost in <year> with the closing of the salmon driftnet fishery . coarse fishing continues to increase it profile . sea angling is developed with many beach mapped and signposted , and the range of sea angling specie is around <number> </s> <section_title_start> food and drink <section_title_end> </s> food and cuisine in ireland take it influence from the crop grown and animal farmed in the island 's temperate climate and from the social and political circumstance of irish history . for example , whilst from the middle age until the arrival of the potato in the <number> century the dominant feature of the irish economy wa the herding of cattle , the number of cattle a person owned wa equated to their social standing . thus herder would avoid slaughtering a milk-producing cow . </s> for this reason , pork and white meat were more common than beef , and thick fatty strip of salted bacon ( known a rasher ) and the eating of salted butter ( i.e . a dairy product rather than beef itself ) have been a central feature of the diet in ireland since the middle age . the practice of bleeding cattle and mixing the blood with milk and butter ( not unlike the practice of the maasai people ) wa common and black pudding , made from blood , grain ( usually barley ) and seasoning , remains a breakfast staple in ireland . all of these influence can be seen today in the phenomenon of the `` breakfast roll `` . </s> the introduction of the potato in the second half of the <number> century heavily influenced cuisine thereafter . great poverty encouraged a subsistence approach to food , and by the mid-19th century the vast majority of the population sufficed with a diet of potato and milk . a typical family , consisting of a man , a woman and four child , would eat of potato per week . consequently , dish that are considered a national dish represent a fundamental simplicity to cooking , such a the irish stew , bacon and cabbage , boxty , a type of potato pancake , or colcannon , a dish of mashed potato and kale or cabbage . </s> since the last quarter of the <number> century , with a re-emergence of wealth in ireland , a `` new irish cuisine `` based on traditional ingredient incorporating international influence ha emerged . this cuisine is based on fresh vegetable , fish ( especially salmon , trout , oyster , mussel and other shellfish ) , a well a traditional soda bread and the wide range of hand-made list of irish cheese that are now being produced across the country . an example of this new cuisine is `` dublin lawyer `` : lobster cooked in whiskey and cream . the potato remains however a fundamental feature of this cuisine and the irish remain the highest per caput consumer of potato in europe . traditional regional food can be found throughout the country , for example coddle in dublin or drisheen in cork , both a type of sausage , or blaa , a doughy white bread particular to waterford . </s> ireland once dominated the world 's market for whiskey , producing <number> of the world 's whiskey at the start of the <number> century . however , a a consequence of bootlegger during the prohibition in the united state ( who sold poor-quality whiskey bearing irish-sounding name thus eroding the pre-prohibition popularity for irish brand ) and tariff on irish whiskey across the british empire during the anglo-irish trade war of the <year> , sale of irish whiskey worldwide fell to a mere <number> by the mid-20th century . in <year> , an irish government survey , found that <number> of whiskey drinker in the united state had never heard of irish whiskey . </s> irish whiskey , a researched in <year> by the cnbc american broadcaster , remains popular domestically and ha grown in international sale steadily over a few decade . typically cnbc state irish whiskey is not a smoky a a scotch whisky , but not a sweet a american whiskey or canadian whiskey whisky . whiskey form the basis of traditional irish cream , such a bailey irish cream , and the `` irish coffee `` ( a cocktail of coffee and whiskey reputedly invented at foynes foynes flying-boat station ) is probably the best-known irish cocktail . </s> porter ( beer ) , a kind of porter beer , particularly guinness , is typically associated with ireland , although historically it wa more closely associated with london . porter remains very popular , although it ha lost sale since the mid-20th century to lager . cider , particularly magners ( marketed in the republic of ireland a bulmers ) , is also a popular drink . red lemonade , a soft-drink , is consumed on it own and a a mixer , particularly with whiskey . </s> celtic nation </s> category : divided region </s> category : international island <article_end> <article_start> </s> the bahamas ( ) , known officially a the commonwealth of the bahamas , is a country within the lucayan archipelago of the west indie in the atlantic . it take up <number> of the lucayan archipelago 's land area and is home to <number> of the archipelago 's population . the archipelagic state consists of more than <number> island , cay , and islet in the atlantic ocean , and is located north of cuba and northwest of the island of hispaniola ( split between haiti and the dominican republic ) and the turk and caicos island , southeast of the united state state of florida , and east of the florida key . the capital is nassau , bahamas on the island of new providence . the royal bahamas defence force describes the bahamas ' territory a encompassing of ocean space . </s> the bahamas were inhabited by the lucayan people , a branch of the arawakan-speaking tano people , for many century . christopher columbus wa the first european to see the island , making his first landfall in the 'new world ' in <year> . later , the spain shipped the native lucayans to and enslaved them on hispaniola , after which the bahama island were mostly deserted from <year> until <year> , when kingdom of england colonist from bermuda settled on the island of eleuthera . </s> the bahamas became a kingdom of great britain crown colony in <year> , when the british clamped down on piracy . after the american revolutionary war , the crown resettled thousand of american loyalist to the bahamas ; they took enslaved people with them and established plantation on land grant . african enslaved people and their descendant constituted the majority of the population from this period on . the slave trade wa abolished by the british in <year> ; slavery in the bahamas wa abolished in <year> . subsequently , the bahamas became a haven for freed african slave . african liberated from illegal slave ship were resettled on the island by the royal navy , while some slavery in north america and seminole escaped to the bahamas from florida . bahamian were even known to recognise the freedom of enslaved people carried by the ship of other nation which reached the bahamas . today afro-bahamians make up <number> of the population of <number> </s> the country gained governmental independence in <year> led by lynden pindling sir lynden o. pindling , with elizabeth ii a queen of the bahamas . in term of gross domestic product per caput , the bahamas is one of the richest country in the america ( following the united state and canada ) , with an economy based on tourism and offshore finance . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the name bahamas is most likely derived from either the tano language ba ha ma ( `` big upper middle land `` ) , which wa a term for the region used by the indigenous people , or possibly from the spanish language baja mar ( `` shallow water or sea `` or `` low tide `` ) reflecting the shallow water of the area . alternatively , it may originate from guanahani , a local name of unclear meaning . </s> the word the constitutes an integral part of the short form of the name and is , therefore , capitalised . the constitution of the commonwealth of the bahamas , the country 's fundamental law , capitalises the `` t `` in `` the bahamas `` . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-colonial era <section_title_end> </s> the first inhabitant of the bahamas were the tano people people , who moved into the uninhabited southern island from hispaniola and cuba around the <number>s1000s ad , having migrated there from south america ; they came to be known a the lucayan people . an estimated <number> lucayans inhabited the bahamas at the time of christopher columbus 's arrival in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> arrival of the spanish <section_title_end> </s> columbus 's first landfall in what wa to european a 'new world ' wa on an island he named san salvador ( known to the lucayans a guanahani ) . whilst there is a general consensus that this island lay within the bahamas , precisely which island columbus landed on is a matter of scholarly debate . some researcher believe the site to be present-day san salvador island ( formerly known a watling 's island ) , situated in the southeastern bahamas , whilst an alternative theory hold that columbus landed to the southeast on samana cay , according to calculation made in <year> by national geographic ( magazine ) writer and editor joseph judge , based on columbus 's log . on the landfall island , columbus made first contact with the lucayans and exchanged good with them , claiming the island for the crown of castile , before proceeding to explore the larger isle of the greater antilles . </s> the <year> treaty of tordesillas theoretically divided the new territory between the kingdom of castile and the kingdom of portugal , placing the bahamas in the spanish sphere ; however they did little to press their claim on the ground . the spanish did however exploit the native lucayan people , many of whom were enslaved and sent to hispaniola for use a forced labour . the slave suffered harsh condition and most died from contracting infectious disease to which they had no immunity ( medical ) ; half of the taino died from smallpox alone . a a result of these depredation the population of the bahamas wa severely diminished . </s> <section_title_start> arrival of the english <section_title_end> </s> the english had expressed an interest in the bahamas a early a <year> . however , it wa not until <year> that the first english settler arrived on the island . known a the eleutherian adventurer and led by william sayle , they migrated to bermuda seeking greater religious freedom . these english puritan established the first permanent european settlement on an island which they named 'eleuthera ' , greek for 'freedom ' . they later settled new providence , naming it sayle 's island . life proved harder than envisaged however , and many including sayle chose to return to bermuda . to survive , the remaining settler wrecking ( shipwreck ) # the bahamas . </s> in <year> , charles ii of england granted the island to the lord proprietor of the province of carolina in north america . they rented the island from the king with right of trading , tax , appointing governor # british empire and commonwealth of nation , and administering the country from their base on new providence . piracy and attack from hostile foreign power were a constant threat . in <year> , spanish privateer juan de alcon raid on charles town charles town ( later renamed nassau , bahamas ) , and in <year> , a joint franco-spanish expedition raid on nassau during the war of the spanish succession . </s> <section_title_start> 18th century <section_title_end> </s> during proprietary rule , the bahamas became a haven for piracy , including blackbeard ( circa <year> <number> ) . to put an end to the 'pirates ' republic ' and restore orderly government , great britain made the bahamas a british overseas territory in <year> , which they dubbed `` the bahama island `` under the royal governorship of woodes rogers . after a difficult struggle , he succeeded in suppressing piracy . in <year> , the raid on nassau ( <year> ) during the war of the quadruple alliance . in <year> , a local assembly wa established giving a degree of self-governance for the english settler . the reform had been planned by the previous governor george phenney and authorised in july <year> . </s> during the american war of independence in the late <number> century , the island became a target for u naval force . under the command of commodore esek hopkins , united state marine corp , the u navy occupied nassau in <year> , before being evacuated a few day later . in <year> a spanish fleet appeared off the coast of nassau , and the city capture of the bahamas ( <year> ) . later , in april <year> , on a visit made by prince william of the united kingdom ( later to become william iv of great britain ) to luis de unzaga at his residence in the captaincy general of havana , they made prisoner exchange agreement and also dealt with the preliminary of the treaty of paris ( <year> ) , in which the recently conquered bahamas would be exchanged for spanish florida , which would still have to conquer the city of st. augustine , florida in <year> by order of luis de unzaga ; after that , also in <year> , the bahamas would be declared a british colony . </s> after u independence , the british resettled some <number> loyalist ( american revolution ) with their african slave in the bahamas , including <number> from new york and at least <number> european , <number> african ancestrals and a few native american creek people from east florida . most of the refugee resettled from new york had fled from other colony , including west florida , which the spanish captured during the war . the government granted land to the planter to help compensate for loss on the continent . these loyalist , who included deveaux and also lord dunmore , established plantation on several island and became a political force in the capital . european american were outnumbered by the african-american slave they brought with them , and ethnic european remained a minority in the territory . </s> <section_title_start> 19th century <section_title_end> </s> the slave trade act <year> abolished slave trading to british possession , including the bahamas . the united kingdom pressured other slave-trading country to also abolish slave-trading , and give the royal navy the right to intercept ship carrying slave on the high sea . thousand of african liberated from slave ship by the royal navy were resettled in the bahamas . </s> in the <year> during the period of the seminole war in florida , hundred of north american slave and african seminole escaped from cape florida to the bahamas . they settled mostly on northwest andros island , where they developed the village of red bay . from eyewitness account , <number> escaped in a mass flight in <year> , aided by bahamian in <number> sloop , with others using canoe for the journey . this wa commemorated in <year> by a large sign at bill baggs cape florida state park . some of their descendant in red bay continue african seminole tradition in basket making and grave marking . </s> in <year> , the home office in london had ruled that `` any slave brought to the bahamas from outside the british west indie would be manumitted . `` this led to a total of nearly <number> enslaved people owned by u national being freed from <year> to <year> . the american slave ship comet and encomium used in the united state domestic coastwise slave trade , were wrecked off abaco island in december <year> and february <year> , respectively . when wrecker took the master , passenger and slave into nassau , custom officer seized the slave and british colonial official freed them , over the protest of the american . there were <number> slave on the comet and <number> on the encomium . the united kingdom finally paid an indemnity to the united state in those two case in <year> , under the treaty of claim of <year> , which settled several compensation case between the two country . </s> slavery wa slavery abolition act <year> on <number> august <year> . after that british colonial official freed <number> north american slave from the enterprise ( slave ship ) , which went into bermuda in <year> ; and <number> from the hermosa , which wrecked off abaco island in <year> . the most notable case wa that of the creole case in <year> : a a result of a slave revolt on board , the leader ordered the u brig to nassau . it wa carrying <number> slave from virginia destined for sale in new orleans . the bahamian official freed the <number> slave who chose to stay in the island . the creole case ha been described a the `` most successful slave revolt in u.s. history `` . </s> these incident , in which a total of <number> enslaved people belonging to u national were freed from <year> to <year> , increased tension between the united state and the united kingdom of great britain and ireland . they had been co-operating in patrol to suppress the international slave trade . however , worried about the stability of it large domestic slave trade and it value , the united state argued that the united kingdom should not treat it domestic ship that came to it colonial port under duress a part of the international trade . the united state worried that the success of the creole slave in gaining freedom would encourage more slave revolt on merchant ship . </s> during the american civil war of the <year> , the island briefly prospered a a focus for blockade runner aiding the confederate state . </s> <section_title_start> early <number> century <section_title_end> </s> the early decade of the <number> century were one of hardship for many bahamian , characterised by a stagnant economy and widespread poverty . many eked out a living via subsistence agriculture or fishing . </s> in august <year> , the edward viii wa appointed governor of the bahamas . he arrived in the colony with his wallis simpson . although disheartened at the condition of government house , they `` tried to make the best of a bad situation `` . he did not enjoy the position , and referred to the island a `` a third-class british colony `` . he opened the small local parliament on <number> october <year> . the couple visited the `` out island `` that november , on axel wenner-gren 's yacht , which caused controversy ; the british foreign office strenuously objected because they had been advised by united state intelligence that wenner-gren wa a close friend of the luftwaffe commander hermann gring of nazi germany . </s> the duke wa praised at the time for his effort to combat poverty on the island . a <year> biography by philip ziegler , however , described him a contemptuous of the bahamian and other non-european people of the empire . he wa praised for his resolution of civil unrest over low wage in nassau , bahamas in june <year> , when there wa a `` full-scale riot `` . ziegler said that the duke blamed the trouble on `` mischief maker communist `` and `` men of central european jewish descent , who had secured job a a pretext for obtaining a deferment of draft `` . the duke resigned from the post on <number> march <year> . </s> <section_title_start> post-second world war <section_title_end> </s> modern political development began after the second world war . the first political party were formed in the <year> , split broadly along ethnic line the united bahamian party ( ubp ) representing the english-descended bahamian ( known informally a the 'bay street boy ' ) , and the progressive liberal party ( plp ) representing the afro-bahamian majority . </s> a new constitution granting the bahamas internal autonomy went into effect on <number> january <year> , with chief minister sir roland symonette of the ubp becoming the first premier . in <year> , lynden pindling of the plp became the first black premier of the bahamian colony ; in <year> , the title of the position wa changed to prime minister of the bahamas . in <year> , pindling announced that the bahamas would seek full independence . a new constitution giving the bahamas increased control over it own affair wa adopted in <year> . in <year> , the ubp merged with a disaffected faction of the plp to form a new party , the free national movement ( fnm ) , a de-racialised , centre-right party which aimed to counter the growing power of pindling 's plp . </s> the british house of lord voted to give the bahamas it independence on <number> june <year> . prince charles delivered the official document to prime minister of the bahamas lynden pindling , officially declaring the bahamas a fully independent nation on <number> july <year> , and this date is now celebrated a the country 's list of national independence day . it joined the commonwealth of nation on the same day . sir milo butler wa appointed the first governor-general of the bahamas governor-general of the bahamas ( the official representative of elizabeth ii of the united kingdom ) shortly after independence . </s> <section_title_start> post-independence <section_title_end> </s> shortly after independence , the bahamas joined the international monetary fund and the world bank on <number> august <year> , and later the united nation on <number> september <year> . </s> politically , the first two decade were dominated by pindling 's plp , who went on to win a string of electoral victory . allegation of corruption , link with drug cartel and financial malfeasance within the bahamian government failed to dent pindling 's popularity . meanwhile , the economy underwent a dramatic growth period fueled by the twin pillar of tourism and offshore finance , significantly raising the standard of living on the island . the bahamas ' booming economy led to it becoming a beacon for immigrant , most notably from haiti . </s> <year> bahamian general election , pindling wa unseated by hubert ingraham of the fnm . ingraham went on to win the <year> bahamian general election , before being defeated <year> bahamian general election , when the plp returned to power under perry christie . ingraham returned to power from <year> to <year> , followed by christie again from <year> to <year> . with economic growth faltering , bahamian re-elected the fnm in <year> , with hubert minnis becoming the fourth prime minister . </s> in september <year> , hurricane dorian struck the abaco island and grand bahama at saffirsimpson scale # category <number> intensity , devastating the northwestern bahamas . the storm inflicted at least united state dollar u $ <number> billion in damage and killed more than <number> people , with <number> people still missing . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> the bahamas consists of a list of island of the bahamas spread out over some in the atlantic ocean , located to the east of florida in the united state , north of cuba and hispaniola and west of the british overseas territory of the turk and caicos island ( with which it form the lucayan archipelago ) . it lie between latitude <number> parallel north <number> and <number> parallel north <number>n , and longitude <number> meridian west <number> and <number> meridian west <number>w and straddle the tropic of cancer . there are some <number> island and <number> cay in total ( of which <number> are inhabited ) with a total land area of . </s> nassau , bahamas , capital city of the bahamas , lie on the island of new providence ; the other main inhabited island are grand bahama , eleuthera , cat island , bahamas , rum cay , long island , bahamas , san salvador island , ragged island , bahamas , acklins , crooked island ( bahamas ) , exuma , berry island , mayaguana , the bimini island , great abaco and great inagua . the largest island is andros , bahamas . </s> all the island are low and flat , with ridge that usually rise no more than . the highest point in the country is mount alvernia ( formerly como hill ) on cat island at . </s> the country contains three terrestrial ecoregions : bahamian dry forest , bahamian pine mosaic , and bahamian mangrove . it had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> according to the kppen climate classification , the climate of the bahamas is mostly tropical savannah climate or aw , with a hot and wet season and a warm and dry season . the low latitude , warm tropical gulf stream , and low elevation give the bahamas a warm and winterless climate . </s> a with most tropical climate , seasonal rainfall follows the sun , and summer is the wettest season . there is only a difference between the warmest month and coolest month in most of the bahama island . every few decade low temperature can fall below for a few hour when a severe cold outbreak come down from the north american mainland , however there ha never been a frost or freeze recorded in the bahamian island . only once in recorded history ha snow been seen in the air anywhere in the bahamas , this occurred in freeport on <number> january <year> , when snow mixed with rain wa seen in the air for a short time . the bahamas are often sunny and dry for long period of time , and average more than <number> ; hour or <number> ; day of sunlight annually . much of the natural vegetation is tropical scrub and cactus and succulent are common in landscape . </s> tropical storm and hurricane occasionally impact the bahamas . in <year> , hurricane andrew passed over the northern portion of the island , and hurricane floyd passed near the eastern portion of the island in <year> . hurricane dorian of <year> passed over the archipelago at destructive saffirsimpson scale category ; <number> strength with sustained wind of and wind gust up to , becoming the strongest tropical cyclone on record to impact the northwestern island of grand bahama and great abaco . </s> { class= `` wikitable `` style= `` text-align : center `` </s> +average sea temperature in nassau , bahamas </s> - </s> ! jan </s> ! feb </s> ! mar </s> ! apr </s> ! may </s> ! jun </s> ! jul </s> ! aug </s> ! sep </s> ! oct </s> ! nov </s> ! dec </s> - </s> } </s> <section_title_start> geology <section_title_end> </s> the bahamas is part of the lucayan archipelago , which continues into the turk and caicos island , the mouchoir bank , the silver bank , and the navidad bank . </s> the bahamas platform , which includes the bahamas , southern florida , northern cuba , the turk and caicos , and the blake plateau , formed about <number> megaannum , not long after the formation of the north atlantic . the thick limestone , which predominate in the bahamas , date back to the cretaceous . these limestone would have been deposited in shallow sea , assumed to be a stretched and thinned portion of the north american plate . sediment were forming at about the same rate a the crust below wa sinking due to the added weight . thus , the entire area consisted of a large marine plain with some island . then , at about <number> ; ma , the area became flooded by the gulf stream . this resulted in the drowning of the blake plateau , the separation of the bahamas from cuba and florida , the separation of the southeastern bahamas into separate bank , the creation of the cay sal bank , plus the bahama bank . sedimentation from the `` carbonate factory `` of each bank , or atoll , continues today at the rate of about per kyr . coral reef form the `` retaining wall `` of these atoll , within which oolites and pellet ( petrology ) form . </s> coral growth wa greater through the tertiary ( geology ) , until the start of the ice age , and hence those deposit are more abundant below a depth of . in fact , an ancient extinct reef exists half a km seaward of the present one , below sea level . oolites form when oceanic water penetrate the shallow bank , increasing the temperature about and the salinity by <number> per cent . cementation ( geology ) ooids are referred to a grapestone . additionally , giant stromatolites are found off the exuma cay . </s> sea level change resulted in a drop in sea level , causing wind blown oolite to form sand dune with distinct cross-bedding . overlapping dune form oolitic ridge , which become rapidly lithified through the action of rainwater , called eolianite . most island have ridge ranging from , though cat island ha a ridge in height . the land between ridge is conducive to the formation of lake and swamp . </s> solution weathering of the limestone result in a `` bahamian karst `` topography . this includes pothole ( geology ) , blue hole such a dean 's blue hole , sinkhole , beachrock such a the bimini road ( `` pavement of atlantis `` ) , caliche , cave due to the lack of river , and sea cave . several blue hole are aligned along the south andros fault ( geology ) line . tidal flat and tidal creek are common , but the more impressive drainage pattern are formed by trough and canyon such a great bahama canyon with the evidence of turbidity current and turbidite deposition . </s> the stratigraphy of the island consists of the middle pleistocene owl 's hole formation ( geology ) , overlain by the late pleistocene grotto beach formation , and then the holocene rice bay formation . however , these unit are not necessarily stacked on top of each other but can be located laterally . the oldest formation , owl 's hole , is capped by a terra rossa ( soil ) paleosoil , a is the grotto beach , unless eroded . the grotto beach formation is the most widespread . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> the bahamas is a parliamentary system constitutional monarchy , with the queen of the bahamas ( elizabeth ii ) a head of state represented locally by a list of governors-general of the bahamas governor-general . political and legal tradition closely follow those of the united kingdom and the westminster system . the bahamas is a member of the commonwealth of nation and personal union it [ of state ] with other commonwealth realm . </s> the prime minister of the bahamas is the [ of government ] and is the leader of the party with the most seat in the house of assembly of the bahamas . executive ( government ) is exercised by the cabinet , selected by the prime minister and drawn from his supporter in the house of assembly . the current governor-general is the honourable cornelius a. smith , and the current list of head of government of the bahamas is the right honourable the rt . hon . hubert minnis member of parliament . </s> legislature is vested in a bicameralism parliament , which consists of a <number>-member house of assembly ( the lower house ) , with member elected from plurality voting system single-member district , and a <number>-member parliament of the bahamas # senate , with member appointed by the governor-general , including nine on the advice of the prime minister , four on the advice of the leader of the opposition leader of her majesty 's loyal opposition , and three on the advice of the prime minister after consultation with the leader of the opposition . a under the westminster system , the prime minister may dissolve parliament and call a general election at any time within a five-year term . </s> constitutional safeguard include freedom of speech , freedom of the press , freedom of religion , freedom of movement and freedom of association . the judiciary of the bahamas is independent of the executive and the legislature . jurisprudence is based on english law . </s> <section_title_start> political culture <section_title_end> </s> the bahamas ha a two-party system dominated by the centre-left progressive liberal party and the centre-right free national movement . a handful of other political party have been unable to win election to parliament ; these have included the bahamas democratic movement , the coalition for democratic reform , bahamian nationalist party and the democratic national alliance ( bahamas ) . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relations <section_title_end> </s> the bahamas ha strong bilateral relationship with the united state and the united kingdom , represented by an ambassador in washington , d.c. and high commissioner in london . the bahamas also associate closely with other nation of the caribbean community ( caricom ) . </s> the embassy of the united state in nassau donated $ <number> million to the minister for disaster preparedness , management , and reconstruction for modular shelter , medical evacuation boat , and construction material . the donation wa made <number> week after the one year anniversary of hurricane dorian . </s> <section_title_start> armed forces <section_title_end> </s> the bahamanian military is the royal bahamaian defence force ( rbdf ) , the navy of the bahamas which includes a land unit called commando squadron ( regiment ) and an air wing ( air force ) . under the defence act , the rbdf ha been mandated , in the name of the elizabeth ii of the bahamas , to defend the bahamas , protect it territorial integrity , patrol it water , provide assistance and relief in time of disaster , maintain order in conjunction with the law enforcement agency of the bahamas , and carry out any such duty a determined by the national security council . the defence force is also a member of the caribbean community ( caricom ) 's regional security task force . </s> the rbdf came into existence on <number> march <year> . it duty include defending the bahamas , stopping illegal drug trade , illegal immigration and poaching , and providing assistance to mariner . the defence force ha a fleet of <number> coastal and inshore patrol craft along with <number> aircraft and over <number> personnel including <number> officer and <number> woman . </s> <section_title_start> administrative divisions <section_title_end> </s> the district of the bahamas provide a system of local government everywhere except new providence ( which hold <number> percent of the national population ) , whose affair are handled directly by the central government . in <year> , the bahamian parliament passed the `` local government act `` to facilitate the establishment of family island administrator , local government district , local district councillor and local town committee for the various island community . the overall goal of this act is to allow the various elected leader to govern and oversee the affair of their respective district without the interference of the central government . in total , there are <number> district , with election being held every five year . there are <number> councillor and <number> town committee member elected to represent the various district . </s> each councillor or town committee member is responsible for the proper use of public fund for the maintenance and development of their constituency . </s> the district other than new providence are : </s> <section_title_start> national flag <section_title_end> </s> the bahamian flag wa adopted in <year> . it colour symbolise the strength of the bahamian people ; it design reflects aspect of the natural environment ( sun and sea ) and economic and social development . the flag is a black equilateral triangle against the mast , superimposed on a horizontal background made up of three equal stripe of aquamarine , gold and aquamarine . </s> <section_title_start> coat of arms <section_title_end> </s> the coat of arm of the bahamas contains a shield with the national symbol a it focal point . the shield is supported by a marlin and a flamingo , which are the national animal of the bahamas . the flamingo is located on the land , and the marlin on the sea , indicating the geography of the island . </s> on top of the shield is a conch shell , which represents the varied marine life of the island chain . the conch shell rest on a helmet . below this is the actual shield , the main symbol of which is a ship representing the santa maria ( ship ) of christopher columbus , shown sailing beneath the sun . along the bottom , below the shield appears a banner upon which is the national motto : </s> `` forward , upward , onward together . `` </s> <section_title_start> national flower <section_title_end> </s> the national flower of the bahamas is the tecoma stans , a it is endemic to the bahama island and it bloom throughout the year . </s> selection of the yellow elder over many other flower wa made through the combined popular vote of member of all four of new providence 's garden club of the <year> the nassau garden club , the carver garden club , the international garden club and the ywca garden club . they reasoned that other flower grown theresuch a the bougainvillea , [ and delonix regia poinciana ] had already been chosen a the national flower of other country . the yellow elder , on the other hand , wa unclaimed by other country ( although it is now also the national flower of the [ [ united state virgin island ) and also the yellow elder is native to the family island . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> by the term of list of country by gdp per caput , the bahamas is one of the richest country in the america . it currency ( the bahamian dollar ) is kept at a <number>-to-1 currency peg with the u dollar . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> the bahamas relies heavily on tourism to generate most of it economic activity . tourism a an industry not only account for about <number> of the bahamian gdp , but also provides job for about half of the country 's workforce . the bahamas attracted <number> ; million visitor in <year> , more than <number> of whom were cruise visitor . </s> <section_title_start> financial services <section_title_end> </s> after tourism , the next most important economic sector is banking and offshore financial centre , accounting for some <number> of gdp . it wa revealed in the panama paper that the bahamas is the jurisdiction with the most offshore entity or company in the world . </s> the economy ha a very competitive tax regime ( classified by some a a tax haven ) . the government derives it revenue from import tariff , vat , licence fee , property and stamp tax , but there is no income tax , corporate tax , capital gain tax , or wealth tax . payroll tax fund social insurance benefit and amount to <number> paid by the employee and <number> paid by the employer . in <year> , overall tax revenue a a percentage of gdp wa <number> . </s> <section_title_start> agriculture , natural resource , and manufacturing <section_title_end> </s> agriculture and manufacturing form the third largest sector of the bahamian economy , representing <number> of total gdp . an estimated <number> of the bahamian food supply is imported . major crop include onion , okra , tomato , orange ( fruit ) , grapefruit , cucumber , sugar cane , lemon , lime ( fruit ) , and sweet potato . </s> access to biocapacity in the bahamas is much higher than world average . in <year> , the bahamas had <number> global hectare of biocapacity per person within it territory , much more than the world average of <number> global hectare per person . in <year> the bahamas used <number> global hectare of biocapacity per person - their ecological footprint of consumption . this mean they use le biocapacity than the bahamas contains . a a result , the bahamas is running a biocapacity reserve . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> the bahamas ha an estimated population of , of which <number> are <number> or under , <number> <number> to <number> and <number> over <number> . it ha a population growth rate of <number> ( <year> ) , with a birth rate of <number>/1,000 population , death rate of <number>/1,000 , and net migration rate of <number> migrant ( s ) /1,000 population . the infant mortality rate is <number> deaths/1,000 live birth . resident have a life expectancy at birth of <number> year : <number> year for female , <number> year for male . the total fertility rate is <number> child born/woman ( <year> ) . </s> the most populous island are new providence , where nassau , bahamas , the capital and largest city , is located ; and grand bahama , home to the second largest city of freeport , bahamas . </s> <section_title_start> racial and ethnic groups <section_title_end> </s> according to the <number> response rate obtained from the race question on the <year> census questionnaire , <number> of the population identified themselves a being afro-bahamians , <number> white bahamian and <number> of a mulatto ( african and european ) . three century prior , in <year> when the first official census of the bahamas wa taken , <number> of the population wa native european and <number> native african . </s> since the colonial era of plantation , african or afro-bahamians have been the largest ethnic group in the bahamas , whose primary ancestry wa based in west africa . the first african to arrive to the bahamas were freed slave from bermuda ; they arrived with the eleutheran adventurer looking for new life . </s> the haitian community in the bahamas is also largely of african descent and number about <number> . due to an extremely high immigration of haitian to the bahamas , the bahamian government started deporting illegal haitian immigrant to their homeland in late <year> . </s> the white bahamian population are mainly the descendant of the puritan and loyalist ( american revolution ) escaping the revolutionary war ( united state ) who arrived in <year> and <year> , respectively . many southern loyalist went to the abaco island , half of whose population wa of european descent a of <year> . the term white is usually used to identify bahamian with anglo ancestry , a well a `` light-skinned `` afro-bahamians . sometimes bahamian use the term conch ( people ) to describe people of anglo descent . </s> a small portion of the euro-bahamian population are greek bahamian , descended from greece labourer who came to help develop the sponging industry in the <year> . they make up le than <number> of the nation 's population , but have still preserved their distinct greek bahamian culture . </s> bahamian typically identify themselves simply a either black or white . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> the island ' population is predominantly christian . protestant denomination collectively account for more than <number> of the population , with baptist representing <number> of the population , anglican <number> , pentecostal <number> , church of god ( holiness ) <number> , seventh-day adventist <number> and methodist <number> . there is also a significant roman catholic community accounting for about <number> . there are also smaller community of jew , muslim , bah faith , hindu , rastafarian and practitioner of traditional african religion such a obeah . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> the official language of the bahamas is english . many people speak an english-based creole language english-based creole language called bahamian dialect ( known simply a `` dialect `` ) or `` bahamianese `` . laurente gibbs , a bahamian writer and actor , wa the first to coin the latter name in a poem and ha since promoted it usage . both are used a autoglossonyms . haitian creole , a french-based creole language french-based creole language is spoken by haitian and their descendant , who make up of about <number> of the total population . it is known simply a creole to differentiate it from bahamian english . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> the culture of the island is a mixture of african ( afro-bahamians being the largest ethnicity ) , british ( a the former colonial power ) and american ( a the dominant country in the region and source of most tourist ) . </s> a form of african-based folk magic ( obeah ) is practised by some bahamian , mainly in the family island ( out-islands ) of the bahamas . the practice of obeah is illegal in the bahamas and punishable in law . </s> in the le developed outer island ( or family island ) , handicraft include basketry made from palm frond . this material , commonly called `` straw `` , is plaited into hat and bag that are popular tourist item . another use is for so-called `` voodoo doll `` , even though such doll are the result of foreign influence and not based in historic fact . </s> junkanoo is a traditional afro-bahamian street parade of 'rushing ' , music , dance and art held in nassau ( and a few other settlement ) every boxing day and new year 's day . junkanoo is also used to celebrate other holiday and event such a emancipation day . </s> regatta are important social event in many family island settlement . they usually feature one or more day of sailing by old-fashioned boat , a well a an onshore festival . </s> many dish are associated with bahamian cuisine , which reflects caribbean , african and european influence . some settlement have festival associated with the traditional crop or food of that area , such a the `` pineapple fest `` in gregory town , eleuthera or the `` crab fest `` on andros . other significant tradition include story telling . </s> bahamian have created a rich literature of poetry , short story , play and short fictional work . common theme in these work are ( <number> ) an awareness of change , ( <number> ) a striving for sophistication , ( <number> ) a search for identity , ( <number> ) nostalgia for the old way and ( <number> ) an appreciation of beauty . some major writer are susan wallace , percival miller , robert johnson , raymond brown , o.m . smith , william johnson , eddie minnis and winston saunders . </s> bahamas culture is rich with belief , tradition , folklore and legend . the best-known folklore and legend in the bahamas include the lusca and chickcharney creature of andros , pretty molly on exuma bahamas and the lost city of atlantis on bimini bahamas . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> sport is a significant part of bahamian culture . the national sport is cricket . cricket ha been played in the bahamas from <year> , the oldest sport being played in the country today . the bahamas cricket association wa formed in <year> , and from the <year> to the <year> , cricket wa played amongst many bahamian . bahamas is not a part of the west indie cricket board , so player are not eligible to play for the west indie cricket team . the late <year> saw the game begin to decline in the country a teacher , who had previously come from the united kingdom with a passion for cricket , were replaced by teacher who had been trained in the united state . the bahamian physical education teacher had no knowledge of the game and instead taught track and field , basketball , baseball , softball , volleyball and association football where primary and high school compete against each other . today cricket is still enjoyed by a few local and immigrant in the country , usually from jamaica , guyana , haiti and barbados . cricket is played on saturday and sunday at windsor park and haynes oval . </s> the only other sporting event that began before cricket wa [ racing ] , which started in <year> . the most popular spectator sport are those imported from the united state , such a basketball , american football , and baseball , rather than from the british isle , due to the country 's close proximity to the united state , unlike their other caribbean counterpart , where cricket , rugby football , and netball have proven to be more popular . </s> dexter cambridge , rick fox , ian lockhart , magnum rolle , buddy hield and deandre ayton are a few bahamian who joined bahamian mychal thompson of the los angeles lakers in the nba rank . over the year american football ha become much more popular than soccer , though not implemented in the high school system yet . league for teen and adult have been developed by the bahamas american football federation . however soccer , a it is commonly known in the country , is still a very popular sport amongst high school pupil . league are governed by the bahamas football association . recently , the bahamian government ha been working closely with tottenham hotspur of london to promote the sport in the country a well a promoting the bahamas in the european market . in <year> , 'spurs ' became the first premier league club to play an exhibition match in the bahamas , facing the jamaica national football team . joe lewis ( british businessman ) , the owner of the club , is based in the bahamas . </s> other popular sport are swimming ( sport ) , tennis and boxing , where bahamian have enjoyed some degree of success at the international level . other sport such a golf , rugby league , rugby union , beach soccer , and netball are considered growing sport . athletics ( sport ) , commonly known a 'track and field ' in the country , is the most successful sport by far amongst bahamian . bahamian have a strong tradition in the sprint ( running ) and jump . track and field is probably the most popular spectator sport in the country next to basketball due to their success over the year . triathlons are gaining popularity in nassau and the family island . </s> durward knowles wa a sailor and olympic champion from the bahamas . he won the gold medal in the star class at the <year> summer olympics in tokyo , together with cecil cooke . he won the bronze medal in the same class at the <year> summer olympics in melbourne along with sloane elmo farrington . he had previously competed for the united kingdom in the <year> olympics , finishing in <number> place in the star class again with sloane elmo farrington . representing the bahamas , knowles won gold in the <year> pan american game star class ( with farrington ) . he is one of only five athlete who have competed in the olympics over a span of <number> year . </s> bahamian have gone on to win numerous track and field medal at the olympic game , iaaf world championship in athletics , commonwealth game and pan american game . frank rutherford is the first athletics olympic medallist for the country . he won a bronze medal for triple jump during the <year> summer olympics . pauline davis-thompson , debbie ferguson , chandra sturrup , savatheda fynes and eldece clarke-lewis teamed up for the first athletics olympic gold medal for the country when they won the <number> ; ; <number> ; m relay at the <year> summer olympics . they are affectionately known a the `` golden girl `` . tonique williams-darling became the first athletics individual olympic gold medallist when she won the <number> metre <number>-metre sprint in <year> summer olympics . in <year> , with the disqualification of marion jones , pauline davis-thompson wa advanced to the gold medal position in the athletics at the <year> summer olympics woman 's <number> metre , predating william-darling . </s> the bahamas were host of the first men 's senior fifa tournament to be staged in the caribbean , the <year> fifa beach soccer world cup . the bahamas also hosted the first <number> edition of the iaaf world relay . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> according to <year> estimate , <number> of the bahamian adult population are literate . </s> the university of the bahamas ( ub ) is the national higher education/tertiary system . offering baccalaureate , master and associate degree , ub ha three campus , and teaching and research centre throughout the bahamas . the university of the bahamas wa chartered on <number> november <number> </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> the bahamas contains about of paved road . inter-island transport is conducted primarily via ship and air . the country ha <number> airport , the chief of which are lynden pindling international airport on new providence , grand bahama international airport on grand bahama island and marsh harbour airport leonard m. thompson international airport ( formerly marsh harbour airport ) on abaco island . </s> establishment in the caribbean </s> category : country in north america </s> category : island country <article_end> <article_start> </s> saint vincent and the grenadine ( ) , also frequently par pro toto # geography saint vincent , is an island country in the caribbean . it 's located in the southeast windward island of the lesser antilles , which lie in the west indie at the southern end of the eastern border of the caribbean sea where the latter meet the atlantic ocean . </s> it territory consists of the main island of saint vincent ( antilles ) and the northern two-thirds of the grenadine , a chain of <number> smaller island . some of the grenadine are inhabited ; bequia , mustique , union island , canouan , petit saint vincent , palm island , grenadine , mayreau , young island ( grenadine ) ; while others are not : tobago cay , baliceaux , battowia , quatre , petite mustique , savan ( island ) and petit nevis . most of saint vincent and the grenadine lie within the hurricane alley . </s> to the north of saint vincent lie saint lucia , to the east is barbados , and grenada lie to the south . saint vincent and the grenadine is a densely populated country for it size ( over <number> inhabitants/km2 ) with approximately inhabitant . </s> kingstown is the capital and main port . saint vincent ha a british empire history , and is now part of the organisation of eastern caribbean state , caribbean community , the commonwealth of nation , the bolivarian alliance for the america and the community of latin american and caribbean state ( celac ) . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> christopher columbus , the first european to reach the island , named it after st. vincent of saragossa , whose feast day it wa on the day columbus first saw it ( <number> january <year> ) . the name of the grenadine refers to the spanish city of granada , but to differentiate it from the island of the same name , the diminutive wa used . before the arrival of the spaniard , the carib native who inhabited the island of st. vincent called it youloumain , in honour of youlouca , the spirit of the rainbow , who they believed inhabited the island . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-colonial period <section_title_end> </s> before the arrival of european and african in the <number> century , various amerindian group passed through or settled on st. vincent and the grenadine , including the ciboney , arawak , and island carib people . the island now known a saint vincent wa originally named youloumain by the native island carib who called themselves kalina/carina ( `` l `` and `` r `` being pronounced the same in their language ) . </s> <section_title_start> european arrival and early colonial period <section_title_end> </s> it is thought that christopher columbus sighted the island in <year> , giving it the name st vincent . the indigenous garifuna people , who became known a the `` black carib `` , aggressively prevented european settlement on saint vincent . </s> <section_title_start> french and british colonisation and the first carib war <section_title_end> </s> various attempt by the english and dutch to claim the island proved unsuccessful , and it wa the french who were first able to colonise the island , settling in the town of barrouallie on the leeward side of st vincent in <year> . the french brought with them enslaved african prisoner of war to work the plantation of sugar , coffee , indigo , tobacco , cotton and cocoa . </s> the british captured the island and drove out the french from barrouallie during the seven year ' war , a claim confirmed with the treaty of paris ( <year> ) . on taking control of the island in <year> , the british laid the foundation of fort charlotte , saint vincent and also brought with them enslaved african prisoner of war to work on the island plantation . the black carib however , opposed to the british presence , went into open conflict against the british , starting the first carib war which lasted from <year> to <year> . </s> during the anglo-french war ( <year> <number> ) the french french capture of saint vincent in <year> . however , the british regained control under the treaty of versailles ( <year> ) . </s> <section_title_start> british colonial period and the second carib war <section_title_end> </s> the uneasy peace between the british and the black carib led to the second carib war , which lasted from <year> to <year> . the black carib were led by garifuna paramount chief joseph chatoyer and they were supported by the french , notably the radical victor hugues from the island of martinique . their revolt and uprising wa eventually put to an end in <year> by british general sir ralph abercromby ; a peace treaty agreement wa made which resulted in almost <number> black carib being exiled to roatn , an island off the coast of honduras , and to belize and baliceaux in the grenadine . </s> in <year> the building of fort charlotte wa completed . </s> the volcano la soufrire ( volcano ) erupted in <year> , resulting in considerable destruction </s> the british abolitionism in the united kingdom slavery in saint vincent ( a well a in the other british west indie colony ) in <year> , and an apprenticeship period followed which ended in <year> . after it end , labour shortage on the plantation resulted , and this wa initially addressed by the immigration of indentured servant ; in the late <year> many portuguese immigrant arrived from madeira and between <year> and <year> shipload of indian labourer arrived . condition remained harsh for both former slave and immigrant agricultural worker , a depressed world sugar price kept the economy stagnant until the turn of the century . the economy then went into a period of decline with many landowner abandoning their estate and leaving the land to be cultivated by liberated slave . </s> the opobo king jaja of opobo of nigeria wa exiled to after his <year> arrest by the british for shipping cargo of palm oil directly to liverpool without the intermediation of the national african company . </s> <section_title_start> 20th century <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , the volcano soufrire ( volcano ) erupted , killing <number> people ; much farmland wa damaged , and the economy deteriorated . </s> saint vincent and the grenadine passed through various stage of colonial status under the british . a representative assembly wa authorised in <year> , crown colony government wa installed in <year> , a legislative council wa created in <year> with a limited franchise , and universal suffrage wa granted in <year> . during the period of it control of saint vincent and the grenadine , britain made several attempt to unify the island with other windward island a a single entity , with the aim of simplifying british control in that sub-region through a single unified administration . in the <year> , the british again tried to unify all of it regional island including saint vincent into one united single entity under british control , unified politically . the unification wa to be called the west indie federation and wa driven by a desire to gain independence from british government . however , the attempt collapsed in <year> . </s> saint vincent wa granted `` associate statehood `` status by britain on <number> october <year> . this gave saint vincent complete control over it own internal affair but wa short of full independence in law . </s> in april <year> la soufrire erupted again . although no one wa killed , thousand were evacuated and again there wa extensive agricultural damage . </s> on <number> october <year> saint vincent and the grenadine became the last of the windward island to gain full independence , and this date is now the country 's list of national independence day , a public holiday in saint vincent and the grenadine . the country opted to remain within the british commonwealth , retaining queen elizabeth a monarchy of saint vincent and the grenadine , represented locally by a governor-general of saint vincent and the grenadine governor-general . </s> <section_title_start> post-independence era <section_title_end> </s> milton cato of the centre-left saint vincent labour party ( svlp ) wa the country 's first prime minister ( he had been premier since <year> ) , ruling until he wa defeated in the <year> vincentian general election by james fitz-allen mitchell of the centre-right new democratic party ( saint vincent and the grenadine ) ( ndp ) . during cato 's time in office there wa a brief rebellion on union island in december <year> led by lennox 'bumba ' charles ; apparently inspired by the recent revolution on grenada , charles alleged neglect of union by the central government . however , the revolt wa swiftly put down and charles arrested . there were also a series of strike in the early <year> . james mitchell remained prime minister for <number> year until <year> , winning three consecutive election in saint vincent and the grenadine . mitchell wa at the forefront of attempt to improve regional integration . in hurricane allen and <year> hurricane damaged many banana and coconut plantation . hurricane season were also very active in <year> and <year> , with hurricane lenny in <year> causing extensive damage to the west coast of the island . </s> in <year> arnhim eustace became prime minister after taking over the leadership of the ndp following mitchell 's retirement ; he wa <year> vincentian general election a year later by ralph gonsalves of the unity labour party ( the successor party to the svlp ) . gonsalvesa left-winger known in the country a `` comrade ralph `` ha argued that european nation owe caribbean nation reparation for slavery for their role in the atlantic slave trade . gonsalves won a second term in <year> , a third term in <year> , and a fourth term in <year> . </s> in <year> , vincentian constitutional referendum , <year> that would make the country a republic , replacing queen elizabeth ii a head of state with a non-executive president , a proposal supported by prime minister gonsalves . a two-thirds majority wa required , and it wa defeated by <number> vote ( <number> per cent ) to <number> ( <number> per cent ) . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> saint vincent and the grenadine lie to the west of barbados , south of saint lucia and north of grenada in the windward island of the lesser antilles , an island arc of the caribbean sea . the island of saint vincent and the grenadine include the main island of saint vincent ( island ) and the northern two-thirds of the grenadine , which are a chain of smaller island stretching south from saint vincent to grenada . there are <number> island and cay that make up st vincent and the grenadine ( svg ) . nine are inhabited , including the mainland st vincent and the grenadine island : young island , bequia , mustique , canouan , union island , mayreau , petit st vincent and palm island . prominent uninhabited island of the grenadine include petit nevis , used by whaling , and petite mustique , which wa the centre of a prominent real-estate scam in the early <year> . </s> the capital of saint vincent and the grenadine is kingstown , saint vincent . the main island of saint vincent measure long , in width and in area . from the most northern to the most southern point , the grenadine island belonging to saint vincent span , with a combined area of . </s> the island of saint vincent is volcanic and heavily forested , and includes little level ground . the windward side of the island is very rocky and steep , while the leeward side ha more sandy beach and bay . saint vincent 's highest peak is soufrire ( volcano ) volcano at . other major mountain on st vincent are ( from north to south ) richmond peak , st vincent , mount brisbane , colonarie mountain , grand bonhomme , petit bonhomme , st vincent and mount st andrew . </s> the country is home to three terrestrial ecoregions : windward island moist forest , leeward island dry forest , and windward island dry forest . it had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> saint vincent and the grenadine is a parliamentary democracy and commonwealth realm , with elizabeth ii a queen of saint vincent and the grenadine . she doe not reside in the island and is represented a [ of state ] in the country by the governor-general of saint vincent and the grenadine , currently susan dougan ( since <number> august <year> ) . </s> the office of governor-general ha mostly ceremonial function including the opening of the island ' house of assembly of saint vincent and the grenadine and the appointment of various government official . control of the government rest with the elected list of prime minister of saint vincent and the grenadine and his or her cabinet . the current prime minister is ralph gonsalves , elected in <year> a head of the unity labour party . </s> the legislative branch of government is the unicameral house of assembly of saint vincent and the grenadine , seating <number> elected member representing single-member electoral district and six appointed member known a senator . the parliamentary term of office is five year , although the prime minister may call election at any time . </s> the judicial branch of government is divided into district court , the eastern caribbean supreme court and the privy council in london being the court of last resort . </s> <section_title_start> political culture <section_title_end> </s> the two political party with parliamentary representation are the new democratic party ( saint vincent and the grenadine ) ( ndp ) and the unity labour party ( ulp ) . the parliamentary opposition is made up of the largest minority stakeholder in the general election , headed by the opposition ( parliamentary ) . the current opposition leader is godwin friday . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> saint vincent ha no formal armed force , although the royal saint vincent and the grenadine police force includes a special service unit a well a a militia that ha a supporting role on the island . </s> in <year> , saint vincent signed the un treaty on the prohibition of nuclear weapon . </s> <section_title_start> administrative divisions <section_title_end> </s> administratively , saint vincent and the grenadine is divided into six parish ( country subdivision ) . five parish are on saint vincent , while the sixth is made up of the grenadine island . kingstown is located in the parish of saint george and is the capital city and central administrative centre of the country . </s> <section_title_start> lgbt rights <section_title_end> </s> act of gross indecency , which may be defined to include [ activity ] , are illegal in saint vincent and the grenadine . section <number> of the criminal code state : </s> any person , who in public or private , commits an act of gross indecency with another person of the same sex , or procures or attempt to procure another person of the same sex to commit an act of gross indecency with him or her , is guilty of an offence and liable to imprisonment for five year . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> international and regional relationships <section_title_end> </s> saint vincent and the grenadine maintains close tie to canada , the united kingdom and the united state , and cooperates with regional political and economic organisation such a the organisation of eastern caribbean state ( oecs ) and caricom . the island nation 's sixth embassy overseas wa opened on <number> august <year> in taipei , after prime minister ralph gonsalves ' official visit to the republic of china ; the other five are located in london , washington d.c. , havana , caracas and brussels . </s> <section_title_start> the double taxation relief ( caricom ) treaty <section_title_end> </s> on <number> july <year> at sherbourne conference centre , st michael , barbados , a a representative of the government of st. vincent and the grenadine , then ( james mitchell , who wa subsequently knighted ) signed the double taxation relief ( caricom ) treaty . there were seven other signatory to the agreement on that day . the country which were represented were antigua and barbuda , belize , grenada , jamaica , st kitts and nevis , st lucia , and trinidad and tobago . </s> an eighth country signed the agreement on <number> august <year> , guyana . </s> this treaty covered tax , residence , tax jurisdiction , capital gain , business profit , interest , dividend , royalty and other area . </s> <section_title_start> fatca <section_title_end> </s> on <number> june <year> , st. vincent and the grenadine signed a model <number> agreement with the united state of america with respect to foreign account tax compliance ( act ) or fatca . </s> according to the updated site a of <number> january <year> , on <number> may <year> the agreement went to `` in force `` status . </s> <section_title_start> international and regional body to which st. vincent and the grenadine belong <section_title_end> </s> st vincent and the grenadine is a member of the united nation , the commonwealth of nation , the organization of american state , and the association of caribbean state ( ac ) . </s> in september <year> , at the seventy-second session of the united nation general assembly , the prime minister of the solomon island , tuvalu , vanuatu and saint vincent and the grenadine called for un action on alleged human right abuse committed on western new guinea 's indigenous papuan . western new guinea ha been occupied by indonesia since <year> . more than <number> papuan have died during a <number>-year papua conflict . </s> <section_title_start> organisation of american states <section_title_end> </s> the charter of the oas wa signed in bogot in <year> and wa amended by several protocol which were named on <number> october <year> according to the oas website . </s> <section_title_start> summits of the americas <section_title_end> </s> the last summit of the america , the seventh , wa held in panama city , panama in <year> with the eighth summit being held in lima , peru in <year> according to the website of the summit of america . </s> <section_title_start> indigenous leader summit of america ( ilsa ) <section_title_end> </s> with st vincent and the grenadine having at least two group of indigenous person it is expected that there will be contribution from the svg 's on this topic at the next ilsas . </s> the position of the oas with respect to indigenous person appears to be developing over the year . the following statement appear to capture the position of the oas with respect to
