association football and [ are other popular sport in jamaica . the jamaica national football team national football team ] qualified for the <year> [ [ fifa world cup . horse racing wa jamaica 's first sport . it wa brought in the <year> by british immigrant to satisfy their longing for their favorite pastime back at home . during slavery , the afro-jamaican slave were considered the best horse jockey . today , horse racing provides job for about <number> people including horse breeder , groomers , and trainer . also , several jamaican are known internationally for their success in horse racing including richard depass , who once held the guinness book of world record for the most win in a day , canadian award winner george hosang , and american award winner charlie hussey , andrew ramgeet , and barrington harvey . also , there are hundred of jamaican who are employed in the united state , canada , and the united kingdom a exercise rider and groomers . </s> race car driving is also a popular sport in jamaica with several car racing track and racing association across the country . </s> the jamaica national bobsled team wa once a serious contender in the winter olympics , beating many well-established team . chess and basketball are widely played in jamaica and are supported by the jamaica chess federation ( jcf ) and the jamaica basketball federation ( jbf ) , respectively . netball is also very popular on the island , with the jamaica national netball team called the sunshine girl consistently ranking in the top five in the world . </s> rugby league ha been played in jamaica since <year> . </s> the jamaica national rugby league team is made up of player who play in jamaica and from united kingdom based professional and semi professional club ( notably in the super league and championship ( rugby league ) ) . in november <year> for the first time ever , the jamaican rugby league team qualified for the rugby league world cup after defeating the united state national rugby league team & canada national rugby league team . jamaica will play in the <year> rugby league world cup in england . </s> according to espn , the highest paid jamaican professional athlete in <year> wa justin masterson , starting pitcher for the baseball team cleveland indian in the united state . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> the emancipation of the slave heralded the establishment of an education system for the mass . prior to emancipation there were few school for educating local and many sent their child off to england to access quality education . after emancipation the west indian commission granted a sum of money to establish elementary school , now known a all age school . most of these school were established by the church . this wa the genesis of the modern jamaican school system . </s> presently the following category of school exist : </s> * early childhood basic , infant and privately operated pre-school . age cohort : <number> <number> year . </s> * primary publicly and privately owned ( privately owned being called preparatory school ) . age <number> <number> year . </s> * secondary publicly and privately owned . age <number> <number> year . the high school in jamaica may be either single-sex or co-educational institution , and many school follow the traditional sixth form used throughout the british west indie . </s> * tertiary community college ; teacher ' college , with the mico teacher ' college ( now the mico university college ) being the oldest , founded in <year> ; the shortwood teacher ' college ( which wa once an all-female teacher training institution ) ; vocational training centre , college and university , publicly and privately owned . there are five local university : the university of the west indie ( mona campus ) ; the university of technology , jamaica , formerly the college of art science and technology ( cast ) ; the northern caribbean university , formerly west indie college ; the university of the commonwealth caribbean , formerly the university college of the caribbean ; and the international university of the caribbean . </s> additionally , there are many community and teacher training college . </s> education is free from the early childhood to secondary level . there are also opportunity for those who can not afford further education in the vocational arena , through the human employment and resource training-national training agency ( heart trust-nta ) programme , which is opened to all working age national population and through an extensive scholarship network for the various university . </s> student are taught spanish in school from the primary level upwards ; about <year> % of educated people in jamaica know some form of spanish . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> jamaica is a mixed economy with both state enterprise and private sector business . major sector of the jamaican economy include agriculture , mining , manufacturing , tourism , petroleum refining process , financial and insurance service . tourism and mining are the leading earner of foreign exchange market . half the jamaican economy relies on service , with half of it income coming from service such a tourism . an estimated <number> million foreign tourist visit jamaica every year . according to the world bank , jamaica is an upper-middle income country that , like it caribbean neighbour , is vulnerable to the effect of climate change , flooding , and hurricane . in <year> , jamaica represented the caribbean community at the g20 and the group of seven annual meeting . in <year> jamaica reported it lowest unemployment rate in <number> year . </s> supported by multilateral financial institution , jamaica ha , since the early <year> , sought to implement structural reform aimed at fostering private sector activity and increasing the role of market force in resource allocation since <year> , the government ha followed a programme of economic liberalisation and stabilisation by removing exchange control , floating the exchange rate , cutting tariff , stabilising the jamaican dollar , reducing inflation and removing restriction on foreign direct investment . emphasis ha been placed on maintaining strict fiscal discipline , greater openness to trade and financial flow , market liberalisation and reduction in the size of government . during this period , a large share of the economy wa returned to private sector ownership through divestment and privatisation programme . the free-trade zone at kingston , montego bay and spanish town allow duty-free importation , tax-free profit , and free repatriation of export earnings . </s> jamaica 's economy grew strongly after the year of independence , but then stagnated in the <year> , due to the heavy fall in price of bauxite and fluctuation in the price of agriculture . the financial sector wa troubled in <year> , with many bank and insurance company suffering heavy loss and liquidity problem . according to the commonwealth of nation secretariat , `` the government set up the financial sector adjustment company ( finsac ) in january <year> to assist these bank and company , providing fund in return for equity , and acquired substantial holding in bank and insurance company and related company , .. but it only exasperated the problem , and brought the country into large external debt . from <year> , once it had restored these bank and company to financial health , finsac divested them . `` the government of jamaica remains committed to lowering inflation , with a long-term objective of bringing it in line with that of it major trading partner . </s> in <year> and <year> there wa a decrease in gdp largely due to significant problem in the financial sector and , in <year> , a severe island-wide drought ( the worst in <number> year ) and hurricane that drastically reduced agricultural production . in <year> and <year> , nominal gdp wa approximately a high of about <number> percent of gdp and then lowered to <number> percent of gdp in <year> and <year> . the economy in <year> wa marked by low level of import growth , high level of private capital inflow and relative stability in the foreign exchange market . </s> recent economic performance show the jamaican economy is recovering . agricultural production , an important engine of growth increased to <number> in <year> compared to the corresponding period in <year> , signalling the first positive growth rate in the sector since january <year> . in <year> , jamaica reported a <number> increase in maize , <number> increase in cooking banana , <number> increase in banana , <number> increase in pineapple , <number> increase in colocasia esculenta , <number> increase in coconut , and a <number> increase in whole milk production . bauxite and alumina production increased <number> from january to december <year> , compared to the corresponding period in <year> . january 's bauxite production recorded a <number> increase relative to january <year> and continued expansion of alumina production through <year> is planned by alcoa . jamaica is the fifth-largest exporter of bauxite in the world , after australia , china , brazil and guinea . the country also export limestone , of which it hold large deposit . the government is currently implementing plan to increase it extraction . </s> a canadian company , carube copper corp , ha found and confirmed , `` ... the existence of at least seven significant cu/au porphyry system ( in st . catherine ) . `` they have estimated that , `` the porphyry distribution found at bellas gate is similar to that found in the northparkes mining district of new south wale , australia ( which wa ) sold to china in <year> for u $ <number> million . `` carube noted that jamaica 's geology , `` ... is similar to that of chile , argentina and the dominican republic all productive mining jurisdiction . `` mining on the site began in <year> . </s> tourism , which is the largest foreign exchange earner , showed improvement a well . in <year> the total visitor arrival wa <number> million , an increase of <number> from the previous year . since <year> , jamaica 's tourism ha risen exponentially , rising to <number> million average tourist per year . jamaica 's largest tourist market are from north america , south america , and europe . in <year> , jamaica recorded a <number> increase in stopover visitor from southern and western europe ( and a <number> increase in stopover arrival from january to september <year> over the same period from the previous year ) with germany , portugal and spain registering the highest percentage gain . in <year> , jamaica won several world travel award in portugal winning the `` chairman 's award for global tourism innovation `` , `` best tourist board in the caribbean `` `` best honeymoon destination `` , `` best culinary destination `` , `` world 's leading beach destination `` and `` world 's leading cruise destination `` . two month later , the travvy tourism award held in new york city , awarded jamaica 's tourism minister edmund bartlett , with the inaugural chairman 's award for , `` global tourism innovation for the development of the global tourism resilience and crisis management centre ( gtrcm ) `` . bartlett ha also won the pacific travel writer 's association 's award in germany for the , `` <year> best tourism minister of the year `` . </s> petrojam , jamaica 's national and only petroleum refinery , is co-owned by the government of venezuela . petrojam , `` .. operates a <number> barrel per day hydro-skimming refinery , to produce automotive diesel oil ; heavy fuel oil ; kerosene/jet fuel , liquid petroleum gas ( lpg ) , asphalt and gasoline . `` customer include the power industry , aircraft refuelers , and local marketing company . on <number> february <year> , the jamaican government voted to retake ownership of venezuela 's <number> share . </s> jamaica 's agricultural export are sugar , banana , cocoa bean , coconut , molasses orange ( fruit ) , lime ( fruit ) , grapefruit , rum , yam ( vegetable ) , allspice ( of which it is the world 's largest and `` most exceptional quality `` exporter ) , and blue mountain coffee which is considered a world renowned gourmet brand . </s> jamaica ha a wide variety of industrial and commercial activity . the aviation industry is able to perform most routine aircraft maintenance , except for heavy structural repair . there is a considerable amount of technical support for transport and agricultural aviation . jamaica ha a considerable amount of industrial engineering , light manufacturing , including metal fabrication , metal roofing , and furniture manufacturing . food and beverage processing , glassware manufacturing , software and data processing , printing and publishing , insurance underwriting , music and recording , and advanced education activity can be found in the larger urban area . the jamaican construction industry is entirely self-sufficient , with professional technical standard and guidance . </s> since the first quarter of <year> , the economy of jamaica ha undergone a period of staunch growth . with inflation for the <year> calendar year down to <number> and unemployment down to <number> , the nominal gdp grew by an unprecedented <number> . an investment programme in island transportation and utility infrastructure and gain in the tourism , mining , and service sector all contributed this figure . all projection for <year> show an even higher potential for economic growth with all estimate over <number> and hampered only by urban crime and public policy . </s> in <year> , jamaica became part of the caribbean community single market and economy caricom single market and economy ( csme ) a one of the pioneering member . </s> the global economic downturn had a significant impact on the jamaican economy for the year <year> to <year> , resulting in negative economic growth . the government implemented a new debt management initiative , the jamaica debt exchange ( jdx ) on <number> january <year> . the initiative would see holder of government of jamaica ( goj ) bond returning the high interest earning instrument for bond with lower yield and longer maturity . the offer wa taken up by over <number> of local financial institution and wa deemed a success by the government . </s> owing to the success of the jdx program , the bruce golding-led government wa successful in entering into a borrowing arrangement with the imf on <number> february <year> for the amount of u $ <number>b . the loan agreement is for a period of three year . </s> in april <year> , the government of jamaica and china signed the preliminary agreement for the first phase of the jamaican logistics hub ( jlh ) the initiative that aim to position kingston a the fourth node in the global logistics chain , joining rotterdam , dubai and singapore , and serving the america . the project , when completed , is expected to provide many job for jamaican , economic zone for multinational company and much needed economic growth to alleviate the country 's heavy debt-to-gdp ratio . strict adherence to the imf 's refinancing programme and preparation for the jlh ha favourably affected jamaica 's credit rating and outlook from the three biggest rating agency . in <year> , both moody 's and standard and poor credit rating upgraded jamaica 's rating to both `` stable and positive `` respectively . </s> <section_title_start> infrastructure <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> the transportation infrastructure in jamaica consists of roadway , railway and aviation , with roadway forming the backbone of the island 's internal transport system . </s> <section_title_start> roadways <section_title_end> </s> the jamaican road network consists of almost of road , of which over is paved . the government of jamaica ha , since the late <year> and in cooperation with private investor , embarked on a campaign of infrastructural improvement project , one of which includes the creation of a system of freeway , the first such access-controlled roadway of their kind on the island , connecting the main population centre of the island . this project ha so far seen the completion of of freeway . </s> <section_title_start> railways <section_title_end> </s> railway in jamaica no longer enjoy the prominent position they once did , having been largely replaced by roadway a the primary mean of transport . of the of railway found in jamaica , only remain in operation , currently used to transport bauxite . on <number> april <year> , a limited passenger service wa resumed between may pen , spanish town and linstead . </s> <section_title_start> air transport <section_title_end> </s> there are three international airport in jamaica with modern airport terminal , long runway , and the navigational equipment required to accommodate the large jet aircraft used in modern and air travel : norman manley international airport in kingston , jamaica ; ian fleming international airport in boscobel , jamaica , saint mary parish , jamaica ; and the island 's largest and busiest airport , sir donald sangster international airport in the resort city of montego bay . manley and sangster international airport are home to the country 's national airline , air jamaica . in addition there are local commuter airport at tinson pen aerodrome tinson pen ( kingston ) , port antonio , and negril , which cater to internal flight only . many other small , rural centre are served by private airstrip on sugar estate or bauxite mine . </s> <section_title_start> ports , shipping and lighthouses <section_title_end> </s> owing to it location in the caribbean sea in the sea lane to the panama canal and relative proximity to large market in north america and emerging market in latin america , jamaica receives much traffic of containerization . the container terminal at the port of kingston ha undergone large expansion in capacity in recent year to handle growth both already realised a well a that which is projected in coming year . montego freeport in montego bay also handle a variety of cargo like ( though more limited than ) the port of kingston , mainly agricultural product . </s> there are several other port positioned around the island , including port esquivel in saint catherine parish , jamaica st. catherine ( windalco ) , rocky point in clarendon parish , jamaica , port kaiser in saint elizabeth parish , jamaica st. elizabeth , port rhoades in discovery bay , reynolds pier in ocho rio , and boundbrook port in port antonio . </s> to aid the navigation of shipping , jamaica operates nine lighthouse . they are maintained by the port authority of jamaica , an agency of the ministry of transport and work . </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> jamaica depends on petroleum import to satisfy it national energy need . many test site have been explored for oil , but no commercially viable quantity have been found . the most convenient source of imported oil and motor fuel ( diesel , gasoline , and jet fuel ) are from mexico and venezuela . </s> jamaica 's electrical power is produced by diesel ( bunker fuel ) generator located in old harbour , jamaica . this facility ha been further equipped with liquid natural gas capability and storage . other smaller power station ( most owned by the jamaica public service company , the island 's electricity provider ) support the island 's electrical grid including the hunt bay power station , the bogue power station saint james parish , jamaica , the rockfort power station saint andrew parish , jamaica and small hydroelectric plant on the white river , rio bueno , morant river , black river ( maggotty ) and roaring river . a wind farm , owned by the petroleum corporation of jamaica , wa established at wigton , manchester parish . </s> jamaica ha successfully operated a slowpoke reactor slowpoke-2 nuclear reactor of <number> ; kw capacity since the early <year> , but there are no plan to expand nuclear power at present . </s> jamaica import approximately of oil energy product per day , including asphalt and lubrication product . just <number> of imported fuel are used for road transportation , the rest being used by the bauxite industry , electricity generation , and aviation . <number> barrels/day of crude import are processed into various motor fuel and asphalt by the petrojam refinery in kingston . </s> jamaica produce enormous quantity of [ ethanol drinking alcohol ] ( at least <number> water content ) , most of which appears to be consumed a beverage , and none used a motor fuel . facility exist to refine hydrous ethanol feedstock into absolute ethanol ( <number> water content ) , but a of <year> , the process appeared to be uneconomic and the production plant wa idle . the facility ha since been purchased by west indie petroleum ltd. and repurposed for petroleum distillate . </s> <section_title_start> communication <section_title_end> </s> jamaica ha a fully digital telephony with a mobile penetration of over <number> . </s> the country 's two mobile operator flow ( brand ) ( formerly lime , bmobile and cable and wireless jamaica ) and digicel have spent million in network upgrade and expansion . the newest operator , digicel wa granted a licence in <year> to operate mobile service in the newly liberalised telecom market that had once been the sole domain of the incumbent flow ( then cable and wireless jamaica ) monopoly . digicel opted for the more widely used gsm wireless system , while a past operator , oceanic ( which became claro jamaica and later merged with digicel jamaica in <year> ) opted for the cdma standard . flow ( formerly `` lime `` pre-columbus communication merger ) which had begun with digital amp standard , subsequently upgraded to gsm in <year> , decommissioned tdma in <year> and only utilised that standard until <year> when lime launched it <number>g network . both operator currently provide islandwide coverage with hspa+ ( <number>g ) technology . currently , only digicel offer lte to it customer whereas flow jamaica ha committed to launching lte in the city of kingston and montego bay , place where digicel 's lte network is currently only found in , in short order . </s> a new entrant to the jamaican communication market , columbus communication , laid a new submarine communication cable connecting jamaica to the united state . this new cable increase the total number of submarine cable connecting jamaica to the rest of the world to four . cable and wireless communication ( parent company of lime ) acquired the company in late <year> and replaced their brand lime with flow . flow ( brand ) currently ha the most broadband and cable subscriber on the island and also ha <number> million mobile subscriber , second to digicel ( which had , at it peak , over <number> million mobile subscription on it network ) . </s> digicel entered the broadband market in <year> by offering wimax broadband , capable of up to <number> mbit/s per subscriber . to further their broadband share post-lime/flow merger in <year> , the company introduced a new broadband service called digicel play , which is jamaica 's second fttx offering ( after lime 's deployment in selected community in <year> ) . it is currently only available in the parish of kingston , portmore and st. andrew . it offer speed of up to <number> mbit/s down , <number> mbit/s up via a pure fibre optic network . digicel 's competitor , flow ( brand ) , ha a network consisting of adsl , coaxial and fibre to the home ( inherited from lime ) and only offer speed up to <number> mbit/s . flow ha committed to expanding it fibre offering to more area in order to combat digicel 's entrance into the market . </s> it wa announced that the office and utility regulation ( our ) , ministry of science , technology , energy and mining ( mstem ) and the spectrum management authority ( sma ) have given approval for another mobile operator licence in january <year> . the identity of this entrant wa ascertained on <number> may <year> , when the jamaican government named the new carrier a symbiote investment limited operating under the name caricel . the company will focus on <number>g lte data offering and will first go live in the kingston metropolitan area and will expand to the rest of jamaica thereafter . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of developing state </s> category:1962 establishment in jamaica </s> category : country in north america <article_end> <article_start> </s> * dominicana redirects here . for the airline , see : dominicana de aviacion </s> the dominican republic ( ; repblica dominicana , ) is a country located on the island of hispaniola in the greater antilles archipelago of the caribbean region . it occupies the eastern five-eighths of the island , which it share with haiti , making hispaniola one of only two caribbean island , along with saint martin ( island ) , that are shared by two sovereign state . the dominican republic is the second-largest nation in the antilles by area ( after cuba ) at , and third-largest by population , with approximately <number> million people ( <year> est . ) , of whom approximately <number> million live in the metropolitan area of santo domingo , the capital city . the official language of the country is spanish language . </s> the native tano people had inhabited hispaniola before the arrival of european , dividing it into five chiefdoms . the tano people had eventually moved north over many year , and lived around the list of caribbean island . the tano native had constructed an advanced farming and hunting society , and were on their way to being an organized civilization . christopher columbus explored and claimed the island for spain , landing there on his first voyage in <year> . the captaincy general of santo domingo became the site of the first permanent european colonization of the america in the america , and the first seat of the spanish colonial rule in the new world . meanwhile , france occupied the western third of hispaniola , naming their colony saint-domingue , which became the independent state of haiti in <year> after the haitian revolution . during the nineteenth century , dominican were often at war , fighting the french , haitian , spanish , or amongst themselves , resulting in a society heavily influenced by caudillo , who ruled the country a if it were their personal kingdom . after more than three hundred year of spanish rule , the dominican people republic of spanish haiti . the leader of the independence movement , jos nez de cceres , intended the dominican nation to unite with the country of gran colombia , but the newly independent dominican were unification of hispaniola . independence came <number> year later in <year> , after victory in the dominican war of independence . over the next <number> year , the dominican republic experienced mostly civil war , several failed invasion by it neighbour , haiti , and spanish occupation of the dominican republic , before permanently ousting the spanish during the dominican restoration war of <year> <number> . the united state occupation of the dominican republic ( <year> <number> ) between <year> and <year> ; a subsequent calm and prosperous six-year period under horacio vsquez followed . from <year> the dictatorship of rafael trujillo ruled until <year> . a civil war in <year> , the country 's last , wa ended by united state occupation of the dominican republic ( <year> <number> ) u.s. military occupation and wa followed by the authoritarian rule of joaqun balaguer ( <year> <number> and <year> <number> ) . since <year> , the dominican republic ha moved toward representative democracy , and ha been led by leonel fernndez for most of the time after <year> . danilo medina succeeded fernndez in <year> , winning <number> of the electoral vote over his opponent ex-president hiplito meja . he wa later succeeded by luis abinader in the <year> presidential election . </s> the dominican republic ha the economy of the dominican republic in the caribbean and central american region and is the list of latin american and caribbean country by gdp ( ppp ) eighth-largest economy in latin america . over the last <number> year , the dominican republic ha had the fastest-growing economy in the western hemisphere with an average list of country by real gdp growth rate of <number> between <year> and <year> . gdp growth in <year> and <year> reached <number> and <number> , respectively , the highest in the western hemisphere . in the first half of <year> , the dominican economy grew <number> continuing it trend of rapid economic growth . recent growth ha been driven by construction , manufacturing , tourism , and mining . the country is the site of the second largest gold mine in the world , the pueblo viejo mine . private consumption ha been strong , a a result of low inflation ( under <number> on average in <year> ) , job creation , and a high level of remittance . </s> the dominican republic is the world tourism ranking in the caribbean . the year-round golf course are major attraction . a geographically diverse nation , the dominican republic is home to both the caribbean 's tallest mountain peak , pico duarte , and the caribbean 's largest lake and point of lowest elevation , lake enriquillo . the island ha an average temperature of and great climatic and biological diversity . the country is also the site of the first cathedral , castle , monastery , and fortress built in the america , located in santo domingo 's ciudad colonial ( santo domingo ) , a world heritage site . music and sport are of great importance in the dominican culture of the dominican republic , with merengue music and bachata ( music ) a the national dance and music , and baseball a the most popular sport . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the `` dominican `` word come from the latin dominicus , meaning sunday . however , the island ha this name by saint dominic ( saint dominic ) , founder of the order of the dominican order . </s> the dominican order established a house of high study on the colony of santo domingo that is now known a the universidad autnoma de santo domingo , and dedicated themselves to the protection of the native tano people , who were subjected to slavery , and to the education of the inhabitant of the island . </s> for most of it history , up until independence , the colony wa known a santo domingo the name of it present capital and patron saint , saint dominic and continued to be commonly known a such in english until the early <number> century . the resident were called `` dominican `` ( dominicanos ) , the adjectival form of `` domingo `` , and a such , the revolutionary named their newly independent country the `` dominican republic `` ( repblica dominicana ) . </s> in the national anthem of the dominican republic ( himno nacional de la repblica dominicana ) , the term `` dominican `` doe not appear . the author of it lyric , emilio prud'homme , consistently us the poetic term `` quisqueyans `` ( quisqueyanos ) . the word `` quisqueya `` derives from the tano language , and mean `` mother of the land `` ( madre de la tierras ) . it is often used in song a another name for the country . the name of the country in english is often shortened to `` the d.r . `` ( la r.d . ) , but this is rare in spanish . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-european history <section_title_end> </s> the arawakan language arawakan-speaking tano moved into hispaniola from the north east region of what is now known a south america , displacing earlier inhabitant , c. <number> c.e . they engaged in farming and fishing , and hunting and gathering . the fierce island carib drove the tano to the northeastern caribbean , during much of the <number> century . the estimate of hispaniola 's population in <year> vary widely , including ten of thousand , one hundred thousand , three hundred thousand , and four hundred thousand to two million . determining precisely how many people lived on the island in pre-columbian era pre-columbian time is next to impossible , a no accurate record exist . by <year> , the island wa divided into five tano chiefdoms . the tano name for the entire island wa either ayiti or quisqueya . </s> the spaniard arrived in <year> . initially , after friendly relationship , the tanos resisted the conquest , led by the female chief anacaona of xaragua and her ex-husband chief caonabo of maguana , a well a chief guacanagarx , guam , hatuey , and enriquillo . the latter 's success gained his people an autonomous enclave for a time on the island . within a few year after <year> , the population of tanos had declined drastically , due to smallpox , measles , and other disease that arrived with the european . </s> the first recorded smallpox outbreak , in the america , occurred on hispaniola in <year> . the last record of pure tanos in the country wa from <year> . still , tano biological heritage survived to an important extent , due to intermixing . census record from <year> reveal that <number> of spanish men in santo domingo were married to tano woman , and some present-day dominican have tano ancestry . remnant of the tano culture include their cave painting , such a the pomier cave , a well a pottery design , which are still used in the small artisan village of higerito , moca , dominican republic . </s> <section_title_start> european colonization <section_title_end> </s> christopher columbus arrived on the island on december <number> , <year> , during the first of his voyage of christopher columbus to the america . he claimed the land for spain and named it la espaola , due to it diverse climate and terrain , which reminded him of the spain . traveling further east , columbus came across the yaque del norte river , in the cibao region , which he named rio de oro after discovering gold deposit nearby . on columbus 's return during his second voyage , he established the settlement of la isabela in what is now puerto plata province in january <year> , while he sent alonso de ojeda to search for gold in the region . </s> in <year> , bartholomew columbus , christopher 's brother , built the city of santo domingo , western europe 's first permanent settlement in the `` new world `` . the colony thus became the springboard for the further spanish colonization of the america , and for decade , the captaincy general of santo domingo of spanish colonial power in the hemisphere . soon after , the largest discovery of gold in the island wa made in the cordillera central , dominican republic region , which led to a mining boom . by <year> , columbus 's cousin giovanni columbus had also discovered gold near buenaventura ; the deposit were later known a mina nuevas . two major mining area resulted , one along san cristbal , dominican republic-buenaventura and another in cibao within the la vega , dominican republic-cotuy-bonao triangle , while santiago de los caballeros , la vega , dominican republic , and bonao became mining town . the gold rush of <year> <number> ensued . ferdinand ii of aragon `` ordered gold from the richest mine reserved for the crown . `` thus , ovando expropriated the gold mine of miguel diaz and francisco de garay in <year> , a pit mine became royal mine , though placer mining were open to private prospector . furthermore , ferdinand wanted the `` best indian `` working his royal mine , and kept <number> in the san cristbal mining area , supervised by salaried miner . </s> under nicols de ovando y cceres ' governorship , the indian were made to work in the gold mine , `` where they were grossly overworked , mistreated , and underfed , `` according to pons . by <year> , the spanish crown legalized the distribution of indian to work the mine , a part of the encomienda system . according to pons , `` once the indian entered the mine , hunger and disease literally wiped them out . `` by <year> , the indian population of about <number> wa reduced to <number> , and by <year> , only <number> remained . about half were located in the mining town of concepcin , santiago , santo domingo , and buenaventura . the repartimiento of <year> accelerated emigration of the spanish colonist , coupled with the exhaustion of the mine . in <year> , a smallpox epidemic killed an additional <number> of the remaining <number> indian , in one month . by <year> , according to pons , `` both the gold economy and the indian population became extinct at the same time . `` </s> in <year> , the catholic monarch first granted permission to the colonist of the caribbean to import african slave , who began arriving to the island in <year> . sugar cane wa introduced to hispaniola from the canary island , and the first sugar mill in the new world wa established in <year> , on hispaniola . the need for a labor force to meet the growing demand of sugar cane cultivation led to an exponential increase in the importation of slave , over the following two decade . the sugar mill owner soon formed a new colonial elite and convinced the spanish king to allow them to elect the member of the real audiencia from their rank . poorer colonist subsisted by hunting the herd of wild cattle that roamed throughout the island and selling their leather . </s> with the conquest of the american mainland , hispaniola 's sugar plantation economy quickly declined . most spanish colonist left for the silver-mines of mexico and peru , while new immigrant from spain bypassed the island . agriculture dwindled , new import of slave ceased , and white colonist , free black , and slave alike lived in poverty , weakening the racial hierarchy and aiding intermixing , resulting in a population of predominantly mixed spaniard , tano , and african descent . except for the city of santo domingo , which managed to maintain some legal export , dominican port were forced to rely on contraband trade , which , along with livestock , became one of the main source of livelihood for the island 's inhabitant . </s> in the mid-17th century , kingdom of france sent colonist and privateer to settle the northwestern coast of hispaniola due to it strategic position in the region . in order to entice the pirate , france supplied them with woman who had been taken from prison , accused of prostitution and thieving . after decade of armed struggle with the french settler , spain ceded the western coast of the island to france with the <year> treaty of ryswick , whilst the central plateau remained under spanish domain . france created a wealthy colony on the island , while the spanish colony continued to suffer economic decline . </s> on april <number> , <year> , english force landed on hispaniola and marched <number> mile overland to santo domingo , the main spanish stronghold on the island . mounted lancer attacked the invader , sending them careening back toward the beach in utter confusion . their commander hid behind a tree where , in the word of one disgusted observer , he wa `` so much possessed with terror that he could hardly speak . `` the elite siege of santo domingo ( <year> ) were amply rewarded with title from the spanish crown . french force attacked santiago in <year> , and this wa followed by a devastating hurricane the next year and a smallpox epidemic that killed about <number> in <year> . in <year> , the spaniard captured the fort at petit-goave , but the french fought back and hanged their leader . two year later , in the nine year ' war , the french sacked santiago . in <year> , the spaniard battle of sabana real and sacked cap-franois . island tension subsided once peace wa restored , and spain 's last habsburg monarch the deformed invalid charles ii of spain died on november <number> , <year> , being succeeded by the sixteen-year-old french bourbon princeling philip of anjou . </s> <section_title_start> <number> century <section_title_end> </s> the house of bourbon replaced the house of habsburg in spain in <year> , and introduced economic reform that gradually began to revive trade in santo domingo . the crown progressively relaxed the rigid control and restriction on commerce between spain and the colony and among the colony . the last flotas sailed in <year> ; the monopoly port system wa abolished shortly thereafter . by the middle of the century , the population wa bolstered by the emigration of spaniard from the canary island , resettling the northern part of the colony and planting tobacco in the cibao valley , and importation of slave wa renewed . the colony of santo domingo saw a population increase during the <number> century , a it rose to about <number> in <year> . of this number , approximately <number> were white landowner , <number> were free mixed people of color , and some <number> were slave . this contrasted sharply with the population of the french colony of saint-domingue ( present-day haiti ) ; the wealthiest colony in the caribbean and whose population of one-half a million wa <number> enslaved and overall , seven time a numerous a the spanish colony of santo domingo . the 'spanish ' settler , whose blood by now wa mixed with that of tanos , african , and canary guanches , proclaimed : 'it doe not matter if the french are richer than u , we are still the true inheritor of this island . in our vein run the blood of the heroic conquistador who won this island of ours with sword and blood . ' </s> when the war of jenkins ' ear between spain and britain broke out in <year> , spanish privateer , particularly from santo domingo , began to patrol the caribbean sea , a development that lasted until the end of the eighteenth century . during this period , spanish privateer from santo domingo sailed into enemy port looking for ship to plunder , thus disrupting commerce between britain and new york . a a result , the spanish obtained stolen merchandisefoodstuffs , ship , enslaved personsthat were sold in hispaniola 's port , with profit accruing to individual sea raider . the revenue acquired in these act of piracy wa invested in the economic expansion of the colony and led to repopulation from europe . </s> between <year> and <year> , dominican privateer captured merchant and warship in the water around santo domingo and captaincy general of puerto rico . they were responsible for bringing hundred of african slave to the island . the most common type of ship used by the privateer wa a sloop . </s> a restriction on colonial trade were relaxed , the colonial elite of st. domingue offered the principal market for santo domingo 's export of beef , hide , mahogany , and tobacco . with the outbreak of the haitian revolution in <year> , the rich urban family linked to the colonial bureaucracy fled the island , while most of the rural hateros ( cattle rancher ) remained , even though they lost their principal market . although the population of spanish santo domingo wa perhaps one-fourth that of french saint-domingue , this did not prevent the spanish king from launching an invasion of the french side of the island in <year> , attempting to take advantage of the chaos sparked by the french revolution . french force checked spanish progress toward port-au-prince in the south , but the spanish pushed rapidly through the north , most of which they occupied by <year> . although the spanish military effort went well on hispaniola , it did not in europe ( see war of the pyrenees ) . a a consequence , spain wa forced to cede santo domingo to the french under the term of the peace of basel ( july <number> , <year> ) in order to get the french to withdraw from spain . </s> <section_title_start> french rule <section_title_end> </s> from <year> to <year> , santo domingo ( the city ) changed hand several time along with the colony it headed . it wa ceded to france in <year> after year of struggle . however , the french failed to consolidate this cession , mainly because of the continued presence of british troop in saint-domingue ( they remained there until <year> ) . a the news of santo domingo 's cession became known on the island , many dominican had sided with britain against france , welcoming british ship into their port , pledging allegiance to the british and enlisting in the military force of france 's longtime opponent . </s> in <year> , toussaint louverture , who at least in theory represented imperial france , marched into santo domingo from saint-domingue to enforce the term of the peace of basel . toussaint 's army committed numerous atrocity ; a a consequence , the spanish population fled from santo domingo in exodus proportion . french control of the former spanish colony passed from toussaint louverture to gen. charles leclerc ( general , born <year> ) when he seized the city of santo domingo in early <year> . following the defeat of the french under gen. donatien de rochembeau at le cap in november <year> by the haitian , their new leader , jean-jacques dessalines , attempted to drive the french out of santo domingo . he invaded the spanish side of the island , defeated the french-led spanish colonial at river yaque del sur , and besieged the capital on march <number> , <year> . at the same time , the haitian general henri christophe marched north through cibao , capturing santiago where he massacred prominent individual who had sought refuge in a church . the arrival of small french squadron off the haitian coast at goncaives and at santo domingo forced the haitian to withdraw . a christophe retreated across the island , he slaughtered and burned . in october <year> the landowner juan snchez ramrez began a rebellion against the french colonial government in santo domingo and the insurgent were aided by history of puerto rico # spanish rule ( <year> <number> ) and colony of jamaica . a combined anglo-spanish force recaptured the territory in <year> . the spaniard , upon re-establishing control , not only tried to re-establish slavery in santo domingo , but many of them also mounted raiding expedition into haiti to capture black and enslave them a well . </s> <section_title_start> independence from spain ( <year> ) <section_title_end> </s> after a dozen year of discontent and failed independence plot by various opposing group , santo domingo 's former lieutenant-governor ( top administrator ) , jos nez de cceres , declared the colony 's independence from the spanish empire a republic of spanish haiti , on november <number> , <year> . this period is also known a the ephemeral independence . </s> <section_title_start> unification of hispaniola ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> the newly independent republic ended two month later under the haitian government led by jean-pierre boyer . </s> a toussaint louverture had done two decade earlier , the haitian abolished slavery . in order to raise fund for the huge indemnity of <number> million franc that haiti agreed to pay the former french colonist , and which wa subsequently lowered to <number> million franc , the haitian government imposed heavy tax on the dominican . since haiti wa unable to adequately provision it army , the occupying force largely survived by commandeering or confiscating food and supply at gunpoint . attempt to land reform land conflicted with the system of communal land tenure ( terrenos comuneros ) , which had arisen with the ranching economy , and some people resented being forced to grow cash crop under boyer and joseph balthazar inginac 's code rural . in the rural and rugged mountainous area , the haitian administration wa usually too inefficient to enforce it own law . it wa in the city of santo domingo that the effect of the occupation were most acutely felt , and it wa there that the movement for independence originated . </s> the haitian associated the roman catholic church with the french slave-masters who had exploited them before independence and confiscated all church property , deported all foreign clergy , and severed the tie of the remaining clergy to the holy see . all level of education collapsed ; the university wa shut down , a it wa starved both of resource and student , with young dominican men from <number> to <number> year old being drafted into the haitian army . boyer 's occupation troop , who were largely dominican , were unpaid and had to `` forage and sack `` from dominican civilian . haiti imposed a `` heavy tribute `` on the dominican people . </s> haiti 's constitution forbade white elite from owning land , and dominican major landowning family were forcibly deprived of their property . during this time , many white elite in santo domingo did not consider owning slave due to the economic crisis that santo domingo faced during the espaa boba period . the few landowner that wanted slavery established in santo domingo had to emigrate to other colony such a cuba , puerto rico , or gran colombia . many landowning family stayed on the island , with a heavy concentration of landowner settling in the cibao region . after independence , and eventually being under spanish occupation of the dominican republic once again in <year> , many family returned to santo domingo including new wave of immigration from spain . </s> <section_title_start> dominican war of independence ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , juan pablo duarte founded a secret society called la trinitaria ( dominican republic ) , which sought the complete independence of santo domingo without any foreign intervention . also francisco del rosario snchez and ramon matias mella , despite not being among the founding member of la trinitaria , were decisive in the fight for independence . duarte , mella , and snchez are considered the three founding father of the dominican republic . </s> the trinitarios took advantage of a haitian rebellion against the dictator jean-pierre boyer . they rose up on january <number> , <year> , ostensibly in support of the haitian charles rivire-hrard who wa challenging boyer for the control of haiti . however , the movement soon discarded it pretext of support for hrard and now championed dominican independence . after overthrowing boyer , hrard executed some dominican , and threw many others into prison ; duarte escaped . after subduing the dominican , hrard , a mulatto , faced a rebellion by black in port-au-prince . haiti had formed two regiment composed of dominican from the city of santo domingo ; these were used by hrard to suppress the uprising . </s> in <year> , the surviving member of la trinitaria , now led by tom bobadilla , chose puerta del conde , the prominent `` gate of the count `` in the old city wall , a the rallying point for their insurrection against the haitian government . on the morning of february <number> , <year> , el conde rang with the shot of the plotter , who had emerged from their secret meeting to openly challenge the haitian . their effort were successful , and for the next ten year , dominican military strongman fought to preserve their country 's independence from their haitian neighbor . </s> the trinitarios were backed by pedro santana , a wealthy cattle rancher from el seibo , who became general of the army of the nascent republic . the dominican republic 's first constitution of the dominican republic wa adopted on november <number> , <year> , and wa modeled after the united state constitution . the decade that followed were filled with tyranny , factionalism , economic difficulty , rapid change of government , and exile for political opponent . archrivals santana and buenaventura bez held power most of the time , both ruling arbitrarily . they promoted competing plan to annex the new nation to another power : santana favored spain , and bez the united state . </s> threatening the nation 's independence were renewed haitian invasion . on march <number> , <year> , the haitian army , under the personal command of president hrard , invaded the eastern province from the north and progressed a far a santiago , but wa soon forced to withdraw after suffering disproportionate loss . according to jos mara imbert 's ( the general defending santiago ) report of april <number> , <year> to santo domingo , `` in santiago , the enemy did not leave behind in the battlefield le than six hundred dead and ... the number of wounded wa very superior ... [ while on ] our part we suffered not one casualty . `` </s> the dominican repelled the haitian force , on both land and sea , by december <year> . the haitian invaded again in <year> after france recognized the dominican republic a an independent nation . santana being called upon to assume command of the troop , met the enemy at ocoa , april <number> , <year> , with only <number> men , and succeeded in utterly defeating the haitian army . in november <year> , bez launched a naval offensive against haiti to forestall the threat of another invasion . his seaman under the french adventurer , fagalde , raided the haitian coast , plundered seaside village , a far a cape dame marie , and butchered crew of captured enemy ship . in <year> , haiti invaded again , but it force were repulsed at the battle of santom in december <year> and the battle of sabana larga in january <year> . </s> <section_title_start> first republic <section_title_end> </s> the dominican republic 's first constitution of the dominican republic wa adopted on november <number> , <year> . the state wa commonly known a santo domingo in english until the early <number> century . it featured a presidential form of government with many liberal tendency , but it wa marred by article <number> , imposed by pedro santana on the constitutional assembly by force , giving him the privilege of a dictatorship until the war of independence wa over . these privilege not only served him to win the war but also allowed him to persecute , execute and drive into exile his political opponent , among which duarte wa the most important . in haiti after the fall of boyer , black leader had ascended to the power once enjoyed exclusively by the mulatto elite . </s> due to the rugged mountainous terrain of the island the region of the dominican republic developed in isolation from one another . in the south , also known at the time a ozama , the economy wa dominated by cattle-ranching ( particularly in the southeastern savannah ) and cutting mahogany and other hardwood for export . this region retained a semi-feudal character , with little commercial agriculture , the hacienda a the dominant social unit , and the majority of the population living at a subsistence level . in the north ( better-known a cibao ) , the nation 's richest farmland , farmer supplemented their subsistence crop by growing tobacco for export , mainly to germany . tobacco required le land than cattle ranching and wa mainly grown by smallholder , who relied on itinerant trader to transport their crop to puerto plata and monte cristi . santana antagonized the cibao farmer , enriching himself and his supporter at their expense by resorting to multiple peso printing that allowed him to buy their crop for a fraction of their value . in <year> , he wa forced to resign and wa succeeded by his vice-president , manuel jimenes . </s> after defeating a new haitian invasion in <year> , santana marched on santo domingo and deposed jimenes in a coup d'tat . at his behest , congress elected buenaventura bez a president , but bez wa unwilling to serve a santana 's puppet , challenging his role a the country 's acknowledged military leader . in <year> , santana wa elected president for his second term , forcing bez into exile . three year later , after repulsing another haitian invasion , he negotiated a treaty leasing a portion of saman peninsula to a u.s. company ; popular opposition forced him to abdicate , enabling bez to return and seize power . with the treasury depleted , bez printed eighteen million uninsured peso , purchasing the <year> tobacco crop with this currency and exporting it for [ cash ] at immense profit to himself and his follower . cibao tobacco planter , who were ruined when hyperinflation ensued , revolted and formed a new government headed by jos desiderio valverde and headquartered in santiago de los caballeros . in july <year> general juan luis franco bid besieged santo domingo . the cibao-based government declared an amnesty to exile and santana returned and managed to replace franco bid in september <year> . after a year of civil war , santana captured santo domingo in june <year> , overthrew both bez and valverde and installed himself a president . </s> <section_title_start> restoration republic <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , after imprisoning , silencing , exiling , and executing many of his opponent and due to political and economic reason , santana signed a pact with the spanish crown and reverted the dominican nation to spanish occupation of the dominican republic . this action wa supported by the cattleman of the south while the northern elite opposed it . spanish rule finally came to an end with the dominican restoration war in <year> , after four year of conflict between dominican nationalist and spanish sympathizer . the war claimed more than <number> life . </s> political strife again prevailed in the following year ; warlord ruled , military revolt were extremely common , and the nation amassed debt . in <year> , president ulysses s. grant ordered u.s. marine to the island for the first time . pirate operating from haiti had been raiding u.s. commercial shipping in the caribbean , and grant directed the marine to stop them at their source . following the virtual takeover of the island , bez offered to annexation of santo domingo . grant desired a naval base at saman bay and also a place for resettling newly freed african american . the treaty , which included u.s. payment of $ <number> million for dominican debt repayment , wa defeated in the united state senate in <year> on a vote of <year> , two-thirds being required . </s> bez wa toppled in <year> , returned , and wa toppled for good in <year> . a new generation wa thence in charge , with the passing of santana ( he died in <year> ) and bez from the scene . relative peace came to the country in the <year> , which saw the coming to power of general ulises heureaux . </s> `` lils `` , a the new president wa nicknamed , enjoyed a period of popularity . he wa , however , `` a consummate dissembler `` , who put the nation deep into debt while using much of the proceeds for his personal use and to maintain his police state . heureaux became rampantly despotic and unpopular . in <year> , he wa assassinated . however , the relative calm over which he presided allowed improvement in the dominican economy . the sugar industry wa modernized , and the country attracted foreign worker and immigrant . </s> <section_title_start> <number> century ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> from <year> on , short-lived government were again the norm , with their power usurped by caudillos in part of the country . furthermore , the national government wa bankrupt and , unable to pay heureaux 's debt , faced the threat of military intervention by france and other european creditor power . </s> united state president theodore roosevelt sought to prevent european intervention , largely to protect the route to the future panama canal , a the canal wa already under construction . he made a small <year> united state occupation of the dominican republic to ward off european power , to proclaim his famous roosevelt corollary to the monroe doctrine , and also to obtain his <year> dominican agreement for u.s. administration of dominican custom , which wa the chief source of income for the dominican government . a <year> agreement provided for the arrangement to last <number> year . the united state agreed to use part of the custom proceeds to reduce the immense foreign debt of the dominican republic and assumed responsibility for said debt . </s> after six year in power , president ramn cceres ( who had himself assassinated heureaux ) wa assassinated in <year> . the result wa several year of great political instability and civil war . u.s. mediation by the william howard taft and woodrow wilson administration achieved only a short respite each time . a political deadlock in <year> wa broken after an ultimatum by wilson telling the dominican to choose a president or see the u.s. impose one . a provisional president wa chosen , and later the same year relatively free election put former president ( <year> <number> ) juan isidro jimenes pereyra back in power . to achieve a more broadly supported government , jimenes named opposition individual to his cabinet . but this brought no peace and , with his former secretary of war desiderio aria maneuvering to depose him and despite a u.s. offer of military aid against aria , jimenes resigned on may <number> , <year> . </s> wilson thus ordered the u.s. occupation of the dominican republic . united state marine corp u.s. marine landed on may <number> , <year> , and had control of the country two month later . the military government established by the u.s. , led by vice admiral harry shepard knapp , wa widely repudiated by the dominican , with many faction within the country leading guerrilla campaign against u.s. force . the occupation regime kept most dominican law and institution and largely pacified the general population . the occupying government also revived the dominican economy , reduced the nation 's debt , built a road network that at last interconnected all region of the country , and created a professional national guard to replace the warring partisan unit . </s> vigorous opposition to the occupation continued , nevertheless , and after world war i it increased in the u.s. a well . there , president warren g. harding ( <year> <number> ) , wilson 's successor , worked to put an end to the occupation , a he had promised to do during his campaign . the u.s. government 's rule ended in october <year> , and election were held in march <year> . </s> the victor wa former president ( <year> <number> ) horacio vsquez , who had cooperated with the u.s . he wa inaugurated on july <number> , <year> and the last u.s. force left in september . in six year , the marine were involved in at least <number> engagement , with <number> insurgent killed or wounded in action . vsquez gave the country six year of stable governance , in which political and civil right were respected and the economy grew strongly , in a relatively peaceful atmosphere . </s> during the government of horacio vsquez , rafael trujillo held the rank of lieutenant colonel and wa chief of police . this position helped him launch his plan to overthrow the government of vsquez . trujillo had the support of carlos rosario pea , who formed the civic movement , which had a it main objective to overthrow the government of vsquez . </s> in february <year> , when vsquez attempted to win another term , his opponent rebelled in secret alliance with the commander of the national army ( the former national guard ) , general rafael trujillo . trujillo secretly cut a deal with rebel leader rafael estrella urea ; in return for letting urea take power , trujillo would be allowed to run for president in new election . a the rebel marched toward santo domingo , vsquez ordered trujillo to suppress them . however , feigning `` neutrality , `` trujillo kept his men in barrack , allowing urea 's rebel to take the capital virtually uncontested . on march <number> , urea wa proclaimed acting president with trujillo confirmed a head of the police and the army . </s> a per their agreement , trujillo became the presidential nominee of the newly formed patriotic coalition of citizen ( spanish : coalicin patriotica de los ciudadanos ) , with urea a his running mate . during the election campaign , trujillo used the army to unleash his repression , forcing his opponent to withdraw from the race . trujillo stood to elect himself , and in may he wa elected president virtually unopposed after a violent campaign against his opponent , ascending to power on august <number> , <year> . </s> <section_title_start> trujillo era ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> there wa considerable economic growth during rafael trujillo 's long and iron-fisted regime , although a great deal of the wealth wa taken by the dictator and other regime element . there wa progress in healthcare , education , and transportation , with the building of hospital and clinic , school , and road and harbor . trujillo also carried out an important housing construction program and instituted a pension plan . he finally negotiated an undisputed border with haiti in <year> and achieved the end of the <number>-year custom agreement in <year> , instead of <year> . he made the country debt-free in <year> . this wa accompanied by absolute repression and the copious use of murder , torture , and terrorist method against the opposition . trujillo 's henchman did not hesitate to use intimidation , torture , or assassination of political foe both at home and abroad . trujillo wa responsible for the death of the spaniard jos almoina in mexico city and jess galndez in new york city . </s> in <year> , <year> dominican republic hurricane destroyed santo domingo and killed <number> people . during the rebuilding process , trujillo renamed santo domingo to `` ciudad trujillo `` ( trujillo city ) , and the nation 's ; and the caribbean 's ; highest mountain pico duarte ( spanish for : the great bald ) to `` pico trujillo `` ( spanish for : trujillo peak ) . by the end of his first term in <year> he wa the country 's wealthiest person , and one of the wealthiest in the world by the early <year> ; near the end of his regime his fortune wa an estimated $ <number> million ( $ <number> billion today ) . </s> although one-quarter haitian , trujillo promoted propaganda against haitian people . in <year> , he ordered what became known a the parsley massacre or , in the dominican republic , a el corte ( the cutting ) , directing the army to kill haitian living on the dominican side of the border . the army killed an estimated <number> to <number> haitian men , woman , and child over six day , from the night of october <number> , <year> , through october <number> , <year> . to avoid leaving evidence of the army 's involvement , the soldier used edged and bladed weapon rather than gun . the soldier were said to have interrogated anyone with dark skin , using the shibboleth perejil ( parsley ) to distinguish haitian from afro-dominican ( dominican republic ) afro-dominicans when necessary ; the ' r ' of perejil wa of difficult pronunciation for haitian . a a result of the massacre , the dominican republic agreed to pay haiti u $ <number> , later reduced to u $ <number> . in <year> , report from the dominican republic revealed hundred more haitian had been killed and thousand deported . </s> trujillo 's dictatorship wa marred by botched invasion , international scandal and assassination attempt . <year> brought the failure of a planned invasion by leftist dominican exile from the cuban island of cayo confites . july <year> wa the year of a failed invasion from guatemala , and on june <number> , <year> , there wa a failed invasion at constanza , dominican republic , maimn and estero hondo by dominican rebel from cuba . </s> on november <number> , <year> , trujillo killed three of the four mirabal sister , nicknamed la mariposa ( the butterfly ) . the victim were patria mercedes mirabal ( born on february <number> , <year> ) , argentina minerva mirabal ( born on march <number> , <year> ) , and antonia mara teresa mirabal ( born on october <number> , <year> ) . along with their husband , the sister were conspiring to overthrow trujillo in a violent revolt . the mirabals had communist ideological leaning , a did their husband . the sister have received many honor posthumously and have many memorial in various city in the dominican republic . salcedo , their home province , changed it name to hermanas mirabal province ( mirabal sister province ) . the international day for the elimination of violence against woman is observed on the anniversary of their death . </s> for a long time , the u.s. and the dominican elite supported the trujillo government . this support persisted despite the assassination of political opposition , the massacre of haitian , and trujillo 's plot against other country . the u.s. believed trujillo wa the lesser of two or more evil . the u.s. finally broke with trujillo in <year> , after trujillo 's agent attempted to assassinate the venezuelan president , rmulo betancourt , a fierce critic of trujillo . </s> trujillo had become expendable . dissident inside the dominican republic argued that assassination wa the only certain way to remove trujillo . </s> according to chester bowles , the u.s . undersecretary of state , internal department of state discussion in <year> on the topic were vigorous . richard n. goodwin , assistant special counsel to the president , who had direct contact with the rebel alliance , argued for intervention against trujillo . quoting bowles directly : the next morning i learned that in spite of the clear decision against having the dissident group request our assistance dick goodwin following the meeting sent a cable to cia people in the dominican republic without checking with state or cia ; indeed , with the protest of the department of state . the cable directed the cia people in the dominican republic to get this request at any cost . when allen dulles found this out the next morning , he withdrew the order . we later discovered it had already been carried out . </s> <section_title_start> post-trujillo ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> trujillo wa assassinated on may <number> , <year> with weapon supplied by the united state central intelligence agency ( cia ) . </s> in february <year> , a democratically elected government under leftist juan bosch ( politician ) took office but it wa overthrown in september . on april <number> , <year> , after <number> month of military rule , a pro-bosch revolt broke out . </s> day later u.s. president lyndon johnson , concerned that communist might take over the revolt and create a `` second cuba , `` sent the marine , followed immediately by the u.s. army 's <number> airborne division and other element of the xviiith airborne corp , in operation powerpack . `` we do n't propose to sit here in a rocking chair with our hand folded and let the communist set up any government in the western hemisphere , `` johnson said . the force were soon joined by comparatively small contingent from the organization of american state . all these remained in the country for over a year and left after supervising election in <year> won by joaqun balaguer . he had been trujillo 's last puppet-president . </s> the dominican death toll for the entire period of civil war and occupation totaled more than <number> , many of them black civilian killed when the us-backed military junta engaged in a campaign of ethnic cleansing in the northern ( also the industrial ) part of santo domingo . </s> balaguer remained in power a president for <number> year . his tenure wa a period of repression of human right and civil liberty , ostensibly to keep pro-castro or pro-communist party out of power ; <number> person were killed . his rule wa criticized for a growing disparity between rich and poor . it wa , however , praised for an ambitious infrastructure program , which included the construction of large housing project , sport complex , theater , museum , aqueduct , road , highway , and the massive columbus lighthouse , completed in <year> during a later tenure . during balaguer 's administration , the dominican military forced haitian to cut sugarcane on dominican sugar plantation ( batey ( sugar worker ' town ) ) . </s> hurricane david hit the dominican republic in august <year> and killed more than <number> people . </s> in <year> , balaguer wa succeeded in the presidency by opposition candidate antonio guzmn fernndez , of the dominican revolutionary party ( prd ) . another prd win in <year> followed , under salvador jorge blanco . balaguer regained the presidency in <year> and wa re-elected in <year> and <year> , this last time just defeating prd candidate jos francisco pea gmez , a former mayor of santo domingo . </s> during this period , the international community condemned the dominican government for their continued exploitation of haitian sugar cane worker ; it had been alleged that <number> of these
