<section_title_start> <year> present <section_title_end> </s> in the <year> , with the support of joaqun balaguer and the social christian reform party in a coalition called the patriotic front , leonel fernndez achieved the first-ever win for the dominican liberation party ( pld ) , which bosch had founded in <year> after leaving the prd ( which he also had founded ) . fernndez oversaw a fast-growing economy : growth averaged <number> per year , unemployment fell , and there were stable exchange and inflation rate . </s> his administration supported the process of modernizing the judicial system , making transparent the creation of an independent supreme court of justice . effort were also made to reform and modernize the other state body . in addition , relation with cuba were reestablished and the free trade agreement with central america wa signed , which wa the genesis for the signing of dr-cafta . </s> in <year> , the prd 's hiplito meja won the election . this wa a time of economic trouble . neverthelss , his government wa marked by major economic and social reform , apart from a decentralization of the national budget . among the law created in this period are the social security , the monetary and financial code , the stock market , electricity , electronic commerce , the police law , the environment , public health , the chamber of account , the insurance law , administrative independence and budgetary of the legislative power and judicial power ; in addition , creation of the santo domingo province and it municipality , a larger budget for municipality , a well a other law . this meant in the <year> election , obtaining a congressional and municipal majority . during this period , great sport structure were built for the <year> pan american game . under meja , the dominican republic participated in the us-led coalition , a part of the multinational brigade plus ultra , during the <year> invasion of iraq , suffering no casualty . in <year> , the country withdrew it approximately <number> soldier from iraq . the government of president meja had to negotiate the free trade agreement with the united state , the main trading partner . he also promoted various commercial measure , popularly called `` economic package `` . this `` package `` wa accompanied by a series of social measure , such a aid to agricultural producer , subsidy to electricity rate , construction of street , sidewalk , local road , etc . , a well a subsidy to poor family whose child attended school , a well a the creation of new tax and increase in existing one . </s> in <year> the effect of the bankruptcy of three banking entity whose saver were protected by the government who financed this situation by creating inflation . this caused a strong economic crisis accompanied by the devaluation of the currency and capital outflow , instability that led to the bankruptcy of many company . with the congressional majority obtained in <year> , president meja promoted a constitutional reform that restored the possibility of presidential reelection , which had been abolished in <year> at the request of his own party . this reform caused problem within his party causing a division within it main leader . </s> meja wa defeated in his re-election effort in <year> by leonel fernndez of the pld who won with <number> of the vote the presidential election . at the beginning of his second presidential term , he made an effort to combat the economic crisis , reestablishing macroeconomic stability , manifesting among other thing through the reduction of the dollar exchange rate and the return of confidence in the economy . on the other hand , his administration wa accused of corruption . president fernndez 's management consisted of improving santo domingo 's collective transport system , the first metro line wa built ; the completion of the main communication route to the country 's tourist pole ; the construction of new school or the construction of more classroom , a well a the provision of computer center with modern computer and internet to the community in coordination with school , church or club . it continued it program of modernization of the state , strengthening the formulation and execution of the budget and promoting law to make the public acquisition of good and service transparent . </s> in <year> , fernndez wa a elected for a third term . fernndez and the pld are credited with initiative that have moved the country forward technologically , on the other hand , his administration have been accused of corruption . danilo medina of the pld wa elected president in <year> and re-elected in <year> . on the other hand , a significant increase in crime , government corruption and a weak justice system threaten to overshadow their administrative period . he wa succeeded by luis abinader in the <year> dominican republic general election . </s> the dominican republic ha the list of latin american and caribbean country by gdp ( ppp ) ninth-largest economy in latin america and is the largest economy in the caribbean and central american region . over the last two decade , the dominican republic ha had one of the fastest-growing economy in the america with an average list of country by real gdp growth rate of <number> between <year> and <year> . gdp growth in <year> and <year> reached <number> and <number> , respectively , the highest in the western hemisphere . in the first half of <year> , the dominican economy grew <number> continuing it trend of rapid economic growth . recent growth ha been driven by construction , manufacturing , tourism , and mining . private consumption ha been strong , a a result of low inflation ( under <number> on average in <year> ) , job creation , a well a a high level of remittance . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> the dominican republic comprises the eastern five-eighths of hispaniola , the second-largest island in the greater antilles , with the atlantic ocean to the north and the caribbean sea to the south . it share the island roughly at a <number>:1 ratio with haiti , the north-to-south ( though somewhat irregular ) border between the two country being . to the north and north-west lie the bahamas and the turk and caicos island , and to the east , across the mona passage , the u commonwealth of puerto rico . the country 's area is reported variously a ( by the embassy in the united state ) and , making it the second largest country in the antilles , after cuba . the dominican republic 's capital and largest city santo domingo is on the southern coast . </s> the dominican republic ha four important mountain range . the most northerly is the cordillera septentrional ( `` northern mountain range `` ) , which extends from the northwestern coastal town of san fernando de monte cristi , near the haitian border , to the saman peninsula in the east , running parallel to the atlantic coast . the highest range in the dominican republic ; indeed , in the whole of the west indie ; is the cordillera central , dominican republic ( `` central mountain range `` ) . it gradually bend southward and finish near the town of azua de compostela , on the caribbean coast . in the cordillera central are the four highest peak in the caribbean : pico duarte ( above sea level ) , la pelona ( ) , la rucilla ( ) , and pico yaque ( ) . in the southwest corner of the country , south of the cordillera central , there are two other range : the more northerly of the two is the sierra de neiba , while in the south the sierra de bahoruco is a continuation of the massif de la selle in haiti . there are other , minor mountain range , such a the cordillera oriental ( `` eastern mountain range `` ) , sierra martn garca , sierra de yama , and sierra de saman . </s> between the central and northern mountain range lie the rich and fertile cibao valley . this major valley is home to the city of santiago de los caballeros and concepcin de la vega and most of the farming area of the nation . rather le productive are the semi-arid san juan valley , south of the central cordillera , and the neiba valley , tucked between the sierra de neiba and the sierra de bahoruco . much of the land around the lake enriquillo basin is below sea level , with a hot , arid , desert-like environment . there are other smaller valley in the mountain , such a the constanza , dominican republic , jarabacoa , villa altagracia , and bonao valley . </s> the llano costero del caribe ( `` caribbean coastal plain `` ) is the largest of the plain in the dominican republic . stretching north and east of santo domingo , it contains many sugar plantation in the savannah that are common there . west of santo domingo it width is reduced to a it hug the coast , finishing at the mouth of the ocoa river . another large plain is the plenum de azua ( `` azua plain `` ) , a very arid region in azua province . a few other small coastal plain are on the northern coast and in the pedernales province peninsula . </s> four major river drain the numerous mountain of the dominican republic . the yaque del norte river is the longest and most important dominican river . it carry excess water down from the cibao valley and empty into monte cristi bay , in the northwest . likewise , the yuna river serf the vega real and empty into saman bay , in the northeast . drainage of the san juan valley is provided by the san juan river , tributary of the yaque del sur , which empty into the caribbean , in the south . the artibonite river is the longest river of hispaniola and flow westward into haiti . </s> there are many lake and coastal lagoon . the largest lake is lake enriquillo , a salt lake at below sea level , the lowest elevation in the caribbean . other important lake are laguna de rincn or cabral , with freshwater , and laguna de oviedo , a lagoon with brackish water . </s> there are many small offshore island and cay that form part of the dominican territory . the two largest island near shore are saona island , in the southeast , and beata , in the southwest . smaller island include the cayos siete hermanos , isla cabra , cayo jackson , cayo limn , cayo levantado , cayo la bocaina , catalina island ( dominican republic ) , cayo pisaje and isla alto velo . to the north , at distance of , are three extensive , largely submerged bank ( topography ) , which geographically are a southeast continuation of the bahamas : navidad bank , silver bank , and mouchoir bank . navidad bank and silver bank have been officially claimed by the dominican republic . isla cabritos lie within lago enriquillo . </s> the dominican republic is located near fault action in the caribbean . in <year> , it suffered <year> dominican republic earthquake a magnitude <number> earthquake off the northeast coast , triggering a tsunami that killed about <number> , mostly in coastal community . caribbean country and the united state have collaborated to create tsunami warning system and are mapping high-risk low-lying area . </s> the country is home to five terrestrial ecoregions : hispaniolan moist forest , hispaniolan dry forest , hispaniolan pine forest , enriquillo wetland , and greater antilles mangrove . it had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the dominican republic ha a tropical rainforest climate in the coastal and lowland area . some area , such a most of the cibao region , have a tropical savanna climate . due to it diverse topography , dominican republic 's climate show considerable variation over short distance and is the most varied of all the antilles . the annual average temperature is . at higher elevation the temperature average while near sea level the average temperature is . low temperature of are possible in the mountain while high temperature of are possible in protected valley . january and february are the coolest month of the year while august is the hottest month . snowfall can be seen on rare occasion on the summit of pico duarte . </s> the wet season along the northern coast last from november through january . elsewhere the wet season stretch from may through november , with may being the wettest month . average annual rainfall is countrywide , with individual location in the valle de neiba seeing average a low a while the cordillera oriental average . the driest part of the country lie in the west . </s> tropical cyclone strike the dominican republic every couple of year , with <number> of the impact along the southern coast . hurricane are most likely between june and october . the last major hurricane that struck the country wa hurricane george in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> the dominican republic is a representative democracy or democracy , with three branch of power : executive , legislature , and judiciary . the president of the dominican republic head the executive branch and executes law passed by the congress of the dominican republic , appoints the cabinet , and is commander in chief of the military of the dominican republic . the president and vice-president run for office on the same ticket and are elected by direct vote for <number>-year term . the national legislature is bicameral , composed of a senate of the dominican republic , which ha <number> member , and the chamber of deputy of the dominican republic , with <number> member . </s> judicial authority rest with the government of the dominican republic # judicial branch 's <number> member . they are appointed by a council composed of the president , the leader of both house of congress , the president of the supreme court , and an opposition or nongoverning-party member . the court `` alone hears action against the president , designated member of his cabinet , and member of congress when the legislature is in session . `` </s> the dominican republic ha a multi-party system multi-party political system . election are held every two year , alternating between the election in the dominican republic , which are held in year evenly divisible by four , and the congressional and municipal election , which are held in even-numbered year not divisible by four . `` international observer have found that presidential and congressional election since <year> have been generally free and fair . `` the central election board ( jce ) of nine member supervises election , and it decision are unappealable . starting from <year> , election will be held jointly , after a constitutional reform . </s> <section_title_start> political culture <section_title_end> </s> the three major party are the conservative social christian reformist party ( partido reformista social agreement with the european union and the caribbean community via the cariforum caribbean forum . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> congress of the dominican republic cuba . </s> the armed force have organized a specialized airport security corp ( cesa ) and a specialized port security corp ( cesep ) to meet international security need in these area . the secretary on the prohibition of nuclear weapon . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> the dominican republic is divided into <number> province of the dominican republic . santo domingo , the capital , is designated distrito nacional ( national district ) . the province are divided into municipality ( municipios ; singular municipio ) . they are the second-level political and administrative division of the country . the president appoints the governor of the <number> province . mayor and municipal council administer the <number> municipal district and the national district ( santo domingo ) . they are elected at the same time a congressional representative . </s> the province are the firstlevel administrative division of the country . the headquarters of the central government 's regional office are normally found in the capital city of province . the president appoints an administrative governor ( gobernador civil ) for each province but not for the distrito nacional ( title ix of the constitution ) . </s> the distrito nacional wa created in <year> . prior to this , the distrito national wa the old santo domingo province , in existence since the country 's independence in <year> . it is not to be confused with the new santo domingo province split off from it in <year> . while it is similar to a province in many way , the distrito nacional differs in it lack of an administrative governor and consisting only of one municipality , santo domingo , the city council ( ayuntamiento ) and mayor ( sndico ) which are in charge of it administration . </s> } </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> the dominican republic is the largest economy ( according to the u.s. state department and the world bank ) in the caribbean and central american region . it is an upper middle-income developing country , with a <year> gdp per caput of u $ <number> , in purchasing power parity term . over the last <number> year , and <number> , respectively , the highest in the western hemisphere . in the first half of <year> , the dominican economy grew <number> . , the average wage in nominal term is u $ <number> per month ( rd $ <number> ) . the country is the site of the second largest gold mine in the world , the pueblo viejo mine . </s> during the last three decade , the dominican economy , formerly dependent on the export of agricultural commodity ( mainly sugar , cocoa and coffee ) , ha transitioned to a diversified mix of service , manufacturing , agriculture , mining , and trade . the service sector account for almost <number> of gdp ; manufacturing , for <number> ; tourism , telecommunication and finance are the main component of the service sector ; however , none of them account for more than <number> of the whole . the dominican republic ha a stock market , bolsa de valores de la repblica dominicana bolsa de valores de la republica dominicana ( bvrd ) . and advanced telecommunication system and transportation infrastructure . high unemployment and income inequality are long-term challenge . international migration affect the dominican republic greatly , a it receives and sends large flow of migrant . mass illegal haitian immigration and the integration of dominican of haitian descent are major issue . a large dominican diaspora exists , mostly dominican american ( dominican republic ) , contributes to development , sending billion of dollar to dominican family in remittance . </s> remittance in dominican republic increased to u $ <year> .30 million in <year> from u $ <year> million in <year> ( according to data reported by the inter-american development bank ) . economic growth take place in spite of a chronic energy shortage , which cause frequent blackout and very high price . despite a widening merchandise balance of trade , tourism earnings and remittance have helped build foreign exchange reserve . following economic turmoil in the late <year> and <year> , during which the gross domestic product ( gdp ) fell by up to <number> and consumer price inflation reached an unprecedented <number> , the dominican republic entered a period of growth and declining inflation until <year> , after which the economy entered a recession . </s> this recession followed the collapse of the second-largest commercial bank in the country , banco intercontinental , linked to a major incident of fraud valued at u $ <number> billion . the baninter fraud had a devastating effect on the dominican economy , with gdp dropping by <number> in <year> a inflation ballooned by over <number> . all defendant , including the star of the trial , ramn bez figueroa ( the great-grandson of president buenaventura bez ) , were convicted . </s> according to the <year> annual report of the united <number> in the world for resource mismanagement . these statistic emphasize national government corruption , foreign economic interference in the country , and the rift between the rich and poor . </s> the dominican republic ha a noted problem of child labor in it coffee , rice , sugarcane , and tomato industry . the labor injustice in the sugarcane industry extend to forced labor according to per dollar . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> the dominican republic is the world tourism ranking in the caribbean . the year-round golf course are major attraction . a geographically diverse nation , the dominican republic is home to both the caribbean 's tallest mountain peak , pico duarte , and the caribbean 's largest lake and point of lowest elevation , lake enriquillo . the island ha an average temperature of and great climatic and biological diversity . the country is also the site of the first cathedral , castle , monastery , and fortress built in the america , located in santo domingo 's ciudad colonial ( santo domingo ) , a world heritage site . </s> tourism is one of the fueling factor in the dominican republic 's economic growth . the dominican republic is the most popular tourist destination in the caribbean . with the construction of project like cap cana , san souci port in santo domingo , casa de campo , dominican republic and the hard rock hotel & casino ( ancient moon palace resort ) in punta cana , the dominican republic expects increased tourism activity in the upcoming year . </s> ecotourism ha also been a topic increasingly </s> <section_title_start> transportation <section_title_end> </s> the country ha three national trunk highway , which connect every major town . these are dr-1 , dr-2 , and dr-3 , which depart from santo domingo toward the northern ( cibao ) , southwestern ( sur ) , and eastern ( el este ) part of the country respectively . these highway have been consistently improved with the expansion and reconstruction of many section . two other national highway serve a spur ( dr-5 ) or alternative route ( dr-4 ) . </s> in addition to the national highway , the government ha embarked on an expansive reconstruction of spur secondary route , which connect smaller town to the trunk route . in the last few year the government constructed a <number>-kilometer toll road that connects santo domingo with the country 's northeastern peninsula . traveler may now arrive in the saman peninsula in le than two hour . other addition are the reconstruction of the dr-28 ( jarabacoa ; constanza ) and dr-12 ( constanza ; bonao ) . despite these effort , many secondary route still remain either unpaved or in need of maintenance . there is currently a nationwide program to pave these and other commonly used route . also , the santiago light rail system is in planning stage but currently on hold . </s> <section_title_start> bus service <section_title_end> </s> there are two main bus transportation service in the dominican republic : one controlled by the government , through the oficina tcnica de transito terrestre ( ottt ) and the oficina metropolitana de servicios de autobus ( omsa ) , and the other controlled by private business , among them , federacin nacional de transporte la nueva opcin ( fenatrano ) and the confederacion nacional de transporte ( conatra ) . the government transportation system cover large route in metropolitan area such a santo domingo and santiago . </s> there are many privately owned bus company , such a metro servicios tursticos and caribe tour , that run daily route . </s> <section_title_start> santo domingo metro <section_title_end> </s> the dominican republic ha a rapid transit system in santo domingo , the country 's capital . it is the most extensive metro system in the insular caribbean and central american region by length and number of station . the santo domingo metro is part of a major `` national master plan `` to improve transportation in santo domingo a well a the rest of the nation . the first line wa planned to relieve traffic congestion in the dr-1 and dr-13 . the second line , which opened in april <year> , is meant to relieve the congestion along the dr-13 duarte-kennedy-centenario corridor in the city from west to east . the current length of the metro , with the section of the two line open , is . before the opening of the second line , <number> passenger rode the santo domingo metro in <year> . with both line opened , ridership increased to <number> passenger in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> communication is called dominican spanish , which closely resembles other spanish vernacular in the caribbean and ha similarity to canarian spanish . in addition , it ha influence from african language and borrowed word from indigenous language of the america # south america and the caribbean particular to the island of hispaniola . school are based on a spanish educational model ; english and french are mandatory foreign language in both private and public school , although the quality of foreign language teaching is poor . some private educational institute provide teaching in other language , notably italian , japanese and mandarin . </s> haitian creole is the largest minority language in the dominican republic and is spoken by haitian immigrant and their descendant . there is a community of a few thousand people whose ancestor spoke saman english in the saman peninsula . they are the descendant of formerly enslaved african american who arrived in the nineteenth century , but only a few elder speak the language today . tourism , american pop culture , the influence of dominican american , and the country 's economic tie with the united state motivate other dominican to learn english . the dominican republic is ranked <number> in latin america and <number> in the world on english language proficiency . </s> <section_title_start> population centre <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> <number> christian </s> <number> no religion </s> <number> other religion </s> , <number> of the population ( <number> million ) identified mercedes ( our lady of mercy ) . </s> the dominican republic ha historically granted extensive religious freedom . according to the united state department of state , `` the constitution specifies that there is no state church and provides for freedom of religion and belief . a concordat with the vatican designates catholicism a the official religion and extends special privilege to the catholic church not granted to other religious group . these include the legal recognition of church law , use of public fund to underwrite some church expense , and complete exoneration from custom duty . `` in the <year> restriction were placed upon church by the government of trujillo . letter of protest were sent against the mass arrest of government adversary . trujillo began a campaign against the catholic church and planned to arrest priest and bishop who preached against the government . this campaign ended before it wa put into place , with his assassination . </s> during world and is additionally the least developed country in the western hemisphere . in <year> , <number> of all haitian were poor ( <number> living in abject poverty ) and <number> were illiterate . the country of nine million people also ha a fast growing population , but over two-thirds of the labor force lack formal job . haiti 's per caput gdp ( ppp ) wa $ <number> in <year> , or just over one-tenth of the dominican figure . </s> a a result , hundred of thousand of haitian have migrated to the dominican republic , with some estimate of <number> haitian in the country , while others put the haitian-born population a high a one million . they usually work at low-paying and unskilled job in building construction and house cleaning and in sugar plantation . there have been accusation that some haitian immigrant work in slavery-like condition and are severely exploited . </s> due to the lack of basic amenity and medical facility in haiti a large number of haitian woman , often arriving with several health problem , cross the border to dominican soil . they deliberately come during their last week of pregnancy to obtain medical attention for childbirth , since dominican public hospital do not refuse medical service based on nationality or legal status . statistic from a hospital in santo domingo report that over <number> of childbirth are by haitian mother . </s> haiti also environmental issue in haiti . deforestation is rampant in haiti ; today le than <number> percent of haiti 's forest remain , and in many place the soil ha eroded right down to the bedrock . haitian burn wood charcoal for <number> of their domestic energy production . because of haiti running out of plant material to burn , some haitian bootlegger have created an illegal market for charcoal on the dominican side . conservative estimate calculate the illegal movement of <number> ton of charcoal per week from the dominican republic to haiti . dominican official estimate that at least <number> truck per week are crossing the border loaded with charcoal . </s> in <year> , dominican president leonel fernndez criticized collective expulsion of haitian a having taken place `` in an abusive and inhuman way . `` after a un delegation issued a preliminary report stating that it found a profound problem of racism and discrimination against people of haitian origin , dominican foreign minister carlos morale troncoso issued a formal statement denouncing it , asserting that `` our border with haiti ha it problem [ ; ] this is our reality and it must be understood . it is important not to confuse national sovereignty with indifference , and not to confuse security with xenophobia . `` </s> the child of haitian immigrant are eligible for haitian nationality , are denied it by haiti because of a lack of proper document or witness . </s> <section_title_start> emigration <section_title_end> </s> the first of three late-20th century emigration wave began in <year> after the assassination of dictator trujillo , due to fear of retaliation by trujillo 's ally and political uncertainty in general . in <year> , the united state began a military occupation of the dominican republic to end a civil war . upon this , the u.s. eased travel restriction , making it easier for dominican to obtain u.s. visa . from <year> to <year> , the exodus continued , fueled by high unemployment and political repression . community established by the first wave of immigrant to the u.s. created a network that assisted subsequent arrival . </s> in the early <year> , underemployment , inflation , and the rise in value of the dollar all contributed to a third wave of emigration from the dominican republic . today , emigration from the dominican republic remains high . in <year> , there were approximately <number> million people of dominican descent in the u.s. , counting both native- and foreign-born . there wa also a growing dominican republic immigration to puerto rico , with nearly <number> dominican living there . although that number is slowly decreasing and immigration trend have reversed because of puerto rico 's economic crisis . </s> there is a significant dominican population in spain . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , the dominican republic had an estimated birth rate of <number> per <year> and a death rate of <number> per <year> . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> primary education is regulated by the ministry of education , with education being a right of all citizen and youth in the dominican republic . </s> preschool education is organized in different cycle and serf the <number> age group and the <number> age group . preschool education is not mandatory except for the last year . basic education is compulsory and serf the population of the <number> age group . secondary education is not compulsory , although it is the duty of the state to offer it for free . it caters to the <year> age group and is organized in a common core of four year and three mode of two year of study that are offered in three different option : general or academic , vocational ( industrial , agricultural , and service ) , and artistic . </s> the higher education system consists of institute and university . the institute offer course of a higher technical level . the university offer technical career , undergraduate and graduate ; these are regulated by the ministry of higher education , science and technology . </s> <section_title_start> crime <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , the dominican republic had a list of country by intentional homicide rate of <number> per <number> population . there wa a total of <number> murder in the dominican republic in <year> . </s> the dominican republic ha become a trans-shipment point for colombian drug destined for europe a well a the united state and canada . money-laundering via the dominican republic is favored by colombian drug cartel for the ease of illicit financial transaction . in <year> , it wa estimated that <number> of all cocaine smuggled into the united state had come through the dominican republic . the dominican republic responded with increased effort to seize drug shipment , arrest and extradite those involved , and combat money-laundering . </s> the often light treatment of violent criminal ha been a continuous source of local controversy . in april <year> , five teenager , aged <number> to <number> , shot and killed two taxi driver and killed another five by forcing them to drink drain-cleaning acid . on september <number> , <year> , the teen were sentenced to prison term of three to five year , despite the protest of the taxi driver ' family . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> due to cultural syncretism , the culture and custom of the dominican people have a european culture , influenced by both african culture and native tano element , although endogenous element have emerged within dominican culture ; culturally the dominican republic is among the most-european country in spanish america , alongside culture of puerto rico , culture of cuba , central chile , culture of argentina , and culture of uruguay . spanish institution in the colonial era were able to predominate in the dominican culture 's making-of a a relative success in the acculturation and cultural assimilation of african slave diminished african cultural influence in comparison to other caribbean country . </s> music and sport are of great importance in the dominican culture , with merengue music and bachata ( music ) a the national dance and music , and baseball a the favorite sport . </s> <section_title_start> visual art <section_title_end> </s> dominican art is perhaps most commonly associated with the bright , vibrant color and image that are sold in every tourist gift shop across the country . however , the country ha a long history of fine art that go back to the middle of the <year> when the country became independent and the beginning of a national art scene emerged . </s> historically , the painting of this time were centered around image connected to national independence , historical scene , portrait but also landscape and image of still life . style of painting ranged between neoclassicism and romanticism . between <year> and <year> the art scene wa influenced by style of realism ( art ) and impressionism . dominican artist were focused on breaking from previous , academic style in order to develop more independent and individual style . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> the <number> century brought many prominent dominican writer , and saw a general increase in the perception of dominican literature . writer such a juan bosch ( politician ) ( one of the greatest storyteller in latin america ) , pedro mir ( national poet of the dominican republic ) , aida cartagena portalatin ( poetess par excellence who spoke in the era of rafael trujillo ) , emilio rodrguez demorizi ( the most important dominican historian , with more than <year> written work ) , manuel del cabral ( main dominican poet featured in black poetry ) , hector inchustegui cabral ( considered one of the most prominent voice of the caribbean social poetry of the twentieth century ) , miguel alfonseca ( poet belonging to generation <number> ) , rene del risco ( acclaimed poet who wa a participant in the june <number> movement ) , mateo morrison ( excellent poet and writer with numerous award ) , among many more prolific author , put the island in one of the most important in literature in the twentieth century . </s> new <number> century dominican writer have not yet achieved the renown of their <number> century counterpart . however , writer such a frank bez ( won the <year> santo domingo book fair first prize ) and junot daz ( <year> pulitzer prize for fiction for his novel the brief wondrous life of oscar wao ) lead dominican literature in the <number> century . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> the architecture in the dominican republic represents a complex blend of diverse culture . the deep influence of the european colonist is the most evident throughout the country . characterized by ornate design and baroque architecture structure , the style can best be seen in the capital city of santo domingo , which is home to the first cathedral , castle , monastery , and fortress in all of the america , located in the city 's ciudad colonial ( santo domingo ) , an area declared a a world heritage site by unesco . the design carry over into the villa and building throughout the country . it can also be observed on building that contain stucco exterior , arched door and window , and red tiled roof . </s> the indigenous people of the dominican republic have also had a significant influence on the architecture of the country . the tano people relied heavily on the mahogany and guano ( dried palm tree leaf ) to put together craft , artwork , furniture , and house . utilizing mud , thatched roof , and mahogany tree , they gave building and the furniture inside a natural look , seamlessly blending in with the island 's surroundings . </s> lately , with the rise in tourism and increasing popularity a a caribbean vacation destination , architect in the dominican republic have now begun to incorporate cutting-edge design that emphasize luxury . in many way an architectural playground , villa and hotel implement new style , while offering new take on the old . this new style is characterized by simplified , angular corner and large window that blend outdoor and indoor space . a with the culture a a whole , contemporary architect embrace the dominican republic 's rich history and various culture to create something new . surveying modern villa , one can find any combination of the three major style : a villa may contain angular , modernist building construction , spanish colonial-style arched window , and a traditional tano hammock in the bedroom balcony . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> dominican cuisine is predominantly spanish cuisine # spanish regional variation : typical dish and meal routine , tano # food and agriculture , and african cuisine . the typical cuisine is quite similar to what can be found in other latin american country . one breakfast dish consists of egg and mang ( dish ) ( mashed , boiled plantain ) . heartier version of mang are accompanied by deep-fried meat ( dominican salami , typically ) , cheese , or both . lunch , generally the largest and most important meal of the day , usually consists of rice , meat , bean , and salad . `` la bandera `` ( literally `` the flag `` ) is the most popular lunch dish ; it consists of meat and red bean on white rice . sancocho is a stew often made with seven variety of meat . </s> meal tend to favor meat and starch over dairy product and vegetable . many dish are made with sofrito , which is a mix of local herb used a a wet rub for meat and sauted to bring out all of a dish 's flavor . throughout the south-central coast , bulgur , or whole wheat , is a main ingredient in tabbouleh ( bulgur salad ) . other favorite dominican food include chicharrn , cassava , tapioca , cuban pastry ( empanadas ) , sweet potato , yam ( vegetable ) , pasteles , chimichurris , and tostones . </s> some treat dominican enjoy are rice pudding ( or arroz con dulce ) , bizcocho dominicano ( lit . dominican cake ) , [ con dulce ] , crme caramel , snow cone ( snow cone ) , dulce de leche , and caa ( sugarcane ) . the beverage dominican enjoy are morir soando , rum , beer , mama juana , batida ( smoothie ) , jugos naturales ( freshly squeezed fruit juice ) , mauby , coffee , and chaca ( dessert ) ( also called maiz caqueao/casqueado , maiz con dulce and maiz con leche ) , the last item being found only in the southern province of the country such a san juan . </s> <section_title_start> music and dance <section_title_end> </s> musically , the dominican republic is known for the popular culture musical style and genre called merengue music , a type of lively , fast-paced rhythm and dance music consisting of a tempo of about <number> to <number> beat per minute ( though it varies ) based on musical element like drum , brass , chorded instrument , and accordion , a well a some element unique to the spanish-speaking caribbean , such a the tambora ( dominican drum ) and gira . </s> it syncopation use latin percussion , brass instrument , bass , and piano or keyboard . between <year> and <year> merengue music wa promoted internationally by dominican group like billo 's caracas boy , chapuseaux and damiron `` los reyes del merengue , `` joseito mateo , and others . radio , television , and international medium popularized it further . some well known merengue performer are wilfrido vargas , johnny ventura , singer-songwriter los hermanos rosario , juan luis guerra , fernando villalona , eddy herrera , sergio vargas , too rosario , milly quezada , and chich peralta . </s> merengue became popular in the united state , mostly on the east coast of the united state , during the <year> and <year> , when many dominican artist residing in the u.s. ( particularly new york ) started performing in the latin club scene and gained radio airplay . they included victor roque y la gran manzana , henry hierro , zacarias ferreira , aventura , and milly jocelyn y los vecinos . the emergence of bachata ( music ) , along with an increase in the number of dominican living among other hispanic and latino american group in new york , new jersey , and florida , ha contributed to dominican music 's overall growth in popularity . </s> bachata ( music ) , a form of music and dance that originated in the countryside and rural marginal neighborhood of the dominican republic , ha become quite popular in recent year . it subject are often romantic ; especially prevalent are tale of heartbreak and sadness . in fact , the original name for the genre wa amargue ( `` bitterness , `` or `` bitter music , `` ) , until the rather ambiguous ( and mood-neutral ) term bachata became popular . bachata grew out of , and is still closely related to , the pan-latinism pan-latin american romantic style called bolero . over time , it ha been influenced by merengue and by a variety of latin american guitar style . </s> palo music is an afro-dominican ( dominican republic ) afro-dominican sacred music that can be found throughout the island . the drum and human voice are the principal instrument . palo is played at religious ceremoniesusually coinciding with saint ' religious feast daysas well a for secular party and special occasion . it root are in the congo region of central-west africa , but it is mixed with european influence in the melody . </s> salsa music ha had a great deal of popularity in the country . during the late <year> dominican musician like johnny pacheco , creator of the fania all star , played a significant role in the development and popularization of the genre . </s> dominican rock and reggaeton are also popular . many , if not the majority , of it performer are based in santo domingo and santiago . </s> <section_title_start> fashion <section_title_end> </s> the country boast one of the ten most important design school in the region , la escuela de diseo de alto de chavn , which is making the country a key player in the world of fashion and design . noted fashion designer oscar de la renta wa born in the dominican republic in <year> , and became a u citizen in <year> . he studied under the leading spaniard designer cristbal balenciaga and then worked with the house of lanvin ( clothing ) in paris . by <year> , he had design bearing his own label . after establishing himself in the u , de la renta opened boutique across the country . his work blend french and spaniard fashion with american style . although he settled in new york , de la renta also marketed his work in latin america , where it became very popular , and remained active in his native dominican republic , where his charitable activity and personal achievement earned him the juan pablo duarte order of merit and the order of cristbal coln . de la renta died of complication from cancer on october <number> , <year> . </s> <section_title_start> national symbol <section_title_end> </s> some of the dominican republic 's important symbol are the flag of the dominican republic , coat of arm of the dominican republic , and the national anthem , titled national anthem of the dominican republic . the flag ha a large white cross that divide it into four quarter . two quarter are red and two are blue . red represents the blood shed by the liberator . blue express god 's protection over the nation . the white cross symbolizes the struggle of the liberator to bequeath future generation a free nation . an alternative interpretation is that blue represents the ideal of progress and liberty , whereas white symbolizes peace and unity among dominican . </s> in the center of the cross is the dominican coat of arm , in the same color a the national flag . the coat of arm picture a red , white , and blue flag-draped shield with a bible , a gold cross , and arrow ; the shield is surrounded by an olive branch ( on the left ) and a palm branch ( on the right ) . the bible traditionally represents the truth and the light . the gold cross symbolizes the redemption from slavery , and the arrow symbolize the noble soldier and their proud military . a blue ribbon above the shield read , `` dios , patria , libertad `` ( meaning `` god , fatherland , liberty `` ) . a red ribbon under the shield read , `` repblica dominicana `` ( meaning `` dominican republic `` ) . out of all the flag in the world , the depiction of a bible is unique to the dominican flag . </s> the floral emblem is the pereskia quisqueyana and the national tree is the swietenia mahagoni . the national bird is the cigua palmera or palmchat ( `` dulus dominicus `` ) . </s> the dominican republic celebrates dia de la altagracia on january <number> in honor of it patroness , juan pablo duarte 's day on january <number> in honor of one of it founding father , independence day on february <number> , dominican restoration war on august <number> , virgen de la mercedes on september <number> , and constitution day on november <number> </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> baseball is by far the most popular sport in the dominican republic . the country ha a baseball league of six team . it season usually begin in october and end in january . after the united state , the dominican republic ha the second highest number of major league baseball ( mlb ) player . ozzie virgil sr. became the first dominican-born player in the mlb on september <number> , <year> . juan marichal , pedro martnez , and vladimir guerrero are the only dominican-born player in the national baseball hall of fame and museum . other notable baseball player born in the dominican republic are jos bautista , adrin beltr , george bell ( outfielder ) , robinson can , rico carty , bartolo coln , nelson cruz , edwin encarnacin , ubaldo jimnez , francisco liriano , david ortiz , plcido polanco , albert pujols , hanley ramrez , manny ramrez , jos reyes ( shortstop ) , sammy sosa , and miguel tejada . felipe alou ha also enjoyed success a a manager and omar minaya a a general manager . in <year> , the dominican team went undefeated en route to winning the <year> world baseball classic . </s> in boxing , the country ha produced score of world-class fighter and several world champion , such a carlos cruz ( boxer ) , his brother leo cruz , juan guzman ( boxer ) , and joan guzman . basketball also enjoys a relatively high level of popularity . tito horford , his son al horford , felipe lpez ( basketball ) , and francisco garca ( basketball ) are among the dominican-born player currently or formerly in the national basketball association ( nba ) . olympic gold medalist and world champion hurdler flix snchez hail from the dominican republic , a doe national football league defensive end luis castillo ( american football ) . </s> other important sport are volleyball , introduced in <year> by u.s. marine and controlled by the dominican volleyball federation , taekwondo , in which gabriel mercedes won an olympic silver medal in <year> , and judo . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of dominican republic-related article </s> * outline of the dominican republic established in <year> <article_end> <article_start> </s> honduras , officially the republic of honduras , is a country in central america . the republic of honduras is bordered to the west by guatemala , to the southwest by el salvador , to the southeast by nicaragua , to the south by the pacific ocean at the gulf of fonseca , and to the north by the gulf of honduras , a large inlet of the caribbean sea . </s> honduras wa home to several important mesoamerican culture , most notably the maya civilization , before the spanish colonization of the america in the sixteenth century . the spanish introduced roman catholicism and the now predominant spanish language , along with numerous custom that have blended with the indigenous culture . honduras became independent in <year> and ha since been a republic , although it ha consistently endured much social strife and political instability , and remains one of the poorest country in the western hemisphere . in <year> , the northern part of what wa the mosquito coast wa transferred from nicaragua to honduras by the international court of justice . </s> the nation 's economy is primarily agricultural , making it especially vulnerable to natural disaster such a hurricane mitch in <year> . the lower class is primarily agriculturally based while wealth is concentrated in the country 's urban center . honduras ha a human development index of <number> , classifying it a a nation with medium development . when the index is adjusted for income inequality , it inequality-adjusted human development index is <number> </s> honduran society is predominantly mestizo ; however , american indian , black and white individual also live in honduras ( <year> ) . the nation had a relatively high political stability until it <year> honduran coup d'tat and again with the <year> honduran general election . </s> honduras span about and ha a population exceeding million . it northern portion are part of the western caribbean zone , a reflected in the area 's demographic and culture . honduras is known for it rich natural resource , including mineral , coffee , tropical fruit , and sugar cane , a well a for it growing textile industry , which serf the international market . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the literal meaning of the term `` honduras `` is `` depth `` in spanish . the name could either refer to the bay of trujillo a an anchorage , fondura in the leonese dialect of spain , or to christopher columbus 's alleged quote that `` gracias a dios que hemos salido de esas honduras `` ( `` thank god we have departed from those depth `` ) . </s> it wa not until the end of the <number> century that honduras wa used for the whole province . prior to <year> , honduras referred to only the eastern part of the province , and higueras referred to the western part . another early name is guaimura , revived a the name for the guaymuras dialogue that took place in honduras a opposed to costa rica . </s> honduran are often referred to a catracho or catracha ( fem ) in spanish . the word wa coined by nicaraguan and derives from the last name of the spanish honduran general florencio xatruch , who in <year> led honduran armed force against an attempted invasion by north american adventurer william walker ( filibuster ) . the nickname is considered complimentary , not derogatory . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-colonial period <section_title_end> </s> in the pre-columbian era , modern honduras wa split between two pan-cultural region : mesoamerica in the west and the isthmo-colombian area in the east . each complex had a `` core area `` within honduras ( the sula valley for mesoamerica , and la mosquitia ( honduras ) for the isthmo-colombian area ) , and the intervening area wa one of gradual transition . however , these concept had no meaning in the pre-columbian era itself and represent extremely diverse area . the lenca of the interior highland are also generally considered to be culturally mesoamerican , though the extent of linkage with other area varied over time ( for example , expanding during the zenith of the toltec empire ) . </s> in the extreme west , maya civilization flourished for hundred of year . the dominant , best known , and best studied state within honduras ' border wa in copn , which wa located in a mainly non-maya area , or on the frontier between maya and non-maya area . copn declined with other lowland centre during the conflagration of the classic maya collapse in the <number> century . the maya of this civilization survive in western honduras a the ch'orti ' people ch'orti ' , isolated from their choltian linguistic peer to the west . </s> however , copn represents only a fraction of honduran pre-columbian history . remnant of other civilization are found throughout the country . archaeologist have studied site such a and la sierra in the naco valley , los naranjos , honduras on lake yojoa , yarumela in the comayagua valley , la ceiba and salitron viejo ( both now under the el cajn dam ( honduras ) reservoir ) , selin farm and cuyamel in the aguan valley , cerro palenque , travesia , curruste , ticamaya , despoloncal , and playa de los muertos in the lower ula river valley , and many others . </s> in <year> , lidar scanning revealed that several previously unknown high density settlement existed in la mosquitia , corresponding to the legend of `` la ciudad blanca `` . excavation and study ha since improved knowledge of the region 's history . it is estimated that these settlement reached their zenith from <number> to <year> ad . </s> <section_title_start> spanish conquest ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> on his fourth and the final voyage to the new world in <year> , christopher columbus landed near the modern town of trujillo , honduras , near guaimoreto lagoon , becoming the first european to visit the bay island department on the coast of honduras . on <number> july <year> , columbus sent his brother bartholomew columbus to explore the island and bartholomew encountered a mayan trading vessel from yucatn , carrying well-dressed maya and a rich cargo . bartholomew 's men stole the cargo they wanted and kidnapped the ship 's elderly captain to serve a an interpreter in the first recorded encounter between the spanish and the maya . </s> in march <year> , gil gonzlez dvila became the first spaniard to enter honduras a a conquistador . followed by hernn corts , who had brought force down from mexico . much of the conquest took place in the following two decade , first by group loyal to cristbal de olid , and then by those loyal to francisco de montejo but most particularly by those following alvarado . in addition to spanish resource , the conqueror relied heavily on armed force from mexicotlaxcalans and aztec army of thousand who remained garrisoned in the region . </s> resistance to conquest wa led in particular by lempira ( lenca ruler ) . many region in the north of honduras never fell to the spanish , notably the mosquito coast . after the spanish conquest , honduras became part of spain 's vast empire in the new world within the captaincy general of guatemala . trujillo and gracias a dios department were the first city-capitals . the spanish ruled the region for approximately three century . </s> <section_title_start> spanish honduras ( <year> <number> ) <section_title_end> </s> honduras wa organized a a province of the captaincy general of guatemala and the capital wa fixed , first at trujillo on the atlantic coast , and later at comayagua , and finally at tegucigalpa in the central part of the country . </s> silver mining wa a key factor in the spanish conquest and settlement of honduras . initially the mine were worked by local people through the encomienda system , but a disease and resistance made this option le available , slave from other part of central america were brought in . when local slave trading stopped at the end of the sixteenth century , african slave , mostly from angola , were imported . after about <year> , very few slave or other outside worker arrived in honduras . </s> although the spanish conquered the southern or pacific portion of honduras fairly quickly , they were le successful on the northern , or atlantic side . they managed to found a few town along the coast , at puerto corts and trujillo in particular , but failed to conquer the eastern portion of the region and many pocket of independent indigenous people a well . the mosquito coast in the northeast wa particularly effective at resisting conquest . the miskito kingdom found support from northern european privateer , pirate and especially the british formerly english colony of jamaica , which placed much of the area under it protection after <year> . </s> <section_title_start> independence ( <year> ) <section_title_end> </s> honduras gained independence from spain in <year> and wa a part of the first mexican empire until <year> , when it became part of the united province of central america . it ha been an independent republic and ha held regular election since <year> . in the <year> and <year> honduras participated in several failed attempt at central american unity , such a the confederation of central america ( <year> <number> ) , the covenant of guatemala ( <year> ) , the diet of sonsonate ( <year> ) , the diet of nacaome ( <year> ) and national representation in central america ( <year> <number> ) . although honduras eventually adopted the name republic of honduras , the unionist ideal never waned , and honduras wa one of the central american country that pushed the hardest for a policy of regional unity . </s> policy favoring international trade and investment began in the <year> , and soon foreign interest became involved , first in shipping from the north coast , especially tropical fruit and most notably banana , and then in building railroad . in <year> , a projected railroad line from the caribbean coast to the capital , tegucigalpa , ran out of money when it reached san pedro sula . a a result , san pedro grew into the nation 's primary industrial center and second-largest city . comayagua wa the capital of honduras until <year> , when the capital moved to tegucigalpa . </s> since independence , nearly <number> small internal rebellion and civil war have occurred in the country , including some change of rgime . </s> <section_title_start> 20th century and the role of american companies <section_title_end> </s> in the late nineteenth century , honduras granted land and substantial exemption to several us-based fruit and infrastructure company in return for developing the country 's northern region . thousand of worker came to the north coast a a result to work in banana production in honduras and other business that grew up around the export industry . banana-exporting company , dominated until <year> by the cuyamel fruit company , a well a the united fruit company , and standard fruit company , built an enclave economy in northern honduras , controlling infrastructure and creating self-sufficient , tax-exempt sector that contributed relatively little to economic growth . american troop landed in honduras in <year> , <year> , <year> , <year> , <year> , <year> and <year> . </s> in <year> , the writer o. henry coined the term `` banana republic `` to describe honduras , publishing a book called cabbage and king ( literature ) , about a fictional country , anchuria , inspired by his experience in honduras , where he had lived for six month . in the admiral , o.henry refers to the nation a a `` small maritime banana republic `` ; naturally , the fruit wa the entire basis of it economy . according to a literary analyst writing for the economist , `` his phrase neatly conjures up the image of a tropical , agrarian country . but it real meaning is sharper : it refers to the fruit company from the united state that came to exert extraordinary influence over the politics of honduras and it neighbor . `` in addition to drawing central american worker north , the fruit company encouraged immigration of worker from the english-speaking caribbean , notably jamaica and belize , which introduced an african-descended , english-speaking and largely protestant population into the country , although many of these worker left following change to immigration law in <year> . </s> honduras joined the ally of world war ii after attack on pearl harbor , on <number> december <year> , and signed the declaration by united nation on <number> january <year> , along with twenty-five other government . </s> constitutional crisis in the <year> led to reform in the <year> . one reform gave worker permission to organize , and a <year> general strike of <year> ( honduras ) paralyzed the northern part of the country for more than two month , but led to reform . in <year> a <year> honduran coup d'tat unseated democratically elected president ramn villeda morale . in <year> , the northern part of what wa the mosquito coast wa transferred from nicaragua to honduras by the international court of justice . </s> <section_title_start> war and upheaval , <year> <number> <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , honduras and el salvador fought what became known a the football war . border tension led to acrimony between the two country after oswaldo lpez arellano , the president of honduras , blamed the deteriorating honduran economy on immigrant from el salvador . the relationship reached a low when el salvador met honduras for a three-round football elimination match preliminary to the fifa world cup . </s> tension escalated and on <number> july <year> , the salvadoran army invaded honduras . the organization of american state ( oas ) negotiated a cease-fire which took effect on <number> july and brought about a withdrawal of salvadoran troop in early august . contributing factor to the conflict were a boundary dispute and the presence of thousand of salvadoran living in honduras illegally . after the week-long war , a many a <number> salvadoran immigrant were expelled . </s> hurricane fifi caused severe damage when it skimmed the northern coast of honduras on <number> and <number> september <year> . juan alberto melgar castro ( <year> <number> ) and paz garcia ( <year> <number> ) largely built the current physical infrastructure and telecommunication system of honduras . </s> in <year> , the country returned to civilian rule . a constituent assembly wa popularly elected in april <year> to write a new constitution , and general election were held in november <year> . the constitution wa approved in <year> and the liberal party of honduras government of roberto suazo crdova won the election with a promise to carry out an ambitious program of economic and social development to tackle the recession in which honduras found itself . he launched ambitious social and economic development project sponsored by american development aid . honduras became host to the largest peace corp mission in the world , and nongovernmental and international voluntary agency proliferated . the peace corp withdrew it volunteer in <year> , citing safety concern . </s> during the early <year> , the united state established a continuing military presence in honduras to support el salvador , the contra ( guerrilla ) guerrilla fighting the nicaraguan government , and also develop an airstrip and modern port in honduras . though spared the bloody civil war wracking it neighbor , the honduran army quietly waged campaign against marxistleninist militia such a the people 's liberation movement-chinchoneros popular liberation movement , notorious for kidnapping and bombing , and against many non-militants a well . the operation included a cia-backed campaign of extrajudicial killing by government-backed unit , most notably battalion <number> ( honduras ) . </s> in <year> , hurricane mitch caused massive and widespread destruction . honduran president carlos roberto flores said that fifty year of progress in the country had been reversed . mitch destroyed about <number> of the country 's crop and an estimated <year> % of the transportation infrastructure , including nearly all bridge and secondary road . across honduras <number> house were destroyed , and an additional <number> damaged . some <number> people killed , and <number> more injured . total loss were estimated at u $ <number> billion . </s> <section_title_start> 21st century <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , president of honduras manuel zelaya and president of the united state george w. bush began talk on u assistance to honduras to tackle the latter 's growing drug cartel in mosquito , eastern honduras using u special force . this marked the beginning of a new foothold for the u military 's continued presence in central america . </s> under zelaya , honduras joined alba in <year> , but withdrew in <year> after the <year> honduran coup d'tat . in <year> , a <year> honduran political crisis resulted when power wa transferred in a coup from the president to the head of congress . the oas suspended honduras because it did not regard it government a legitimate . </s> country around the world , the organization of american state , and the united nation formally and unanimously condemned the action a a coup d'tat , refusing to recognize the de facto government , even though the lawyer consulted by the library of congress submitted to the united state congress an opinion that declared the coup legal . the honduran supreme court also ruled that the proceeding had been legal . the government that followed the de facto government established a truth and reconciliation commission , comisin de la verdad y reconciliacin , which after more than a year of research and debate concluded that the ousting had been a coup d'tat , and illegal in the commission 's opinion . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> the north coast of honduras border the caribbean sea and the pacific ocean lie south through the gulf of fonseca . honduras consists mainly of mountain , with narrow plain along the coast . a large undeveloped lowland jungle , la mosquitia ( honduras ) lie in the northeast , and the heavily populated lowland sula valley in the northwest . in la mosquitia lie the unesco world-heritage site ro pltano biosphere reserve , with the coco river which divide honduras from nicaragua . </s> the islas de la baha and the swan island , honduras are off the north coast . misteriosa bank and rosario bank , north of the swan island , fall within the exclusive economic zone ( eez ) of honduras . </s> natural resource include timber , gold , silver , copper , lead , zinc , iron ore , antimony , coal , fish , shrimp , and [ </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the climate varies from tropical in the lowland ] s to [ [ temperate in the mountain . the central and southern region are relatively hotter and le humid than the northern coast . </s> <section_title_start> ecology <section_title_end> </s> the region is considered a biodiversity hotspot because of the many plant and animal specie found there . like other country in the region , it contains vast biological resource . honduras host more than <number> specie of vascular plant , of which <number> ( described so far ) are orchid ; around <number> reptile and amphibian , more than <number> bird specie , and <number> mammalian specie , of which half are bat . </s> in the northeastern region of la mosquitia ( honduras ) lie the ro pltano biosphere reserve , a lowland rainforest which is home to a great diversity of life . the reserve wa added to the unesco world heritage site list in <year> . </s> honduras ha rain forest , cloud forest ( which can rise up to nearly above sea level ) , mangrove , savanna and mountain range with pine and oak tree , and the mesoamerican barrier reef system . in the bay island ( department ) there are bottlenose dolphin , manta ray , parrot fish , school of acanthurus coeruleus and whale shark . </s> <section_title_start> environmental issue <section_title_end> </s> deforestation resulting from logging is rampant in olancho department . the clearing of land for agriculture is prevalent in the largely undeveloped la mosquitia ( honduras ) region , causing land degradation and soil erosion . honduras had a <year> forest landscape integrity index mean score of <number>/10 , ranking it <number> globally out of <number> country . </s> lake yojoa , which is honduras ' largest source of fresh water , is polluted by [ metal ] produced from mining activity . some river and stream are also polluted by mining . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> honduras is governed within a framework of a presidential system representative democracy republic . the president of honduras is both [ of state ] and [ of government ] . executive power is exercised by the politics of honduras . legislative power is vested in the national congress of honduras . the judiciary is independent of both the executive branch and the legislature . </s> the national congress of honduras ( congreso nacional ) ha <number> member ( diputados ) , elected for a four-year term by proportional representation . congressional seat are assigned the party ' candidate on a department of honduras in proportion to the number of vote each party receives . </s> <section_title_start> political culture <section_title_end> </s> in <year> , a military coup removed the democratically elected president , ramn villeda morale . a string of authoritarian military junta held power uninterrupted until <year> , when roberto suazo crdova wa elected president . </s> the party system wa dominated by the conservative national party of honduras ( partido nacional de honduras : pnh ) and the liberal liberal party of honduras ( partido <number> had `` no confidence `` in the supreme court , and <number> thought there wa electoral fraud in the primary election of november <year> . also , <number> expected the presidential , , a very close election in <year> left uncertainty a to whether hernandez or his main challenger , television personality salvador nasralla , had prevailed . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> honduras and nicaragua had tense relation throughout <year> and early <year> due to a boundary dispute off the atlantic coast . nicaragua imposed a <number> tariff against honduran good due to the dispute . </s> in june <year> a coup d'tat ousted president manuel zelaya ; he wa taken in a military aircraft to costa rica . the general assembly of the united nation voted to denounce the coup and called for the restoration of zelaya . several latin american nation , including mexico , temporarily severed diplomatic relation with honduras . in july <year> , full diplomatic relation were once again re-established with mexico . the united state sent out mixed message after the coup ; obama called the ouster a coup and expressed support for zelaya 's return to power . u secretary of state hillary clinton , advised by john negroponte , the former reagan-era ambassador to honduras implicated in the irancontra affair , refrained from expressing support . she ha since explained that the u would have had to cut aid if it called zelaya 's ouster a military coup , although the u ha a record of ignoring these event when it chooses . zelaya had expressed an interest in hugo chvez ' alba ( alba ) , and had actually joined in <year> . after the <year> coup , honduras withdrew it membership . </s> this interest in regional agreement may have increased the alarm of establishment politician . when zelaya began calling for a `` fourth ballot box `` to determine whether honduran wished to convoke a special constitutional congress , this sounded a lot to some like the constitutional amendment that had extended the term of both hugo chvez and evo morale . `` chvez ha served a a role model for like-minded leader intent on cementing their power . these president are barely in office when they typically convene a constitutional convention to guarantee their reelection , `` said a <year> spiegel international analysis , which noted that one reason to join alba wa discounted venezuelan oil . in addition to chvez and morale , carlos menem of argentina , fernando henrique cardoso of brazil and columbian president lvaro uribe had all taken this step , and washington and the eu were both accusing the sandinista national liberation front government in nicaragua of tampering with election result . politician of all stripe expressed opposition to zelaya 's referendum proposal , and the attorney-general accused him of violating the constitution . the honduran supreme court agreed , saying that the constitution had put the supreme electoral tribunal ( honduras ) in charge of election and referendum , not the national statistic institute , which zelaya had proposed to have run the count . whether or not zelaya 's removal from power had constitutional element , the honduran constitution explicitly protects all honduran from forced expulsion from honduras . </s> the united state maintains a small military presence at one honduran base . the two country conduct joint peacekeeping , counter-narcotics , humanitarian , disaster relief , humanitarian , medical and civic action exercise . u.s. troop conduct and provide logistics support for a variety of bilateral and multilateral exercise . the united state is honduras ' chief trading partner . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> honduras ha a military with
