a a low middle-income nation . the nation 's per caput income sits at around <number> u dollar making it one of the lowest in north america . </s> in <year> , <number> of the population were living below the poverty threshold . by <year> more than <number> were living below the poverty line . </s> economic growth in the last few year ha averaged <number> a year , one of the highest rate in latin america ( <year> ) . despite this , honduras ha seen the least development amongst all central american country . honduras is ranked <number> of <number> country with a human development index of .625 that classifies the nation a having medium development ( <year> ) . the three factor that go into honduras ' hdi ( an extended and healthy life , accessibility of knowledge and standard of living ) have all improved since <year> but still remain relatively low with life expectancy at birth being <number> , expected year of schooling being <number> ( mean of <number> year ) and gnp per caput being $ <number> ( <year> ) . the hdi for latin america and the caribbean overall is <number> with life expectancy at birth being <number> , expected year of schooling being <number> ( mean of <number> ) and gni per caput being $ <number> ( <year> ) . </s> the <year> honduran coup d'tat led to a variety of economic trend in the nation . overall growth ha slowed , averaging <number> percent from <year> to <year> but slowing to <number> percent annually between <year> and <year> . following the coup trend of decreasing poverty and extreme poverty were reversed . the nation saw a poverty increase of <number> percent and in extreme poverty of <number> percent in just <number> year . furthermore , unemployment grew between <year> and <year> from <number> percent to <number> percent . </s> because much of the honduran economy is based on small scale agriculture of only a few export , natural disaster have a particularly devastating impact . natural disaster , such a hurricane mitch , have contributed to this inequality a they particularly affect poor rural area . additionally , they are a large contributor to food insecurity in the country a farmer are left unable to provide for their family . a study done by honduras ngo , world neighbor , determined the term `` increased workload , decreased basic grain , expensive food , and fear `` were most associated with hurricane mitch . </s> the rural and urban poor were hit hardest by hurricane mitch . those in southern and western region specifically were considered most vulnerable a they both were subject to environmental destruction and home to many subsistence farmer . due to disaster such a hurricane mitch , the agricultural economic sector ha declined a third in the past twenty year . this is mostly due to a decline in export , such a banana and coffee , that were affected by factor such a natural disaster . indigenous community along the patuca river were hit extremely hard a well . the mid-pataca region wa almost completely destroyed . over <number> of rice harvest and all of banana , plantain , and manioc harvest were lost . relief and reconstruction effort following the storm were partial and incomplete , reinforcing existing level of poverty rather than reversing those level , especially for indigenous community . the period between the end of food donation and the following harvest led to extreme hunger , causing death amongst the tawahka population . those that were considered the most `` land-rich `` lost <number> of their total land on average . those that were the most `` land-poor `` , lost le total land but a greater share of their overall total . this meant that those hit hardest were single woman a they constitute the majority of this population . </s> <section_title_start> poverty reduction strategy <section_title_end> </s> since the <year> when honduras wa designated a `` food priority country `` by the un , organization such a the world food program ( wfp ) have worked to decrease malnutrition and food insecurity . a large majority of honduran farmer live in extreme poverty , or below <number> u dollar per caput . currently one fourth of child are affected by chronic malnutrition . wfp is currently working with the honduran government on a school feeding program which provides meal for <number> honduran school , reaching <number> million school child . wfp also participates in disaster relief through reparation and emergency response in order to aid in quick recovery that tackle the effect of natural disaster on agricultural production . </s> honduras ' poverty reduction strategy in honduras wa implemented in <year> and aimed to cut extreme poverty in half by <year> . while spending on poverty-reduction aid increased there wa only a <number> increase in gdp between <year> and <year> . this improvement left honduras still below that of country that lacked aid through poverty reduction strategy behind those without it . the world bank belief that this inefficiency stem from a lack of focus on infrastructure and rural development . extreme poverty saw a low of <number> percent only two year after the implementation of the strategy but then increased to <number> percent by <year> . </s> poverty reduction strategy were also intended to affect social policy through increased investment in education and health sector . this wa expected to lift poor community out of poverty while also increasing the workforce a a mean of stimulating the honduran economy . conditional cash transfer were used to do this by the family assistance program . this program wa restructured in <year> in an attempt to increase effectiveness of cash transfer for health and education specifically for those in extreme poverty . overall spending within poverty reduction strategy have been focused on education and health sector increasing social spending from <number> of honduras ' gdp in <year> to <number> in <year> . </s> critic of aid from international finance institution believe that the world bank 's poverty reduction strategy result in little substantive change to honduran policy . poverty reduction strategy also excluded clear priority , specific intervention strategy , strong commitment to the strategy and more effective macro-level economic reform according to jose cuesta of cambridge university . due to this he belief that the strategy did not provide a pathway for economic development that could lift honduras out of poverty resulting in neither lasting economic growth of poverty reduction . </s> prior to it <year> <year> honduran coup d'tat honduras widely expanded social spending and an extreme increase in minimum wage . effort to decrease inequality were swiftly reversed following the coup . when zelaya wa removed from office social spending a a percent of gdp decreased from <number> percent in <year> to <number> recent in <year> . this decrease in social spending exacerbated the effect of the recession , which the nation wa previously relatively well equipped to deal with . </s> the world bank group group executive board approved a plan known a the new country partnership framework ( cpf ) . this plan 's objective are to expand social program coverage , strengthen infrastructure , increase financing accessibility , strengthen regulatory framework and institutional capacity , improve the productivity of rural area , strengthen natural disaster and climate change resiliency , and the buildup local government so that violence and crime rate will decrease . the overall aim of the initiative is to decrease inequality and vulnerability of certain population while increasing economic growth . additionally the signing of the u.s.central america free trade agreement ( cafta ) wa meant to diversify the economy in order to promote growth and expand the range of export the country is reliant on . </s> <section_title_start> economic inequality <section_title_end> </s> level of income inequality in honduras are higher than in any other latin american country . unlike other latin american country , inequality steadily increased in honduras between <year> and <year> . between <year> and <year> inequality saw a decrease but increased again in <year> . </s> when honduras ' human development index is adjusted for inequality ( known a the ihdi ) honduras ' development index is reduced to .443 . the level of inequality in each aspect of development can also be assessed . in <year> inequality of life expectancy at birth wa <number> , inequality in education wa <number> and inequality in income wa <number> the overall loss in human development due to inequality wa <number> </s> the ihdi for latin america and the caribbean overall is <number> with an overall loss of <number> . in <year> for the entire region , inequality of life expectancy at birth wa <number> , inequality in education wa <number> and inequality in income wa <number> . while honduras ha a higher life expectancy than other country in the region ( before and after inequality adjustment ) , it quality of education and economic standard of living are lower . income inequality and education inequality have a large impact on the overall development of the nation . </s> inequality also exists between rural and urban area a it relates to the distribution of resource . poverty is concentrated in southern , eastern , and western region where rural and indigenous people live . north and central honduras are home to the country 's industry and infrastructure , resulting in low level of poverty . poverty is concentrated in rural honduras , a pattern that is reflected throughout latin america . the effect of poverty on rural community are vast . poor community typically live in adobe home , lack material resource , have limited access to medical resource , and live off of basic such a rice , maize and bean . </s> the lower class predominantly consists of rural subsistence farmer and landless peasant . since <year> there ha been an increase in the number of landless peasant in honduras which ha led to a growing class of urban poor individual . these individual often migrate to urban center in search of work in the service sector , manufacturing , or construction . demographer believe that without social and economic reform , rural to urban migration will increase , resulting in the expansion of urban center . within the lower class , underemployment is a major issue . individual that are underemployed often only work a part-time laborer on seasonal farm meaning their annual income remains low . in the <year> peasant organization and labor union such a the national federation of honduran peasant , the national association of honduran peasant and the national union of peasant formed . </s> it is not uncommon for rural individual to voluntarily enlist in the military , however this often doe not offer stable or promising career opportunity . the majority of high-ranking official in the honduran army are recruited from elite military academy . additionally , the majority of enlistment in the military is forced . forced recruitment largely relies on an alliance between the honduran government , military and upper class honduran society . in urban area male are often sought out from secondary school while in rural area roadblock aided the military in handpicking recruit . higher socio-economic status enables individual to more easily evade the draft . </s> middle class honduras is a small group defines by relatively low membership and income level . movement from lower to middle class is typically facilitated by higher education . professional , student , farmer , merchant , business employee , and civil servant are all considered a part of the honduran middle class . opportunity for employment and the industrial and commercial sector are slow growing , limiting middle class membership . </s> the honduran upper class ha much higher income level than the rest of the honduran population reflecting large amount of income inequality . much of the upper class affords their success to the growth of cotton and livestock export post-world war ii . the wealthy are not politically unified and differ in political and economic view . </s> <section_title_start> trade <section_title_end> </s> the currency is the honduran lempira . </s> the government operates both the electrical grid , empresa nacional de energa elctrica ( enee ) and the land-line telephone service , hondutel . enee receives heavy subsidy to counter it chronic financial problem , but hondutel is no longer a monopoly . the telecommunication sector wa opened to private investment on <number> december <year> , a required under cafta . the price of petroleum is regulated , and the national congress of honduras often ratifies temporary price regulation for basic commodity . </s> gold , silver , lead and zinc are mined . </s> in <year> honduras signed cafta , a free trade agreement with the united state . in december <year> , puerto corts , the primary seaport of honduras , wa included in the u.s. container security initiative . </s> in <year> the u.s. department of homeland security and the united state department of energy announced the first phase of the secure freight initiative ( sfi ) , which built upon existing port security measure . sfi gave the u.s. government enhanced authority , allowing it to scan container from overseas for nuclear and radiological material in order to improve the risk assessment of individual us-bound container . the initial phase of secure freight involved deploying of nuclear detection and other device to six foreign port : </s> * port qasim in pakistan ; </s> * puerto corts in honduras ; </s> * southampton in the united kingdom ; </s> * port of salalah in oman ; </s> * port of singapore ; </s> * gamman terminal at port of busan , korea . </s> container in these port have been scanned since <year> for radiation and other risk factor before they are allowed to depart for the united state . </s> for economic development a <year> memorandum of understanding with a group of international investor obtained honduran government approval to build a zone ( city ) with it own law , tax system , judiciary and police , but opponent brought a suit against it in the supreme court , calling it a `` state within a state `` . in <year> , honduras ' congress ratified decree <number> , which led to the establishment of zone for employment and economic development ( honduras ) . the government began construction of the first zone in june <year> . </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> about half of the electricity sector in honduras is privately owned . the remaining electricity generation capacity is run by enee ( empresa nacional de energa elctrica ) . </s> key challenge in the sector are : </s> * financing investment in generation and transmission without either a financially healthy utility or concessionary fund from external donor </s> * re-balancing tariff , cutting arrears and reducing loss , including electricity theft , without social unrest </s> * reconciling environmental concern with government objective two large new dam and associated hydropower plant . </s> * improving access to electricity in rural area . </s> <section_title_start> transportation <section_title_end> </s> infrastructure for transportation in honduras consists of : rail transport in honduras ; of roadway ; six port ; and <number> airport altogether ( <number> paved , <number> unpaved ) . the ministry of public work , transport and housing ( soprtravi in spanish acronym ) is responsible for transport sector policy . </s> <section_title_start> water supply and sanitation <section_title_end> </s> water supply and sanitation in honduras differ greatly from urban center to rural village . larger population center generally have modernized water treatment and distribution system , but water quality is often poor because of lack of proper maintenance and treatment . rural area generally have basic drinking water system with limited capacity for water treatment . many urban area have sewer system in place to collect wastewater , but proper treatment of wastewater is rare . in rural area sanitary facility are generally limited to latrine and basic septic pit . </s> water and sanitation service were historically provided by the ( sanaa ) . in <year> , the government enacted a new `` water law `` which called for the decentralization of water service . under the <year> law , local community have both the right and the responsibility to own , operate , and control their own drinking water and wastewater system . since this law passed , many community have joined together to address water and sanitation issue on a regional basis . </s> many national and international non-government organization have a history of working on water and sanitation project in honduras . international group include the international red cross and red crescent movement , water <number> international , rotary international , catholic relief service , water for people , ecologic development fund , care ( relief ) , the canadian executive service organization ( ceso-saco ) , engineer without border usa , flood the nation , student helping honduras ( shh ) , global brigade , and agua para el pueblo in partnership with aguaclara at cornell university . </s> in addition , many government organization work on project in honduras , including the european union , the united state agency for international development , the united state army corp of engineer , cooperacion andalucia , the government of japan , and others . </s> <section_title_start> crime <section_title_end> </s> in recent year honduras ha experienced very high level of violence and criminality . homicide violence reached a peak in <year> with an average of <number> homicide a day . city such a san pedro sula and the tegucigalpa have registered homicide rate among the highest in the world . the violence is associated with illegal drug trade a honduras is often a transit point , and with a number of urban gang , mainly the ms-13 and the <number> street gang . but a recently a <year> , organization such a insight crime 's show figure of <number> per <number> inhabitant ; a <number> drop from <year> figure . </s> violence in honduras increased after plan colombia wa implemented and after president of mexico felipe caldern declared the war against drug trafficking in mexico . along with neighboring el salvador and guatemala , honduras form part of the northern triangle of central america , which ha been characterized a one of the most violent region in the world . a a result of crime and increasing murder rate , the flow of migrant from honduras to the u.s. also went up . the rise in violence in the region ha received international attention . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> { class= `` wikitable `` style= `` float : right ; margin-left : <number>px `` </s> + population in honduras </s> - </s> ! scope= `` col `` style= `` background : # cfb ; `` year </s> ! scope= `` col `` style= `` background : # cfb ; `` million </s> - </s> <year> style= `` text-align : right ; `` <number> </s> - </s> <year> style= `` text-align : right ; `` <number> </s> - </s> style= `` text-align : right ; `` </s> } </s> honduras had a population of in . the proportion of the population below the age of <number> in <year> wa <number> , <number> were between <number> and <number> year old , and <number> were <number> year old or older . </s> since <year> , emigration from honduras ha accelerated a economic migrant and political refugee sought a better life elsewhere . a majority of honduran diaspora live in the united state . a <year> u state department estimate suggested that between <number> and one million honduran lived in the united state at that time , nearly <number> of the honduran population . the large uncertainty about number is because numerous honduran live in the united state without a visa . in the <year> census in the united state , <number> resident identified a honduran , up from <number> in <year> . </s> <section_title_start> race and ethnicity <section_title_end> </s> the ethnic breakdown of honduran society wa <number> mestizo , <number> american indian , <number> black and <number> white ( <year> ) . the <year> honduran census provides no racial data but in <year> five classification were created : white , indian , negro , yellow , and mestizo . this system wa used in the <year> and <year> census . mestizo wa used to describe individual that did not fit neatly into the category of white , indian , negro or yellow or who are of mixed white-indian descent . </s> john gillin considers honduras to be one of thirteen `` mestizo country `` ( mexico , guatemala , el salvador , nicaragua , panama , colombia , venezuela , cuba , ecuador , peru , bolivia , paraguay ) . he claim that in much a spanish america little attention is paid to race and race mixture resulting in social status having little reliance on one 's physical feature . however , in `` mestizo country `` such a honduras , this is not the case . social stratification from spain wa able to develop in these country through colonization . </s> during colonization the majority of honduras ' indigenous population died of disease like smallpox and measles resulting in a more homogenous indigenous population compared to other colony . nine indigenous and african american group are recognized by the government in honduras . the majority of amerindian in honduras are lenca people , followed by the miskito , cho'rti ' , tolupan , pech and sumo . around <number> lenca individual live in the west and western interior of honduras while the other small native group are located throughout the country . </s> the majority of black in honduran are culturally ladino people , meaning they are culturally hispanic . non-ladino group in honduras include the black carib , miskito people , arab immigrant and the black population of the islas de la baha the black carib population descended from freed slave from saint vincent . the miskito population ( about <number> individual ) are the descendant of african and british immigrant and are extremely racially diverse . while the black carib and miskito population have similar origin , black carib are considered black while miskitos are considered indigenous . this is largely a reflection of cultural difference , a black carib have retained much of their original african culture . the majority of arab honduran are of palestinian and lebanese descent . they are known a `` turcos `` in honduras because of migration during the rule of the ottoman empire . they have maintained cultural distinctiveness and prospered economically . </s> <section_title_start> gender <section_title_end> </s> the male to female ratio of the honduran population is <number> . this ratio stand at <number> at birth , <number> from <number> to <number> year old , <number> from <number> to <number> year old , .88 from <number> to <number> year old , and .77 for those <number> year or older . </s> gender development index ( gdi ) wa .942 in <year> with an hdi of .600 for female and .637 for male . life expectancy at birth for male is <number> and <number> for female . expected year of schooling in honduras is <number> year for male ( mean of <number> ) and <number> for female ( mean of <number> ) . these measure do not reveal a large disparity between male and female development level , however , gni per caput is vastly different by gender . male have a gni per caput of $ <number> while that of female is only $ <number> . honduras ' overall gdi is higher than that of other medium hdi nation ( .871 ) but lower than the overall hdi for latin america and the caribbean ( .981 ) . </s> the united nation development program ( undp ) rank honduras <number> for measure including woman 's political power , and female access to resource . gender inequality index ( gii ) depicts gender-based inequality in honduras according to reproductive health , empowerment , and economic activity . honduras ha a gii of .461 and ranked <number> of <number> country in <year> . <number> of honduras ' parliament is female and <number> of adult female have a secondary education or higher while only <number> of adult male do . despite this , while male participation in the labor market is <number> , female participation is <number> . honduras ' maternal mortality ratio is <number> and the adolescent birth rate is <number> for woman age <year> . </s> familialism and machismo carry a lot of weight within honduran society . familialism refers to the idea of individual interest being second to that of the family , most often in relation to dating and marriage , abstinence , and parental approval and supervision of dating . aggression and proof of masculinity through physical dominance are characteristic of machismo . </s> honduras ha historically functioned with a patriarchal system like many other latin american country . honduran men claim responsibility for family decision including reproductive health decision . recently honduras ha seen an increase in challenge to this notion a feminist movement and access to global medium increase . there ha been an increase in educational attainment , labor force participating , urban migration , late-age marriage , and contraceptive use amongst honduran woman . </s> between <year> and <year> honduran total fertility rate decreased from <number> birth to <number> birth . this is largely attributable to an increase in educational attainment and workforce participation by woman , a well a more widespread use of contraceptive . in <year> <number> of woman were using at least one type of contraceptive . by <year> <number> were largely due to female sterilization , birth control in the form of a pill , injectable birth control , and iud . a study done in <year> of honduran men and woman reflect conceptualization of reproductive health and decision making in honduras . <number> of men and <number> of woman surveyed believed men were responsible for decision regarding family size and family planning us . <number> of men believed men were responsible for both . </s> sexual violence against woman ha proven to be a large issue in honduras that ha caused many to migrate to the u.s . the prevalence of child sexual abuse wa <number> in honduras with the majority of report being from child under the age of <number> . woman that experienced sexual abuse a child were found to be twice a likely to be in violent relationship . femicide is widespread in honduras . in <year> , <number> of unaccompanied refugee minor were female . gang are largely responsible for sexual violence against woman a they often use sexual violence . between <year> and <year> according to the un special repporteur on violence against woman , violent death increased <number> percent . impunity for sexual violence and femicide crime wa <number> percent in <year> . additionally , many girl are forced into human trafficking and prostitution . </s> between <year> and <year> honduras recognized domestic violence a both a public health issue and a punishable offense due to effort by the pan american health organization ( paho ) . paho 's subcommittee on woman , health and development wa used a a guide to develop program that aid in domestic violence prevention and victim assistance program however , a study done in <year> showed that while the policy requires health care provider to report case of sexual violence , emergency contraception , and victim referral to legal institution and support group , very few other regulation exist within the realm of registry , examination and follow-up . unlike other central american country such a el salvador , guatemala and nicaragua , honduras doe not have detailed guideline requiring service provider to be extensively trained and respect the right of sexual violence victim . since the study wa done the unfpa and the health secretariat of honduras have worked to develop and implement improved guideline for handling case of sexual violence . </s> an educational program in honduras known a sistema de aprendizaje tutorial ( sat ) ha attempted to `` undo gender `` through focusing on gender equality in everyday interaction . honduras ' sat program is one of the largest in the world , second only to colombia 's with <number> student . it is currently sponsored by asociacion bayan , a honduran ngo , and the honduran ministry of education . it function by integrating gender into curriculum topic , linking gender to the idea of justice and equality , encouraging reflection , dialogue and debate and emphasizing the need for individual and social change . this program wa found to increase gender consciousness and a desire for gender equality amongst honduran woman through encouraging discourse surrounding existing gender inequality in the honduran community . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> spanish language is the official , national language , spoken by virtually all honduran . in addition to spanish , a number of indigenous language are spoken in some small community . other language spoken by some include honduran sign language and bay island creole english . </s> the main indigenous language are : </s> * garifuna language ( arawakan language ) ( almost <number> speaker in honduras including monolingual ) </s> * mskito language ( misumalpan language ) ( <number> speaker in honduras ) </s> * sumu language ( misumalpan language ) ( le than <year> speaker in honduras , more in nicaragua ) </s> * pech language pech/paya , ( chibchan language ) ( le than <year> speaker ) </s> * jicaque language ( jicaquean language ) ( le than <number> speaker ) </s> * ch'orti ' language ch'orti ' ( mayan language ) ( le than <number> speaker ) </s> the lenca language isolate lost all it fluent native speaker in the <number> century but is currently undergoing revival effort among the member of the ethnic population of about <number> . the largest immigrant language are arabic ( <number> ) , armenian ( <number> ) , turkish ( <number> ) , yue chinese ( <number> ) . </s> <section_title_start> largest city <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> although most honduran are nominally roman catholic ( which would be considered the main religion ) , membership in the roman catholic church is declining while membership in protestant church is increasing . the international religious freedom report , <year> , note that a cid gallup poll reported that <number> of the population identified themselves a catholic , <number> a evangelical protestant , <number> claiming to be from other religion , including muslim , buddhist , jew , rastafarian , etc . and <number> do not belong to any religion or unresponsive . <number> reported a being either atheistic or agnostic . customary catholic church tally and membership estimate <number> catholic where the priest ( in more than <number> parish ) is required to fill out a pastoral account of the parish each year . </s> the cia factbook list honduras a <number> catholic and <number> protestant . commenting on statistical variation everywhere , john green of pew forum on religion and public life note that : `` it is n't that ... number are more right than [ someone else 's ] number ... but how one conceptualizes the group . `` often people attend one church without giving up their `` home `` church . many who attend evangelical megachurches in the u , for example , attend more than one church . this shifting and fluidity is common in brazil where two-fifths of those who were raised evangelical are no longer evangelical and catholic seem to shift in and out of various church , often while still remaining catholic . </s> most pollster suggest an annual poll taken over a number of year would provide the best method of knowing religious demographic and variation in any single country . still , in honduras are thriving anglican , presbyterian , methodist , seventh-day adventist church seventh-day adventist , lutheran , the church of jesus christ of latter-day saint latter-day saint ( mormonism ) and pentecostal church . there are protestant seminary . the catholic church , still the only `` church `` that is recognized , is also thriving in the number of school , hospital , and pastoral institution ( including it own medical school ) that it operates . it archbishop , scar rodrguez maradiaga , is also very popular , both with the government , other church , and in his own church . practitioner of the buddhism , jewish , islamic , bah faith , rastafari movement and indigenous denomination and religion exist . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> see health in honduras </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> about <number> of the population are literacy and the net primary enrollment rate wa <number> in <year> . in <year> , the primary school completion rate wa <number> . honduras ha bilingual ( spanish and english ) and even trilingual ( spanish with english , arabic , or german ) list of school in honduras and list of university in honduras . </s> the higher education is governed by the national autonomous university of honduras which ha center in the most important city of honduras . </s> <section_title_start> crime <section_title_end> </s> crime in honduras is rampant and criminal operate with a high degree of impunity . honduras ha one of the highest murder rate in the world . official statistic from the honduran observatory on national violence show honduras ' homicide rate wa <number> per <number> in <year> with the majority of homicide case unprosecuted . </s> highway assault and carjacking at roadblock or checkpoint set up by criminal with police uniform and equipment occur frequently . although report of kidnapping of foreigner are not common , family of kidnapping victim often pay ransom without reporting the crime to police out of fear of retribution , so kidnapping figure may be underreported . </s> owing to measure taken by government and business in <year> to improve tourist safety , roatan and the bay island have lower crime rate than the honduran mainland . </s> in the le populated region of gracias a dios , narcotics-trafficking is rampant and police presence is scarce . threat against u.s. citizen by drug trafficker and other criminal organization have resulted in the u.s. embassy placing restriction on the travel of u.s. official through the region . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> art <section_title_end> </s> the most renowned honduran painter is jos antonio velsquez . other important painter include carlos garay , and roque zelaya . some of honduras ' most notable writer are lucila gamero de medina , froyln turcios , ramn amaya amador and juan pablo suazo euceda , marco antonio rosa , roberto sosa ( poet ) , eduardo bhr , amanda castro , javier abril espinoza , tefilo trejo , and roberto quesada . </s> the jos francisco saybe theater in san pedro sula is home to the crculo teatral sampedrano ( theatrical circle of san pedro sula ) </s> honduras ha experienced a boom from it film industry for the past two decade . since the premiere of the movie `` anita la cazadora de insectos `` in <year> , the level of honduran production ha increased , many collaborating with country such a mexico , colombia , and the u.s . the most well known honduran film are `` el xendra `` , `` amor y frijol `` , and `` cafe con aroma a mi tierra `` . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> honduran cuisine is a fusion of indigenous lenca cuisine , cuisine of spain , caribbean cuisine and african cuisine . there are also dish from the garifuna people . coconut and coconut milk are featured in both sweet and savory dish . regional specialty include fried fish ( food ) , tamale , carne asada and baleadas . </s> other popular dish include : meat roasted with chismol and carne asada , chicken with rice and corn , and fried fish with pickled onion and jalapeos . some of the way seafood and some meat are prepared in coastal area and in the bay island department involve coconut milk . </s> the soup honduran enjoy include bean soup , mondongo soup ( tripe soup ) , seafood soup and beef soup . generally these soup are served mixed with plantain ( cooking ) , cassava , and cabbage , and served with maize tortilla . </s> other typical dish are the montucas or corn tamale , stuffed tortilla , and tamale wrapped in plantain ( cooking ) leaf . honduran typical dish also include an abundant selection of tropical fruit such a papaya , pineapple , plum , sapote , passion fruit and banana which are prepared in many way while they are still green . </s> <section_title_start> medium <section_title_end> </s> at least half of honduran household have at least one television . public television ha a far smaller role than in most other country . honduras ' main newspaper are la prensa ( honduras ) , el heraldo ( tegucigalpa ) , la tribuna ( honduras ) and diario tiempo . the official newspaper is . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> punta is the main music of honduras , with other sound such a caribbean salsa , merengue music , reggae , and reggaeton all widely heard , especially in the north , and mexican rancheras heard in the rural interior of the country . the most well known musician are guillermo anderson and polache . </s> <section_title_start> celebrations <section_title_end> </s> some of honduras ' national holiday include honduras independence day on <number> september and child 's day or da del nio , which is celebrated in home , school and church on <number> september ; on this day , child receive present and have party similar to christmas or birthday celebration . some neighborhood have piatas on the street . other holiday are easter , maundy thursday , good friday , day of the soldier ( <number> october to celebrate the birth of francisco morazn ) , christmas , el dia de lempira ( lenca ruler ) on <number> july , and new year 's eve . </s> honduras independence day festivity start early in the morning with marching band . each band wear different color and feature cheerleader . fiesta catracha take place this same day : typical honduran food such a bean , tamale , baleadas , cassava with chicharrn , and tortilla are offered . </s> on christmas eve people reunite with their family and close friend to have dinner , then give out present at midnight . in some city firework are seen and heard at midnight . on new year 's eve there is food and `` cohetes `` , firework and festivity . birthday are also great event , and include piatas filled with candy and surprise for the child . </s> la ceiba carnival is celebrated in la ceiba , a city located in the north coast , in the second half of may to celebrate the day of the city 's patron saint isidore the laborer . people from all over the world come for one week of festivity . every night there is a little carnaval ( carnavalito ) in a neighborhood . on saturday there is a big parade with float and display with people from many country . this celebration is also accompanied by the milk fair , where many honduran come to show off their farm product and animal . </s> <section_title_start> national symbols <section_title_end> </s> the flag of honduras is composed of three equal horizontal stripe . the blue upper and lower stripe represent the pacific ocean and the caribbean sea . the central stripe is white . it contains five blue star representing the five state of the federal republic of central america . the middle star represents honduras , located in the center of the central american union . </s> the coat of arm wa established in <year> . it is an equilateral triangle , at the base is a volcano between three castle , over which is a rainbow and the sun shining . the triangle is placed on an area that symbolizes being bathed by both sea . around all of this an oval containing in golden lettering : `` republic of honduras , free , sovereign and independent `` . </s> the `` national anthem of honduras `` is a result of a contest carried out in <year> during the presidency of manuel bonilla . in the end , it wa the poet augusto coello that ended up writing the anthem , with german-born honduran composer carlos hartling writing the music . the anthem wa officially adopted on <number> november <year> , during the presidency of . the anthem is composed of a choir and seven stroonduran . </s> the national flower is the famous orchid , rhyncholaelia digbyana ( formerly known a brassavola digbyana ) , which replaced the rose in <year> . the change of the national flower wa carried out during the administration of general oswaldo lpez arellano , thinking that brassavola digbyana `` is an indigenous plant of honduras ; having this flower exceptional characteristic of beauty , vigor and distinction `` , a the decree dictate it . </s> the national tree of honduras wa declared in <year> to be simply `` the pine that appears symbolically in our coat of arm `` ( el pino que figura simblicamente en nuestro escudo ) , even though pine comprise a genus and not a specie , and even though legally there 's no specification a for what kind of pine should appear in the coat of arm either . because of it commonality in the country , the pinus oocarpa specie ha become since then the specie most strongly associated a the national tree , but legally it is not so . another specie associated a the national tree is the pinus caribaea . </s> the national mammal is the white-tailed deer ( odocoileus virginianus ) , which wa adopted a a measure to avoid excessive depredation . it is one of two specie of deer that live in honduras . </s> the national bird of honduras is the scarlet macaw ( ara macao ) . this bird wa much valued by the pre-columbian civilization of honduras . </s> <section_title_start> folklore <section_title_end> </s> legend and fairy tale are paramount in honduran culture . lluvia de peces ( rain of fish ) is an example of this . the legend of el cadejo and la llorona are also popular . </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> the major sport in honduras are football , basketball , rugby , volleyball and cycling , with smaller following for athletics , softball and handball . information about some of the sport organisation in honduras are listed below : </s> * football in honduras </s> * federacin nacional autnoma de ftbol de honduras </s> * honduras national baseball team </s> * honduras national football team </s> * honduras national under-20 football team </s> * honduras u-17 national football team </s> * </s> category : northern triangle of central america <article_end> <article_start> </s> antigua and barbuda ( ; ) is a sovereign state island country in the west indie in the america , lying between the caribbean sea and the atlantic ocean . it consists of two major island , antigua and barbuda separated by , and smaller island ( including great bird island , antigua , green island ( antigua and barbuda ) , guiana island , long island ( antigua and barbuda ) , maiden island ( antigua and barbuda ) , prickly pear island , york island ( antigua and barbuda ) , redonda ) . the permanent population number is about <number> ( <year> est . ) , with <number> being resident on antigua . the capital and largest port and city is st. john 's , antigua and barbuda st. john 's on antigua , with codrington , antigua and barbuda being the largest town on barbuda . lying near each other , antigua and barbuda are in the middle of the leeward island , part of the lesser antilles , roughly at <number> parallel north <number>n of the equator . </s> the antigua wa explored by christopher columbus in <year> and named for the santa mara la antigua . antigua wa colonized by britain in <year> ; barbuda island wa first colonised in <year> . having been part of the british leeward island from <year> , antigua and barbuda joined the west indie federation in <year> . with the breakup of the federation , it became one of the west indie associated state in <year> . following self-governance in it internal affair , independence wa granted from the united kingdom on <number> november <year> . antigua and barbuda is a member of the commonwealth of nation and elizabeth ii is the country 's queen and [ of state ] . </s> the economy of antigua and barbuda is particularly dependent on tourism , which account for <number> of gdp . effect of climate change on island nation , antigua and barbuda are particularly vulnerable to the effect of climate change , such a sea level rise , and extreme weather like hurricane , which have direct impact on the island through coastal erosion , water scarcity , and other challenge . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> antigua is spanish for `` ancient `` and barbuda is spanish for `` bearded `` . the island of antigua wa originally called wadadli by arawak and is locally known by that name today ; island carib possibly called barbuda wa'omoni . christopher columbus , while sailing by in <year> may have named it santa maria la antigua , after an icon in the spanish seville cathedral . the `` bearded `` of barbuda is thought to refer either to the male inhabitant of the island , or the bearded fig tree present there . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-colonial period <section_title_end> </s> antigua wa first settled by archaic age hunter-gatherer amerindian called the ciboney . radiocarbon dating ha established the earliest settlement started around <year> bc . they were succeeded by the ceramic age pre-columbian arawakan languages-speaking saladoid people who migrated from the lower orinoco river . they introduced agriculture , raising , among other crop , the famous antigua black pineapple ( ananas comosus ) , maize , sweet potato , chili pepper , guava , tobacco , and cotton . later on the more bellicose island carib also settled the island , possibly by force . </s> <section_title_start> european arrival and settlement <section_title_end> </s> christopher columbus wa the first european to sight the island in <year> . the spanish did not colonise antigua until after a combination of european and african disease , malnutrition , and slavery eventually extirpated most of the native population ; smallpox wa probably the greatest killer . </s> the english settled on antigua in <year> ; christopher codrington settled on barbuda in <year> . tobacco and then sugar wa grown , worked by a large population of slave from west africa who soon came to vastly outnumber the european settler . </s> <section_title_start> colonial era <section_title_end> </s> the english maintained control of the island , repulsing an attempted french attack in <year> . the brutal condition endured by the slave led to revolt in <year> and <year> and a planned revolt in <year> , the latter led by prince klaas , though it wa discovered before it began and the ringleader were executed . slavery wa abolished in the british empire in <year> , affecting the economy . this wa exacerbated by natural disaster such a the <year> earthquake and the <year> hurricane . mining occurred on the isle of redonda , however this ceased in <year> and the island ha since remained uninhabited . </s> part of the leeward island colony , antigua and barbuda became part of the short-lived west indie federation from <year> to <year> . antigua and barbuda subsequently became an associated state of the united kingdom with full internal autonomy on <number> february <year> . the <year> were dominated by discussion a to the island ' future and the rivalry between vere bird of the antigua labour party ( alp ) ( premier from <year> to <year> and <year> to <year> ) and the progressive labour movement ( plm ) of george walter ( premier <year> <number> ) . eventually antigua and barbuda gained full independence on <number> november <year> ; vere bird became prime minister of the new country . the country opted to remain within the commonwealth of nation , retaining queen elizabeth a monarchy of antigua and barbuda , with the last list of colonial governor and administrator of antigua # governor of antigua and barbuda ( <year> <number> ) , wilfred jacob , a governor-general of antigua and barbuda governor-general . </s> <section_title_start> independence era <section_title_end> </s> the first two decade of antigua 's independence were dominated politically by the bird family and the alp , with vere bird ruling from <year> to <year> , followed by his son lester bird from <year> to <year> . though providing a degree of political stability , and boosting tourism to the country , the bird government were frequently accused of corruption , cronyism and financial malfeasance . vere bird jr. , the elder son , wa forced to leave the cabinet in <year> following a gun for antigua in which he wa accused of smuggling israeli weapon to colombian drug-traffickers . another son , ivor bird , wa convicted of selling cocaine in <year> . </s> in <year> hurricane luis caused severe damage on barbuda . </s> the alp 's dominance of antiguan politics ended with the <year> antiguan general election , which wa won by baldwin spencer 's united progressive party ( antigua and barbuda ) ( upp ) . however the upp lost the <year> antiguan general election , with the alp returning to power under gaston browne . </s> most of barbuda wa devastated in early september <year> by hurricane irma , which brought wind with speed reaching <number> ; km/h ( <number> ; mph ) . the storm damaged or destroyed <number> of the island 's building and infrastructure , leaving barbuda `` barely habitable `` according to prime minister gaston browne . nearly everyone on the island wa evacuated to antigua . </s> amidst the following rebuilding effort on barbuda that were estimated to cost at least $ <number> million , the government announced plan to revoke a century old law of communal land by allowing resident to buy land ; a move that ha been criticised a promoting `` disaster capitalism `` . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> antigua and barbuda both are generally low-lying island whose terrain ha been influenced more by limestone formation than volcanism . the highest point on antigua and barbuda is boggy peak , located in southwestern antigua , which is the remnant of a volcanic crater rising . </s> the shoreline of both island are greatly indented with beach , lagoon , and natural harbor . the island are rimmed by reef and shoal . there are few stream a rainfall is slight . both island lack adequate amount of fresh groundwater . </s> about south-west of antigua lie the small , rocky island of redonda , which is uninhabited . </s> <section_title_start> city and village <section_title_end> </s> the most populous city in antigua and barbuda are mostly on antigua , being saint john 's , antigua and barbuda saint john 's , all saint , antigua and barbuda , piggotts , and liberta , antigua and barbuda . the most populous city on barbuda is codrington , antigua and barbuda . it is estimated that <number> of the population life in an urban area , which is much lower than the international average of <number> . </s> <section_title_start> islands <section_title_end> </s> antigua and barbuda is comprised mostly of it two namesake island , antigua , and barbuda , other than that , antigua and barbuda 's biggest island are guiana island & long island off the coast of antigua , and redonda island , which is far from both of the main island . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> rainfall average per year , with the amount varying widely from season to season . in general the wettest period is between september and november . the island generally experience low humidity and recurrent drought . temperature average , with a range from to in the winter to from to in the summer and autumn . the coolest period is between december and february . </s> hurricane strike on an average of once a year , including the powerful saffirsimpson scale # category <number> hurricane irma , on <number> september <year> , which damaged <number> of the structure on barbuda . some <number> people were evacuated to antigua . </s> an estimate published by time ( magazine ) indicated that over $ <number> ; million would be required to rebuild home and infrastructure . philmore mullin , director of barbuda 's national office of disaster service , said that `` all critical infrastructure and utility are non-existent food supply , medicine , shelter , electricity , water , communication , waste management `` . he summarised the situation a follows : `` public utility need to be rebuilt in their entirety ... it is optimistic to think anything can be rebuilt in six month ... in my <number> year in disaster management , i have never seen something like this . `` </s> <section_title_start> environmental issue <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> ethnic groups <section_title_end> </s> antigua ha a population of , mostly made up of people of west african , british , and portuguese people descent . the ethnic distribution consists of <number> black & mulatto , <number> mixed race , <number> white , and <number> other ( primarily south asian and other asian ) . most white are of british descent . christian levantine arab , and a small number of asian and sephardic jew make up the remainder of the population . </s> an increasingly large percentage of the population life abroad , most notably in the united kingdom ( antiguan british ) , united state and canada . a minority of antiguan resident are immigrant from other country , particularly from dominica , guyana and jamaica , and , increasingly , from the dominican republic , st. vincent and the grenadine and nigeria . an estimated <number> american citizen also make their home in antigua and barbuda , making their number one of the largest american population in the english-speaking eastern caribbean . </s> <section_title_start> languages <section_title_end> </s> english is the official language . the barbudan accent is slightly different from the antiguan . </s> in the year before antigua and barbuda 's independence , standard english wa widely spoken in preference to antiguan creole . generally , the upper and middle class shun antiguan creole . the educational system dissuades the use of antiguan creole and instruction is done in standard ( british ) english . </s> many of the word used in the antiguan dialect are derived from british english a well a african language . this can be easily seen in phrase such a : `` ent it ? `` meaning `` ai n't it ? `` which is itself dialectal and mean `` is n't it ? `` . common island proverb can often be traced to africa . </s> spanish is spoken by around <number> inhabitant . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> a majority ( <number> ) of antiguan are christian , with the anglican ( <number> ) being the largest single denomination . other christian denomination present are seventh-day adventist church ( <number> ) , pentecostalism ( <number> ) , moravian church ( <number> ) , roman catholic </s> ( <number> ) , methodist church ( <number> ) , wesleyan holiness church ( <number> ) , church of god ( cleveland , tennessee ) ( <number> ) , baptist ( <number> ) , mormonism ( < <number> ) , a well a jehovah 's witness . </s> non-christian religion practiced in the island include the rastafari , islam , and bah faith . </s> <section_title_start> governance <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> political system <section_title_end> </s> the politics of antigua and barbuda take place within a framework of a unitary state , parliamentary system , representative democracy monarchy , in which the [ of state ] is the monarch who appoints the list of governors-general of antigua and barbuda governor-general a vice-regal representative . elizabeth ii is the present queen of antigua and barbuda , having served in that position since the island ' independence from the united kingdom in <year> . the queen is currently represented by governor-general rodney williams ( politician ) . a council of minister is appointed by the governor general on the advice of the list of prime minister of antigua and barbuda , currently gaston browne ( <year> ) . the prime minister is the [ of government ] . </s> executive power is exercised by the government while legislative power is vested in both the form of government and the two chamber of parliament of antigua and barbuda . the bicameral parliament consists of the senate ( <number> member appointed by member of the government and the official opposition party , and approved by the governor-general ) , and the house of representative ( <number> member elected by first past the post ) to serve five-year term . </s> the current leader of her majesty 's loyal opposition is the united progressive party member of parliament ( mp ) , the honourable baldwin spencer . </s> <section_title_start> elections <section_title_end> </s> the last election held were on <number> june <year> , during which the antigua labour party won <number> seat , and the united progressive party ( antigua and barbuda ) <number> seat . </s> since <year> , election have been won by the populism antigua labour party . however , in the antigua and barbuda general election , <year> saw the defeat of the longest-serving elected government in the caribbean . prime minister lester bird , who had succeeded his father vere cornwall bird sr. , and deputy robin yearwood had been in office since <year> . </s> the elder bird wa prime minister from <year> to <year> and chief minister of antigua from <year> to <year> , except for the <year> <number> period when the progressive labour movement ( plm ) defeated his party . vere cornwall bird , the nation 's first prime minister , is credited with having brought antigua and barbuda and the caribbean into a new era of independence . </s> <section_title_start> party elections <section_title_end> </s> gaston browne defeated his predecessor lester bryant bird at the antigua labour party 's biennial convention in november <year> held to elect a political leader and other officer . the party then altered it name from the antigua labour party ( alp ) to the antigua and barbuda labour party ( ablp ) . this wa done to officially include the party 's presence on the sister island of barbuda in it organisation , the only political party on the mainland to have a physical branch in barbuda . </s> <section_title_start> judiciary <section_title_end> </s> the judicial branch is the eastern caribbean supreme court ( based in saint lucia ; one judge of the supreme court is a resident of the island and presides over the high court of justice ) . antigua is also a member of the caribbean court of justice . the judicial committee of the privy council serf a it supreme court of appeal . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relations <section_title_end> </s> antigua and barbuda is a member of the united nation , the bolivarian alliance for the america , the commonwealth of nation , the caribbean community , the organization of eastern caribbean state , the organization of american state , the world trade organization and the eastern caribbean 's regional security system . </s> antigua and barbuda is also a member of the international criminal court ( with a bilateral immunity agreement of protection for the u military a covered under article <number> of the rome statute of the international criminal court ) . </s> in <year> , antigua and barbuda called for reparation for slavery at the united nation . prime minister baldwin spencer said `` we have recently seen a number of leader apologising `` , and that they should now `` match their word with concrete and material benefit . `` </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the royal antigua and barbuda defence force ha around <number> member dispersed between the line infantry regiment , service and support unit and coast guard . there is also the antigua and barbuda cadet corp made up of <number> teenager between the age of <number> to <number> </s> in <year> , antigua and barbuda signed the un treaty on the prohibition of nuclear weapon . </s> <section_title_start> administrative divisions <section_title_end> </s> antigua and barbuda is divided into six parish and two dependency : </s> { style= `` background : none ; `` </s> * parish </s> * # saint george parish , antigua and barbuda </s> * # saint john parish , antigua and barbuda </s> * # saint mary parish , antigua and barbuda </s> * # saint paul parish , antigua and barbuda </s> * # saint peter parish , antigua and barbuda </s> * # saint philip parish , antigua and barbuda </s> * dependency </s> * # barbuda </s> * # redonda </s> style= `` width:400px ; `` </s> } </s> note : though barbuda and redonda are called dependency they are integral part of the state , making them essentially administrative division . dependency is simply a title . </s> <section_title_start> human rights <section_title_end> </s> antigua and barbuda doe not allow discrimination in employment , child labor , human trafficking , there are law against domestic abuse and child abuse . although it ha not been enforced or a case brought to trial in many year , like other caribbean island , lgbt right in antigua and barbuda same-sex sexual activity is illegal in antigua and barbuda and punishable by prison time , though not enforced . there are several current movement under way to repeal the buggery law . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> tourism dominates the economy , accounting for more than half of the gross domestic product ( gdp ) . antigua is famous for it many luxury resort a an ultra-high end travel destination . weakened tourist activity in the lower and middle market segment since early <year> ha slowed the economy , however , and squeezed the government into a tight fiscal corner . </s> investment banking and financial service also make up an important part of the economy . major world bank with office in antigua include the royal bank of canada ( rbc ) and scotiabank . financial-services corporation with office in antigua include pricewaterhousecoopers . the u security and exchange commission ha accused the antigua-based stanford international bank , owned by texas billionaire allen stanford , of orchestrating a huge fraud which may have bilked investor of some $ <number> ; billion . </s> the twin-island nation 's agricultural production is focused on it domestic market and constrained by a limited water supply and a labor ( economics ) shortage stemming from the lure of higher wage in tourism and construction work . </s> manufacturing is made up of enclave-type assembly for export , the major product being bedding , handicraft and electronic component . prospect for economic growth in the medium term will continue to depend on income growth in the industrialised world , especially in the united state , from which about one-third of all tourist come . </s> access to biocapacity is lower than world average . in <year> , antigua and barbuda had <number> global hectare of biocapacity per person within it territory , much le than the world average of <number> global hectare per person . in <year> antigua and barbuda used <number> global hectare of biocapacity per person - their ecological footprint of consumption . this mean they use more biocapacity than antigua and barbuda contains . a a result , antigua and barbuda are running a biocapacity deficit . </s> following the opening of the american university of antigua college of medicine by investor and attorney neil simon in <year> , a new source of revenue wa established . the university employ many local antiguan and the approximate <year> student consume a large amount of the good and service . </s> antigua and barbuda also us an economic citizenship program to spur investment into the country . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> antigua and barbuda ha a greater than <number> literacy rate . in <year> , antigua and barbuda adopted a national mandate to become the pre-eminent provider of medical service in the caribbean . a part of this mission , antigua and barbuda built the most technologically advanced hospital in the caribbean , the mt . st. john medical centre . the island of antigua currently ha three foreign-owned for-profit education for-profit offshore medical school . the island 's medical school cater mostly to foreign student but contribute to the local economy and health care . the three school are : </s> * the american university of antigua , college of medicine ( aua ) , founded in <year> </s> * the university of health science antigua ( uhsa ) , founded in <year> </s> * the metropolitan university college of medicine . </s> there is also the government-run antigua state college a well a the antigua and barbuda institute of information technology ( abiit ) and the antigua and barbuda hospitality training institute ( abhti ) . in <year> , the university of the west indie opened it fifth campus overall ( and fourth physical campus ) in university of the west indie at five island . the country wa previously served solely by the university of the west indie open campus . </s> island academy international , which offer the international baccalaureate , is the only international school in the country . there are also many other private school but these institution tend to follow the same local curriculum ( cxcs ) a government school . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> the culture is predominantly a mixture of west african and british cultural influence . </s> cricket is the national sport . other popular sport include football , boat racing and surfing . ( antigua sailing week attracts local and visitor from all over the world ) . </s> calypso music and soca music , both originating primarily out of trinidad and tobago , are important in antigua and barbuda . </s> <section_title_start> festivals <section_title_end> </s> the national carnival held each august commemorates the abolition of slavery in the british west indie , although on some island , carnival may celebrate the coming of lent . it festive pageant , show , contest and other activity are a major tourist attraction . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> corn and sweet potato play an important role in antiguan cuisine . for example , a popular antiguan dish , dukuna is a sweet , steamed dumpling made from grated sweet potato , flour and spice . one of the antiguan staple food , cou-cou , is a cooked paste made of cornmeal and water . </s> <section_title_start> media <section_title_end> </s> there are three newspaper : the antigua daily observer , antigua new room and the antiguan time . the antigua observer is the only daily printed newspaper . </s> the local television channel ab tv <number> is available ( it is the only station that show exclusively local program ) . there are also several local and regional radio station , such a v2c-am <number> , zdk-am <year> , vybz-fm <number> , zdk-fm <number> , observer radio <number> fm , dneca radio <number> fm , second advent radio <number> fm , abundant life radio <number> fm , crusader radio <number> fm , nice fm <number> </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> antiguan author jamaica kincaid ha published over <number> work of literature . </s> <section_title_start> sports <section_title_end> </s> the antigua and barbuda national cricket team represented the country at the <year> commonwealth game , but antiguan cricketer otherwise play for the leeward island cricket team in domestic match and the west indie cricket team internationally . the <year> cricket world cup wa hosted in the west indie from <number> march to <number> april <year> . </s> antigua hosted eight match at the sir vivian richards stadium , which wa completed on <number> february <year> and can hold up to <number> people . </s> antigua is a host of stanford twenty20 twenty20 cricket , a version started by allen stanford in <year> a a regional cricket game with almost all caribbean island taking part . </s> rugby football and netball are popular a well . </s> association football , or soccer , is also a very popular sport . antigua ha a antigua and barbuda national football team which entered fifa world cup qualification for the <year> tournament and for <year> and onwards . a professional team wa formed in <year> , antigua barracuda fc , which played in the usl pro , a lower professional league in the usa . the nation 's team had a major achievement in <year> , getting out of it preliminary group for the <year> fifa world cup , notably due to a victory over powerful haiti . in it first game in the next concacaf group play on <number> june <year> in tampa , fl , antigua and barbuda , comprising <number> barracuda player and <number> from the lower english professional league , scored a goal against the united state . however , the team lost <number>:1 to the u . </s> <section_title_start> symbol <section_title_end> </s> the national bird is the frigate bird , and the national tree is the bucida buceras ( whitewood tree ) . </s> clare waight keller included agave karatto to represent antigua and barbuda in meghan markle 's wedding of prince harry and
